news_article: Apple has started rolling out its new App Store commission structure through its Small Business Program, lowering fees to 15% for developers who earn less than $1 million a year, AppleInsider reported. It had introduced the program in November. Apparent Software Founder Jacob Gorban and a few other developers revealed that the reduced program fees are now in effect.

news_headline: OnePlus offers discounts on a wide selection of products from Jan 19-26
news_article: On the occasion of Republic Day, OnePlus is offering discounts on a wide selection of products from January 19-26. There's a ₹300 discount on OnePlus Power Bank, OnePlus Buds, and OnePlus Band while OnePlus TV Y series has a discount of ₹500. You can purchase the discounted products from Amazon or the OnePlus website.

news_headline: Data Protection Bill won't get cleared in its current version: BJP MP
news_article: BJP MP Rajeev Chandrasekhar, while speaking at the Global Technology Summit 2020, said the Data Protection Bill, 2019 will not get cleared in its current version. The committee is going to redraw the bill, he added. "Throughout this process witnesses would...argue as if privacy is a favour that is being done by the state for the citizens," he further said.

news_headline: Dozens of Al Jazeera journalists' iPhones hacked using Israeli spyware
news_article: Dozens of Al Jazeera journalists have been hit by a cyberattack using spyware sold by Israeli private intelligence firm NSO Group, according to researchers at Citizen Lab. The spyware used a vulnerability in iPhone's iMessage to spy on victims without them opening malicious links. The attack is likely to have been ordered by Saudi Arabia and UAE, according to researchers.

news_headline: Ola to invest ₹2,400 cr to set up 'world's largest scooter factory' in TN
news_article: Ola on Monday said it has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the government of Tamil Nadu to set up what it claims would be the “world’s largest scooter manufacturing facility” in the state. Ola said it will invest ₹2,400 crore to set up a factory with an initial annual capacity of 2 million units.

news_headline: Deeply sorry for below-quality 'Cyberpunk 2077': CD Projekt Co-founder
news_article: CD Projekt Co-founder Marcin Iwinski on Thursday posted a video on Twitter, apologising for "'Cyberpunk 2077' not meeting the quality standard [they] wanted it to meet." Users reported several glitches with the game after its launch, post which full refunds were made available to anyone who purchased the game through the PlayStation Store or the Xbox Store.

news_headline: Samsung unveils robot that can clean up messy rooms, set the table for meals
news_article: Samsung showed its AI-powered robot Samsung Bot Handy at the 2021 Consumer Electronics Show (CES), that can clean up messy rooms, set the table and pour wine. It relies on AI to recognise and pick up objects of varying sizes, shapes and weights. It can detect the item's material composition and use the right amount of force to grab it.

news_headline: NVIDIA's $40 billion acquisition of Arm to be probed by UK regulator
news_article: UK's Competition and Markets Authority on Wednesday said it will start an investigation into American graphics card maker NVIDIA's $40 billion deal to buy British chip designer Arm Holdings. The competition regulator will consider whether Arm has an incentive to withdraw, raise prices or reduce the quality of its IP licencing services to NVIDIA's rivals, following the takeover.

news_headline: TikTok to make accounts private by default for users aged under 16
news_article: TikTok users aged under 16 will have their accounts set to private by default to improve child safety, the Chinese app announced on Wednesday.  They will have to proactively approve any request from other users to follow them and to be able to comment on their videos. Furthermore, users will also be prevented from downloading any videos created by under-16s.

news_headline: US cybersecurity firm FireEye says it was hacked by a nation
news_article: US cybersecurity firm FireEye said it was recently hit by a "state-sponsored attack" carried out by a "highly sophisticated threat actor". FireEye CEO Kevin Mandia concluded the attack was done by "a nation with top-tier offensive capabilities". The attack is being looked into by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and Microsoft, whose initial analysis has supported FireEye's conclusion.

news_headline: Elon Musk donates $5 million to Khan Academy via Musk Foundation
news_article: Khan Academy's Founder Salman Khan has thanked world's richest person Elon Musk and the Musk Foundation for a $5 million donation to Khan Academy. Khan called the donation from Musk a "major gift" that will help to ensure that people have access to free and world-class education. Founded in 2008, Khan Academy provides short lessons in the form of videos.

news_headline: Facebook to pay UK publishers for their content from 2021
news_article: Facebook, with the launch of its "News" tab in the UK starting January, 2021, will be paying publishers to feature their content on its platform. Facebook said it has partnered with the first group of publishers, including Conde Nast, Guardian Media Group and The Economist. It's expected to cost Facebook tens of millions of pounds annually, as per The Guardian.

news_headline: Julian Assange can't be extradited to US due to suicide risk, rules UK court
news_article: A British judge on Monday rejected the US' request to extradite WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange to face espionage charges. Assange was likely to commit suicide if sent to US, District Judge Vanessa Baraitser said. Assange has been indicted on 17 espionage charges and one charge of computer misuse over WikiLeaks' publication of leaked military and diplomatic documents a decade ago.

news_headline: Alibaba driver in China sets himself on fire after pay dispute with company
news_article: Liu Jin, an Alibaba delivery driver set himself on fire in China following a pay dispute with a company owned by the Chinese tech giant, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday. "I want my blood and sweat money back," Liu said in the videos shared on social media. Liu now has medical bills of more than $150,000, the publication reported.

news_headline: Govt writes to WhatsApp, asks it to withdraw new privacy policy: Report
news_article: The government has reportedly written to WhatsApp asking the messaging app to withdraw the recent changes in the privacy policy. The government said that any unilateral changes wouldn't be fair and acceptable. In a letter to WhatsApp CEO Will Cathcart, the government said the proposed changes "raise grave concerns regarding the implications for the choice and autonomy of Indian citizens."

news_headline: World's 2nd largest radio telescope at Arecibo Observatory collapses
news_article: Arecibo Observatory's radio telescope in Puerto Rico, the world's second-largest single-dish radio telescope, collapsed after instrument platform fell overnight. It served as a resource for radio astronomy, planetary and geospace research for 57 years. It was made up of a 1,000-foot-wide dish antenna built into a depression that reflects radio waves from space to a 900-tonne instrument platform.

news_headline: Satellite pics show remains of SpaceX's rocket prototype after explosion
news_article: Satellite images showed the remains of Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Starship rocket prototype that crash-landed and exploded on Wednesday during a test launch. The 16-storey prototype of the Starship spaceship travelled more than five minutes upward in the air before crash landing at the SpaceX's launch site in Texas. Satellite images showed Starship nosecone lying beside the remains of the spaceship.

news_headline: Google in talks with Jio, Airtel for providing internet via light
news_article: Google is reportedly in talks to partner with Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel for its Project Taara, which aims to provide internet connectivity through light beams. The project was started by a company within Google called Google X which works on breakthrough technologies. The project aims to provide internet to far-flung areas, at speeds of up to 20 Gbps.

news_headline: Wipro takes over METRO AG's IT operations in $700 mn deal
news_article: Wipro on Tuesday announced a strategic digital and IT partnership deal with Germany-based METRO AG, which is estimated to be valued at $700 million for the first five years. As part of the deal, Wipro will take over METRO AG's IT units and over 1,300 employees will be transferred to Wipro. The deal could extend for an additional four years.

news_headline: Google CEO apologises for handling of AI expert Timnit Gebru's exit
news_article: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Wednesday apologised to employees about the controversial exit of renowned AI researcher Timnit Gebru from the company. "We need to accept responsibility...that a prominent Black, female leader with immense talent left Google unhappily," he wrote. Gebru alleges she was fired over her academic paper that attacks technology used by Google products.

news_headline: Google investigates ethical AI team member over handling of sensitive data
news_article: Google on Wednesday said it is investigating an ethical AI team member and has locked her corporate account after finding that thousands of files were shared with external accounts. Margaret Mitchell had been using automated scripts to find evidence of discriminatory treatment of Timnit Gebru, a former Black employee in the AI team who was controversially fired, reported Axios.

news_headline: WhatsApp testing voice, video calls feature on desktop app: Report
news_article: WhatsApp is testing the ability to make video and voice calls via its desktop app, as per a tweet by The Guardian's Alex Hern. Hern shared an image on Twitter that shows both the video call icon and the voice call icon inside a chat on the desktop app. Both the icons had the "beta" tag on them.

news_headline: Indian tech firms received $38B during COVID-19: Amitabh Kant
news_article: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant said that Indian tech companies have witnessed over $38 billion investment in the last five to six months while the world was reeling under the impact of COVID-19. While speaking at the TiE Global Summit, he added that India is currently home to 34 unicorn startups and 52 soonicorns (soon to be unicorns).

news_headline: China drafts rules to limit collection of personal data by mobile apps
news_article: The Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC) has published draft rules seeking to restrict the collection of personal data by mobile apps. The guidelines cover 38 types of apps including online shopping, instant messaging and ride-hailing or sharing apps. The rules have included users' phone number, their location and destination under the scope of required information for ride-hailing apps.

news_headline: Aramco teams up with Google to offer cloud services in Saudi Arabia
news_article: A subsidiary of Saudi Aramco has teamed up with Google Cloud to offer cloud services to customers in Saudi Arabia. Google Cloud will establish and operate a new cloud region in Saudi Arabia. A new company will also be formed after the required regulatory clearances to supply cloud solutions and services to customers.

news_headline: US maintains ban on phone calls during flights
news_article: US' Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has killed a proposal to allow in-flight voice calls via mobile phones after the proposition drew "strong opposition". The proposal "fail[s] to address significant safety and national security concerns," according to US pilots and flight attendants. The FCC made the proposal in 2013 to allow mobile telephone conversations above 10,000 feet.

news_headline: Google, Apple, 44 others support challenge to block H-1B visa changes
news_article: Google, Apple and 44 other US firms and organisations filed an amicus brief supporting a lawsuit challenging upcoming rule changes to H-1B visa eligibility. The lawsuit was recently filed by the US Chamber of Commerce along with others, including 12 organisations and universities. The rules will "stifle the ability of American companies to hire and retain global talent", Twitter said.

news_headline: Apple removes 39,000 game apps on China store in biggest single day removal
news_article: Apple on Thursday removed over 46,000 apps on its China store, including 39,000 game apps, marking the biggest removal ever in a single day. The apps were removed as December 31 was the deadline for all game publishers to obtain a licence. Only 74 of the top 1,500 paid games on Apple store were not removed, according to Qimai.

news_headline: ₹2.46 cr robot that can cook meals from scratch created by UK company
news_article: A London-based robotics company Moley Robotics has created the Moley Kitchen robot that can cook meals from scratch and clean up afterwards. The robot has two robotic arms with fully articulated "hands" that can retrieve ingredients from smart fridge and use the sink to fill pans. It has been developed with the assistance of BBC MasterChef's 2011 winner Tim Anderson.

news_headline: Germany blocks China's takeover of tech firm over security issues: Report
news_article: Germany has blocked the takeover of satellite and radar technology firm IMST by China-controlled missile maker CASIC's subsidiary due to national security concerns, Reuters cited a government document saying. Berlin believes IMST's know-how is crucial for national security. The document also said that IMST's expertise is also needed for the construction of critical infrastructure in the future.

news_headline: Malaysia's ex-PM's tweet justifying beheadings in France deleted by Twitter
news_article: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad's tweet justifying the recent beheading attacks in France has been deleted by Twitter. "Muslims have a right to be angry and to kill millions of French people for the massacres of the past," he had tweeted. Twitter removed the tweet by Mohamad for glorifying violence.

news_headline: US carmakers ask for government's help amid global chip shortage
news_article: The AAPC, a lobbying organisation for GM, Ford Motor and US operations of FCA, has asked the US government to help find a solution to the global chip shortage. It said the issue could diminish automakers' production and affect the US economy negatively. AAPC President Matt Blunt said he has also begun "nascent" discussions with the President-elect Joe Biden's administration.

news_headline: Twitter to remove misleading tweets on COVID-19 vaccinations
news_article: Twitter has said that starting next week, it will ask users to remove tweets that spread "false or misleading narratives about COVID-19 vaccinations". This rule will apply to tweets falsely claiming conspiracies, such as coronavirus vaccines are used to "intentionally cause harm to or control populations", or theories about adverse impacts of receiving vaccinations that have been widely debunked.

news_headline: Facebook page of website that spent $46 mn on FB ads 'deleted without reason'
news_article: Canadian content curation site Shared's CEO Jordan Nabigon said Facebook has deleted his company's main Facebook page without warning in October, and without providing an explanation. Nabigon has spent nearly $46 million on Facebook advertising between 2006 and 2020 for Shared and his other company Freebies. Facebook told Nabigon that the page was deleted "due to safety and security reasons".

news_headline: Chinese internet firms misusing users' data, bullying them: Chinese association
news_article: China Consumers' Association (CCA) on Thursday said the country's internet companies have been violating consumers' rights by misusing their personal data and "bullying" them into purchases and promotions. Algorithms that send targeted ads and promotions based on users' internet use deprive them of choice, it added. The government-backed consumer association did not, however, name any company.

news_headline: Signal downloads grew 9,483% in India after WhatsApp policy update: Report
news_article: Signal app saw a growth of 9,483% in its downloads in India, after WhatsApp announced its new policy update, reports citing Sensor Tower data said. It had 24,000 downloads between January 1-5 and saw 2.3 million new downloads between January 6-10. Telegram too saw its downloads rise 15% with 1.5 million new downloads between January 6-10.

news_headline: Who's Brian Acton, WhatsApp Co-founder who also funded WhatsApp rival Signal?
news_article: WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton, who became a part of Facebook after Facebook's acquisition of WhatsApp in 2014, left Facebook in 2017 after rift with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg over monetising WhatsApp. In February 2018, he launched the non-profit Signal Foundation and helped Signal messaging app with $50 million funding. In March 2018, Acton had tweeted, "It is time #deletefacebook."

news_headline: Twitter to discontinue its streaming app Periscope by March 2021
news_article: Twitter on Tuesday said it will shut down its live-streaming app Periscope, which it bought in 2015, due to declining usage over the last two years and high supporting costs. "Periscope app is in an unsustainable maintenance-mode state," it said. Twitter added that the announcement had to be delayed due to reprioritised projects amid COVID-19.

news_headline: US govt, 48 states sue Facebook, seek WhatsApp, Instagram break up
news_article: The US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and 48 state attorneys general on Wednesday filed lawsuits against Facebook, revolving around acquiring rivals Instagram in 2012 and WhatsApp in 2014. The lawsuits accuse Facebook of abusing dominance, creating monopoly and crushing smaller competitors. They also seek a "divestiture of assets", which means breaking Instagram and WhatsApp away from Facebook.

news_headline: Amazon to remove QAnon products from store post US Capitol riot
news_article: Amazon has announced that it will remove some QAnon products from its online marketplace under policies that prohibit offensive items or other inappropriate content. It had earlier been questioned over having apparel with QAnon insignia and related books up for sale days after US Capitol riot. Earlier, Amazon removed Parler from AWS for its alleged role in the riot.

news_headline: World's most-followed TikTok star, 16-yr-old Charli, makes first startup investment
news_article: America's 16-year-old dancer Charli D'Amelio, the world's most-followed TikTok star who crossed 100 million followers on the app, has made her first startup investment. She joined the $50 million Series B funding round of Step, a US-based banking service that focuses on teenagers. The funding was led by Coatue, with participation from celebrities like Justin Timberlake and The Chainsmokers.

news_headline: Take strict action against Amazon for causing misery to traders: CAIT to ED
news_article: Traders' body CAIT has written to the ED seeking "strict action" against Amazon, claiming that it has caused "misery" to small traders by resorting to predatory pricing. It has provided ED with all the "necessary details" to prove that Amazon has "brazenly" violated India's laws. It has also raised questions on how Amazon has been "carrying on multi-brand retail trading".

news_headline: Lawnmower robot in Germany messages owner as thief tries to steal it
news_article: A lawnmower robot in Germany sent a message to its owner that it had flipped upside down while a thief tried to steal it. The owner spotted a thief with the robot tucked under his arm when he went outside to the lawn to check on the device. Caught in the act, the thief dropped the lawnmower robot and escaped.

news_headline: Zoom being probed in US over interactions with Chinese govt
news_article: Zoom has said the US SEC and two US Attorney's offices have been investigating it for months. It said it has provided information to multiple US prosecutors and regulators on interactions with China and other overseas governments. The US has charged a former China-based Zoom executive with disrupting video meetings commemorating Tiananmen Square crackdown's 31st anniversary at China's request.

news_headline: Elon Musk's girlfriend Grimes says she 'finally' has COVID-19
news_article: Tesla CEO and world's richest person Elon Musk's girlfriend, Grimes, posted an Instagram story over the weekend where she said she "finally" has COVID-19. "Finally got COVID-19 but weirdly enjoying the DayQuil fever dream 2021," she wrote. The 32-year-old singer, who shares baby boy X Æ A-Xii with Musk, also shared the song 'Good Days' in her story about COVID-19.

news_headline: Streaming platform Quibi plans to sell content catalogue to Roku: WSJ
news_article: US-based mobile-focused streaming platform Quibi is in advanced talks to sell its content catalogue to video-streaming device maker Roku, the Wall Street Journal reported. Under the terms discussed, Roku would acquire rights to Quibi's library. Earlier in October, Quibi had announced its closure, six months after launch. Founded by Jeffrey Katzenberg, Quibi was launched on April 6.

news_headline: Pune metro to use human waste treatment tech at metro stations
news_article: The Maha Metro and DRDO signed an MoU for adopting Biodigester Technology for treating human waste and recycling water consumed in Pune metro rail. Maha Metro MD said this will help "conserve a significant amount of water in a state where water scarcity is increasing every day". The technology is an "efficient and economic" onsite alternative to conventional sanitation techniques.

news_headline: UK's security agency helps NHS fight cyber crime related to COVID-19
news_article: UK's security agency National Cyber Security Centre is stepping in to help state-run National Health Service (NHS) fight cyber attacks related to COVID-19. The agency's assessment of NHS uncovered 35 internet domains that could be exposed to malicious activity. It reported that 200 of the 723 incidents that required its intervention from September 2019-August 2020 were pandemic-related.

news_headline: China unveils prototype of new high-speed train that can travel at 620 km/h
news_article: China has unveiled a prototype for a new high-speed maglev train that is capable of hitting speeds of 620 km/h. The China Railway Engineering Corporation (CREC) has said that it is expected to be the fastest land vehicle. The train runs on high-temperature superconducting power that makes it look as if the train is floating along the magnetised tracks.

news_headline: M'luru Police make prior approval for private drone operators mandatory
news_article: The Mangaluru City Police have made it mandatory for the operators of private unmanned aerial vehicles or drones to get prior approval from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) and the Deputy Commissioner of Police (Law & Order)'s office. Drones that are being operated illegally will be seized and action will be initiated against operators, Mangaluru Police Commissioner added.

news_headline: 2021 onwards, every payments business will focus on profitability: Paytm CEO
news_article: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma on Tuesday, while addressing a summit, said that in the next two years starting 2021, every payments business will focus on profitability. He added that competition in payments is "getting mature". "Payments is so fundamental as a business that it will inevitably have n number of players," said Sharma.

news_headline: Man cited in NY Post's article on Biden's son sues Twitter for defamation
news_article: Owner of the repair shop cited in New York Post's story on Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden, sued Twitter claiming its choices falsely labelled him as a hacker. The paper had cited the shop as source for information obtained from a laptop allegedly owned by Hunter. Twitter later said the article violated its "hacked materials" policy and limited its reach.

news_headline: Tesla's stock could 'get crushed like soufflé under sledgehammer': Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an e-mail to his employees warned that the electric carmaker's stock could "get crushed like soufflé under a sledgehammer" if costs are not cut. "When looking at our actual profitability, it is very low at around 1% for the past year," Musk wrote. Tesla shares are among the best performers in 2020, rising nearly 600%.

news_headline: WeChat blocks Aus PM's post criticising fake photo of soldier
news_article: The Chinese social media platform WeChat has blocked a message by Australian PM Scott Morrison criticising a fake image of an Australian soldier murdering a child posted by a Chinese government spokesman. A note claimed that the content had violated regulations. The move comes amid a diplomatic dispute between Australia and China over the image.

news_headline: N95 mask with noise-cancelling earbuds, in-built mic unveiled at CES
news_article: Telecom firm Binatone unveiled its MaskFone at CES 2021, which is a mask with a standard N95 filter and has in-built earbuds for answering calls and listening to music. It has an environmental noise-cancelling feature and an in-built mic. MaskFone offers breathable fabric, water and sweat-resistance and controls for picking up calls or adjusting volume.

news_headline: Silicon Valley CEOs cannot lay down the law: EU chief
news_article: On Twitter's ban of US President Donald Trump, the chief of the European Commission said that such a decision must be taken according to the law and not by a "Silicon Valley CEO". Ursula von der Leyen added that Europe has a friend in the White House after "four long years" but it would strive to regulate US technology companies.

news_headline: Apple moves self-driving car unit under exec who oversees Siri: Report
news_article: Apple has moved its self-driving car unit under the leadership of John Giannandrea, Senior Vice President of Machine Learning and AI Strategy, who also oversees the development of Apple's virtual assistant Siri, Bloomberg reported. Apple began working on its autonomous car project, known as Titan, in 2014. CEO Tim Cook in 2017 called autonomous systems "mother of all AI projects".

news_headline: Apple adds iPhone 5c to its vintage products list
news_article: Apple has added iPhone 5c to its vintage products list as the product has not been sold in the last five to seven years. This means that the company will no longer provide support for iPhone 5c but the product will continue to receive hardware service as long as its parts are available. The iPhone 5c was launched in 2013.

news_headline: 50-year-old problem of biology solved by Artificial Intelligence
news_article: DeepMind's AI system 'AlphaFold' has been recognised as a solution to "protein folding", a grand challenge in biology for over 50 years. DeepMind showed it can predict how proteins fold into 3D shapes, a complex process that is fundamental to understanding the biological machinery of life. AlphaFold can predict the shape of proteins within the width of an atom.

news_headline: US Senator introduces bill that would let victims sue porn websites
news_article: Following a New York Times column which accused Pornhub of hosting non-consensual videos of underage girls, a bill was introduced by US lawmakers led by Senator Josh Hawley that would allow victims of sex trafficking and sexual assault to sue websites hosting illegal content depicting them. Earlier, Pornhub announced it'll no longer allow downloading of videos from its platform.

news_headline: Facebook could soon face its 1st antitrust suit by US govt: Report
news_article: Facebook could soon face the first antitrust action against it by the US government as federal and state authorities are preparing to file new lawsuits against Facebook and Google, WSJ reported. The authorities are probing if the firms abused their power in the internet economy and are readying as many as four cases by January-end.

news_headline: Dell's VMware sues ex-COO Rajiv Ramaswami over moving to Nutanix
news_article: Dell's VMware has sued its former COO Rajiv Ramaswami for breach of legal contract and duty obligations. Ramaswami became the CEO of Nutanix just two days after quitting VMware in December 2020. For at least two months before resigning Ramaswami was meeting with Nutanix secretly and also working with senior leadership to shape VMware's key strategic vision, VMware said.

news_headline: Stop sneaky moves: Musk as ViaSat asks for environmental probe of Starlink
news_article: Elon Musk criticised ViaSat after the rival communication firm asked the US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to look into the potential environmental impact of SpaceX's internet venture Starlink's satellites. “Starlink “poses a hazard” to Viasat’s profits, more like it. Stop the sneaky moves, Charlie Ergen!" Musk tweeted. "And Mark Dankberg. This action is wack, not dank!!” he added.

news_headline: WhatsApp or Facebook can't read your messages with friends, family: WhatsApp
news_article: Issuing a clarification on its updated privacy policy, WhatsApp said neither the app nor Facebook can read users' messages or hear their calls with their friends, family and co-workers. "Instead, this update includes changes related to messaging a business on WhatsApp, which is optional," it added. WhatsApp said it doesn't share users' contacts with Facebook.

news_headline: Need to classify social media platforms as news media: SC Judge
news_article: Supreme Court Judge S Ravindra Bhat said there is a need to classify social media platforms as news media and subject them to same journalistic standards. He added the platforms can never be neutral. He even said the news disseminated on these platforms is not factual and fake news and planting bots have "triggered riots that leads to public mischief".

news_headline: Hacker archives deleted Parler posts from the day of US Capitol riot
news_article: A hacker claims to have archived the posts of users across Parler, including deleted and private posts, from January 6, the day US Capitol was attacked. The hacker has archived around 1.1 million Parler video URLs that include GPS metadata pointing to locations where videos were taken. Parler has been embroiled in a controversy over its alleged role in riot.

news_headline: When did billionaire Jack Ma criticise Chinese govt and what did he say?
news_article: Billionaire Jack Ma criticised Chinese regulators in October 2020, called Chinese banks "pawn shops" and said China's biggest risk is that it "lacks financial ecosystem". Days later, $35-billion IPO of his Ant Group on the Hong Kong and Shanghai exchanges, set to be the world's biggest, was halted by regulators. They ordered Ant Group to return to its 'payments origin'.

news_headline: Amazon, JPMorgan and Berkshire's healthcare venture to shut in Feb
news_article: The healthcare venture of Amazon, Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase, Haven, is shutting down next month. The venture was created in 2018 to provide better healthcare services and insurance at a lower cost to workers and families at the three firms. However, the firms will continue to collaborate informally to address the specific needs of their employees.

news_headline: K'taka plant vandalism to have minor impact on iPhone production: Reports
news_article: Apple's iPhone production will reportedly face a 'minor impact' due to vandalism and violence that took place on Saturday at its contract manufacturer Wistron’s facility near Bengaluru. Only the iPhone SE 2020 is being manufactured there and part of the production might shift if its factory remains affected, as per reports. Employees vandalised the plant due to non-payment of salaries.

news_headline: Hawaii's 1st Tesla Supercharger may be built on Oracle Founder's island: Report
news_article: Tesla has recently applied for a permit to construct Hawaii's first Supercharger in Lanai City, an island that Oracle's billionaire Founder Larry Ellison owns 98% of, Electrek reported. Lanai has only around 48 kilometres of paved roads and zero stoplights. Ellison recently announced his plans to move to Lanai, an island he bought in 2012 for a reported $300 million.

news_headline: Putting OTT under I&B aimed to bring content in one place: I&B Secy
news_article: The idea behind government's move to bring OTT and content platforms under the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (I&B) was to bring content at one place while keeping platforms at another, I&B Ministry Secretary Amit Khare said. "I am clarifying this because...there used to be a discussion that online and offline content should not be treated differently," Khare added.

news_headline: Singapore citizen world's 1st to cross int'l border with digital COVID-19 travel pass
news_article: A Singaporean citizen who returned to the country from Japan has become the world's first person to use a digital COVID-19 health certificate for immigration purposes. He used the International Chamber of Commerce's AOKpass app to officially present a negative COVID-19 PCR digital test result. The app allows users to store COVID-19 related information and have medical professionals certify them.

news_headline: Apple CFO, Apple's ex-design chief candidates for Ferrari CEO: Report
news_article: Apple CFO Luca Maestri and former Chief Design Officer Jony Ive are reportedly candidates to be Ferrari's next CEO, Reuters reported. Ferrari CEO Louis Camilleri announced his retirement earlier due to "personal reasons". Former Vodafone CEO Vittorio Colao was allegedly in the running for the position too, but Reuters said a source close to Colao has called the claim "groundless".

news_headline: WhatsApp redesigns storage management tool to help delete files in bulk
news_article: WhatsApp has redesigned its storage management tool to allow users to identify and delete large files in bulk. The tool will group together files and media that have been forwarded many times as well as sort files by size in descending order. Users can access the tool from "Storage and data" by selecting the "Manage storage" option.

news_headline: Lenovo records 53% jump in profit to $310 mn in Sept quarter
news_article: Lenovo reported a 53% jump in its net profit for the July-September quarter to $310 million, whereas its revenue increased 7% to $14.5 billion. It set new records for group revenue, pre-tax income and net income, delivering year-on-year growth for the first time in six quarters. The company said it's continuing to benefit from remote working trend due to COVID-19.

news_headline: Will vigorously defend TikTok ban order: US
news_article: The US Commerce Department on Sunday said it will comply with a US judge's ruling to stay a ban on TikTok in the country but will also "vigorously defend" its executive order. The judge on Friday had ruled that the government's threats about TikTok "are phrased in the hypothetical". TikTok US' deal with Oracle and Walmart is still in negotiations.

news_headline: 29-year-old Pune techie loses ₹26 lakh to online 'gift' scam
news_article: A 29-year-old IT professional from Pune lost ₹26 lakh to an online scam after fraudsters made her believe that she was about to receive a 'gift' from her company's boss in Australia. They first asked her to transfer money for various fees and charges. They demanded more money by claiming the gift was seized by customs officials at the airport.

news_headline: Israel PM Netanyahu removes photo with Trump from his Twitter banner
news_article: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday changed his Twitter cover photo with US President Donald Trump and replaced it with another picture showing him being vaccinated against COVID-19. Netanyahu changed his cover photo with Trump after a long time. The removal comes after the relations between both the leaders declined after Netanyahu congratulated President-elect Biden on his election win.

news_headline: Startup aims to launch electric air taxis in Singapore by 2023
news_article: German startup Volocopter is set to host the world's first electric air taxi service in Singapore by 2023. Volocopter said that it is committed to start its operations within three years once it completes flight trials, evaluation and certification in collaboration with the city-state. It has already started issuing tickets for a 15-minute trip that will cost €300 (approximately ₹27,000).

news_headline: Financial impact is immaterial: Epic Games CEO on reduced App Store fee
news_article: Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney said that the "financial impact" of Apple's decision to reduce App Store commission for small businesses to 15% is "immaterial" to the company's revenue. Small businesses account for less than 5% of its revenue, he said. Apple hopes to "maintain the monopoly" by giving "special...terms to tech titans like Amazon" and small developers, Sweeney said.

news_headline: HDFC Bank submits digital outage control plan to RBI
news_article: HDFC Bank's CFO Srinivasan Vaidyanathan on Saturday said the bank has submitted to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) a plan on how it will fix issues related to digital outages. In December, RBI had barred HDFC Bank from launching digital initiatives and signing up credit card customers following repeated outages of its services including ATMs and e-banking since 2018.

news_headline: Don't enable Trump's monstrous behaviour: Michelle Obama to Silicon Valley
news_article: Former First Lady Michelle Obama called on Silicon Valley leaders to ban Trump from their platforms after violence perpetrated by pro-Trump rioters ensued at the US Capitol. She said  companies should stop enabling Trump's "monstrous behaviour" and policies to "prevent their technology from being used by the nation’s leaders to fuel insurrection" should be put in place.

news_headline: People don't care whether this looks like an alien invasion: BioVYZR inventor
news_article: Yezin Al-Qaysi, the Canadian inventor of the roughly ₹28,000 ($379) COVID-19 helmet BioVYZR, said some thought his invention is "ridiculous" while some said they didn't care "whether this looks like an alien invasion". Al-Qaysi said he invented the air purifier-fit helmet because he believes masks have limitations. "It feels like you're standing under an umbrella," he said about the experience.

news_headline: Tata Motors' 'tere mere pyaar...' tweet sparks Tesla tie-up rumours, firm denies
news_article: After a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla, the Indian automaker said it "categorically denies all rumours suggesting the same". "We have not taken any decision regarding a strategic partner for our PV business," it added. Shares of Tata Motors jumped nearly 7% after the tweet.

news_headline: Instagram briefly blocks '#sikh' amid farmers' protests: Reports
news_article: Instagram blocked hashtag '#sikh' on its platform amid the ongoing farmers' protests, some users have complained on Twitter. Initially, on searching for the hashtag, Instagram reportedly showed an error that read, "To make sure only...most relevant posts are shown, we've hidden some posts that may be private or low quality." However, Instagram later started showing some posts with '#sikh'.

news_headline: Google India FY20 revenue rises 35% to ₹5,594 cr, profit rises 24%
news_article: Google India has reported a rise of nearly 35% year-on-year in its revenue for the financial year 2019-20 to ₹5,594 crore. Its net profit for the period was higher by about 24% at over ₹586 crore as compared to approximately ₹472 crore in the financial year 2018-19. Google India also saw its total expenses rise 30.4% to over ₹4,455 crore.

news_headline: Google removes personal loan apps that violated safety policies in India
news_article: Google on Thursday said it has removed personal loan apps found violating its user safety policies from its app store in India. It reviewed hundreds of such apps based on flags submitted by users and government agencies. The development comes days after Hyderabad Police busted instant loan app scam that led to borrowers committing suicide due to harassment over repayment.

news_headline: New policy does not expand our ability to share data with Facebook: WhatsApp
news_article: Facebook-owned messaging platform WhatsApp has said its updated terms and privacy policy "does not expand our ability to share data with Facebook". "Our aim is to provide transparency and new options available to engage with businesses so they can serve their customers and grow," it added. The Indian government has asked WhatsApp to withdraw the changes to its privacy policy.

news_headline: Malaysian researchers develop drone from pineapple leaves
news_article: Malaysian researchers have developed an eco-friendly drone made out of the fibre found in the pineapple leaves. The drone is easier to dispose of, compared to those made out of synthetic fibres, Professor Mohamed Thariq Hameed Sultan said, adding that it can degrade in two weeks. It can fly up to 3,280-feet high and remain airborne for about 20 minutes.

news_headline: Twitter's market value drops by $8.8 bn after posting quarterly report
news_article: Twitter shares plunged 21%, erasing $8.8 billion in market value, after the social media platform reported that it added only one million new daily users in its third-quarter. The company reported fewer new users despite the return of live sports as well as the US presidential election campaign that was expected to drive people to the platform.

news_headline: Xbox bug that could have let hackers link usernames with users' emails fixed
news_article: Microsoft has patched a bug in the Xbox website that could have allowed hackers to link Xbox gamer tags (usernames) with users' email addresses. A security researcher who reported the bug to Microsoft told ZDNet the bug was located on enforcement.xbox.com where users view strikes against their profile. The bug allowed the researcher to view emails of other users.

news_headline: Apple announces 15 apps as App Store Best of 2020 winners
news_article: Apple on Wednesday named 15 apps as its App Store Best of 2020 winners, that were "celebrated for their positive cultural impact...and importance". Exercise app Wakeout! won the iPhone App of the Year title while Genshin Impact was the iPhone Game of the Year. Disney+ and Zoom won the Apple TV and iPad App of the Year titles respectively.

news_headline: 27-yr-old Chinese man, head of ₹21,000-cr loan app scam, arrested from Delhi
news_article: The Hyderabad police arrested a 27-year-old Chinese national in the ₹21,000-crore loan app scam after intercepting him at the Delhi Airport. Police said Zhu Wei is the overall head of operations of the illegal loan apps run by four companies. The apps charged up to 36% interest and harassed borrowers for loan recovery, leading them to even commit suicide.

news_headline: Bitcoin falls for second consecutive day, drops below $33,000-mark
news_article: Cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell for the second consecutive day on Thursday, dropping below the $33,000-mark to record its lowest in three weeks. Earlier this month, Bitcoin had surpassed the $41,000-mark to record an all time high, before dropping 21%. Bitcoin has rallied more than 900% since March 2020 and it had only breached the $20,000-mark around mid-December 2020.

news_headline: OPPO launches Reno5 Pro 5G smartphone & Enco X wireless earphones
news_article: OPPO has launched Reno5 Pro 5G smartphone and OPPO Enco X True Wireless earphones in a Live event today. OPPO said that the 5G ready smartphone comes with industry-first AI Highlight Video feature and offers the Reno Glow design that makes the surface scratch and fingerprint resistant. The Reno5 Pro 5G is powered by a 5G-integrated MediaTek Dimensity 1000+ chipset.

news_headline: I enjoy situational comedy shows: Nehha on doing 'Bhabi Ji Ghar...'
news_article: Nehha Pendse, who'll be seen in show 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai', said, "I'm not a...fan of slapstick comic series instead I enjoy situational comedy shows." "That's the reason I took up 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' which [is] set in UP," she added. "As I've worked across regions, I always wished to play a UP-based character too," said Nehha.

news_headline: Rhea will bounce back: Rumi Jaffery on film 'Chehre' with Big B, Emraan
news_article: Filmmaker Rumi Jaffery said that Rhea Chakraborty will "bounce back" with 'Chehre' starring Amitabh Bachchan and Emraan Hashmi. Commenting on Rhea's arrest in a drug case following Sushant Singh Rajput's death, Jaffery said, "I'm confident she will get through this phase. Everybody around will advise you to be brave, but only the one going through knows how difficult it is."

news_headline: US says India's digital tax discriminates against its companies
news_article: The US has said that digital services taxes adopted by India as well as Italy and Turkey discriminate against American companies and are inconsistent with international tax principles. However,  the US said it won't be taking specific actions for now. India last year imposed a 2% tax on transactions where companies take payment abroad for digital services provided in India.

news_headline: 38 years of togetherness: Suniel Shetty shares video on anniversary
news_article: On his 38th wedding anniversary with Mana Shetty, actor Suniel Shetty shared a video, which included several old pictures of the actor and his wife. "38 years of togetherness...make your marriage more memorable than your wedding...Happy anniversary WIFEY," he wrote. Several celebrities, including Tiger Shroff, Sanjay Kapoor and Bosco Leslie Martis, also wished the couple on the occasion.

news_headline: Shweta has taken my son Reyansh to an undisclosed location: Estranged husband
news_article: TV actress Shweta Tiwari's estranged husband Abhinav Kohli has claimed his son Reyansh has been missing since Sunday. "I don't know where he is. He was with me for 40 days. Shweta has taken him to an undisclosed location," he added. He further said, "I personally went to her house also, but she is not meeting or taking my calls."

news_headline: FIR against Sohail, Arbaaz for going home instead of quarantining in Mumbai hotel
news_article: An FIR has been filed against Sohail Khan, his son Nirvaan and Arbaaz Khan for violating COVID-19 norms, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. "They returned from Dubai on December 25 and were asked to remain in quarantine in a hotel but they went home," it added. They gave a false undertaking to quarantine themselves at Hotel Taj Lands End.

news_headline: Felt like throwing Sushant out of house after argument, later he said sorry: Nitish
news_article: Actor Nitish Bharadwaj, while recalling working with Sushant Singh Rajput in 'Kedarnath', revealed they once had an altercation during rehearsal and he "felt like throwing Sushant out of the house". "Eventually, we gave the shot and...he came and hugged me [and] he was like 'Sorry sir'," Nitish added. "These are all creative altercations...Later he had sent me chocolates," said Nitish.

news_headline: Fortnite-maker Epic Games acquires US-based RAD Game Tools
news_article: Fortnite-maker Epic Games has acquired US-based RAD Game Tools, a video game software development company, for an undisclosed sum. Epic said RAD's products and technology appear in close to 25,000 games and are leveraged by the world's leading gaming companies. Epic and RAD plan to integrate RAD's technology into 'Unreal Engine' to "benefit the developer community and gamers alike".

news_headline: Big B explains connection between Sean Connery's date of death & '007'
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan, mourning the demise of Sean Connery, the first actor to play 'James Bond', gave an explanation behind the connection between Connery's date of death and '007', the fictional spy's code number. "What's the date today...31.10.20...Add up.. 3 +1 is 4, then [add] 1...then 0...then 2, so 4+1+2 =7...then 0...So 3+1+1+2 = 7 and two zeros...So 007!!" Bachchan wrote.

news_headline: YouTube to end full-day ad reservations on its homepage
news_article: YouTube will no longer allow reservations for full-day advertisements on its homepage, the company told CNBC. YouTube has come under the scrutiny of the Democratic National Committee after US President Donald Trump reserved banner ads on YouTube's homepage for days leading up to and including Election Day. Google said the change in policy was not connected to the presidential election.

news_headline: Hrithik Roshan praises Dimple Kapadia's performance in 'Tenet'
news_article: Hrithik Roshan took to Instagram Stories on Tuesday to praise Dimple Kapadia's performance in 'Tenet'. He wrote, "Hers is unmistakably one of the best performances by an Indian actor in an international film. Just brilliant!!!!" Hrithik added, "The charm, the power, the poise, the seductive eyes, Dimple aunty you are something else!" The film is directed by Christopher Nolan.

news_headline: I crave for experiences I can grow with: Ishaan on choosing scripts
news_article: Talking about how he chooses movie scripts, Ishaan Khatter said that he is mostly driven by instinct and added, "I want to work with certain people and I crave for experiences I can grow with." The actor, who will next star in the horror-comedy film 'Phone Bhoot', told Times of India, "Comedy is one of the hardest things to crack."

news_headline: A silly day to remember in sadness: Walker's daughter on his death anniversary
news_article: Hollywood actor Paul Walker's daughter Meadow Walker took to Instagram to share an old picture of herself with her late father on his seventh death anniversary. She wrote, "A silly day to remember in sadness." Meadow added, "Today's a celebration of the love and happiness you brought to the world. Here's a photo of my best bud & I napping."

news_headline: Saw myself open up as a person: Saiee Manjrekar on life post debut
news_article: Mahesh Manjrekar's daughter, actress Saiee Manjrekar, who made her debut with Salman Khan's 'Dabangg 3', has said her life after her debut has been "super". "Normally, I've always been a...shy person. I saw myself open up as a person after that," she added. "With all...interactions, and meeting people daily, I kind of started being more aware of...things happening," Saiee said.

news_headline: Discrepancy in statement, we've not given Arjun Rampal clean chit: NCB
news_article: Actor Arjun Rampal, who was questioned by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in connection with a drug case on Monday, could be called again for questioning as the anti-drug agency found a discrepancy in his statement. "The investigation is on in Arjun Rampal case, we have not given him a clean chit," said Sameer Wankhede, Zonal Director of NCB, Mumbai.

news_headline: I still give auditions, there's nothing wrong about it: Hiten Tejwani
news_article: On being asked if he still auditions for his roles, actor Hiten Tejwani, who has starred in over 40 films and shows, said, "Yes I do." He added, "People have seen me in...particular role, and they want to see me in...role they want to offer...to see if I can look that part, it's equally important. There's nothing wrong in that."

news_headline: 'Parasite' director Bong Joon Ho to head Venice Film Festival jury
news_article: South Korean filmmaker Bong Joon Ho, who directed the 2019 film 'Parasite', has been selected as jury president of the 78th Venice International Film Festival, organizers announced on Friday. "As president of the jury, and more importantly as a perpetual cinephile, I'm ready to admire and applaud...the great films selected by the festival," the Oscar-winner said in a statement.

news_headline: I feel I've been welcomed with open arms in the industry: Pulkit
news_article: On being asked if he had to struggle to find a place in Bollywood, Pulkit Samrat said, "I got my first break on television from Ekta Kapoor. Then it was Kumar Mangat...who gave me...break in Bittoo Boss and then Fukrey happened." He added, "I feel I've been welcomed with open arms in the industry and [I'm] grateful for the same."

news_headline: Kiara had to totally transform for her role in 'Indoo ki Jawani': Director
news_article: Abir Sengupta, the director of Kiara Advani's upcoming film 'Indoo Ki Jawani', has revealed that the actress had to completely transform herself from a "proper South Bombay girl" to a desi Ghaziabad girl for the film. "I realised...it's going to be tough. But the way she has put in her hard work, it came very easy and smooth," he added.

news_headline: I felt this is my kind of human being: Gauahar on fiancé Zaid
news_article: Speaking about her fiancé Zaid Darbar, actress Gauahar Khan said, "I was averse to the idea of being with anyone when I met him. Yet, I felt this was something different...I felt this is my kind of human being." She further said, "He can handle me, understand and take care of me, love me and be my best friend."

news_headline: Suspected Russian hackers attacked US nuclear weapons agency
news_article: The US nuclear weapons agency was hacked as part of a suspected Russian cyberattack that struck a number of federal government agencies, media reports said. The energy department said an ongoing investigation found the hack didn't affect "mission-essential national security functions". It added that the probe found the malware has been "isolated to business networks only".

news_headline: He defined an era and a style: Craig on Connery's death
news_article: Following the demise of Sir Sean Connery, Daniel Craig, who will play James Bond in his upcoming film 'No Time To Die', said, "He (Connery) defined an era and a style." Remembering Connery, who was the first actor to play Bond on screen, Craig added, "He will continue to influence actors and filmmakers alike for years to come."

news_headline: Justin Timberlake reveals he welcomed 2nd child with wife Jessica Biel
news_article: During his latest appearance on 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show', singer-actor Justin Timberlake confirmed that he and his wife Jessica Biel have welcomed their second child. "His name is Phineas. He's awesome and so cute. Nobody's sleeping. But we're thrilled...and couldn't be happier. Very grateful," he told Ellen. The couple welcomed their first child, son Silas, in April 2015.

news_headline: Beauty norms for actresses are changing slowly: Shikha Talsania
news_article: Actress Shikha Talsania, who will share screen space with Sara Ali Khan and Varun Dhawan in the upcoming film 'Coolie No 1', noted that the beauty norms for actresses in the film industry are gradually changing. "I don't think it is changing very quickly. But there is definitely more acceptance and inclusiveness now. Which I think is great," she explained.

news_headline: Realising my love for Aly was the best part about Bigg Boss: Jasmin
news_article: Actress and recently evicted contestant from 'Bigg Boss 14' Jasmin Bhasin spoke about her relationship with Aly Goni and said that the "feeling of falling in love, and realising it" was her biggest takeaway from the reality show. "When we [Aly and I] were apart, emotions overpowered all logic. We decided to stop living in denial," she added.

news_headline: Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother, actor Siddhanth Kapoor, has tested positive for coronavirus. The actor, who's currently in Goa, told ETimes, "Around Sunday I lost my sense of taste. I felt that I should get myself tested and the test result has come positive." He added, "I've quarantined myself here. I'm sure that I will be okay in a few days."

news_headline: Samsung uses iPhone to tweet about its upcoming smartphone; gets trolled
news_article: Samsung used its rival company Apple's iPhone to promote an event for the upcoming Galaxy S21 smartphone. A poll posted by the official Twitter handle of Samsung Mobile US had 'Twitter for iPhone' written at the bottom, implying that an iPhone was used to post the tweet. "Not even Samsung employees use a Samsung phone," a Twitter user said.

news_headline: Choreographer Ganesh Acharya reveals he has lost 98-kg weight
news_article: Choreographer Ganesh Acharya, in a recent promo of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', revealed that he has lost 98-kg weight. In the promo, Kapil Sharma jokes, "Do aadmi gayab kar diye aapne." Earlier in an interview in 2017, Ganesh had revealed that his weight almost touched 200 kg in 2015 after he had gained weight for a movie.

news_headline: Robert De Niro joins Christian Bale in David O Russell's next film
news_article: Hollywood actor Robert De Niro will star in David O Russell's upcoming movie along with actors Mike Myers, Timothy Olyphant, Michael Shannon, Chris Rock, and Anya Taylor-Joy. The previously announced cast includes actors Christian Bale, Margot Robbie and John David Washington. According to The Hollywood Reporter, the filmmaker will be directing the movie from his own script.

news_headline: I don't believe in starving myself or doing crash diets: Mrunal
news_article: Actress Mrunal Thakur, who has worked with actors like John Abraham, Hrithik Roshan and Shahid Kapoor, said she learned about holistic fitness from her co-stars and added, "I don't believe in starving myself or doing crash diets." She further said, "I eat everything. I swear by yoga and MMA. I work out every day, regardless of how busy I am."

news_headline: After Ram Charan, Varun Tej tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Telugu actor Varun Tej Konidela has tested positive for coronavirus. He shared the news on Twitter on Tuesday and informed that he has quarantined himself at home and is taking necessary precautions. The news comes after Varun's relative Ram Charan shared that he has tested positive for COVID-19. Ram had recently hosted a party which was attended by Varun.

news_headline: Actor Varun Tej Konidela tests negative for coronavirus
news_article: Telugu actor Varun Tej Konidela, who contracted coronavirus last week, has now tested negative for the virus. The actor took to social media on Thursday to share the news and wrote, "Never thought a report saying 'Negative' would bring in so much joy to me. Yes, I tested COVID Negative. Thank you very much for all the love and prayers."

news_headline: Mom told me to be honest: Renee on getting acting advice from Sushmita
news_article: Renee Sen, who will make her acting debut with the upcoming short film 'Suttabaazi', spoke about receiving acting advice from her mother, actress Sushmita Sen, and said, "My mom just told me to be very honest about it." She added, "Her only advice to me...is that I should be able to deliver what my director wants me to."

news_headline: Hike messaging app shuts down, removed from app stores
news_article: Hike messaging app has shut down and vanished from Google and Apple's app stores after the startup announced its app was going off the air earlier this month without giving explanation. Hike Founder Kavin Bharti Mittal had on January 6 announced the closure of Hike Sticker Chat. "India won't have its own messenger," Mittal had tweeted amid WhatsApp's policy controversy.

news_headline: GoT prequel 'House of the Dragon' casts Matt Smith, Olivia Cooke: Reports
news_article: Actors Matt Smith, Olivia Cooke and Emma D'Arcy have reportedly joined the cast of 'Game of Thrones' prequel 'House of the Dragon'. According to The Hollywood Reporter, Matt, who has starred in the television series 'The Crown', will play Prince Daemon Targaryen. The actors have joined the cast alongside previously announced Paddy Considine, who will play King Viserys Targaryen.

news_headline: Aparshakti Khurana to star in suspense thriller film with Madhavan
news_article: Aparshakti Khurana will star in a suspense thriller film, which will be directed by Kookie Gulati. He shared the news on Instagram and wrote, "Super thrilled to announce my first suspense thriller with Madhavan, Khushali Kumar, Darshan Kumaar, Bhushan Kumar @tseries.official to be directed by @kookievgulati." He also shared a picture wherein he can be seen posing with his co-actors.

news_headline: Xiaomi accepts faulty update that bricked many Mi A3 devices
news_article: Chinese smartphone manufacturer Xiaomi on Tuesday said it was aware of the faulty, recently released Android 11 update that bricked several Mi A3 devices. The company has since halted the rollout of the update. Xiaomi added that users would be provided with a free solution regardless of whether the smartphone model is within warranty or not.

news_headline: Cyberpunk 2077 maker CD Projekt sued by investor over game's launch
news_article: CD Projekt, the maker of the video game Cyberpunk 2077, has been sued by an investor who claimed he was misled about the game. In his complaint, Andrew Trampe said the company failed to disclose that the game was “virtually unplayable on...Xbox or PlayStation systems due to an enormous number of bugs". Sony also removed the game from PlayStation's store.

news_headline: Actress Rakul Preet tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: Actress Rakul Preet took to Instagram on Tuesday to share that she has tested positive for coronavirus. "I've quarantined myself. I am feeling fine and will rest up well so that I can be back at shoot soon," she stated. "[I] request everyone who met me to kindly get yourself tested. Thank you and please stay safe," Rakul added.

news_headline: Brazilian filmmaker drops iPhone from plane, it survives 300m drop & records free fall
news_article: According to Brazilian media outlet G1's report, Brazilian documentary filmmaker Ernesto Galiotto dropped his iPhone 6s from a small plane's window accidentally while trying to capture a video. Galiotto claimed he found the phone near a beach by using GPS tracking and discovered it had survived the 300-metre drop. The phone had also recorded a video of the free fall.

news_headline: Facebook buys customer service startup Kustomer for a reported $1 bn
news_article: Facebook on Monday confirmed it has acquired Kustomer, a startup specialising in customer-service platforms and chatbots, for a reported sum of $1 billion. Kustomer was last valued at $710 million in a funding round roughly a year ago. Facebook-owned WhatsApp's COO Matt Idema said their aim with Kustomer is to "give businesses access to best-in-class tools that deliver excellent service".

news_headline: Electric car battery that can fully charge in 5 minutes produced for first time
news_article: Electric car batteries that can be fully charged in five minutes have been produced in a factory for the first time. The new lithium-ion batteries were developed by Israeli company StoreDot and manufactured by its strategic partner Eve Energy in China on a normal production line. StoreDot CEO Doron Myersdorf said the company is aiming for a 2025 mass roll-out.

news_headline: Deepika to star alongside Hrithik in 'War' director's Fighter: Reports
news_article: Deepika Padukone will share screen space with Hrithik Roshan in upcoming action-thriller film 'Fighter', which will be directed by Siddharth Anand, as per reports. "Both are expected to do loads of action," Bollywood Hungama said quoting a source. Hrithik, who'll reportedly play the role of an air force officer in 'Fighter', also worked with Siddharth in 'War' and 'Bang Bang'.

news_headline: I was typecast in a mother's role very early in life: Shefali Shah
news_article: In a recent interview, actress Shefali Shah mentioned that she got typecast as a mother quite early in her acting career. "I was 20. I did a show where I played the mother of a 15-year-old...And then, when I was around 28-30, I played mother to Akshay Kumar. According to screen time, I'm probably 133 years or something," she said.

news_headline: Users to lose access to WhatsApp if new privacy policy not accepted by Feb 8
news_article: WhatsApp has started sending an in-app notification asking users to agree to its updated terms and privacy policy, which come into effect on February 8. Users will lose access to the app if they don't accept the new terms by then. WhatsApp also asked the users who would prefer to delete their accounts to visit its Help Center.

news_headline: I could do justice to the role as I knew Sathya Sai Baba well: Jalota on biopic
news_article: Bhajan singer and former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Anup Jalota, who has played the role of late godman Sathya Sai Baba in an upcoming biopic, said that he was able to do justice to the role because he knew him well. "I am one of his followers...so I knew how he used to sit, walk...and interact with his followers," Jalota added.

news_headline: Facebook Pages will no longer show number of 'likes'
news_article: Facebook on Wednesday announced that it'll be making some changes to Facebook Pages. The redesign will no longer feature the "like" button or display the total number of "likes" the Pages receive. Further, Pages will get their own News Feed, allowing them to participate in conversations as the public figure or the brand, follow trends and interact with their fans.

news_headline: Nazara becomes first Indian gaming tech startup to seek IPO
news_article: Mumbai-based Nazara Technologies has become India's first gaming technology startup to seek a market debut as it filed Initial Public Offering (IPO) documents with the market regulator. Backed by billionaire business magnate Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, Nazara was founded in 2000 by gamer Nitish Mittersain when he was a college undergrad. He started Nazara with ₹3 crore borrowed from friends and family.

news_headline: We realised we'd be better off as friends: Krishna on breakup with Eban
news_article: Talking about her breakup with ex-boyfriend Eban Hyams, Tiger Shroff's sister Krishna Shroff said that they both realised they would be better off as friends than being in a relationship. "So it wasn't very messy of a breakup at all," she added. "I've never had an issue being friends with exes...usually they have a problem with it," Krishna further said.

news_headline: RBI forms working group to study digital lending via apps, portals
news_article: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday constituted a working group to examine aspects of digital lending by regulated and unregulated players, such as online platforms and mobile apps. The bank added that the "recent spurt and popularity" of lending apps has raised "certain serious concerns". The working group will also suggest appropriate regulatory approaches for such players.

news_headline: What are the new guidelines issued for companies like Ola and Uber?
news_article: Cab aggregators like Ola and Uber should pay at least 80% of the ride fare to drivers, new guidelines stated. 'Surge price' is capped at 1.5 times the base fare while the cancellation fee for both riders and drivers is set at 10% of the total fare, not exceeding ₹100. The base fare will be for at least 3 km.

news_headline: Karnataka Anti-Tobacco Cell objects to smoking visual in KGF 2 teaser
news_article: The Karnataka State Anti-Tobacco Cell and Health Department have objected to a scene showing actor Yash lighting a cigarette and smoking in the recently released teaser of 'KGF Chapter 2'. A letter objecting to the scene has been sent to director Prashanth Neel, Yash and producer Vijay Kiragandur as the makers failed to display the anti-smoking warning message in teaser.

news_headline: Canada's accusations of China being cybercrime threat groundless: China
news_article: Chinese Foreign Ministry's spokesperson Zhao Lijian said that Canada's accusations of China being a cybercrime threat are "groundless". The Communications Security Establishment (CSE) of Canada, in its second national cyber threat assessment, also named Russia, Iran and North Korea as major threats. It said that it feared foreign actors could try to disrupt power supplies.

news_headline: Apple asked to pay VirnetX $503 mn in security-patent trial in US
news_article: A US jury has asked Apple to pay VirnetX around $503 million in royalties for VPN on Demand, the iOS feature that allows users access to virtual private networks. VirnetX had argued that both VPN on Demand and Apple's FaceTime features were using its inventions. It had told the jury that it was entitled to more than $700 million.

news_headline: US internet entrepreneur and ex-Zappos CEO Tony Hsieh dies at 46
news_article: Former CEO of online fashion retailer Zappos Tony Hsieh has died aged 46 after a house fire in Connecticut, US. Hsieh was reportedly visiting family, having recently retired after 20 years leading Zappos, which was acquired by Amazon for more than $1 billion in 2009. Hsieh sold his first company to Microsoft in 1998 for $265 million.

news_headline: We need young people to end violence against children: Ayushmann
news_article: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who is UNICEF's celebrity advocate for children's rights, noted that young people should join forces to put an end to violence against children. "Influencing peer groups to recognise violence in its many forms is something the young people can do very effectively," he said on the occasion of National Youth Day.

news_headline: Vikrant Massey to star in Hindi remake of Malayalam film 'Forensic'
news_article: Actor Vikrant Massey will star in the Hindi remake of the Malayalam thriller film, 'Forensic', which released earlier this year. He will essay the role of a meticulous forensic officer, portrayed by Tovino Thomas in the original. Talking about the film, Vikrant said, "It's an intelligent film that keeps you on tenterhooks. At the same time, it's an out-and-out entertainer."

news_headline: I've done a lot of bad films, I'm grateful I still get work: Rahul
news_article: Speaking about his acting career, 'Aashiqui' star Rahul Roy said, "I have done a lot of bad films and I've accepted them...I am grateful that I still get work." The actor, who will next star in the film 'Sayonee', added, "A lot of people didn't want to take me...but they will...see that I have completely revolutionized my way of working."

news_headline: Google, Facebook, Amazon face PIL in HC seeking financial regulation
news_article: A petition has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking a detailed legal framework for regulating fintech companies such as Google, Facebook and Amazon. The petition claims that unregulated operation of such companies in financial sector can lead to financial crisis. The High Court has issued notice to RBI, SEBI, NPCI and IRDAI seeking their stand on the plea.

news_headline: Wasn't easy to convince Annu Kapoor for the role: 'Paurashpur' director
news_article: Speaking about roping in veteran actor Annu Kapoor for the web series 'Paurashpur', director Shachindra Vats said it wasn't easy to convince the actor to play the role of king Bhadrapratap in the show. "King Bhadrapratap has shades of grey but the character exudes power and attitude, and Annu Kapoor has done full justice to the role," Shachindra added.

news_headline: Actress Amrita Rao, RJ Anmol blessed with a baby boy
news_article: Actress Amrita Rao and her husband RJ Anmol have been blessed with a baby boy. The couple welcomed their first child on Sunday morning. "Both the mother and baby are healthy and doing well. The family is ecstatic and both Amrita and RJ Anmol thank everyone for their wishes and blessings," their spokesperson said in a statement.

news_headline: Army was the most secular place: Rannvijay recalls his growing up years
news_article: Actor Rannvijay Singha remembered his growing up years in an Army environment and said, "There was no bhed-bhaav...It (Indian Army) was the most secular place. We would celebrate Christmas, Eid, Holi, Gurpurab, everything." He further said that there was no gender bias and added, "It wasn’t as if the girls would play with dolls and the guys football."

news_headline: Only one unit of PlayStation 5 with 20 kg gold to be made by Russian company
news_article: Russian company Caviar will make only one unit of a luxury Sony PlayStation 5 gaming console which will be made by assembling eight sheets created by using 20 kilograms of gold. The controllers will be made of crocodile leather with gold inserts. While the company did not reveal the gadget's price, a report estimated it will cost over ₹8 crore.

news_headline: There aren't so much drugs in B'wood as it's being claimed to be: Sukhwinder
news_article: Commenting on Bollywood's alleged drug links, singer Sukhwinder Singh said, "There aren't so much drugs in the film industry as it's being claimed to be." He added, "If there were drugs to that extent, then they wouldn't even have been able to even go to shoot!" "A lot of people are trying to convert it into a tamasha," said Sukhwinder.

news_headline: 2020 has been a special year: Nawazuddin Siddiqui
news_article: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui mentioned that the year 2020 was special because he got to play two "completely contrasting" characters, Jatil Yadav in 'Raat Akeli Hai' and Ayyan Mani in 'Serious Men'. "They represented distinct ideologies and mannerisms, which make them stand apart. I am thankful for all the love and appreciation from our audiences," he added.

news_headline: He was misunderstood: Dialogue writer on Saif's humanising Raavan comment
news_article: Manoj Muntashir, who has penned the dialogues and lyrics of 'Adipurush', has reacted to Saif Ali Khan's remark wherein he said the film will portray 'Raavan' in a "humane" manner. Manoj said Saif was misunderstood and there's nothing offensive in the film. "[Raavan] will be seen in all his shades...He'll be shown as...flamboyant king, who was also cruel," he added.

news_headline: Brother of Arjun Rampal's girlfriend granted bail in drug case
news_article: A special NDPS court on Tuesday granted bail to Agisilaos Demetriades, the brother of actor Arjun Rampal's girlfriend Gabriella, in connection with a drug case related to Sushant Singh Rajput's death case. He was arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on October 18. Agisilaos was in touch with other drug peddlers related to the case, NCB had said.

news_headline: Divya Bhatnagar dies after battling for life on ventilator, had COVID-19
news_article: TV actress Divya Bhatnagar, who was on ventilator after her oxygen levels dropped and later tested positive for coronavirus, has passed away. Actress Devoleena Bhattacharjee took to Instagram and wrote, "I know today you must be in a better place and free from all the sorrows, pains, sadness." Divya had starred in the show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai'.

news_headline: If I had a party, would ask friends to get tested for COVID-19: Drashti
news_article: Television actress Drashti Dhami, who turned 36 on Sunday, said, "If I had a party, I would ensure that friends who come to my birthday get a COVID-19 test." Admitting that she feels scared of stepping out due to the fear of contracting coronavirus, Drashti added, "I've learnt how to be at home and entertain myself...But...I'm reaching a saturation point."

news_headline: Swara Bhasker joins farmers' protest at Delhi's Singhu border
news_article: Actress Swara Bhasker joined the farmers' protest at Delhi's Singhu border on Thursday. Taking to Twitter, she shared a few pictures from the ongoing protest and wrote, "A humbling day to see the grit, resolve and determination of protesting farmers and the elderly at #SinghuBorder #FarmersProtests." Earlier, actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh was also spotted at the protest at Singhu border.

news_headline: Neha Kakkar shows baby bump in pic with husband; celebs congratulate
news_article: Singer Neha Kakkar on Friday posted a picture with husband Rohanpreet Singh and showed her baby bump. Commenting on the picture, Rohanpreet wrote, "Ab toh kuch zyada hi khyaal rakhna parhega Nehuuuu (Now I'll have to take extra care of you)." Celebrities including comedian Kapil Sharma, actor Jay Bhanushali and singer Harshdeep Kaur congratulated the couple.

news_headline: VJ Chitra's husband didn't like scene she enacted, pushed her on day she died: Police
news_article: Following the arrest of Tamil TV actress VJ Chitra's husband for allegedly abetting her suicide, Assistant Commissioner of Police Sudarshan told NDTV, "He didn't like a scene she had enacted on TV." "On the day she died, he had also pushed her," the official added. The 29-year-old actress was found dead at her hotel room in Chennai last week.

news_headline: Actor Faraaz Khan, who was battling for life after brain infection, dies at 50
news_article: Actor Faraaz Khan, who was battling for his life in a Bengaluru hospital after suffering seizures due to herpes infection in brain, has passed away aged 50. "With a heavy heart I break the news that #FaraazKhan has left us for what I believe, is a better place," tweeted Pooja Bhatt. Faraaz had starred in films including 'Mehndi' and 'Fareb'.

news_headline: No uncle or aunty recommended me: Sidharth on his B'wood journey
news_article: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, in an interview, spoke about his journey in the Hindi film industry and said, "I had zero experience on camera and no uncle or aunty recommended me, so I could only learn from my mistakes." He added, "I did modelling for pocket money. I became...assistant director in my mid-20s. I feel it's just the beginning for me."

news_headline: We've made the decision to implement changes: 'Tandav' director
news_article: 'Tandav' director Ali Abbas Zafar has issued a statement, announcing that the team has decided to implement changes to the web series "to address the concerns raised towards the same". "We thank the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting for the guidance & support in the matter," he added. An FIR was filed against the makers for allegedly hurting religious sentiments.

news_headline: Katrina's sister Isabelle to star in 'Suswagatam Khushaamadeed'
news_article: Katrina Kaif's sister, actress Isabelle Kaif, will star opposite Pulkit Samrat in the film 'Suswagatam Khushaamadeed'. Pulkit will essay the role of a Delhi boy, while Isabelle will be playing the role of Noor who hails from the city of Agra. Talking about working with Isabelle, he said that she's extremely hard-working and has brought fresh energy on the set.

news_headline: Was offered Munna's part in Mirzapur, I said I don't have dates: Ali
news_article: Actor Ali Fazal, who plays a character named Guddu Pandit in 'Mirzapur', has revealed that he was offered another part initially. "I think it was Munna's part, which Divyendu has done," he said, adding, "So I made an excuse. I said I don't have dates...something has come up, I left. Then I got a call back later saying...let's try this."

news_headline: Gaming billionaire to launch 'Half-Life'-inspired gnome into space to thank NZ
news_article: Gabe Newell, the billionaire Co-founder of gaming company Valve which owns Steam, said he will launch a 'Half-Life'-inspired, titanium gnome into space to thank New Zealand for its hospitality during his stay there through the pandemic. The gnome's journey will be live-streamed and Newell will donate a dollar per viewer who watches it within 24 hours of the launch.

news_headline: He signed his first autograph in Tashkent: Big B shares pic with Abhishek
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan took to Instagram on Wednesday to share an old picture with his son, actor Abhishek Bachchan. He wrote, "Tashkent, Soviet Union...1900's...where he signed his first autograph...Abhishek."
