Reacting to the post, a fan wrote, "Sir, I think you mean 1990's," while another fan wrote, "Love and respect for Senior and Junior Bachchan."

news_headline: A film very close to my heart: Madhuri on 23 yrs of Dil To Pagal Hai
news_article: Taking to Instagram on Saturday, Madhuri Dixit shared a post on the 23rd anniversary of her film, 'Dil to Pagal Hai', which also starred Shah Rukh Khan, Karisma Kapoor and Akshay Kumar. She wrote, "#DilTohPagalHai is a film very close to my heart." Madhuri added, "It was a wonderful learning experience and working alongside @iamsrk @therealkarismakapoor, @akshaykumar is always memorable."

news_headline: Want to be a part of projects like Paatal Lok, Mirzapur: Hina Khan
news_article: Actress Hina Khan said in an interview that she wants to be a part of projects like 'Paatal Lok', 'Mirzapur' and 'Delhi Crime'. The actress further said she wants to explore the digital space next year. "I want to...do some great projects next year. I also want to do some really good art films that are realistic," Hina added.

news_headline: I am a seasoned player, have seen so many highs and lows: Ajay Devgn
news_article: Talking about his film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', Ajay Devgn said, "I'm ecstatic with...box office of our film. I wasn't expecting it to break records." He added, "In...career spanning 29 years, I've seen so many highs and lows...that I never go into a film thinking it will break records. I'm a seasoned player. I do...film because I believe in it."

news_headline: Dadlani's heart bleeds for Rhea but he was silent when women accused Anu Malik: Sona
news_article: Sona Mohapatra has criticised Vishal Dadlani for not speaking against #MeToo accused Anu Malik and questioned his sense of justice after Dadlani shared a tweet wherein he talked about Rhea Chakraborty's alleged media trial. Sona tweeted, "Dadlani's heart bleeds for Rhea...None of this justice bent came into play for Vishal when endless women called out his #IndianIdol colleague Anu Malik."

news_headline: Bigg Boss 14 contestant Rahul Vaidya's mom confirms he'll marry Disha Parmar
news_article: Bigg Boss 14 contestant Rahul Vaidya's mother Geeta has confirmed that her son will marry actress Disha Parmar this year. Talking to The Times of India, Geeta said, "We're waiting for Rahul to come out [of the show], the moment he's out, [we'll]...finalise the dates." She added, "Disha doesn't want to get married in summer, so mostly we'll have...June wedding."

news_headline: TikTok to remove videos of Trump's speeches to supporters
news_article: TikTok will remove videos of US President Donald Trump's speeches to supporters, saying they violate the company's misinformation policy. It will also redirect specific hashtags used by US Capitol rioters, like #stormthecapitol and #patriotparty, to reduce their content's visibility in the app. TikTok will still let people post "counter speech" against the Trump videos.

news_headline: I'd consciously reduced my work as my priority was family: Arjun Rampal
news_article: Actor Arjun Rampal has said he consciously took on little work in the past five years because he wanted to concentrate on his family. "My mom wasn't well. She was diagnosed with cancer. My priority was to spend time with her," he added. "I was also going through a separation. I wanted to be there for kids," Arjun further said.

news_headline: Actor Anil Nedumangad drowns to death aged 48 in Kerala dam while bathing with friends
news_article: Actor Anil Nedumangad, known for his roles in Malayalam films 'Ayyappanum Koshiyum', 'Kammattipaadam' and 'Paavada', drowned to death aged 48 today in Malankara dam in Kerala's Thodupuzha. He had stepped into the Malankara dam reservoir to take a bath with his friends. Condoling Anil's demise, actor Dulquer Salmaan wrote, "Heart hurts. Can’t make sense of this. RIP Anil etta."

news_headline: Broadcaster to air deepfake version of UK Queen's Christmas message
news_article: UK broadcaster Channel 4 will show an alternative Christmas message which will be delivered by a digitally-altered version of Queen Elizabeth II. It will show the Queen sharing her reflections on the year, including the departure of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. Channel 4 said the intention was to give a "stark warning" about fake news in digital era.

news_headline: Abhishek's 'Bob Biswas' wraps shoot, SRK thanks team
news_article: The shooting of Abhishek Bachchan and Chitrangda Singh's 'Bob Biswas', produced by Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment, is complete, the makers announced on Thursday. Taking to Twitter, Shah Rukh wrote, "Thank you all for being so professional and getting the job done...in these testing times." Directed by Diya Annapurna Ghosh, 'Bob Biswas' is a spin-off of 2012 film 'Kahaani'.

news_headline: Was so nervous about interviewing SRK I forgot to wear my other shoe, says TV host
news_article: TV host and chef Maria Goretti has shared an old video of an interview with Shah Rukh Khan and wrote, "I was nervous as hell, because I'm a huge @iamsrk fan, like...rest of the world." "I was so nervous, I forgot to put my other shoe on," she added. "He was so kind and full of good manners," wrote Maria.

news_headline: The new 'Coolie No 1' has its own journey: Varun Dhawan
news_article: On being asked what aspects of the original 'Coolie No 1' will the new film retain, Varun Dhawan said, "Screenplay of original...was outstanding, which was written by Rumi Jaffery, Kader Khan." He added, "We've tried to keep that intact but the new film continues its own journey as well." Directed by David Dhawan, the film also stars Sara Ali Khan.

news_headline: I get messages asking me to sleep with or marry someone: Aditi Sanwal on casting couch
news_article: Talking about casting couch, 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay 2' actress Aditi Sanwal said that she often receives vulgar messages from people claiming to be casting agents. "Sometimes I receive messages asking me to sleep with or marry someone," she added. Aditi further said, "I don’t even think such people are genuine, so I just block them."

news_headline: Tesla in talks to set up manufacturing facility in Gujarat
news_article: Tesla is in talks with the Gujarat government to set up a manufacturing facility in the state. "We are hopeful that...Tesla will prefer Gujarat," Additional Chief Secretary of Gujarat Chief Minister's Office told the Economic Times. The state government has assured the company all possible assistance and incentives for setting up base in Gujarat, the official further said.

news_headline: Offices post COVID-19 to become spaces where staff book desks: AWS CEO
news_article: Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy expects office buildings to evolve into 'hot offices', in the post-pandemic world, where employees can decide which day to come in and reserve a desk. In an interview with CNBC, he said that most people would adopt a hybrid model of work instead of working from office 100% of the time.

news_headline: Tiger, Tara's Heropanti 2 to be shot across 10 countries: Reports
news_article: Tiger Shroff and Tara Sutaria-starrer 'Heropanti 2' will be shot across the globe in over 10 countries, as per reports. The makers have zeroed in on London, New York, Moscow, Tokyo and Manila, and more cities will be added after the shooting begins, reports stated. The film will be directed by Ahmed Khan and produced by Sajid Nadiadwala.

news_headline: Suspected Russian hackers used Microsoft vendors to attack: Reports
news_article: The suspected Russian hackers behind the cyberattack on US agencies also used Microsoft's resellers to break into customers of Microsoft's Office 365 software, media reports said. Security firm CrowdStrike said some hackers got access to the vendor that sold it Office licences and used that to try to read its email. CrowdStrike found no impact from the intrusion attempt.

news_headline: We shouldn't expect too much from its box office: Kiara on 'Indoo Ki...'
news_article: Ahead of the release of her film 'Indoo Ki Jawani', Kiara Advani said box office pressure isn't playing on her mind. She added, "We need to be practical and not expect too much from its box office." "The world isn't operating the way it did pre-pandemic...I hope people watch the film wherever they're comfortable, theatres or on...OTT [later]," said Kiara.

news_headline: It was horror and disbelief: Sean Bean on Ned Stark's death in GoT
news_article: Hollywood actor Sean Bean spoke about his character Ned Stark's death scene in the television series 'Game of Thrones', saying, "It was horror and disbelief." He added, "Joffrey changed his mind (about exiling Ned), and then resignation and...seeing his daughter for the last time, Arya...Those mix of feelings is what made it what it was."

news_headline: Google could face US antitrust lawsuit over its app store fees: Report
news_article: Google could face an antitrust lawsuit from three US states over the 30% fee it takes from developers for subscriptions and in-app purchases on its Play Store, Bloomberg reported. Vice President of Product Management at Google Sameer Samat said if developers don't agree with Google's business terms, they can choose other app store platforms to distribute their apps on Android.

news_headline: It'll be a proud moment when we make India COVID-19 free: Big B
news_article: Commenting on India's COVID-19 vaccination drive, Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan took to Twitter and spoke about making India coronavirus-free. The actor, who had contracted the virus in July 2020, wrote, "It was a proud moment when we made India polio-free, it shall be just as proud a moment when we make India COVID-19 free. Jai Hind."

news_headline: China's bottled water tycoon $6 bn away from overtaking Zuckerberg: Bloomberg
news_article: China's bottled water tycoon Zhong Shanshan, who recently overtook Warren Buffett to become the world's sixth richest person, is only $6 billion away from surpassing Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's net worth of $101 billion. Shanshan's wealth currently stands at $95 billion and has surged by nearly $20 billion in the last 10 days, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

news_headline: Sona says her new video got comments doubting MeToo claims over 'vulgar clothes'
news_article: Singer Sona Mohapatra said she received comments on her latest video saying she "possibly lied about her #MeToo call-outs" considering she "wears such vulgar clothes". She added the comments also said she's "possibly the kind of woman who likes men to misbehave with her." Sharing screenshots, Sona tweeted, "The chaps don't even make sense in the way they write."

news_headline: After 'Roop Ki Rani Choron Ka Raja', I had more failures: Satish
news_article: Actor-director Satish Kaushik spoke about the setbacks and disappointments during the initial years of his career and said he had more failures after the release of his directorial-debut film 'Roop Ki Rani Choron Ka Raja'. "Slowly things got better...You make it and then you fall. You accept your failures as much as your success," he added.

news_headline: Happy that producers took bold step: Director on 'Indoo...' theatrical release
news_article: Talking about the theatrical release of his upcoming comedy film 'Indoo Ki Jawani', director Abir Sengupta said he's happy that the producers have taken a bold step to release the film in theatres amid the coronavirus pandemic. "[I'm] very excited because this is my first Hindi film and I always wanted to see it on the big screen," he added.

news_headline: Arjun signs Vishal Bhardwaj's son Aasmaan's directorial debut: Reports
news_article: According to reports, actor Arjun Kapoor has been signed for filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj's son Aasmaan's directorial debut. "Arjun loved the script when he heard it for the first time," a source said. Aasmaan is in the process of zeroing in on the cast and is planning to begin the shoot depending on the pandemic situation, reports added.

news_headline: 'Bond Girl' Tanya Roberts dies aged 65 a day after being wrongly declared dead
news_article: Actress Tanya Roberts, who starred in the James Bond film 'A View to a Kill', died aged 65. Roberts' representative on Tuesday confirmed to Variety that she died on Monday night due to a urinary tract infection that spread to her kidney, gallbladder, liver and blood stream. Pingel, however, had mistakenly told outlets the actress had passed away on Sunday.

news_headline: Film festival invites one fan to watch movies alone on remote Swedish island
news_article: Sweden's Göteborg Film Festival is inviting one cinema fan to spend a week from January 30 to February 6 to watch its line-up of 60 titles on an isolated remote island. Inviting applications, the festival said the viewer will not be allowed to use a phone or laptop. The viewer will be set up in the former lighthouse keeper's house.

news_headline: NCB searches for Sushant Singh Rajput's friend Rishikesh Pawar
news_article: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) is conducting a search for Sushant Singh Rajput's friend, assistant director Rishikesh Pawar, who has been absconding since January 7. Rishikesh was summoned to appear before the agency in connection with a drugs case. Reportedly, he was also questioned by NCB in September after being named as one of the persons supplying drugs to Sushant.

news_headline: Esha Deol's Instagram account hacked, name changed to 'Instagram Support'
news_article: Actress Esha Deol on Sunday tweeted that her Instagram account was hacked and her account's display name was changed to 'Instagram Support'. "Please don't reply to any message if you received any from my Instagram account," the actress tweeted. Recently, Instagram accounts of singer Asha Bhosle, actor-politician Urmila Matondkar and other celebrities were also hacked in a similar pattern.

news_headline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's net worth quintupled to $167 bn in 2020
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's net worth has quintupled to around $167 billion in 2020, who is now also the world's second richest person, trailing only Amazon's Jeff Bezos. According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, Musk started the year at a net worth of $27.6 billion. Tesla's 689% increase in value this year is a major reason for Musk's surge.

news_headline: Twitter labels Trump's tweet accusing Democrats of trying to 'steal the election'
news_article: US President Donald Trump accused Democrats of trying to "steal" the election early Wednesday, saying his administration would "never" allow this to happen. Twitter immediately labelled the post with a warning saying, "Some or all of the content shared in this Tweet is disputed and might be misleading about an election or other civic process."

news_headline: We want to see our fans in India and perform in person: BTS
news_article: In a recent interview, the members of K-pop boy band BTS thanked their fans in India and said that they wish to perform in the country. "Thank you for the love and support... we want to be there and see all the armies in India... we want to... say Namaste... and just give our voices in person," they told NDTV.

news_headline: All rubbish was being offered to me: Vidya Malavade on taking break from films
news_article: Vidya Malavade, who starred in film 'Chak De! India', talked about her absence from films and said, "I...kept saying no to projects...because all rubbish was being offered to me." She added that she doesn't want to do any film for money. "I'm not doing it for anything but for me to feel that magic of a good performance," Vidya said.

news_headline: Men never molested women at home according to him: Sona on Mukesh's remark
news_article: Singer Sona Mohapatra has criticised actor Mukesh Khanna's remark wherein he said that the "MeToo problem began when women stepped out to work". "Men never ever molested or assaulted women and children inside homes according to this fellow who is best ignored. Tacky [mandbuddhi]," she tweeted. "The sad truth is there are...more such regressive mindsets around us everywhere," Sona added.

news_headline: Want to tell that story to the world: Deepika on playing Draupadi
news_article: During a recent interview, actress Deepika Padukone confirmed that she will play the role of Draupadi in Madhu Mantena's upcoming production 'Mahabharat'. Commenting on the project, she told Femina, "The most famous story coming out of our country, Mahabharat, in which I am playing Draupadi, I want to tell that story to the world."

news_headline: Interesting to play demon king: Saif on playing Lankesh in 'Adipurush'
news_article: Actor Saif Ali Khan, who will play Lankesh in the action-drama film 'Adipurush', spoke about playing the antagonist in the upcoming movie and said, "It's interesting to play a demon king." Commenting on his character, he added, "We'll make him humane...justify his abduction of Sita...the war with Ram as revenge for what was done to his sister Surpanakha by Lakshman."

news_headline: Soumitra Chatterjee's haemoglobin count drops, given blood transfusion
news_article: Actor Soumitra Chatterjee was given a blood transfusion on Sunday after his haemoglobin count dropped. "His bleeding... is not... controlled fully. His haemoglobin is fluctuating. We had to transfuse four units of blood... every passing day we may be losing ground," one of the attending doctors said. "His organ functions are holding on... oxygen part is satisfactory," the doctor added.

news_headline: WhatsApp calls Apple's data privacy labels 'anti-competitive'
news_article: Following Apple's announcement that all third-party apps on its App Store would require detailed information on privacy, a WhatsApp spokesperson has called the move "anti-competitive". They alleged that the updated policy would not apply to iMessage as it comes pre-installed on Apple devices. This may give WhatsApp a competitive disadvantage compared to iMessage, the spokesperson told Axios.

news_headline: Classics shouldn't be touched: Saira on reports of Dilip's 'Shakti' remake
news_article: Commenting on reports of Amitabh Bachchan and Dilip Kumar starrer 'Shakti' getting a remake, Dilip's wife and veteran actress Saira Banu said, "What! Is it really happening? Such classics shouldn't be touched at all." She told ETimes, "How can you have people standing in for Dilip Kumar and Amitabh Bachchan who have so much of an aura and grace?"

news_headline: UPI records over 2 bn transactions worth ₹3.86 lakh cr in Oct
news_article: UPI registered 2.07 billion transactions worth ₹3.86 lakh crore in October, NPCI data showed. In September, the number of UPI transactions stood at 1.80 billion with the value of the transactions at ₹3.29 lakh crore. The number of transactions via UPI had crossed the one billion mark in October 2019 for the first time since its launch.

news_headline: Had late-night conversations on leadership with Branson: PayPal CEO
news_article: PayPal CEO Dan Schulman said he has had "a number of late-night conversations" on inequality and the role of a business leader with Virgin Group Founder Richard Branson. He said Branson told him that employees have to be kept above shareholders and customers. Schulman added that this employee-first philosophy has been crucial to PayPal's success.

news_headline: It was like living in bunkers during World War: Gajraj on lockdown
news_article: Actor Gajraj Rao has said the first month of the coronavirus-induced lockdown was "unbearable". "It was like living in bunkers during...World War, looking at the same faces every day," he added. "Soon, we realised it's going to stay for a long time...Family support came to...rescue. The aim was to keep harmony at home and not have bleakness there," Gajraj said.

news_headline: Have to make it my own: Mads on replacing Depp in 'Fantastic Beasts 3'
news_article: Actor Mads Mikkelsen, who has replaced Johnny Depp as Gellert Grindelwald in the 'Fantastic Beasts' franchise, said that there is going to be a link between his and Depp's portrayal of the character. "I...have to make it my own. But...we have to find...some bridges, so it doesn't completely detach from what he's already masterfully achieved," the actor added.

news_headline: Bhiku Mhatre has given me a career: Manoj on his character in 'Satya'
news_article: Actor Manoj Bajpayee, who played gangster Bhiku Mhatre in the 1998 Ram Gopal Varma directorial 'Satya', said the character gave him a career in the film industry. "I feel lucky that I was blessed with that kind of a role which changed a lot of things for me...people still remember Bhiku Mhatre with so much fondness," he added.

news_headline: Parineeti shares tweet of 1st film announcement as she completes 9yrs in B'wood
news_article: Actress Parineeti Chopra, who made her debut with 'Ladies vs Ricky Bahl', on Wednesday completed nine years in the film industry. Taking to social media, the actress shared the old tweets of her first film announcement. "HOW IT STARTED. 9 years...Thank you," she captioned the post. Parineeti will be next seen in 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar' and 'Saina'.

news_headline: Twitter transfers @POTUS account to US President Joe Biden
news_article: Twitter on Wednesday transferred the official President of the United States Twitter account, @POTUS, to Joe Biden after he was sworn in as the 46th President of US. The account was reset to zero, which means that President Biden did not inherit Donald Trump's 33.3 million followers. Other official accounts, including @WhiteHouse, @FLOTUS and @VP, were also transferred.

news_headline: Hang in there pal: Ryan to 11-year-old 'Deadpool' fan battling cancer
news_article: Actor Ryan Reynolds, who plays 'Deadpool', recorded a message for his 11-year old fan Brody Dery, who is currently battling cancer. "I'm sending you...love and I'm sending you strength, whatever strength I've got...I hope I get to meet you in person one of these days and hang in there," he told the 'Deadpool' fan.

news_headline: Qualcomm CEO Steve Mollenkopf to retire after 26 years at the company
news_article: US chipmaker Qualcomm on Tuesday announced that its CEO Steve Mollenkopf is retiring, ending his 26-year journey at the company. Mollenkopf, who will remain at Qualcomm as a strategic advisor for an undisclosed period of time, will be replaced by Qualcomm President Cristiano Amon. "I am immensely proud of all that we have accomplished at Qualcomm," Mollenkopf said.

news_headline: Saif's height to be enhanced to 8-9 feet for 'Adipurush': Reports
news_article: Actor Saif Ali Khan's height will be enhanced to eight or nine feet, using special effects, for his upcoming film 'Adipurush', as per reports. The actor, who'll essay the role of Lankesh, will also sport a thick moustache, long hair and a muscular build, reports added. The film will be directed by Om Raut and it'll also star Prabhas.

news_headline: Haryana Police to set up Regional Cyber Crime Coordination Centre
news_article: Haryana Police has announced that it is in the process of setting up a Regional Cyber Crime Coordination Centre to deal with online criminal activities. The facility will assist the force in enhancing capability in cyber investigations, DGP Manoj Yadava said. Increased use of technology due to COVID-19 has led to sharp rise in cyber crime incidents, he added.

news_headline: I wouldn't have done it that big: Clooney on Cruise's COVID-19 rule breach rant
news_article: George Clooney has reacted to Tom Cruise's expletive-filled outburst on 'Mission Impossible 7' sets. Cruise screamed at crew members over an apparent breach of COVID-19 rules. Clooney said, "I wouldn't have done it that big...it's not my style to take everybody to task that way." Clooney further said Cruise isn't wrong, adding, "He didn't overreact because it's a problem."

news_headline: Pokèmon Go creator Niantic acquires US online gaming startup Mayhem
news_article: Pokémon Go creator Niantic announced the acquisition of Mayhem, a San Francisco-based startup focused on online gaming communities. The terms of the acquisition were not disclosed by Niantic. The "majority" of Mayhem's team will be joining Niantic. Its CEO Ivan Zhou will join Niantic's Social Platform Product team, while the rest of the team will join Platform Engineering.

news_headline: TV actor Mohit Malik tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: Actor Mohit Malik, who stars in show 'Lockdown Ki Lovestory', has tested positive for coronavirus. He shared the news on Friday and informed his fans that his pregnant wife Addite Malik is "fortunately safe". "I request all those who were in touch with me...to exercise caution and take...necessary tests if any symptoms show or even otherwise, as...safety measure," he wrote.

news_headline: Amazon India's e-comm unit's losses widen to ₹5,849.2 cr in FY20
news_article: The online marketplace unit of Amazon India, Amazon Seller Service, saw its losses widening to ₹5,849.2 crore in FY20 as compared to ₹5,685.4 crore recorded in FY19, filings revealed. Its revenue, however, grew 43% to ₹10,847.6 crore from ₹7,593.5 crore. Amazon Seller Services saw its total expenses rising over 25% from ₹13,463.1 crore to ₹16,877.1 crore.

news_headline: 400 Canadian Amazon workers test COVID-19 +ve at 4 facilities: Report
news_article: Over 400 Amazon workers have tested COVID-19 positive at four facilities near Ontario, The National Post reported. An Amazon ex-worker in Canada said he wasn't surprised by the numbers as the working conditions at facilities are "hell". A current worker said there is no sanitation or social distancing at facilities and that 99% of workers are scared of working there.

news_headline: Jaimie Alexander to reprise role in 'Thor: Love And Thunder': Reports
news_article: Actress Jaimie Alexander will reprise her role of Sif, the Asgardian warrior and childhood friend of Chris Hemsworth's character 'Thor', in Marvel's upcoming film 'Thor: Love And Thunder', Deadline reported. The actress made her first appearance as Sif in 2011's 'Thor' and reprised the role in the 2013 sequel 'Thor: The Dark World'.

news_headline: Microsoft tweaks 'Productivity Score' feature after criticism
news_article: Microsoft has responded to the criticism of its Productivity Score tool, which several users alleged was enabling workplace surveillance. It said it will remove individual user names from the tool entirely and modify the user interface to "make it clearer that Productivity Score is a measure of organisational adoption of technology and not individual user behavior."

news_headline: I made peace with potential loss: US man who forgot password to $220M bitcoins
news_article: The US man, who forgot the password to access his bitcoins worth $220 million, has said that he long ago "made peace" with the reality that he may never gain access to those bitcoins. Stefan Thomas' key for his digital wallet is locked in a hard drive that allows 10 password attempts. He is left with only two more tries.

news_headline: Designer Swapnil Shinde comes out as transwoman, changes name to Saisha
news_article: Designer Swapnil Shinde took to Instagram to share pictures after coming out as a transwoman. "I [believed] I was attracted to men because I was gay, but it was...six years ago that I finally accepted to myself, and today...I accept to you. I'm not a gay man. I'm a Transwoman," a post read. The designer also changed name to 'Saisha'.

news_headline: Ate and cherished every morsel without worrying: Shreyas on weight gain
news_article: Actor Shreyas Talpade commented on gaining weight for his upcoming film 'Love You Shankar', and said, "Director Rajiv S Ruia wanted me to put on 15 kilos...I ate and cherished every morsel without worrying about anything." He further added, "When I put on 10 kilos...saw the look of appreciation on the face of the director...I knew I had nailed it."

news_headline: Man threw away hard drive with bitcoins, offers $70M for permission to dig it up
news_article: A UK man who accidentally threw away his hard drive loaded with bitcoins in 2013 has offered the local authority a 25% share in the bitcoins (around $70 million) for permission to dig up the landfill. James Howells' hard drive had 7,500 bitcoins which are now worth nearly $270 million. The council says excavation isn't possible under its licensing permit.

news_headline: It was extremely challenging: Arjun Rampal on shooting amid COVID-19
news_article: Actor Arjun Rampal has said shooting for his upcoming film 'Nail Polish' amid the coronavirus pandemic was "extremely challenging". Arjun, whose co-actors Manav Kaul and Anand Tiwari tested positive for the virus, added, "Re-gathering ourselves and braving the situation, we had all the experiences. The best feeling was fighting through all these times and finishing what we had started."

news_headline: I do some films for money, so that I can do good cinema for free: Siddiqui
news_article: During a recent interview, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui mentioned that he has done some films solely for money so that he can do "good cinema" for free. "I did it for Manto, I didn't take any [money]. But for that three-four months process, I have to either do a film for money before or after it for a balance," he explained.

news_headline: Tesla enters India, registers itself as a company in Bengaluru
news_article: Tesla has marked its entry in India and registered itself as a company in Bengaluru. According to a Registrar of Companies filing, the new entity 'Tesla India Motors and Energy Private Limited' is classified as a subsidiary of a foreign company. Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, Venkatrangam Sreeram and David Jon Feinstein as the three directors at the new entity.

news_headline: Flipkart partially spins off PhonePe, PhonePe raises $700 million
news_article: Walmart-owned Flipkart on Thursday announced a partial spin-off of PhonePe so it can access dedicated long-term capital over the next three to four years. PhonePe is raising $700 million funding from existing Flipkart investors led by Walmart, valuing PhonePe at $5.5 billion. Flipkart, which acquired PhonePe in 2016, will remain PhonePe's majority shareholder.

news_headline: Impossible to take Tesla private now: Elon Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, in response to a tweet saying he should create a holding company and optimise his time in areas such as innovation, said, "Tesla public company duties are a much bigger factor, but going private is impossible now." Musk has also said that SpaceX's Starlink will likely go for IPO once its revenue growth becomes "reasonably predictable".

news_headline: Television is not a dead medium: Rithvik Dhanjani
news_article: While various television actors are moving towards digital platforms for acting projects, actor Rithvik Dhanjani said, "Television is not a dead medium." He added, "TV still reaches the maximum number of people in the nation, even in the remotest of areas, where people don't have smartphones. I don't think films or web series have that kind of reach yet."

news_headline: People targeted me more than CBFC: Pahlaj Nihalani on getting sacked
news_article: Commenting on getting sacked and replaced by Prasoon Joshi in 2017, former Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) chairman Pahlaj Nihalani said that people targeted him more than the board itself. "Why they are not targeting CBFC now?" Nihalani commented. "I had opposed obscenity, nudity...use of abusive language, but the same system and guideline are there," Nihalani added.

news_headline: Full censorship is not possible on OTT platforms: Priya Banerjee
news_article: On the decision of OTT platforms being brought under Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, actress Priya Banerjee said that  "full censorship" won't be possible on the web. She added, "It is going to be a challenge to censor so much of content." Priya also talked about how some web series add elements that are "unnecessary and only for titillation".

news_headline: Twitter locks Trump's account for 12 hrs, FB bans him from posting for 24 hrs
news_article: Twitter has locked US President Donald Trump's account for 12 hours for "repeated and severe violations" of its Civic Integrity Policy and asked him to delete three tweets that were posted on Wednesday. If he doesn't delete them, his account will remain suspended indefinitely, it said. Facebook has blocked Trump's page from posting for 24 hours due to policy violations.

news_headline: Biden admin plans position focused on antitrust, competition policy: Report
news_article: The incoming administration of US President-elect Joe Biden is considering creating a White House position focused on competition policy and issues relating to antitrust, reported Reuters. Currently, the US Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission share the work of antitrust enforcement and have been investigating Big Tech platforms such as Alphabet’s Google, Facebook, Amazon and Apple.

news_headline: I've decided to use it in my favour: Sneha on being stereotyped as mother
news_article: Actress Sneha Wagh has said she got stereotyped into playing a mother after she played one in her second TV project 'Ek Veer Ki Ardaas...Veera'. However, she added that she has decided to use it in her favour. "I've no qualms in playing a mother now...All mothers in real life aren't same, similarly, all my roles are different," Sneha said.

news_headline: Movie business is like women, you don't understand them: Arshad
news_article: Calling box office numbers a "scam", actor Arshad Warsi said, "There are films I just can't stand that do well and there are films...I just love that don't see the light of day. It's hard for me to understand." He added, "I think...movie business is like women; you don't understand them...I don't know how it functions, how does it work."

news_headline: Kriti to play Sita in Saif and Prabhas starrer 'Adipurush': Reports
news_article: Kriti Sanon has been roped in to play Sita in the upcoming film 'Adipurush', which will feature Prabhas as Ram and Saif Ali Khan as the antagonist Lankesh, Mumbai Mirror reported. The storyline of the film will reportedly revolve around the triumph of good over evil. Director Om Raut's upcoming film is scheduled to release on August 11, 2022.

news_headline: Was asked to leave NY outlet as some were uncomfortable: Vikas on racism
news_article: Talking about facing racism in the US, filmmaker-chef Vikas Khanna revealed that he was asked to leave a restaurant in New York because some girls sitting behind him were feeling uncomfortable. "This was after 9/11," he added. "Racism, colourism​, isolation, segregation are prevalent in the US. And it's not easy for an outsider to find his way to...top," said Vikas.

news_headline: Facebook to move UK users to California terms in Brexit response
news_article: Facebook will shift its United Kingdom users to user agreements with its corporate headquarters in California, moving them out of their current terms with Facebook's Irish unit and Europe's privacy laws. The change will take effect next year and follows a similar move by Google announced in February. "Facebook has had to make changes to respond to Brexit," it said.

news_headline: Amazon accused of colluding with publishers to raise e-book prices by 30%
news_article: A lawsuit filed against Amazon on Thursday alleged that the e-commerce platform entered into anticompetitive pricing agreements in 2015 with major publishers that allowed them to illegally increase e-book prices by 30%. The publishers named were Hachette, HarperCollins, Macmillan, Penguin Random House, and Simon & Schuster. Apple was found guilty of colluding with the same five publishers in 2013.

news_headline: The time of one actor ruling the film industry is gone now: Paresh
news_article: Speaking about how digital platforms have broadened the playing field for actors, Paresh Rawal said, "Pratik Gandhi ('Scam 1992' actor) is an overnight star, this is a new type of stardom." He added, "It's not like we used to have in Hindi films that one actor becomes a star and continues to rule for decades. That time has gone."

news_headline: Wouldn't dare to try to copy Karisma: Sara on 'Coolie No 1' remake
news_article: Actress Sara Ali Khan, who will reprise Karisma Kapoor's character in the remake of the 1995 film 'Coolie No 1', said she has not tried to copy Karisma in the movie. "One is not trying to copy Karisma...I wouldn't dare to try to ape her...the only attempt here is to bring something of my own into this film," she added.

news_headline: I didn't shoot all of last year, as an actor, I lost a year: Hina
news_article: Actress Hina Khan, who starred in 'Hacked' and 'Damaged 2' in the year 2020, both of which were shot in pre-Covid times, said, "I'm sad that I didn't shoot all of last year...I lost a year." She added, "Not meeting people, like we did earlier, makes a lot of difference...I don't have any project lined up in 2021 as yet."

news_headline: People's Sexiest Man Alive 2020 Michael B Jordan confirms relationship, shares pics
news_article: Actor Michael B Jordan, who was named 2020's Sexiest Man Alive by People magazine, took to Instagram to confirm his relationship with comedian Steve Harvey's daughter Lori Harvey. While Michael shared two photos of himself and Lori on his Instagram profile, Lori posted a photo with a heart emoji. Michael B Jordan played Erik Killmonger in 2018's 'Black Panther'.

news_headline: Sajid once asked Jiah to take off her top & read lines in a bra: Late actress' sister
news_article: Late actress Jiah Khan's sister alleged on BBC's 'Death In Bollywood' that Sajid Khan had asked Jiah to "take off her top" during rehearsal and read lines in her bra. "She cried at home...She said, 'I've a contract, if I leave, he'll sue...If I stay...I'll be...harassed, it's a lose-lose situation'," Jiah's sister stated. Jiah starred in Sajid's 2010 film 'Housefull'.

news_headline: No such project in pipeline: Madhavan on rumour of doing Ratan Tata's biopic
news_article: When a fan took to Twitter to ask R Madhavan if he will play the lead role in Ratan Tata's biopic and shared a poster of the same, Madhavan clarified that it was a fan-made poster. "No such project is even on the pipeline or being discussed," Madhavan tweeted. He will next star in the biopic-drama 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

news_headline: Mahesh Manjrekar slaps & abuses a person in road rage incident, video surfaces
news_article: A non-cognizable offence has been registered against actor Mahesh Manjrekar for allegedly slapping and abusing a person in an incident of road rage in Pune. The incident took place on January 15. The offence has been registered at the Yavat Police Station in Pune. A video of the incident has also surfaced online.

news_headline: Oracle moves headquarters from Silicon Valley to Texas
news_article: Oracle has moved its headquarters from Silicon Valley in California to Texas. Oracle said the moves "best position Oracle for growth and provide our personnel with more flexibility about where and how they work". It will continue to support its former headquarters and other offices. The move comes days after Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced he had moved to Texas.

news_headline: Noida-based firm which works with defence forces claims data hack
news_article: A Noida-based defence tech service provider, which works with the country's defence and paramilitary forces and intelligence agencies, has alleged that critical and classified data have been accessed by hackers. The hacked emails were of "extremely sensitive" nature and "of substantial financial value", the firm said. It added that it has suffered a financial loss of ₹50 crore.

news_headline: Trump has removed tweets, access to be restored after 12-hr block: Twitter
news_article: US President Donald Trump has removed the tweets which led to the suspension of his Twitter account for 12 hours, a Twitter spokesperson said. He will regain access to his account and will be able to post again after the 12-hour suspension period. Twitter had earlier said that President Trump's account would remain locked if the tweets were not removed.

news_headline: There once was a lioness & a pack of wolves: Kangana on Javed's defamation case
news_article: Kangana Ranaut has reacted to defamation case filed against her by Javed Akhtar. Retweeting the news shared by Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, she wrote, "Ek thi sherni...aur ek bhediyon ka jhund...(There once was a lioness...and a pack of wolves)." Javed filed the case over allegations that he threatened her for speaking out about her alleged relationship with Hrithik Roshan.

news_headline: It didn't affect my morale: Maniesh Paul on testing COVID-19 +ve
news_article: Actor Maniesh Paul, who recently recovered from coronavirus, spoke about battling the virus and said, "It didn't affect my morale and neither did I feel sad or upset." "One has to take it in the stride. I spoke to my doctor and made sure to follow all instructions," he added. "Things have been good since I tested negative," Maniesh said.

news_headline: Amazon firing manufacturing staff working on drone project: Report
news_article: Amazon is reportedly laying off dozens of research and development and manufacturing staff working on the delivery drone project called "Amazon Prime Air" and turning to external manufacturers. It has reached tentative deals with Spain and Austria's aerospace companies to manufacture component parts for its drones, FT reported. Amazon plans to use electric drones to deliver packages under 2.3 kg.

news_headline: Lucknow team seeks Mumbai police chief's help in 'Tandav' probe
news_article: The Lucknow Police team on Wednesday asked the Mumbai Commissioner of Police to aid them in investigating the case lodged against the 'Tandav' makers. A senior police official informed that a four-member team from Lucknow arrived in Mumbai on Tuesday after an FIR was filed at Hazratganj police station against the web series for promoting enmity and causing public mischief.

news_headline: My dad calls her daughter-in-law: Shawn on relationship with Camila
news_article: Singer Shawn Mendes recently revealed that his father refers to his girlfriend Camila as 'daughter-in-law'. "My dad is never very serious about things, but he would always bug me and be like, 'How's my daughter-in-law doing?'" he said on Zach Sang Show. "Obviously your parents don't know, but when you know you know," he added.

news_headline: Musk's SpaceX to fly remote-controlled cars to the Moon for a race
news_article: Elon Musk-led space exploration company SpaceX is set to fly two remote-controlled vehicles to the Moon aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket in October 2021 for a race organised by Moon Mark and aerospace company Lunar Outpost. The vehicles will be designed in collaboration with Frank Stephenson, known for his work with McLaren and Ferrari among others.

news_headline: Bravo, congratulations: Priyanka on India's COVID-19 vaccination drive
news_article: Priyanka Chopra took to Twitter on Saturday to praise India's COVID-19 vaccination drive and expressed gratitude towards the country's frontline workers. "Bravo India! Congratulations to Indian authorities, medical [and] health teams for starting...the massive COVID-19 vaccination drive. Forever grateful to our frontline heroes who've been risking their lives this past year," she tweeted.

news_headline: I only think about what's on my plate: Sunny Leone on comparisons
news_article: Sunny Leone has said she doesn't believe in competition or get worried by the number of projects her contemporaries are working on. "I look at myself...what's on my plate and what choices I need to make," Sunny said, adding, "I don't compare myself with anybody else...I want to live my life the way I want to [and] do better work."

news_headline: Elon Musk's tweet leads to 4.4% rise in Japanese game maker's shares
news_article: Shares of a Japanese game maker Bandai Namco rose after the world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted a meme featuring a character from the game maker's Idolmaster franchise. Namco's shares surged as high as 4.4% in Tokyo on Wednesday. Idolmaster is a long-running series that initially started as an arcade game and grew to include mobile games and animated series.

news_headline: Reliance's fibre-optic unit raises $1 bn from ADIA, PIF
news_article: Reliance Industries has announced that Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) and Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund (PIF) will each invest $507.2 million (₹37.8 billion) in the company's Digital Fibre Infrastructure Trust. The company had said in an exchange filing earlier this month that it was raising ₹397.1 billion through stake sales and borrowings for its fibre-optic business.

news_headline: 3-month-old baby of actress who featured in 'Harry Potter' films contracts COVID-19
news_article: English actress Jessie Cave's three-month-old baby has tested positive for coronavirus and is receiving treatment in a UK hospital. "This strain is super powerful and contagious so I do hope that people take extra care in the coming weeks," she wrote on Instagram as she shared a picture from the hospital. Cave played Lavender Brown in the 'Harry Potter' franchise.

news_headline: Not arrogant because I didn't get success overnight: Pankaj Tripathi
news_article: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said that he doesn't have the "arrogance" because he didn't "get success overnight". "I have crossed 45 now, and every achievement makes me humble," the actor added. Tripathi also talked about how being successful changed his life and said, "Earlier, I never said 'no' to any work... but now credibility matters to me."

news_headline: A moment that created a paradigm shift: Dia on winning Miss Asia Pacific
news_article: Talking about winning Miss Asia Pacific International in 2000, Dia Mirza said, "It's a moment that created...paradigm shift in my life." "It's interesting for a person who never participated in any form of competition because that was not...background of my education," she added. "I remember thinking...I'm not here to compete with others but to be...best version of myself," said Dia.

news_headline: Lopez to play FBI agent in 'The Cipher' movie adaptation: Reports
news_article: Singer-actress Jennifer Lopez will reportedly star in the film adaptation of the bestselling book, 'The Cipher', written by Isabella Maldonado. In addition to featuring in the film, Lopez will also reportedly produce it. According to Variety, Lopez will play FBI agent Nina Guerrera, who tries to solve a serial killer's case. The film will release on a digital platform.

news_headline: Fake call centre that cheated 4,500 foreigners of ₹90 crore busted in Delhi
news_article: Delhi Police busted a fake call centre where employees posed as personnel from law enforcement agencies and extorted money from foreigners saying that their details were found at crime scenes. The police made 54 arrests in connection with the call centre that cheated 4,500 foreigners of ₹90 crore. The mastermind of the fake call centre was allegedly operating from Dubai.

news_headline: 40 anti-LGBT groups fundraising on Amazon's charity programme: Report
news_article: A report by openDemocracy revealed that over 40 US-based anti-LGBT groups are fundraising on Amazon's charitable donation programme, AmazonSmile. The report included groups that have intervened in international cases opposing same-sex marriage and anti-discrimination laws. "If at any point an organisation violates [the] agreement, its eligibility will be revoked," Amazon told Business Insider.

news_headline: I'm a huge fan of Akshay, he's an outstanding actor: Arshad
news_article: Arshad Warsi, who'll share screen space with Akshay Kumar in action film 'Bachchan Pandey', has said he's very excited to work with Akshay. Calling him an "outstanding actor", Arshad said, "I'm a huge fan of Akshay. He's so good - his energy level and his madness." Talking about the film, he said, "[People] are really going to like this film."

news_headline: IIT-K team makes 5G network system that uses drones for emergencies
news_article: An IIT-Kharagpur team has made a UAV-assisted system for 5G that can serve as an airborne mobile telecom tower during emergencies. The system involves an android-based application fitted to a fleet of drones that can create emergency communication networks from closest available mobile towers.The institute said its fleet can be deployed in a particular location through intelligent programming.

news_headline: Twitter launches @SecondGentleman account for US VP-elect Harris' husband
news_article: Twitter has launched @SecondGentleman account for Douglas Emhoff, the husband of US Vice President-elect Kamala Harris. "I'm so incredibly honoured and humbled to be the first @SecondGentleman of the United States. As we countdown to Inauguration Day, I've been doing my homework—and looking to the past for inspiration," he tweeted from his personal Twitter account.

news_headline: Comedy is the toughest beat to crack for any actor: Mrunal
news_article: Talking about the comedy genre, actress Mrunal Thakur said it's the "toughest beat to crack" for any actor. The actress, who'll be seen in the comedy film 'Aankh Micholi', added, "The most important virtue is to be observant in order to have a good comic timing and I tried to inculcate that right from the word go!"

news_headline: Maybe in few yrs, when I can support you: Tiger after fan asks him to marry her
news_article: During an 'Ask Me Anything' session on Instagram, actor Tiger Shroff responded to a fan who wrote, "Marry me. Come to the UK." The 30-year-old actor responded, "Maybe in a few years when I can support you...so much to learn and earn until then." Tiger will be next seen in 'Heropanti 2', 'Ganapath' and 'Baaghi 4'.

news_headline: I pre-shot something already: Lisa Kudrow on 'Friends' reunion
news_article: Actress Lisa Kudrow, who played Phoebe Buffay in 'Friends', revealed that she has already started filming for the reunion special and mentioned, "There are different facets to it, and we already shot packages of things." She added during her appearance on Rob Lowe's podcast, "I pre-shot something for it already so we're definitely doing it...I already shot a little something."

news_headline: 3 yrs of us & very soon, 3 of us: Anushka shares pic with Kohli on anniversary
news_article: Actress Anushka Sharma took to social media to share a picture with her husband, Team India captain Virat Kohli on the occasion of their third wedding anniversary today. "Three years of us & very soon, three of us. Miss you," she wrote in the caption. The couple is expecting their first child in January.

news_headline: Bell Bottom casting director refutes rape accused Ayush's involvement with film
news_article: Vaibhav Vishant, the casting director of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bell Bottom', has responded after some reports linked rape accused Ayush Tewari to the film. He clarified that Ayush has nothing to do with the film or its casting. Earlier, Mumbai Police registered an FIR against a casting director for allegedly raping a TV actress on the pretext of marriage.

news_headline: Soumitra was a true gentleman: Radhika on her 'Ahalya' co-star
news_article: Mourning the demise of Soumitra Chatterjee, actress Radhika Apte recalled her experience of working with the late Bengali actor in the 2015 short film 'Ahalya' and called him a true gentleman. "I'm...grateful that I got an opportunity to work alongside Soumitra sir...to be able to witness his craft as an actor, makes me feel very fortunate," she added.

news_headline: 'Zero' didn't show the trauma & tragedy of a dwarf: Actor Lilliput
news_article: Actor Lilliput, who was recently seen in 'Mirzapur 2', has said Shah Rukh Khan's 2018 film 'Zero' didn't show the trauma and tragedy of a dwarf. "Anushka Sharma played a woman with...far more tragic story than him (Shah Rukh)...She couldn't speak or walk," he added. "He was the one jumping around...what problem does he have? Even...script was weird," said Lilliput.

news_headline: No aspect ruled out till date: CBI on Sushant Singh Rajput case
news_article: The CBI on Wednesday stated that it's conducting the investigation into the death of Sushant Singh Rajput in a thorough and professional manner, "using latest scientific techniques". "No aspect has been ruled out as on date," CBI said in its reply to a letter written by BJP leader Subramanian Swamy to the PMO, asking for an update on the investigation.

news_headline: I didn't want kids, glad that my decision went down well with family: Ayesha
news_article: Actress Ayesha​ Jhulka recently spoke about her decision to not have kids and said, "I don't have kids as I didn't want them." She added, "I'm glad that my decision went down well with the entire family." Talking about her husband, she said, "Sameer is a wonderful husband...he has enhanced my life by...supporting me in whatever I wanted to do."

news_headline: MP govt will register a case against 'Tandav' makers: State Home Min
news_article: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday said that the state government will register a case against the makers of 'Tandav'. Mishra added, "I condemn the way Zeeshan Ayyub, Saif Ali Khan and Ali Abbas Zafar reacted to our religion." CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also tweeted, "No one has the right to hurt our faith and insult our deities."

news_headline: Not sure when I can walk again: 'Fan' actress Shikha on paralysis after stroke
news_article: Actress Shikha Malhotra, who appeared in 'Fan', has communicated with the help of her film's director about how she's recovering after suffering a stroke and paralysis on right side of her body. "My health is improving but...process is slow. I'm not sure when I'll be able to walk again," she stated. "I'm going through a tough phase," Shikha added.

news_headline: Chef Vikas' directorial The Last Color to release in India on Dec 11
news_article: Chef Vikas Khanna's directorial debut 'The Last Color' will release in theatres in India on December 11. The film, which portrays the lives of widows in Varanasi, stars Neena Gupta. Talking about the release, Khanna said, "Having travelled the whole world and taken the film onto the global stage, it indeed feels overwhelming to bring the film to its roots."

news_headline: Bobby Deol to play lead in 'Arth' remake, producer confirms
news_article: Actor Bobby Deol is all set to reprise the role of Kulbhushan Kharbanda in the remake of 'Arth'. Informing about the same, producer Sharat Chandra told Pinkvilla, "Yes, the supremely talented Bobby Deol will reprise Kulbhushan Kharbanda Ji's role in the 'Arth' remake. We are in the final stage of discussions with him.”

news_headline: Alcohol found in actress Arya Banerjee's stomach, death not a case of homicide
news_article: The post-mortem report of 'The Dirty Picture' actress Arya Banerjee has confirmed that her death was not a case of homicide. Kolkata Police Joint Commissioner (crime) Murli Dhar Sharma said she was suffering from cirrhosis of liver. "It was not a case of homicide. Alcohol was found in her stomach at the time of her death," he stated.

news_headline: Celebrating 125 years of togetherness: Ayushmann on wedding anniversary
news_article: On their 12th wedding anniversary, Ayushmann Khurrana shared a post for his wife Tahira Kashyap on Instagram and wrote, "Celebrating 125 years of togetherness...because I know that I know you from centuries and time immemorial." Alongside a picture of him and Tahira, he added, "You're my companion, lover, personal stand-up comedian, life coach and above all my best friend."

news_headline: Salman to cameo as Prem of 'Maine Pyar...' in 'Laal Singh...': Reports
news_article: Salman Khan will reportedly have a cameo as Prem of his 1989 film 'Maine Pyar Kiya' in Aamir Khan's film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The shooting for the same will reportedly take place on January 8. "Aamir's character, then an Army man in his 20s, will be seen bumping into Salman," Mid-Day quoted a source as saying.

news_headline: Ranbir defines what an artiste is: Sanjana on her 'Rockstar' co-star
news_article: While praising her 'Rockstar' co-star Ranbir Kapoor, actress Sanjana Sanghi said, "He's the first actor I worked with...I've learned so much from him. To me, he....defines what an artiste is." Speaking about working with him in the 2011 film, she told BT, "I've seen the magic unfolding...It was a mystical experience to see him transform into this character."

news_headline: It won't make us mask free: Shilpa Shirodkar after getting vaccinated
news_article: Actress Shilpa Shirodkar, who recently received a coronavirus vaccine dose in the UAE, said, "I'm not mask-free yet...the vaccine won't make us mask free, it will just help us fight against the virus." She told The Times of India that the course of the vaccine involves two doses and she is yet to get her second dose.

news_headline: I used COVID-19 pandemic phase for personal growth: Aarti Singh
news_article: TV actress and ex-Bigg Boss contestant Aarti Singh said that she used the COVID-19 pandemic phase to spend time with her mother and rediscover herself for "personal growth". Aarti, who hasn't signed any new project yet, said she doesn't want to work for the sake of it. "It’s better to give one hit rather than giving 15 flops," she added.

news_headline: Shot for Rockstar before 9th grade exams, had practice papers couriered: Sanjana
news_article: Sanjana Sanghi, who played Nargis Fakhri's younger sister in 'Rockstar', spoke about juggling her studies and shoots. "I have had to do all sorts of things like have my practice papers couriered to me while I was shooting in Kashmir, completed them, and couriered them back...because I was shooting for 'Rockstar' just before my ninth grade final exams," she stated.

news_headline: Hollywood actor Ellen Page comes out as transgender, changes name to Elliot
news_article: Canadian actor Ellen Page took to Twitter to announce that he is transgender. "I want to share with you that I'm trans, my pronouns are he/they and my name is Elliot," he wrote in a statement. "Despite feeling profoundly happy...I am also scared. I am scared of the invasiveness, the hate, the "jokes" and of violence," the 33-year-old added.

news_headline: She brings out more love in me: Karan on newborn daughter
news_article: Actor Karanvir Bohra took to Instagram to share a picture of his newborn daughter sleeping on his chest and wrote, "She sleeps best like this!" He further mentioned, "People will say I am spoiling her...But I can't help it. That's the kind of Dad I am. She brings out more love in me than I even knew I had."

news_headline: If she invites me, I would love to go: Kushal on ex Gauahar's wedding
news_article: Commenting on his ex-girlfriend Gauahar Khan getting married to Zaid Darbar, actor Kushal Tandon said, "I'm in touch with her...I am happy that she is getting married...If she invites me to her wedding, I would love to go." However, he further added, "I'll be shooting that time, so I'm not sure if I will be able to attend the wedding."

news_headline: Committed to theatrical experience: Vin Diesel on 'Fast & Furious 9'
news_article: While various films released on digital platforms instead of theatres amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, Hollywood actor Vin Diesel stated that 'Fast and Furious 9' aka 'F9' will get a theatrical release. "It's...wonderful...to know that we're going to be there on May 28 with a movie that everybody is going to want to see together," Vin told Total Film Magazine.

news_headline: CBI, NCB and ED have done a fair job in Sushant's case: Suman
news_article: Shekhar Suman, while talking about Sushant Singh Rajput's death case, tweeted, "I think...the three departments, CBI (Central Bureau Of Investigation), NCB (Narcotics Control Bureau) and ED (Enforcement Directorate) have done a fair job of interrogation, investigation and arrest." He added, "I guess because of...lack of any evidence they're helpless. So we've to...wait and see if they get lucky."

news_headline: My strength, my weakness: Priyanka shares pic with Nick on anniversary
news_article: Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, Priyanka Chopra shared a picture of herself with singer-actor Nick Jonas on their second wedding anniversary. She wrote, "Happy 2-year anniversary to the love of my life...My strength. My weakness. My all." Nick also shared a few pictures with Priyanka from their wedding ceremony and wrote, "Two years married to the most...inspiring and beautiful woman."

news_headline: My confidence was stripped: Priyanka on facing racism as a student in US
news_article: Priyanka Chopra spoke about the racist bullying she experienced while attending a high school in America at the age of 15. "I took it very personally...I went into a shell. I was like, 'I...want to be invisible'," she said. "My confidence was stripped. I've always considered myself a confident person, but I was very unsure...of who I was," Priyanka added.

news_headline: Karanvir Bohra & wife Teejay blessed with baby girl, pic surfaces
news_article: Television actor Karanvir Bohra and wife Teejay Sidhu have been blessed with a baby girl. The child was born in Vancouver, Canada. "I've become Charlie, now that I've got three angels," Karanvir told SpotboyE, which also shared a picture from the hospital. The couple is already parents to twin girls, who were born in the year 2016.

news_headline: 'Wonder Woman 1984' was the hardest movie I ever got to shoot: Gal
news_article: Actress Gal Gadot has said that her upcoming film 'Wonder Woman 1984' has been the toughest acting job of her career. "Most of the stuff you see in the film is real people doing the real thing...be it the facial expressions, weight, movement...It was the hardest movie I ever got to shoot by far," she said at a press conference.

news_headline: My bio on dating app would be 'only looking for love': Kiara
news_article: Actress Kiara Advani revealed that she has never joined a dating application, but if she ever did so, her bio would read, "only looking for love". Kiara shared that she researched various dating applications after she signed the film 'Indoo Ki Jawaani'. "It's quite cool everybody is very straightforward on a dating app...their intentions are clear," she added.

news_headline: We've regressed, people in 1950s and 60s weren't judged so much: Kajol
news_article: During a recent interview, actress Kajol said, "We have regressed as a society. I feel like, people in the 1950s and 60s weren't judged so much." While stating that earlier women could work more freely without being subjected to intense scrutiny, Kajol added, "Now...everything that you're doing is looked at with such minuteness...that's one of the biggest steps against feminism."

news_headline: Adityanath wants to hijack B'wood: Sena leader on film city plan in UP
news_article: Commenting on Yogi Adityanath's plan to build a film city in Uttar Pradesh, Shiv Sena leader G Radhakrishnan said that UP CM wants to hijack Bollywood. He alleged that Yogi came to Mumbai in a "big chartered flight to take the film city away from its original place". Notably, Adityanath met Bollywood personalities to talk about the proposed film city.

news_headline: Sushant's sister announces ₹25L scholarship at UC Berkeley on his birth anniversary
news_article: Shweta Singh Kirti has set up a scholarship fund in the name of her brother, late actor Sushant Singh Rajput to mark his birth anniversary today. The Sushant Singh Rajput Memorial Fund is of $35,000 (over ₹25 lakh) and has been set up in University of California, Berkeley for students interested in pursuing Astrophysics. "Hope you...stay happy...wherever you...are!" wrote Shweta.

news_headline: Shaheer, Ruchikaa share first pictures after court marriage
news_article: Shaheer Sheikh and Ruchikaa Kapoor have shared first pictures from their court wedding on social media. In the pictures, Shaheer can be seen in white kurta-pyjama and sunglasses, and Ruchikaa in light blue salwar kameez. "Off on an adventure called Forever...#HappilyEverAfter #ForeverPerson," Ruchikaa wrote with a heart emoji on Instagram.

news_headline: Varun starrer 'Ekkis' is not shelved, shoot to begin in Sept: Sriram
news_article: Filmmaker Sriram Raghavan denied the speculations about his upcoming Varun Dhawan starrer film 'Ekkis' getting shelved and stated that they will start shooting for the biopic in September 2021. "We were supposed to shoot in September this year...But...Ekkis has been pushed forward to next year. I need specific weather in September-October to shoot in battle locations," he explained.

news_headline: Not going to copy-paste what has been done: Nehha on 'Bhabi Ji Ghar...' role
news_article: Nehha Pendse, who'll be replacing Saumya Tandon in show 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai', has said she'll not copy-paste what has been done in the past. She added she'll play the role of Anita Mishra in her own way. "I think it won't come all to me one day. Over a period of time, I'll be...giving more to...character," said Nehha.

news_headline: Haven't got this much recognition from any other project: Priyanshu on Mirzapur 2
news_article: Actor Priyanshu Painyuli, who played the role of Robin in 'Mirzapur 2', said, "What [the show] did for me is special." He added, "I haven't got this much recognition from any other project of mine." Priyanshu further said he never imagined that his character Robin and his dialogue 'Yeh Bhi Theek hai' will resonate so well with the audience.

news_headline: Diljit calls Kangana 'blind' for misidentifying woman as 'Shaheen Bagh Dadi'
news_article: Singer Diljit Dosanjh has criticised Kangana Ranaut after she misidentified an elderly woman named Mahinder Kaur, who took part in farmers' protest, and wrote in a now-deleted tweet that she's 'Shaheen Bagh Dadi' Bilkis Bano who's "available for ₹100". Sharing Kaur's interview, Diljit wrote, "One shouldn't be so blind." Kangana deleted the tweet after social media users called her out.

news_headline: I'm always in rush to reach home: Aditya on life after marriage
news_article: Singer Aditya Narayan spoke about how his life has changed after getting married to Shweta Agarwal and said, "Now, every time I'm out of the house for work, I'm always in a rush to reach home." He told The Times of India, "I love the fact that we can...do different things and yet find time to do things together."

news_headline: Important to understand need of the hour: Sara on 'Coolie...' OTT release
news_article: Sara Ali Khan has said she's a bit disappointed with the digital release of 'Coolie No 1' as she won't be able to check the box office numbers. "But I also think, as actors...it's very important to understand the need of the hour. With...pandemic...it's socially responsible and necessary that we give you something fun and entertaining at home," she added.

news_headline: He knowingly gave me an STD, tried to strangle me: Singer sues actor LaBeouf
news_article: British singer FKA twigs on Friday filed a lawsuit against actor Shia LaBeouf, accusing him of physical and emotional abuse during their year-long relationship. She also accused LaBeouf of knowingly giving her a sexually transmitted disease (STD). The lawsuit said that on one occasion in February 2019, the actor slammed her against a car and tried to strangle her.

news_headline: Hrithik is thousand times better than I was as a father: Rakesh
news_article: While praising his son Hrithik Roshan, who turned 47 on Sunday, filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said, "He's [a] thousand times better than I was as a father. He looks after his kids so well! His world revolves around his children." Rakesh also told The Times of India, "He's (Hrithik) simple and innocent and his eyes reflect that."

news_headline: Wanted to dispel myths with 'Delhi Crime': Richie Mehta
news_article: Indo-Canadian filmmaker Richie Mehta, whose web series 'Delhi Crime' won the Best Drama Series award at the 48th International Emmy Awards last month, said he wanted to dispel myths with his show. "A lot of people around the world started to define India based on crimes like this, and that made me very uncomfortable," he explained.

news_headline: Tom Holland loses and gains over 13 kg for his role in 'Cherry'
news_article: Actor Tom Holland lost over 13 kg and then gained it back for his role of an army medical officer in the upcoming film 'Cherry'. Director Joe Russo, in an interview, said, "Tom really shredded himself for the part...We are on an independent movie schedule here. He didn't really have a lot of time to be doing these things."

news_headline: People trying to make a fuss about it: Madhurima on controversies around B'wood
news_article: Talking about how she coped with all the negativity around the entertainment industry in recent months, actress Madhurima Tuli said she was keeping herself busy with the things she loves. "Right now people are...trying to make a fuss about it...if you give them what they want...it'll grow bigger...so we might as well not pay any importance to it," she added.

news_headline: Jennifer Lopez goes nude for new music video, fans say 'Can't believe she's 51'
news_article: Singer Jennifer Lopez went nude for her new song 'In The Morning', the video of which was released on Friday. "The fact she's 51 YEARS OLD and has a better body than I do is outstanding," commented a user while another wrote, "Can't believe...she's 51...She looks younger and younger each day." "It's full of symbolism," Jennifer said about the video.

news_headline: Easy to make it news but he's not 12 years younger to me: Gauahar on fiancé Zaid
news_article: Reacting to reports that her fiancé Zaid Darbar is 12 years younger to her, Gauahar Khan said, "It's very easy for people to make it a news. But it's wrong." She added, "Yes, he's a few years younger to me but 12 is not the number." She stated, "Passing comments that age gap can...[be]...a barrier in relationships is very easy."

news_headline: There will never be a better Bond than you: Abhishek after Sean's death
news_article: Following the demise of Sir Sean Connery, who was the first actor to portray James Bond on screen, Abhishek Bachchan tweeted, "We've lost another legend today." "After watching 'Highlander', I hoped he'd remain immortal. He'll live on through his immense work. #RIP Sean Connery. There will never be a better Bond than you," he wrote with a folded hands emoji.

news_headline: Mom has tested COVID-19 negative: Neetu Kapoor's daughter
news_article: Actress Neetu Kapoor has tested negative for coronavirus, daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shared on Friday. Sharing a selfie with her mother on Instagram, Riddhima wrote, "Thank you for...your good wishes & prayers - My mother has tested Covid negative today." Neetu on Thursday had shared a statement wherein she revealed that she tested positive for the virus earlier this week.

news_headline: I do want children, as many as I can have: Priyanka Chopra
news_article: Priyanka Chopra recently opened up about her plans of having children and said, "I do want children, as many as I can have." Speaking about her life with Nick Jonas, she told The Sunday Times, "It's so comforting to find a person who is in your corner...I'm just a girl trying to live her life in the best way possible."

news_headline: Sunny Deol tests COVID-19 +ve, says 'my health is fine'
news_article: Actor and BJP MP Sunny Deol has tested positive for coronavirus, he confirmed on Twitter on Wednesday. "I am in isolation and my health is fine. I request that all of you who have come in contact with me in the last few days, please isolate yourself and get your test done," the 64-year-old wrote.

news_headline: OTT gave me the chance to be in middle of frame: Chandan Roy Sanyal
news_article: Chandan Roy Sanyal, who was recently seen in web show 'Aashram', has said OTT gave him the chance to be in the middle of the frame. "Earlier, I'd be on...side. That's exciting for me. I'm looking forward," he added. Talking about 'Aashram', Chandan said, "[It] became...mass loved project. I've had people from all over...world getting in touch for the show."

news_headline: Karishma Prakash has resigned, she has nothing to do with Deepika now: KWAN
news_article: Deepika Padukone's former manager Karishma Prakash, who has been summoned by the NCB in a drug case, has resigned from her position at KWAN, which managed Deepika and other Bollywood celebrities. "She now has nothing to do with KWAN or with any of...artists that the agency [represents] including Deepika," Vijay Subramaniam, Co-founder and CEO of KWAN, said in a statement.

news_headline: Publication says Raj Kundra gifted Lamborghini to 8-yr-old son, he calls it fake news
news_article: Actor Shilpa Shetty's husband, businessman Raj Kundra, took to Twitter to react to an article by a publication which said he bought a Lamborghini for his eight-year-old son Viaan. "Such a credible magazine but such a badly researched article! Kindly mention the Lambo was a toy Lambo car! #fakenews," he wrote. The article was later taken down by the publication.

news_headline: Film industry is not open to newer and different casting: Nushrratt
news_article: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha, who has starred in various romantic-comedy films, said she wants to explore other genres as well but is not getting the opportunity. "I feel we are not open to newer, different casting...they are not trusting actors as much as they should, I want to do other things too. Why don't you trust me?" she added.

news_headline: 'The Conjuring' actress Vera Farmiga to star in horror film 'Bad Bloom'
news_article: Hollywood actress Vera Farmiga, known for starring in horror films like 'The Conjuring' series and 'The Orphan', will play the lead role in the upcoming horror film 'Bad Bloom'. According to The Hollywood Reporter, the movie will revolve around a family that lives in isolation on a remote island "to keep an unknown creature at bay."

news_headline: Akshay charges ₹99 crore for 'Bachchan Pandey': Reports
news_article: Akshay Kumar reportedly charged ₹99 crore for Sajid Nadiadwala's 'Bachchan Pandey'. "While Akshay's market value per film is around ₹110-₹120 crore, he couldn't say no to Sajid's request to cut down on fees for 'Bachchan Pandey' considering the pandemic situation," reports said. "The two finally zeroed in on ₹99 crore as the acting fees for Akshay," reports added.

news_headline: Ben Affleck to direct 'Keeper of the Lost Cities' adaptation
news_article: Ben Affleck and his Pearl Street Films production company will direct and produce an adaptation of Shannon Messenger's bestselling book series 'Keeper of the Lost Cities' for Disney. According to Variety, Affleck will adapt the project's script with Kate Gritmon, and Madison Ainley will serve as an executive producer. The story revolves around a 12-year-old telepathic girl named Sophie.

news_headline: Boney will be happy if Janhvi is cast in Sridevi's role: Ali on Mr India trilogy
news_article: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said though he's yet to finalise the cast of his upcoming 'Mr India' trilogy, producer Boney Kapoor will be really happy if his daughter Janhvi Kapoor is cast in her mother Sridevi's role. Talking about the trilogy, the filmmaker said that it's a "new sci-fi film, with a big budget and high production values".

news_headline: His direction helps actors thrive: Deepika on working with Shakun Batra
news_article: Deepika Padukone, who is currently shooting with Siddhant Chaturvedi and Ananya Panday for director Shakun Batra's untitled film, said, "It's fantastic to work with someone like Shakun who is just so brilliant." Further speaking about the filmmaker she said, "The whole process of the way he directs...is something that helps us actors really thrive...I really couldn't have asked for more."

news_headline: Sunny Leone is doing most of her action scenes herself: Vikram Bhatt
news_article: Praising actress Sunny Leone, who will star in his upcoming web series 'Anamika', Vikram Bhatt said, "Sunny has taken all of us by surprise." He added, "She is performing most of her action scenes by herself. It's fantastic that it all comes out naturally on screen. She is really confident and that has come out beautifully."

news_headline: Hoping 'Shamshera', 'Bell Bottom' will pull people into theatres: Vaani
news_article: Actress Vaani Kapoor, who'll be seen in films like 'Shamshera', 'Bell Bottom' and 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui' this year, has said she's hoping that these films will "pull people into theatres". "The industry has been heavily affected by the virus and we'll need to bring people back to the cinemas," she added. Vaani further said all three films are "extremely diverse".

news_headline: My fans are just a bunch of people who really want to say good things: Vijay
news_article: Actor Vijay Varma recently spoke about the love he gets from his followers on social media and said, "I probably have...best fans or followers on social media." He added, "You can barely find anyone writing anything remotely offensive. It's just a bunch of people who really want to say good things, share love, humour and so on and so forth."

news_headline: Was replaced as lead actor thought someone else is better looking: Aahana
news_article: Aahana Kumra has revealed that she was once replaced in a film because the lead actor thought someone else is better looking or more worthy for the part. When asked how she copes up with the rejections and replacements, she said her mantra is "live and learn". "This is an uncertain industry and this only works on fate," Aahana added.

news_headline: People want to watch movies in the theatres: Manoj Bajpayee
news_article: During a recent interview, actor Manoj Bajpayee noted that the performance of his film 'Suraj Pe Mangal Bhari', following its recent theatrical release, is proof that people want to watch movies in theatres. Further speaking about working with actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh in the film, Manoj said, "He is a very simple person and his sense of humour is terrific."

news_headline: After 'Mirzya', big filmmakers replaced me: Saiyami Kher
news_article: Actress Saiyami Kher, in an interview, talked about how after 'Mirzya' "big filmmakers" replaced her with "commercially more successful" actresses. Saiyami also recounted her struggles to enter the film industry and added, "After long, tedious three years of auditioning, 'Mirzya' happened. That too was a six-month auditioning process. Unfortunately, it didn’t do well at the box office."

news_headline: Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Shweta shares note written by late actor
news_article: Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Shweta Singh Kirti shared a handwritten note by the late actor on Instagram. "I'm not okay the way I am, but if I got good at things...I realised I had the game wrong because the game was to find out what I already was," the note reads. "Written by bhai...thought so profound," Shweta captioned the post.

news_headline: We're exploring opportunities: Mukesh on Fardeen's comeback plan
news_article: A day after Fardeen Khan was seen visiting casting director and filmmaker Mukesh Chhabra, the latter confirmed that the actor is planning a comeback. "We are exploring opportunities. He is back [and he is] looking good," Mukesh told The Times Of India. Fardeen made his film debut with 1998's 'Prem Aggan' and was last seen in 2010's 'Dulha Mil Gaya'.

news_headline: You're all babies: Billie on losing 1L Insta followers over drawing of breasts
