news_article: Singer Billie Eilish recently lost over 1 lakh Instagram followers after she posted a drawing of breasts on the platform. The 19-year-old had posted it in response to a viral Instagram challenge after her fans asked about a drawing she's really proud of.  She later took to Instagram to address the incident and wrote, "LMFAOO y'all (you're all) babies smh."

news_headline: My husband doesn't want to come in front of the world: Rakhi Sawant
news_article: Rakhi Sawant recently spoke about her husband and said, "My husband doesn't want to come in front of the world." "It has been more than a year he hasn't come here, he's in the UK. My marriage has...turned into a big tragedy," she added. Further, Rakhi said that she's bankrupt and is still shouldering the responsibility of her family.

news_headline: Pak actress Mahira tests COVID-19 +ve, says 'It has been rough'
news_article: Pakistani actress Mahira Khan took to Instagram on Sunday to share that she has tested positive for coronavirus. "I'm isolating and have also informed all those who were in contact with me over the last few days. It's been rough but it will be ok soon, Inshallah," she wrote. "PS Prayers and movie recommendations are more than welcome," Mahira added.

news_headline: I never probe or ask personal questions to my kids: Javed Akhtar
news_article: On being asked if he has spoken to his son Farhan Akhtar about the rumours around his wedding, Javed Akhtar said he never asks personal questions to his children. "I believe...once kids become adults, they've...right to their privacy and asking them personal questions is a no-no," he said, adding, "If they offer personal information, you should listen but never...question them."

news_headline: Neena Gupta, Manoj Bajpayee, Sakshi Tanwar to team up for 'DIAL 100'
news_article: Actors Manoj Bajpayee, Neena Gupta and Sakshi Tanwar will share screen space in the upcoming thriller-drama titled 'DIAL 100', which will be directed by Rensil D'Silva. The actors took to their social media accounts to share the news. "Excited to announce my next thriller drama #DIAL100...The drama and suspense has made me fall in love with it already," Manoj tweeted.

news_headline: It was very satisfying as an actor: Ishaan on 'A Suitable Boy' role
news_article: Actor Ishaan Khatter, who played a character named Maan Kapoor in 'A Suitable Boy', spoke about his role and said, "It was very satisfying as an actor." He added, "It gave me the chance to display many shades within one character, without stepping out of the boundaries of his life and the believability of the character."

news_headline: Kangana Ranaut to star in 'Manikarnika Returns: The Legend Of Didda'
news_article: Actress Kangana Ranaut will star in the second instalment of the Manikarnika franchise, 'Manikarnika Returns: The Legend Of Didda'. The film will reportedly be mounted on an international scale. 'Manikarnika Returns: The Legend Of Didda' will be jointly produced by Kangana and Kamal Jain, who also bankrolled the first instalment 'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi'.

news_headline: We're getting stuck with the underworld gangster genre: Supriya on OTT
news_article: Stating that there is variety in the content that is being released on digital platforms in western countries, actress Supriya Pathak said, "In India, we seem to be getting stuck with the underworld gangster genre...the tone is very similar." Supriya said, "In this country if one thing works, we have a tendency to dole out cookie-cutter versions of the same."

news_headline: Like Hrithik, Ibrahim should just explode on screen: Saif
news_article: Speaking about his elder son Ibrahim Ali Khan becoming an actor, Saif Ali Khan said, "Like Hrithik Roshan, he should just explode on the screen." The actor further told Mumbai Mirror, "There will be comparisons with me, he can't avoid that, but he's still growing, developing his own personality, so it's best to be seen less for now."

news_headline: Aanand L Rai to direct a biopic on Viswanathan Anand: Reports
news_article: Aanand L Rai will reportedly direct a biopic based on the life of ex-world chess champion Viswanathan Anand. The yet-to-be-titled film will be produced by Rai's Colour Yellow Productions and Mahaveer Jain's Sundial Entertainment, film trade analyst Taran Adarsh tweeted. The filmmaker is currently shooting a romantic-drama titled 'Atrangi Re', which stars Sara Ali Khan, Dhanush and Akshay Kumar.

news_headline: Intensity in characters made it a memorable one: Ajay on 15 yrs of 'Apaharan'
news_article: Taking to Instagram, Ajay Devgn wrote about his film 'Apaharan', which completed 15 years of release on Wednesday. Sharing a video from the film, he wrote, "The cast, the plot, the intensity in characters made this movie a memorable one...Celebrating #15YearsOfApaharan." Directed by Prakash Jha, the action-drama film also starred Nana Patekar and Bipasha Basu.

news_headline: I haven't ever had Botox to this day: Jennifer Lopez
news_article: Actor-singer Jennifer Lopez, who will launch her skincare line 'JLo Beauty' on January 1, 2021, revealed that she never got Botox. "I don't have anything against people doing that, it's just not my thing. I'm more about a natural approach to skincare...I don't want to...go to the needles at some point," she said during a Zoom call via Page Six.

news_headline: Dia Mirza's ex-manager sent to 14-day judicial custody in drugs case
news_article: A court in Mumbai has sent actress Dia Mirza's ex-manager Rahila Furniturewala and businessman Karan Sajnani to 14-day judicial custody in connection with a drugs case. Rahila and Karan were arrested by NCB last week in a case involving illegal import of high-quality marijuana. Rahila's sister Shaista Furniturewala was also arrested as she too was found in possession of drugs.

news_headline: Cinema-loving audience will always be there: Saqib on theatre vs OTT debate
news_article: Saqib Saleem, while commenting on the debate over OTT vs theatres, said that both the platforms can co-exist very happily. "There will be a lot of OTT work in the coming years but...cinema-loving audience will always be there," he added. "There will always be films like 'Sooryavanshi', 'Baahubali', the big-ticket films you really want to go to...theatres for," Saqib said.

news_headline: Ahana's newborn twins are biggest gifts for my b'day: Dharmendra
news_article: Dharmendra, who turned 85 years old on December 8, has said his daughter Ahana Deol's newborn twins, Astraia and Adea, are the biggest gifts for his birthday. "And I got...gift in advance," he added. Ahana's twins were born on November 26. Talking about how he celebrated his birthday, Dharmendra said, "I don't celebrate my birthday these days after...mother passed away."

news_headline: Akshay plays volleyball with soldiers on Army Day, shares video
news_article: On the occasion of Army Day, actor Akshay Kumar shared a video of himself playing volleyball with men from the Indian Army. He wrote, "Had the pleasure of meeting some of our bravehearts today to flag off a marathon on...#ArmyDay and what better way to warm up than a quick game of volleyball." India is celebrating 73rd Army Day today.

news_headline: Akshay to play double role in upcoming sci-fi film: Reports
news_article: Akshay Kumar is reportedly collaborating with 'Mission Mangal' director Jagan Shakti for a science-fiction film, in which the actor will play a double role. The upcoming film will reportedly go on floors by the end of 2021 and will release in 2022. Akshay's earlier films like 'Aflatoon', 'Jai Kishen' and 'Rowdy Rathore' also featured him in a double role.

news_headline: Feels great: Vidya on short film 'Natkhat' reaching Oscar 2021 race
news_article: Speaking about her short film 'Natkhat' entering the race for the Academy Awards 2021's Best Short Film (Live Action) category, actress Vidya Balan said, "It feels great to have our film qualify for the Oscars." The actress who starred in the film and co-produced it, said, "This film is incredibly close to me."

news_headline: OnePlus launches gamified engagement of Netflix film, ‘AK vs AK’
news_article: OnePlus has partnered with Netflix to launch an online game, ‘AK vs AK: Stops at Nothing’ that captures fictionalised rivalry between Anil Kapoor & Anurag Kashyap as depicted in the Netflix film. "Through this partnership, we hoped to provide immersive experience...while creating synergy between OnePlus 8T 5G’s key features & Netflix’s AK vs AK", Siddhant Narayan, HOM, OnePlus India said.

news_headline: It was physically, emotionally demanding to play Mary Kom: Priyanka
news_article: Actress Priyanka Chopra Jonas has said that it was "both physically and emotionally demanding" to play boxer Mary Kom in the 2014 biopic. The 38-year-old actress posted a video on Instagram, showcasing few scenes from the movie and wrote, "It's an experience I will never forget. An amazing team and an equally supportive Mary herself saw me through it all."

news_headline: Harrison Ford returns as Indiana Jones for the fifth instalment
news_article: Hollywood actor Harrison Ford will reprise his lead role for a fifth "Indiana Jones" movie, Disney confirmed. "At the helm is James Mangold, director of Ford v Ferrari, and Indy himself, Harrison Ford, will be back to continue his iconic character's journey," Disney tweeted. The movie would be produced by Lucasfilm and will release in July 2022.

news_headline: Kerala theatres exempted from entertainment tax till March
news_article: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday announced that the cinema theatres in the state have been exempted from paying entertainment tax from January to March this year. "Fixed electricity charges have been reduced by 50% for the 10 months during when theatres were closed," he added. The Kerala CM also said that the validity of various licenses has been extended.

news_headline: 'Malang' allowed me to explore myself as an actor: Disha Patani
news_article: Talking about her crime-drama film 'Malang', actress Disha Patani said, "[It] allowed me to explore myself as an actor and grow more." She added, "We're inching closer towards 2021 but the love that the film has been getting constantly feels like the film just released yesterday." Directed by Mohit Suri, 'Malang' also starred Aditya Roy Kapur and Anil Kapoor.

news_headline: Delhi Health Minister thanks SRK for donating Remdesivir injections
news_article: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Thursday thanked Shah Rukh Khan for donating 500 Remdesivir injections. "We're extremely thankful to...@iamsrk, @MeerFoundation for donating 500...injections at a time when it was needed the most. We're much obliged for...support extended by you during the time of crisis," he tweeted. Remdesivir injections are used in the treatment of COVID-19 patients.

news_headline: Saif, Arjun, Jacqueline, Yami head to Dalhousie to shoot 'Bhoot Police'
news_article: Actors Saif Ali Khan, Arjun Kapoor, Jacqueline Fernandez and Yami Gautam have left for Himachal Pradesh's Dalhousie to shoot the first schedule of their upcoming horror comedy film 'Bhoot Police'. They were spotted at Mumbai airport and took a private charter to head to the location. According to reports, the shooting will begin in November.

news_headline: Excited to work with Ishaan, Mrunal & Priyanshu: 'Pippa' director
news_article: Director Raja Krishna Menon has said he's very excited to work with Mrunal Thakur, Priyanshu Painyuli and Ishaan Khatter in the upcoming film 'Pippa'. "With Mrunal and Priyanshu joining Ishaan, we've three of...most exciting young actors coming together," he added. "I'm very excited to work with such extraordinary young talent and look forward to...energy they bring to 'Pippa'," Raja said.

news_headline: Babil shares dad Irrfan's video message for him, pays tribute on birth anniversary
news_article: Babil Khan has shared an old video on his father Irrfan Khan's 54th birth anniversary. The video shows Babil's mother, younger brother and Irrfan recording a message telling Babil that they miss him. "[I] don't remember anyone's birthdays because you never remembered mine and never encouraged me to remember yours...This time I couldn't forget yours if I tried," wrote Babil.

news_headline: Himanshi shares Kangana's tweet on farmers' protest; reacts to her remarks
news_article: Sharing a tweet by Kangana Ranaut on farmers' protest, former Bigg Boss contestant Himanshi Khurana wrote, "Oh she's spokesperson now. Baat ko galt angle dena inse sikhe koi." In her tweet, Kangana shared a link to an article on farmers' protest and wrote, "Hopefully government won't allow anti national elements to take advantage and create another Shaheen Baag riots."

news_headline: Madonna shares photo showing her scar from hip surgery
news_article: Singer Madonna on Monday took to Instagram Story to share pictures showing her scar from a hip surgery. She shared the pictures following a cupping treatment session that left her with circular marks dotted across her thighs. The 62-year-old added the hashtags "recovery", "cupping" and "beautiful scar" in the pictures.

news_headline: 'Mad Max: Fury Road' actor Hugh Keays-Byrne passes away aged 73
news_article: Actor Hugh Keays-Byrne, known for films like 'Mad Max', 'Mad Max: Fury Road', 'Stone' and TV series 'Farscape', passed away aged 73. "It's amazing you were able to play an evil warlord so well cause you were such a...beautiful soul," actress Charlize Theron tweeted. "He cared about...preserving the environment long before these issues became fashionable," filmmaker Brian Trenchard-Smith said.

news_headline: 'Kal Ho...' made me laugh & cry in a heartbeat: Preity on film's 17 yrs
news_article: Actress Preity Zinta on Saturday took to Instagram to share a post on the 17th anniversary of her film 'Kal Ho Naa Ho', which also starred Shah Rukh Khan and Saif Ali Khan. "A movie that made me laugh and cry in a heartbeat," she wrote, adding, "An experience that went beyond words...This was probably one of my best-written films."

news_headline: I get scared when people say 'she's at her career-best': Taapsee
news_article: Actress Taapsee Pannu said in an interview that she gets scared when people say that she is at her career-best. "It's scary because then you feel there is going to be a decline. If you reach the peak, the only way ahead is to come down...that's a crazy thought," she added. Taapsee was last seen in Anubhav Sinha's 'Thappad'.

news_headline: Will rectify scene: Mirzapur 2 makers apologise to author Surender Mohan Pathak
news_article: The makers of 'Mirzapur 2' have apologised to author Surender Mohan Pathak who had accused them of depicting his book 'Dhabba' as "sheer porno" in the show. Excel Entertainment shared a statement on Twitter which was signed by the show's creator Puneet Krishna. "We'd like to assure you that to rectify this situation...we'll blur...book-cover...or remove...VO within...3 weeks," the statement read.

news_headline: Om Puri shot despite having typhoid: Wife on his last film Omprakash Zindabad
news_article: Late actor Om Puri's last film 'Omprakash Zindabad' is set to release in theatres on December 18. Talking about the same, wife Nandita Puri said, "It feels good to see his last film release in theatres." She further said the film was shot five years ago, adding, "I remember him filming in Lucknow and despite having typhoid, finishing...shoot on time."

news_headline: Show is a work of fiction: Sunil Grover on 'Tandav' controversy
news_article: Commenting on the ongoing controversy surrounding his web series 'Tandav', actor Sunil Grover said, "This is a work of fiction. Politics, of course, is always a topic of conversation in our country." He further explained "The show was shot last year, so a lot of things in it hadn't happened yet in real life. But they happened later."

news_headline: I'm getting larger than life and real-life hero roles: Sonu Sood
news_article: Sonu Sood, who has been helping people amid the coronavirus pandemic, has said the kind of roles coming his way have changed. "They are larger than life and real-life hero roles. Things that I've done in real life, they're trying to put that in my scripts too," he added. "I've to make sure that I live up to...expectations," said Sonu.

news_headline: IFFI to pay homage to Irrfan, Sushant and Chadwick Boseman
news_article: Irrfan Khan, Sushant Singh Rajput, Rishi Kapoor and Chadwick Boseman are among 28 names from the world of cinema to be honoured during the 51st edition of International Film Festival of India (IFFI). The festival will showcase films of 19 artistes from India and nine international names who passed away last year. It'll be held in Goa from January 16-24.

news_headline: 'ME' vanishes from Amazon Prime Videos' logo across social platforms
news_article: OTT platform Amazon Prime Video has removed 'ME' from their logo across various social platforms. APV took to Twitter and tweeted a photo of its logo where 'ME' was missing from it with hashtag "#WhereIsME". It also took to Instagram and posted several dialogues from various web series and movies with 'ME' missing from all the dialogues.

news_headline: Void which will never be filled: Sagarika on her father's death
news_article: Actress Sagarika Ghatge Khan, who lost her father on January 9, took to social media to post pictures of her late father with the family and wrote, "I am feeling a void which will never be filled." She added, "Thank you for teaching me how to be brave...Love you a lot Daddy. Missing you terribly."

news_headline: Deepika, Kriti, John, Abhishek join Akshay in Housefull 5: Reports
news_article: Several actors from the previous 'Housefull' films, including Deepika Padukone, Kriti Sanon, John Abraham, Abhishek Bachchan and Jacqueline Fernandez, will join Akshay Kumar for the fifth instalment of the franchise, as per reports. "It is being envisioned on a huge scale," reports added. Producer Sajid Nadiadwala is reportedly planning to shoot the film in the IMAX format.

news_headline: Never made the first move: Janhvi Kapoor about her dating life
news_article: Speaking with Kareena Kapoor Khan on her chat show 'What Women Want', actress Janhvi Kapoor revealed that she has "never made the first move" and is "sly" if she is interested to date someone. The 23-year-old added, "I will drop my hints, but I won't make it too obvious till I know the other person is for sure interested."

news_headline: Remo is fine, will be back with me on trip to mountains soon: Raghav
news_article: Giving a health update about choreographer-director Remo D'souza, who was hospitalised on Friday after he suffered a heart attack, dancer-actor Raghav Juyal took to Instagram and wrote, "Guys sir is fine now". He further wrote, "He is already recovering and will be back with me on a trip to the mountains soon. Just send him healing energies everyone."

news_headline: If something isn't working, part ways: Minissha Lamba on her separation
news_article: Actress Minissha Lamba, who announced her divorce from restaurateur Ryan Tham last year, in an interview opened up about her separation. She said, "Life goes on and the important thing is to be happy." Minissha added, "If something is not working, part ways amicably. Today we have options for that; there is no stigma attached to separation."

news_headline: I felt helpless in America: Preity as she reveals her mom, brother got COVID-19
news_article: Actress Preity Zinta revealed on Monday that her mother, brother, his wife, children and her uncle tested COVID-19 positive three weeks ago. "Suddenly terms like ventilators, ICU and oxygen machines took a new meaning. I felt helpless & powerless here in America," she wrote. "Today, after hearing that they've all tested negative I can finally...stop stressing," wrote Preity.

news_headline: Singer Joe Jonas to make acting debut with war drama 'Devotion'
news_article: American singer Joe Jonas will make his acting debut with war movie 'Devotion'. Joe will reportedly share screen space with Jonathan Majors, Glen Powell, Thomas Sadoski and Christina Jackson. The film will narrate the true story of US Navy fighter pilots, Jesse Brown and Tom Hudner. 'Devotion' will be directed by JD Dillard, who previously helmed 'Sweetheart' and 'Sleight'.

news_headline: He gave a shot in less than 15 seconds: Gautam on working with Salman
news_article: Speaking about his experience of working with Salman Khan for their upcoming film 'Radhe: Your Most Wanted Bhai', television actor Gautam Gulati shared an incident that left him "stunned". "Myself and Prabhudeva were standing and looking at his shot, it was so difficult. But...he managed to give that shot in just lesser than 15 seconds," Gautam shared.

news_headline: Vidya's team's car stopped from entering forest as she 'rejected' minister's invite
news_article: Vehicles of production team of Vidya Balan's upcoming film were allegedly stopped from entering a Madhya Pradesh forest for shooting. This was after she reportedly rejected Madhya Pradesh Forest Minister Vijay Shah's dinner invitation. Commenting on reports, Shah said, "I was there on request from those who took permission for shoot and requested me for dinner. I said not possible."

news_headline: I've been rejected many times, it has not affected me: Dino Morea
news_article: Actor Dino Morea in an interview spoke about facing rejections in the entertainment industry and revealed that he has been rejected many times. "But it hasn't affected me. I've not taken it to heart," he added. "Rejections are part and parcel of this game and one needs to be ready for it mentally to take that rejection," Dino further said.

news_headline: I was dropped out of films after 'Thugs...' flopped: Fatima
news_article: Fatima Sana Shaikh has said she was dropped out of films after her film, 'Thugs of Hindostan', flopped. "Thought my career was over," Fatima said, adding, "I was getting offers but...not the kind...I wanted to do...so I held back. I decided that because it's been tough to be part of this industry and I wanted to be in...position to choose."

news_headline: Ananya doesn't take things to her heart: Mom Bhavana on cyber-bullying
news_article: Talking about cyber-bullying, actress Ananya Panday's mother Bhavana Pandey said that the actress is a positive person and "she doesn't take things to her heart too much". Bhavana further said that as a mother, she used to get very "hurt and angry" reading comments about Ananya and added, "Now I understand that being a public figure it's okay".

news_headline: Tamil TV actress VJ Chitra found dead at hotel aged 29, suicide suspected
news_article: Television actress and host VJ Chitra, who rose to fame with her role in the Tamil soap opera 'Pandian Stores', was found dead at a hotel room in Chennai's outskirts on Wednesday. She was 29 and is suspected to have died by suicide. Police is ascertaining the cause of her death and her body has been sent for autopsy.

news_headline: Wajid Khan's wife reveals she was harassed by his family to convert to Islam
news_article: Late music composer Wajid Khan's wife Kamalrukh Khan has alleged she was harassed by Wajid's family to convert to Islam. "My dignity...didn't permit me to bend backwards for him and his family, by converting to Islam," she wrote. "The result-being outcast from my husband's family, scare tactics to make me convert included taking me to court seeking divorce," added Kamalrukh.

news_headline: Was asked to compromise for a role on OTT platform: Maanvi Gagroo
news_article: Actress Maanvi Gagroo, in an interview with Times of India, revealed that she was once asked to "compromise" for a role if she wanted to work with an OTT platform. However, the actress went ahead and complained about the offender to the platform and demanded an action to be taken. Notably, Maanvi has worked in several popular web series.

news_headline: We all have our own space here: Rakul Preet Singh on comparisons
news_article: Rakul Preet Singh, on being asked if competition or comparison worry her, said, "Healthy competition makes you do better." She added, "What's the point of excelling with people not doing well around you? I've always seen competition as an opportunity to grow. We all have our own space here." Rakul will be next seen in films like 'Attack' and 'MayDay'.

news_headline: Colossus of a captain, gem of a person: Ranveer on Kapil Dev's b'day
news_article: Ranveer Singh, who'll essay the role of Kapil Dev in film '83', took to Instagram on Wednesday to wish the former Indian cricketer on the occasion of his 62nd birthday. "Colossus of a Captain! Gem of a person! Thank you Sir for...allowing us to tell your extraordinary story! Here's wishing the OG @therealkapildev good health...on his special day," he wrote.

news_headline: Want to work more in India with Indian actors: Christopher Nolan
news_article: Filmmaker Christopher Nolan, while sharing his experience of working in India, said that he wants to come back and shoot again in India, and work with Indian actors. "I had an amazing experience in India," he added. Nolan shot a sequence of 'Tenet' in Mumbai and filmed some scenes of his 2012 film 'The Dark Knight Rises' in Jodhpur.

news_headline: Rejected Prem Qaidi as I was supposed to be introduced in bikini: Ayesha Jhulka
news_article: Ayesha Jhulka, who starred in films like 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar' and 'Chachi 420', spoke about the films she rejected and said, "There was a Rama Naidu film, 'Prem Qaidi' which I'd to reject because I was supposed to be introduced in...bikini." She further said she also couldn't do Mani Ratnam's 'Roja' due to date issues, adding, "I regretted it."

news_headline: Dulquer Salmaan teams up with R Balki for a thriller film: Reports
news_article: Actor Dulquer Salmaan will reportedly play the lead role in filmmaker R Balki's upcoming thriller movie. The project would mark the first collaboration between Balki and the actor, who made his Hindi film debut with the 2018 Irrfan Khan starrer movie 'Karwaan'. Reportedly, the film is scheduled to go on floors later this year.

news_headline: I hate vulgar and double-meaning type of comedy: Paresh Rawal
news_article: Actor Paresh Rawal, who will feature in 'Coolie No 1', said he hates vulgar comedy and stated that his upcoming film is a "family entertainer". "These days, you can't tell when a nude scene might show up in a movie, or if there's going to be bad language...I hate double-meaning type of comedy," Paresh further said.

news_headline: She's an iconic star: Sara on comparisons with Karisma in Coolie No 1
news_article: Sara Ali Khan, who'll reprise Karisma Kapoor's role in 'Coolie No 1', recently talked about comparisons with Karisma and said, "She's an iconic star...I don't think I've even attempted to step into her shoes." She added, "I think instead of aping or trying to copy Karisma, which is impossible to do, we've tried to bring a freshness to the role."

news_headline: Got only ₹20L of ₹35L fee for Aksar 2, have to pay mom's nurses ₹60k a month: Maker
news_article: 'Aksar 2' director Ananth Narayan Mahadevan has alleged he hasn't been paid his full remuneration by the 2017 film's producer. "I was supposed to be paid ₹35 lakh. I've been paid ₹20 lakh till date over...two years," he stated. "My mother is...bedridden. I've to pay 2 nurses...₹60,000 a month...I've told the producers everything...But these people kept fooling me," said Ananth.

news_headline: Sarabhai vs Sarabhai writer criticises Pak version, calls it 'daylight robbery'
news_article: 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai' writer Aatish Kapadia shared on Facebook that a "word to word" and "frame to frame" "unofficial" remake of the show is currently on air in Pakistan. "It has been shamelessly put on a free video streaming platform and the actors have performed my written word so badly," he added. Kapadia further called the remake a "daylight robbery".

news_headline: Ankita shares old videos of Sushant on his birth anniversary
news_article: Remembering late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his birth anniversary, actress Ankita Lokhande took to Instagram to share old videos of the actor and wrote, "I'm gonna share few of your old videos...to celebrate you. These are the only memories I have with you." Lokhande further said, "I pray and I know you are very happy, wherever you are."

news_headline: Shehnaaz Gill to return to Bigg Boss house for guest appearance
news_article: Bigg Boss season 14's latest promo has revealed that the reality show's former contestant Shehnaaz Gill will enter the Bigg Boss house in the upcoming episode as a guest. The promo video showed Shehnaaz interacting with host Salman Khan from inside the house. Posting the clip on Instagram, Shehnaaz wrote, "Did you guys miss me yet?"

news_headline: Wish you were here: Riddhima shares pics of late father Rishi
news_article: Riddhima Kapoor Sahni took to Instagram to post throwback pictures of her late father Rishi Kapoor. She captioned the post, "You are missed everyday! Wish you were here with us. We love you." Rishi Kapoor passed away at the age of 67 in April this year after battling leukemia for more than two years.

news_headline: 1st pic from Aditya & Shweta's reception surfaces, comedian Bharti attends
news_article: The first picture from singer Udit Narayan's son Aditya Narayan and his newly-wed wife Shweta Agarwal's wedding reception has surfaced online. Among those who attended the wedding reception included Govinda with wife Sunita and children Tina and Yashvardhan, and comedian Bharti Singh with husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa. Aditya and Shweta got married at Iskcon Temple in Mumbai on Tuesday.

news_headline: John Cena shares Ranveer Singh's photo, actor comments 'Kuch bhi'
news_article: WWE wrestler John Cena took to Instagram on Sunday to share a picture of actor Ranveer Singh with a fan without any caption. The photo is the same that the actor had shared himself on Instagram in March. Commenting on John Cena's post, Ranveer wrote, "Kuch bhi" with a laughing emoji.

news_headline: Kangana's tweets portray farmers protest as anti-national: DSGMC chief
news_article: Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) chief Manjinder Singh Sirsa has sent a legal notice to actress Kangana Ranaut for her tweet on 'Shaheen Bagh Dadi' Bilkis Bano and saying that she is a woman "available for ₹100". "Her tweets portray farmers protest as anti-national," Sirsa said. Kangana "misidentified" an old woman at the ongoing farmers' protest as Bilkis Bano.

news_headline: Sad that a deadly virus had to make us spend more time with families: Hina
news_article: Actress Hina Khan, who took a trip to the Maldives with her parents amid the coronavirus pandemic, said, "It is so sad that a deadly virus had to exist to push us and make us pause our lives to spend more time with our families." She added, "I will continue to spend more time with them, though I do nevertheless."

news_headline: Rajinikanth resumes 'Annaatthe' shoot amid COVID-19, makers share pic
news_article: Rajinikanth has resumed shooting for his upcoming movie 'Annaatthe' in Hyderabad and the makers of the film shared a photo of the actor and his daughter Aishwaryaa R Dhanush from the sets. The shooting was brought to a halt when the lockdown for COVID-19 was imposed. "Superstar Rajinikanth at Annaatthe shoot," production studio Sun Pictures tweeted with the picture.

news_headline: Vikrant Massey is a distinct actor, I really love his work: Konkona
news_article: Konkona Sensharma, who'll be seen alongside Vikrant Massey in 'Ramprasad Ki Tehrvi', has said he's a very distinct actor. "I really love Vikrant's work...He can do many things really well...So it was a wonderful opportunity to act alongside him," she added. Konkona has previously worked with Vikrant in 'A Death in the Gunj' and 'Dolly Kitty Aur Woh Chamakte Sitare'.

news_headline: Woman says Rhea has lost any chance at a B'wood career, Soni Razdan replies
news_article: Actress Soni Razdan has come out in support of Rhea Chakraborty after a Twitter user wrote, "She...has possibly lost any chance at a Bollywood career." "She going to jail has...exposed only the people who sent her there and shown that she was...innocent...Why won't anyone work with her? I think she'll do very well. I hope so anyway," Soni replied.

news_headline: Fire breaks out at Fatima's house, actress thanks fire department for prompt response
news_article: A fire broke out at actress Fatima Sana Shaikh's house in Mumbai. The actress took to Instagram Stories to thank the officials of fire department for their prompt response. Sharing a picture, Fatima wrote, "A small fire broke at my place...and in a panic state...I called the fire department...they were here in no time. And took care of the situation."

news_headline: Ayushmann to play a doctor in 'Doctor G', says 'Loved the script'
news_article: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana will be seen playing a doctor in a new film titled 'Doctor G', which will be directed by Anubhuti Kashyap. Speaking about the upcoming project, the actor said, "Doctor G is a script that I fell in love with instantly because it is super fresh.  It...will...deliver a message...that will hopefully speak directly to your hearts."

news_headline: Vicky approached to play Big B's role in Chupke Chupke remake: Reports
news_article: Actor Vicky Kaushal has reportedly been approached to play Amitabh Bachchan's role in the remake of 1975 film 'Chupke Chupke'. Reportedly, the film will also star Rajkummar Rao, who will essay the character played by Dharmendra in the original. The 1975 comedy-drama film, which was directed by Hrishikesh Mukherjee, also starred Sharmila Tagore and Jaya Bachchan, among others.

news_headline: Veteran Bengali actor Monu Mukherjee passes away at 90
news_article: Veteran Bengali actor Monu Mukherjee, who featured in Satyajit Ray's 'Joi Baba Felunath' and 'Ganashatru', passed away on Sunday following a cardiac arrest, at the age of 90. "We conferred on him the Lifetime Achievement Award at the Tele-Samman Awards 2015. My condolences to his family, colleagues and admirers," West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee tweeted following his demise.

news_headline: Nothing is happening, sad for all of us: Arshad on 'Munna Bhai 3'
news_article: Talking about the third instalment of the 'Munna Bhai' franchise, Arshad Warsi said, "Nothing is happening." He added, "I think you should all go...to Vidhu Vinod Chopra and Raju's (Rajkumar Hirani) house and threaten them to start fast." Arshad further said, "It's been a bit too long...Raju is busy with other things...I don't think so. Sad for all of us."

news_headline: I used to have immense respect for Kangana, I was wrong: Mika on her tweet
news_article: After Kangana Ranaut misidentified an elderly woman named Mahinder Kaur, who took part in farmers' protest, and said that she's 'Shaheen Bagh Dadi' Bilkis Bano, Mika Singh tweeted, "Shame on you". "I used to have immense respect for Kangana...I now think I was wrong, Kangana being a woman you should show the old lady some respect," Mika said.

news_headline: Arjun Rampal summoned again by NCB on Dec 16 in drug-related case
news_article: Arjun Rampal has been summoned by NCB on December 16 for questioning in connection with a drug-related case. He was first summoned by the agency on  November 13 and was reportedly questioned for six hours. Last month, NCB had raided his residence and seized medicines which are controlled substances covered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

news_headline: Social media platforms enable abusers: Zoya Akhtar on cyberbullying
news_article: While commenting on cyberbullying, filmmaker Zoya Akhtar said, "Social media platforms [enabling] the abusers of women, by not identifying them or holding them accountable, is a recipe for disaster." During a session organised by the Population Foundation of India and the Jaipur Literature Festival, Zoya added, "It's...a matter of time before the virtual abuse seeps into real spaces."

news_headline: Tamil TV actress Chitra's husband arrested for abetting her suicide
news_article: Nearly a week after the Tamil TV actress Chitra was found dead in her hotel room, her husband Hemanth was arrested on Monday night for allegedly abetting her suicide. Chitra's mother had also accused Hemanth of harassing her daughter. Police said on the day of her suicide, Hemanth had an argument with her at a shooting spot near the hotel.

news_headline: Weirdest rumour about me was I'm getting married to Ashutosh Rana: Sandhya
news_article: Actress Sandhya Mridul, while speaking about the weirdest rumour she has heard about herself, said, "I was very new and...was working with Ashutosh Rana and somebody spread a rumour about me getting married to him." She added, "I was like, what the hell is going on? Are you mad? I was like these people will say things out of anything."

news_headline: My event company suffered in 2020, had to let go of many people: Milind
news_article: Model-actor Milind Soman has revealed that his event management business suffered a lot last year due to the coronavirus pandemic. He added his company had to let go of many employees during the lockdown because it didn't have money to pay them. "In 2021, I hope I can resurrect my business...we can start working again, rehire people," Milind further said.

news_headline: I quit college at 19 and worked as peon, my father still runs tea stall: Dharmesh
news_article: Dancer and actor Dharmesh Yelande has said that he quit college at the age of 19 and worked as a peon. He told Humans of Bombay that eventually with his success and earnings, he bought a house for his family. He also revealed that his father still runs a tea stall he opened several years ago to feed the family.

news_headline: I do it for my own amusement: Ranveer on his fashion choices
news_article: Commenting on his "whimsical" fashion choices, Ranveer Singh said, "I do it for my own amusement...playing 'dress-up' is fun for me. I am always attracted to original, distinctive and unique expression." He also mentioned that he decided to be authentic with his choices and be true to himself after his "life-altering" back injury during the shooting of his film 'Lootera'.

news_headline: FIR filed against 'Mirzapur' creators for allegedly defaming Mirzapur
news_article: An FIR has been registered against producers of the web series 'Mirzapur' at the Kotwali Dehat Police Station of Mirzapur district in UP for allegedly defaming the district. The FIR was registered on the complaint of a local resident, who alleged that the show promotes social enmity, presents the district in a bad light and "has hurt his religious sentiments".

news_headline: The Conjuring writers join Vikram Bhatt's next as screenplay consultants
news_article: American writer duo Carey and Chad Hayes, who've worked on several horror films including 'The Conjuring', have joined filmmaker Vikram Bhatt's upcoming project, 'The Cello', as screenplay consultants. It is based on a story by Saudi poet-songwriter Turki Al-Sheikh. "Filmmaking is a collaborative process and to work with the best is an honour," Carey and Chad said in a statement.

news_headline: When I heard I was gay, I thought 'this is how rumours start': Neelam
news_article: Actress Neelam Kothari, who appeared in the web series 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives', said in an interview with Mashable India that she once heard from someone that she's gay. "When I heard...this I was like 'Okay, this is how rumours start, out of nowhere'," she added. "It wasn't written about but I got to hear about it," said Neelam.

news_headline: Kept marriage secret for 4 yrs, Parmeet's parents didn't approve of me: Archana
news_article: Actress Archana Puran Singh has revealed that after her wedding to Parmeet Sethi, they kept their marriage a secret for four years. On 'The Kapil Sharma Show', Archana revealed how his parents did not approve of her as she was an actress. The couple got married in 1992 and have two sons.

news_headline: Mahesh's sister, nephew seek written apology, ₹90L in damages from Luviena
news_article: Mahesh Bhatt's sister Kumkum Saigal and her son, Sahil, have moved the Mumbai City Civil Court, seeking a permanent injunction against Luviena Lodh from making defamatory statements against them, a written apology and ₹90 lakh in damages. Luviena, in a video, had accused Mahesh and his family of harassing her. She also called Mahesh "the biggest don of the industry".

news_headline: Arshad joins Akshay and Kriti starrer 'Bachchan Pandey': Reports
news_article: Actor Arshad Warsi has been roped in to play Akshay Kumar's friend in the upcoming film 'Bachchan Pandey', Mumbai Mirror reported. While Akshay and Arshad have never worked together in a film before, they have been part of the 'Jolly LLB' franchise. The production of the film, which will also star Kriti Sanon, will reportedly start in January 2021.

news_headline: Aubrey reveals Kristen contracted COVID-19 during 'Happiest Season' filming
news_article: Actress Aubrey Plaza revealed that her 'Happiest Season' co-star Kristen Stewart contracted coronavirus while shooting for their movie. "COVID-19 was on our set, Kristen got sick. Well, we didn't know...It was the last week of February...I think a bunch of people on our set got sick. I didn't, thank God," she said on 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert'.

news_headline: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' shooting schedule revised for Tabu: Reports
news_article: Actors Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani's shooting schedule for 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has been reportedly revised to accommodate actress Tabu's dates. Reportedly, the filming was originally scheduled to start in January end, however, Tabu does not have dates this month to shoot for the sequel to the 2007 film, ETimes reported.

news_headline: Guru Dutt's daughter sends notice to director for copyright violation
news_article: Late actor-filmmaker Guru Dutt's daughter, Nina Memon, has sent a legal notice for copyright infringement to director Bhavna Talwar, who had announced a biopic on Dutt's life last year. Memon has stated in the notice that she's the sole copyright owner of the late actor's life story. "Memon hasn't assigned any rights to a third party," Memon's spokesperson told Mid-Day.

news_headline: Robert pays tribute to Chadwick, says 'His energy was undeniable'
news_article: Late actor Chadwick Boseman was honoured with the Hero for the Ages Award at the MTV Movie & TV Awards: Greatest of All Time special and his Marvel co-star Robert Downey Jr paid tribute to the 'Black Panther' actor. "His energy and intensity was undeniable. There was something different and special about Chadwick," Robert said.

news_headline: Rajiv Lakshman deletes photos with Rhea after they go viral, issues statement
news_article: 'Roadies' fame Rajiv Lakshman deleted his photos with Rhea Chakraborty after they went viral. Rajiv had captioned the pictures as 'I Love You' and 'My Girl'. "I seem to have created unnecessary trouble with my irresponsible choice of words on a post. Rhea is a dear old friend...and I’m happy to meet her again...and...I wish her well," he wrote.

news_headline: Police alerted of lockdown breach as Priyanka visits London salon, team clarifies
news_article: The police were alerted of a lockdown breach after actress Priyanka Chopra was spotted at a salon in London with her mother and pet dog. The actress' spokesperson clarified that the salon was opened privately for the production and everyone involved had been tested. The spokesperson added that the exemption paperwork was provided to the police and they "left satisfied".

news_headline: Author of Didda's biography accuses Kangana of copyright infringement
news_article: 'Didda: The Warrior Queen of Kashmir' author Ashish Kaul has accused Kangana Ranaut of "blatantly violating his sole rights" after she announced film 'Manikarnika Returns: The Legend Of Didda'. He claimed he has "exclusive copyrights to...life story of Didda". "No historian, apart from Kalhan who wrote...two pages, and me, who...spent six years on research, have information on her," he added.

news_headline: Salman plans to begin the shoot of 'Tiger 3' in March: Reports
news_article: According to reports, actor Salman Khan is all set to begin the shoot of 'Tiger 3' in March. Pinkvilla said quoting a source, "If everything goes as planned and the pandemic does not act as a spoilsport, he will be shooting for 'Tiger 3' from March till September." Reportedly, Salman would complete the shoot of 'Antim' by February end.

news_headline: Vivek Oberoi's brother-in-law arrested in Sandalwood drug case
news_article: The Bengaluru Central Crime Branch (CCB) Police has arrested the absconding accused Aditya Alva, Vivek Oberoi's brother-in-law, in connection with the Sandalwood drug case. According to police officials, Aditya was arrested in Chennai on Monday. Alva had been absconding since an FIR was lodged at Cottonpet Police Station on September 4 and is among the 12 accused in the case.

news_headline: Digital platforms give an actor a lot of space, opportunities: Namit
news_article: Speaking about his experience of working on digital platforms, actor Namit Das said, "It gives an actor a lot of space and actor like me has got many opportunities to be a part of different kinds of stories." Namit added that this would have been difficult when the options were limited to films or television.

news_headline: Dhanush joins Ryan Gosling and Chris Evans starrer 'The Gray Man'
news_article: Actor Dhanush will share screen space with Hollywood actors Ryan Gosling, Chris Evans and Ana de Armas in the Russo Brothers' upcoming film 'The Gray Man'. The movie, which is based on Mark Greaney's 2009 novel of the same name, will also feature actors Jessica Henwick, Wagner Moura, and Julia Butters.

news_headline: I'm only one left to meet this visual genius: Akshay as Twinkle interviews Nolan
news_article: Taking to Twitter on Thursday, Akshay Kumar shared a video of his wife, author Twinkle Khanna, interviewing 'Tenet' director Christopher Nolan. He wrote, "First my mom-in-law (Dimple Kapadia) worked with #ChristopherNolan and now the wife gets to interview him...seems like I'm the only one left in the family yet to meet the visual genius! Watch this interview while I sulk."

news_headline: 2020 helped me value the small things in life: Sonu Sood
news_article: Sonu Sood said the year 2020 helped him value the small things in life and added, "We often forget to spend...quality time with our loved ones." The actor, who helped migrant workers during the coronavirus pandemic, further said, "This year has...been a lot about self-contemplation...learned a lot about myself. I have been...inspired by frontline workers during the pandemic."

news_headline: Want public apology from Sajid: Sherlyn after alleging he asked her to feel his penis
news_article: Actress Sherlyn Chopra, who had alleged that filmmaker Sajid Khan had taken his penis out and had asked her to feel it when she had met him in April 2005, has now demanded a public apology from him. "He has been a habitual offender...I don't understand how serial offenders like him get support from the film industry," she stated.

news_headline: Ayushmann's 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui' had a no OTT clause: Reports
news_article: According to reports, actor Ayushmann Khurrana's contract with the producers of 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui' included a strict theatrical release. Pinkvilla said quoting a source, "He [Ayushmann] along with his team has devised a plan to clearly bifurcate between OTT and theatrical content before coming onboard a film." Notably, Ayushmann's 'Gulabo Sitabo' was his first film to release on OTT.

news_headline: The failure of 'Mohenjo Daro' was heartbreaking: Pooja Hegde
news_article: Pooja Hegde, who made her Bollywood debut with Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Mohenjo Daro', said in an interview that its failure was heartbreaking. "I held off signing Hindi films because I needed a sturdy second movie," she added. "I built on...success of 'Housefull 4'...and here I am," said Pooja who'll be next seen in films like 'Cirkus' and 'Radhe Shyam'.

news_headline: Remo D'souza posts video after returning home from hospital
news_article: Choreographer-filmmaker Remo D'souza, who was hospitalised after suffering a heart attack, has posted a video after returning home. "Thank you all for the love, prayers and blessings I am back," he wrote. Commenting on the video, choreographer Terence Lewis wrote, "This made my day! So happy to see you safe home with your loved ones! Stay blessed."

news_headline: Cannot imagine how we'd have survived pandemic without digital platforms: Swara
news_article: Actress Swara Bhasker has said she's grateful for the emergence of OTT platforms and added, "I cannot imagine how we'd have survived the pandemic without internet and digital platforms." Swara, who starred in web shows like 'Bhaag Beanie Bhaag' and 'Rasbhari', further said, "It's been a strangely blessed year where despite...pandemic I've seen such success and warmth from the audiences."

news_headline: My parents' achievements gave me a comfortable life: Sikandar Kher
news_article: Speaking about the advantages of being a star kid in Bollywood, actor Sikandar Kher said, "Whatever my parents (Kirron Kher and Anupam Kher) have achieved in their lives has given me a more comfortable life." When asked about being compared to his parents, he said, "Those things don't bother me...if I start worrying about that then I am finished."

news_headline: Anubhav Sinha to produce Hansal Mehta's next film: Reports
news_article: Anubhav Sinha will reportedly produce Hansal Mehta's next film, which will also mark the first collaboration of the two filmmakers. The yet-to-be-titled film is being touted as a big-scale commercial thriller. Earlier, there were reports about the two joining hands for a pandemic anthology. Anubhav is currently working on his upcoming film 'Abhi Toh Party Shuru Hui Hai'.

news_headline: Your legacy will live on forever: Anushka on Irrfan's birth anniversary
news_article: Several celebrities, including Anushka Sharma, Ayushmann Khurrana and Vicky Kaushal, took to social media to share a post on the 54th birth anniversary of Irrfan Khan. "A legendary figure of the industry! You'll always be missed and your legacy will live on forever," Anushka wrote while sharing a picture of the late actor. Meanwhile, Ayushmann wrote, "You'll always be remembered."

news_headline: I try and avoid overtly sexual comedies: Jaaved Jaaferi
news_article: In a recent interview, actor Jaaved Jaaferi mentioned that he avoids being a part of "overtly sexual" comedy films. "When doing stand up, you may slightly cross a certain line, use certain words and topics which are not universal. There also, I restrict myself and don't engage in profanities too much," he further explained.

news_headline: Arjun Rampal seeks time till Dec 21 to appear before NCB in drugs case
news_article: Actor Arjun Rampal has sought time till December 21 to appear before Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in a drug-related case. Arjun was summoned by the NCB on December 16 for questioning in connection with the case. NCB had raided Arjun's residence and seized medicines which are controlled substances covered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

news_headline: Will remember you fondly: Richa on 'Fukrey Returns' actor Lucas' demise
news_article: Mourning the demise of her 'Fukrey Returns' co-star Olanokiotan Gbolabo Lucas, who played Bobby in the 2017 film, Richa Chadha shared behind-the-scene videos of him from the film's shoot. "Dear Lucas, this is how I will always remember you...fondly. Thank you for being wonderful, for being a sport and for being such a spreader of joy," she wrote.

news_headline: Social media user asks others to bully Bieber's wife; singer reacts
news_article: After a social media user asked others to bully Justin Bieber's wife Hailey during an Instagram Live session, the singer said, "This sad excuse of a human just encouraged people on video to literally go after my wife...It is not right." "So we need to f**king bombard that s*** with Jelena and how Selena is better," the user had said.

news_headline: 63rd Grammy Awards postponed to March 14 amid rising COVID-19 cases
news_article: The 63rd Annual Grammy Awards has been rescheduled to March 14 amid rising COVID-19 cases in Los Angeles, the Recording Academy said. "The deteriorating COVID-19 situation...with hospital services being overwhelmed...have all led us to conclude that postponing our show was the right thing to do," it added. Grammy Awards was earlier scheduled to be broadcast on January 31.

news_headline: If things settle down, then maybe this year: Varun Dhawan on his marriage
news_article: Speaking about his marriage plans with Natasha Dalal, actor Varun Dhawan said, "There is nothing concrete right now." He added, "There is so much uncertainty in the world right now, but if things settle down (COVID and its impact), then maybe this year." Varun further said, "I am planning for it definitely soon. But let there be more certainty."

news_headline: Sunny denies reports of getting Y-category security after speaking on protests
news_article: Actor and BJP MP Sunny Deol has denied reports that he was given Y-category security by the government after he expressed his views on the ongoing farmers' protests. Taking to Twitter, Sunny wrote that he has been accorded Y-category security since July 2020. "An attempt has been made to link this security provision to...ongoing...protest which is wrong," he added.

news_headline: Haasan to undergo leg surgery, says 'will resume campaign in few days'
news_article: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Sunday announced that he'll take a break from his professional commitments to undergo a follow-up leg surgery. Ahead of the Tamil Nadu assembly elections, the Makkal Needhi Maiam chief posted on Twitter, "Now I have an opportunity to take some rest...I'll come back fully rejuvenated within a few days to resume my campaign with renewed vigour."

news_headline: Vijay Raaz, arrested for allegedly molesting crew member, gets bail
news_article: Actor Vijay Raaz, who was arrested for allegedly molesting a woman crew member during the shooting of a film, has been granted bail. "The court has said he has to appear before the investigation officer whenever needed," Atul Kulkarni, Additional SP, Gondia, Maharashtra, said. The incident happened during the shooting of film 'Sherni', which also stars Vidya Balan.

news_headline: Jackky Bhagnani to launch Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur Sanon: Reports
news_article: Producers Jackky Bhagnani and Deepshikha Deshmukh are reportedly planning to launch Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur Sanon in their upcoming project. Nupur, who appeared in B Praak's track 'Filhall', will reportedly begin shooting for the untitled project next year. "The project is really interesting and offers an ideal debut for Nupur Sanon," reports stated.

news_headline: Richa has been a great support system: Ali on coping with mom's death
news_article: On being asked about his biggest regret in 2020, actor Ali Fazal said, "My biggest regret is losing my mother." He added, "But I've had a great support system, I've had somebody like Richa (Chadha) who's been there in that time, so that's also a good asset." Fazal's mother passed away following age-related health complications on June 17 last year.

news_headline: Janhvi to star in Good Luck Jerry, actress shares look from the film
news_article: Actress Janhvi Kapoor will star in an upcoming film titled, 'Good Luck Jerry'. Aanand L Rai, whose Colour Yellow Productions is backing the film, on Monday shared that she has begun shooting for the film in Punjab. Janhvi also took to social media to share her look from the film, which also stars Deepak Dobriyal and Sushant Singh, among others.

news_headline: I never thought that one day I want to be a star: Nawazuddin
news_article: Recalling the initial days of his acting career, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "I was confident about my skill, but I never thought that one day I want to be a star." Stating that he didn't come to Mumbai to act in films, Nawazuddin told Times of India, "I knew that I didn't have the personality for that...I tried television."

news_headline: Walking is the best way for me to metabolise fat: Rebel Wilson
news_article: During an Instagram live session, Hollywood actress Rebel Wilson revealed that walking was the exercise that helped her lose weight. "I do have access to really amazing personal trainers. But...the majority of exercise I've done this year has just been me going out for a walk. Walking is the best way for me...to metabolise fat," she said.

news_headline: Arjun Rampal's sister summoned by NCB, set to appear before agency today
news_article: Arjun Rampal's sister Komal Rampal has been summoned by Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in Mumbai at 11 am on Wednesday. Notably, this comes after the NCB questioned Arjun and his partner Gabriella Demetriades as part of an investigation in relation to alleged drug links in Bollywood. "I have never been on the wrong side of the law," Arjun had said.

news_headline: I don't have Salman's number, want to tell him to give me work: Shardul Pandit
news_article: Following his eviction from Bigg Boss 14, television actor Shardul Pandit said, "I did get the most elegant farewell on Bigg Boss but there is no work outside." He added, "I don't have Salman Khan's number but I would like to give him a message, 'I need work. If you've any position for an actor, please give me work'."

news_headline: It was correct: Punjab CM on arrest of singer Shree Brar for promoting 'gun culture'
news_article: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said arrest of Punjabi singer Shree Brar, who was accused of glorifying violence and promoting gun culture in a music video, was "correct and justified". Patiala Senior Superintendent of Police Vikram Jeet Duggal on Tuesday said Shree's song had provocative lyrics, promoting violence and anti-social acts to the extent of even providing shelter to gangsters.

news_headline: Good film offers are coming after Sacred Games & Mirzapur: Harshita
news_article: Actress Harshita Shekhar Gaur has said she's glad that the OTT space has opened avenues for talent. "I don't know if people were aware of me earlier but after Sacred Games and Mirzapur, good film offers are coming my way," she added. "I think web has changed the game. It has rightly made story the hero," Harshita further said.

news_headline: Sussanne Khan issues clarification on Mumbai pub raid, says no arrests were made
news_article: Sussanne Khan issued clarification over reports that she was arrested for COVID-19 rule breach after a late-night police raid at a Mumbai pub. She said guests were asked to wait for three hours as authorities and management sorted things out. "We were finally allowed to leave at 6 am...The speculation...that there were arrests made are completely incorrect," she added.

news_headline: Web has given a new life not only to actors but to stories: Shweta
news_article: Actress Shweta Tripathi Sharma, who has worked in both films and web series, said, "The web has given a new life not only to actors but to stories, storytellers, musicians. On OTT, characters are not dry-cleaned." Speaking about her and Ali Fazal's 'Mirzapur' characters, she said, "Guddu and Munna have their set of flaws but you still like them."

news_headline: Rishi uncle would always message dad after my film released: Tiger
news_article: Speaking about the actors who passed away in the year 2020, including Irrfan Khan, Rishi Kapoor and Sushant Singh Rajput, actor Tiger Shroff said, "[They were] all...supremely talented actors and will be forever missed, no doubt." He added, "Rishi uncle...would always message my dad after a film of mine released with the most amazing words of praise and encouragement."

news_headline: Mom used to get her teeth taken out at vet: Chris on Civil Rights movies
news_article: Actor and comedian Chris Rock said that movies based on the Civil Rights movement "make racism look very fixable". "My mother used to get her teeth taken out at the vet...you weren't allowed to go to...dentist. No movie shows you that," Chris stated. "The problem is they only show the back of the bus and the lunch counter," he added.

news_headline: Those making money here won't be called haram****: Kangana on 'max film units' in HP
news_article: Kangana Ranaut on Saturday shared an article about Saif Ali Khan, Arjun Kapoor, Jacqueline Fernandez and Yami Gautam leaving for Himachal Pradesh to begin the shooting of 'Bhoot Police'. She tweeted, "Himachal is hosting maximum film units from Mumbai at this point, Dev Bhumi belongs to every Indian and anyone making money from this state won't be called haram****."

news_headline: Was drinking myself to death: Hopkins on 45 yrs of sobriety
news_article: Veteran actor Anthony Hopkins on Wednesday marked 45 years of sobriety and shared a video on Twitter wherein he opened up about his journey. "45 years ago today, I'd...wake-up call. I was heading for disaster, drinking myself to death," he said, adding, "Got...a thought, 'Do you want to live or die?'...I said, 'I want to live.' Suddenly the relief came."

news_headline: Kangana reacts after Mumbai Mayor calls her 'do takke ke log'
news_article: Kangana Ranaut has reacted to a video wherein Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar called the actress "do takke ke log" after the Bombay High Court quashed BMC's demolition notice to Kangana. She tweeted, "The amount of...cases, abuses, insults...I faced from Maharashtra government in these few months make Bollywood mafia and people like Aditya Pancholi and Hrithik Roshan seem like kind souls."

news_headline: Didn't tell family about my kissing scene in LSD: Nushrratt
news_article: Nushrratt Bharuccha has revealed that she didn't tell her family about her kissing scene in 2010 film 'LSD: Love, Sex Aur Dhokha'. "I knew...I had to do it but my family wouldn't let me," she added. "So I didn't tell them or they would have been like 'no way you're doing this film'...Eventually, they did get to know," Nushrratt said.

news_headline: Parzaan Dastur, who played a Sikh boy in KKHH, gets engaged; pics surface
news_article: Parzaan Dastur, who is known for his role as a Sikh boy in the film 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai', has got engaged to his girlfriend Delna Shroff. The duo are set to get married in February this year. A mutual friend of Parzaan and Delna shared pictures from their engagement ceremony, wherein both can be seen wearing traditional costume.

news_headline: After row on Taimur's name, we've not thought about it: Kareena on 2nd baby name
news_article: During the latest episode of talk show 'What Women Want', Kareena Kapoor spoke about naming her second child and revealed that she and her husband Saif Ali Khan have not thought about it yet. She said, "After the whole name controversy of Taimur, both Saif and me haven't...thought about it. We're...going to leave it last minute and then...spring a surprise."

news_headline: Remo is humble, working with him was insane: Siddharth Gupta
news_article: Siddharth Gupta, while sharing his experience of working with Remo D'Souza in the song 'Dil Na Todunga', said, "The experience...was insane!" He added that the choreographer-director gives the artistes enough space which makes it easy for them to give their best shot. "He's so humble which I believe is one of his best qualities," Siddharth further said.

news_headline: I know her as she's my cousin's wife's sister: Cezanne on woman claiming he married her
news_article: After a US-based Pakistani woman claimed that TV actor Cezanne Khan married her for Green Card, the actor denied the claims and said that he knows her as she is the sister of his cousin's wife who lives in Karachi. He further said that the woman morphed the marriage certificate. "There is a limit to obsession," he further said.

news_headline: I'm in need of money: Vikas Gupta on saying yes to Bigg Boss 14
news_article: Former Bigg Boss contestant Vikas Gupta, while talking about participating in the season 14, said, "Last two years have been difficult. I need money." Talking about his role in the show, Vikas said he's not participating as a challenger. "There is a twist, that's the reason why I am going...But, yes, I will be competing in the finale," he added.

news_headline: UP Police obtains production warrant for comedian Munawar Faruqui
news_article: The Uttar Pradesh Police have obtained and submitted a production warrant at Indore district jail for stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui, who is accused of making objectionable remarks against Hindu deities. "On January 7, we served the production warrant at Indore jail and submitted another copy at a court in Indore," said investigating officer Inspector Dhakeshwar Singh.

news_headline: PIL filed to remove Big B's voice from COVID-19 safety caller tune
news_article: A PIL has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking removal of Amitabh Bachchan's voice from the caller tune on precautions against coronavirus. "Mr Amitabh Bachchan...and his...family members became the patient of...Corona and he himself could not escape from the...disease," the petition read. It added he doesn't have a "clean history" and "he's not serving...nation being a social worker".

news_headline: Some of that has carried through my life: Sunny on being bullied as kid
news_article: Actress Sunny Leone recently spoke about being bullied as a child and said that children used to tease her for the way she looked. "I was a light-skinned Indian girl with...dark hair on her arms and legs and...very awkward looking," she added. "Some of that bullying has carried through my entire life which isn't a great feeling," Sunny further said.

news_headline: Gauahar Khan shares photos from 'Chiksa' celebrations ahead of wedding
news_article: Actress Gauahar Khan took to Instagram on Monday to share pictures with her fiancé Zaid Darbar from their pre-wedding festivities. "When half of me met half of you and together the better halves shaped our beautiful moments. #Alhamdulillah. Day 1of #GaZa celebrations - Chiksa," she wrote. The couple will get married on December 25.

news_headline: Television personality Sharon Osbourne tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Television personality Sharon Osbourne, known for co-hosting 'The Talk', revealed that she has tested positive for COVID-19. "After a brief hospitalisation, I'm now recuperating at a location away from Ozzy Osbourne (her husband)," Sharon tweeted. She added that Ozzy has tested negative for the coronavirus infection. Sharon further wrote that 'The Talk' is on "scheduled hiatus".

news_headline: Kiara Advani in talks to star in Hrithik's 'Krrish 4': Reports
news_article: Kiara Advani is reportedly in talks to star in 'Krrish 4', which will also feature Hrithik Roshan. "Kriti Sanon was in contention for...main role, her date diary was completely blocked with as many as five films she had already signed up," reports said. "Currently, the Roshans are discussing the modalities with Kiara and then take the final call," reports added.

news_headline: Shahid & I were not even friends who hung out: Amrita on link-up rumours
news_article: Amrita Rao, in an interview with Times of India, spoke about dealing with link-up rumours while working with Shahid Kapoor. "Shahid was always in a relationship when I was his co-star...[We] have only been very good colleagues, we were not even friends who hung out with each other," she said. "We've tremendous respect for each other as artists," added Amrita.

news_headline: Family, friends criticised my choice: Sharman on 5 yrs of 'Hate Story 3'
news_article: As Sharman Joshi's 2015 thriller-romance film 'Hate Story 3' completed five years, the actor recalled signing the film and said, "A lot of people criticised my choice at that point in time, including my family and close friends. "He further said, "I had the guts at the time...I wanted to show a different aspect of my personality to my audience."

news_headline: Mumbai Police summons Kangana in Javed Akhtar defamation case
news_article: Kangana Ranaut has been summoned by Mumbai Police on Friday in connection with a defamation case filed by Javed Akhtar. He had filed a complaint last year over allegations that he threatened her to not speak about her alleged relationship with Hrithik Roshan. Javed also alleged that she unnecessarily dragged his name in Sushant Singh Rajput's death case.

news_headline: His versatility is unmatched: Deepika on Ranveer as an actor
news_article: Praising her husband Ranveer Singh's acting skills, Deepika Padukone said, "As an actor, he's probably the best we've had in a...long time. His versatility is unmatched." Deepika told Femina, "I don't think there's any actor in the current generation who has his versatility...when you see Ranveer play a role, there's an absolute transformation...I haven't seen that in a long time."

news_headline: There's lot of scrutiny in today's day and age as a movie star: Sara
news_article: When asked what is the most challenging part of being an actor, actress Sara Ali Khan said, "The one thing that's both an advantage and disadvantage...is that there is a lot of scrutiny in today's day and age." Commenting on facing criticism online, she said, "Under the guise of anonymity, you don't know who your critics are."

news_headline: Ethan Hawke to play antagonist in Marvel's 'Moon Knight' series
news_article: Hollywood actor Ethan Hawke will feature as the antagonist in the upcoming Marvel Studios series 'Moon Knight'. While the details of Hawke's character have not been revealed yet, according to The Hollywood Reporter, the show will star actor Oscar Isaac as the lead superhero Moon Knight aka Marc Spector. The project is scheduled to go on floors in March.

news_headline: OTT is the best thing that has happened for young talented people: Bobby
news_article: Talking about OTT platforms, Bobby Deol said that it is the best thing that has happened for young talented people. He added that they have got an opportunity to work not just as actors, but also as technicians and daily wage earners. Talking about the year 2020, Bobby said, "[It] taught us that the smallest things have the greatest value."

news_headline: Kangana has right to express her thoughts on Twitter: Bombay HC
news_article: Kangana Ranaut has right to have a Twitter account and express her thoughts, Bombay High Court said while hearing petition by a lawyer who wants Ranaut's Twitter account suspended. It asked petitioner Ali Kaashif Khan Deshmukh to show how Kangana's tweets caused him personal injury or breached his fundamental rights. The court posted it for further hearing on January 7.

news_headline: Kangana Ranaut shares her old pic in bikini, responds after being trolled
news_article: Kangana Ranaut has responded after being trolled for sharing an old picture in bikini from Mexico. "Some people are giving me lecture on Dharma and Sanatan," she wrote. "What will happen if Goddess Bhairavi appeared with her hair loose, without clothes, drinking blood? You'll be scared. And you call yourself a devotee? Don't pretend to be...authority on religion," she added.

news_headline: Cameras under the gate now? Saif as photographers slide cameras under building gate
news_article: A video of actor Saif Ali Khan and his wife, actress Kareena Kapoor shows the actor reacting to photographers sliding cameras under the gate of a building they were coming out from. "The cameras are under the gate now?" he said to which Kareena can be heard responding, "Yeah I know." The couple recently returned to Mumbai from Himachal Pradesh.

news_headline: A designer told my team they don't give clothes to TV actors: Shivangi Joshi
news_article: TV actress Shivangi Joshi, who stars in show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', has said she feels hurt when people look down upon the medium. Sharing her experience with a fashion designer, she said, "I'd once wanted to wear a particular designer's clothes, but my team was told that they don't give their clothes to TV actors...It does feel bad."

news_headline: Tom Hardy breaks London's lockdown rules by visiting gym: Reports
news_article: Hollywood actor Tom Hardy was reportedly spotted outside a closed martial arts school apparently breaking the lockdown rules imposed by the UK government. According to The Sun, the actor was seen outside the building with his workout gear. Reportedly, all gyms have been closed in UK due to the national lockdown, which was announced earlier this month.

news_headline: Actress Shilpa Shirodkar gets vaccinated against COVID-19 in UAE, shares pic
news_article: Actress Shilpa Shirodkar took to Instagram to share that she has received a coronavirus vaccine in the UAE. Sharing a picture of herself, she wrote, "Vaccinated and safe!! The new normal...here I come 2021." Talking to a portal, Shirodkar said that her next dose will be in 21 days and she'll soon have a document which says 'COVID-19 vaccine taken'.

news_headline: Can't forget the times we've had: Karanvir remembers Kushal Punjabi
news_article: Taking to Instagram on Saturday, actor Karanvir Bohra remembered late actor Kushal Punjabi and shared an old picture with him and actor Chetan Hansraj. He wrote, "Can't forget the times we've had, this picture was taken in Goa exactly 10 years back." Karanvir added, "I pray that you're in a happy place #kushlani...Your family must be missing you so much."

news_headline: I'm more successful than most people with a fat bank balance: Arshad
news_article: When asked if he feels he could have seen better success at the professional front, actor Arshad Warsi said, "I'm extremely successful. I am way more successful than most people who have a very fat bank balance," he added. He also mentioned that he feels he's underutilised as an actor and wants to do more films like 'Durgamati' and 'Ishqiya'.

news_headline: Mithun collapses on set due to food poisoning, finishes shoot
news_article: Mithun Chakraborty, who's shooting for Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', collapsed on the film's set on Saturday. "It was an action scene...He had a terrible bout of food poisoning and was unable to...stand. After taking a...break, he finished the sequence," Agnihotri told Mid-Day. "When he returned to...set on Sunday morning, he ensured he made up for the backlog," Agnihotri added.

news_headline: Abhay Deol, Karan Deol in talks to star in Ajay's 'Velley': Reports
news_article: Abhay Deol and Sunny Deol's son Karan Deol are reportedly in talks to star in 'Velley', which is the remake of Telugu crime-comedy film 'Brochevarevarura'. It'll reportedly be produced by Ajay Devgn and directed by Deven Munjal, who has worked on films like 'Om Shanti Om' and 'Main Hoon Na'. The film will reportedly go on floors next year.

news_headline: Amitabh Bachchan to star in Sooraj Barjatya's family drama: Reports
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan will reportedly star in Sooraj Barjatya's family drama film. It will go on floors in the first quarter of 2021 and mark the first collaboration of Amitabh and Sooraj, as actor and director, according to reports. The actor will reportedly start shooting for the film after completing the shoot of Ajay Devgn's thriller film 'MayDay'.

news_headline: Sir Sean Connery, Oscar winner and 1st actor to play James Bond, dies at 90
news_article: Sir Sean Connery, the first actor to portray James Bond, has passed away aged 90. He had also won the Oscar in the Best Supporting Actor category for his role in 1987 film 'The Untouchables'. Some of his popular films include 'Marnie', 'Murder on the Orient Express', 'The Man Who Would Be King' and 'Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade'.

news_headline: Things were not working out: Actor Mrunal on taking a break from work
news_article: TV actor Mrunal Jain, who has starred in shows like 'Uttaran' and 'Bandini', has said he decided to take a break because "things were not working out". "I thought something is missing...I worked on my look, craft and tried to study my previous look," he added. "I started working on my diction...I started working more aggressively on it," said Mrunal.

news_headline: Rapper Raja Kumari represents India at Joe Biden's inaugural gala
news_article: Grammy-nominated Indian-American rapper Raja Kumari on Tuesday represented India at the Asian American Pacific Islander (AAPI) Inaugural Ball: Breaking Barriers. "Performing 'NRI' for AAPI ball...shows how far we've come as a culture," Kumari added. "Watching Kamala Harris become the first South Asian...to hold the office of US Vice President will be the most awe-inspiring moment," Kumari stated.

news_headline: Rapper Dr Dre hospitalised after reportedly suffering from brain aneurysm
news_article: Rapper Dr Dre has been hospitalised with a possible brain aneurysm at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles, according to Deadline. The rapper-producer was reportedly rushed by ambulance to Cedars' ICU on Monday. Dre took to Instagram on Wednesday to share an update and wrote, "I'm...getting excellent care from my medical team. I'll be out of...hospital and back home soon."

news_headline: Letitia deletes social media accounts amid anti-vaccine video criticism
news_article: 'Black Panther' actress Letitia Wright deleted her social media accounts following the criticism she received after posting a video that questioned the legitimacy of the coronavirus vaccine. She recently tweeted the link of a video, titled 'COVID-19 VACCINE, SHOULD WE TAKE IT?', for which she faced criticism. ''If you...ask questions...you get cancelled, '' she had reacted to the backlash.

news_headline: Bombay HC reserves order in Sonu Sood-BMC illegal construction case
news_article: The Bombay High Court on Wednesday reserved its order in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and Sonu Sood row over illegal construction at his residence. BMC in an affidavit had alleged that Sood is a "habitual offender" and has carried out unauthorised construction in a residential building in the past as well.

news_headline: Father of late actor Sushant Singh Rajput hospitalised due to heart problem
news_article: KK Singh, the father of late actor Sushant Singh Rajput, has been hospitalised in Faridabad due to heart problem. Bollywood and fashion photographer Viral Bhayani shared a picture of KK Singh with his daughters, writing, "Sushant's father is in Faridabad's Asian Hospital due to heart issue. Please pray for his early recovery."

news_headline: When I was getting married, people told me my career is over: Genelia
news_article: Speaking about taking a break from movies after marriage, Genelia Deshmukh said, "I had people telling me...your career is done...but I was clear that it isn't going to stop me from marrying." Genelia will next feature in the film 'It's My Life', which will release on television on November 29. The film, starring Harman Baweja, was shot back in 2007.

news_headline: Always knew potential of OTT, I was a pioneer who jumped into it: Madhavan
news_article: Actor R Madhavan, who starred in 2018 web show 'Breathe', has said he always knew the potential of OTT platforms. "I was definitely a pioneer who jumped into it," he added. "Many platforms are cropping up, and thankfully become a great revenue earner not just for actors but everyone involved in the industry- technicians, junior artists, etc," Madhavan further said.
