news_headline: If content on digital platforms is censored, it will be sad: Manoj
news_article: Commenting on the possibility of content on digital platforms getting censored, actor Manoj Bajpayee said, "If at all, that happens, it will be sad. It will curtail the wings of filmmakers." He further said, "If it is a story requirement, then it needs to. I think makers should get the liberty to self-censor as restrictions would hurt everyone."

news_headline: What a wonderful film: Oscar-winning director Danny Boyle on 'AK vs AK'
news_article: Commenting on 'AK vs AK', Oscar-winning director Danny Boyle told Anil Kapoor, Anurag Kashyap and Vikramaditya Motwane, "I just wanted to convey to you what a wonderful film you've made." He added, "For me, it joins the pantheons of great films about filmmaking, of which there is a number." Boyle called 'AK vs AK' "an incredibly modern film about filmmaking".

news_headline: Manmarziyaan writer Kanika marries Raanjhanaa writer Himanshu, shares pics
news_article: Kanika Dhillon, known for writing films like 'Manmarziyaan', 'Kedarnath' and others, got married to Himanshu Sharma, known for writing 'Raanjhanaa', 'Tanu Weds Manu' and others. Sharing pictures from their wedding, Kanika wrote on Instagram, "Here is to #2021 #newbeginnings." Himanshu was previously dating actress Swara Bhasker and Kanika was earlier married to director Prakash Kovelamudi.

news_headline: KIFF to go virtual, SRK to join inaugural event: Mamata Banerjee
news_article: The 26th Kolkata International Film Festival (KIFF) will be held virtually due to the coronavirus pandemic, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee tweeted on Wednesday. She added that Shah Rukh Khan will join the inaugural event virtually on January 8 at 4 pm. The festival will commence by paying tribute to Satyajit Ray and Bengali actor Soumitra Chatterjee.

news_headline: Neena, Kalki to team up for international film 'Goldfish'
news_article: Indian actresses Neena Gupta and Kalki Koechlin will collaborate for an international film titled 'Goldfish', which will focus on creating awareness about mental health. The actors will play mother and daughter in the movie which will be directed by Pushan Kripalani. "Neenaji...is an amazing actor, I love her and looking forward to working with her," Kalki said about the project.

news_headline: TV actor Anas Rashid blessed with baby boy, shares pics
news_article: TV actor Anas Rashid, known for show 'Diya Aur Baati Hum', and his wife Heena Iqbal have been blessed with their second child, a baby boy. He took to Instagram to share pictures of the newborn with his grandparents and wrote, "My father welcomes home his grandson -'Khabib Anas Rashid'. Thanks for all your...love and wishes on this awaited occasion."

news_headline: With farmers suffering and pandemic, won't celebrate birthday: Dharmendra
news_article: Actor Dharmendra, who will turn 85 on December 8, said that he does not wish to celebrate his birthday this year as people are suffering. "This year has been quite sad with the farmers suffering and the ongoing pandemic, it doesn't make one feel happy," he said. Dharmendra also mentioned that he stopped enjoying birthdays after his mother passed away.

news_headline: I was told TV actors come with baggage: Kritika on facing bias
news_article: Actress Kritika Kamra, who shared screen space with Saif Ali Khan in the web series 'Tandav', spoke about facing bias because of her television background and said, "I've...been told that TV actors come with certain baggage." She added, "I'm okay to go out there and prove myself as many times as I need to...I'll still say that I've been fortunate."

news_headline: He's very simple: Kirti on working with Pankaj in 'Criminal Justice'
news_article: Speaking about her experience of working with actor Pankaj Tripathi in the crime drama web series 'Criminal Justice: Behind Closed Doors', actress Kirti Kulhari said that the actor is a "very simple" man. "Most of my scenes are with Pankaj Tripathi and he is...easy to work with...He does his thing and I did mine...it all went very smooth," she added.

news_headline: Hina Khan wins Best Actress at Montgomery International Film Fest
news_article: Actress Hina Khan has won the Best Actress Award for her film 'Lines' at the Montgomery International Film Festival, USA. She posted a picture of Certificate of Achievement on Instagram and wrote, "This month I complete 12 years in the industry and I couldn't be more proud of myself as my film 'LINES' is getting an overwhelming response overseas."

news_headline: Deepa Mehta's 'Funny Boy' becomes Canada's official entry for Oscars
news_article: Indo-Canadian filmmaker Deepa Mehta's film 'Funny Boy' is Canada's official entry for the 93rd Academy Awards in the Best International Feature Film category. If selected by the Academy, this will be the second time that the director will be competing for the award in the category. In 2007, Deepa's film 'Water' was Oscar-nominated in the International Feature Film category.

news_headline: Life without you is so basic: Alia on sister Shaheen's birthday
news_article: Actress Alia Bhatt shared a poem on Instagram to mark her sister Shaheen Bhatt's 32nd birthday on Saturday. "Life without you is just so basic, also who would look after my arms and leggies? I know we're technically sisters, but I believe you're my soul mate too," she wrote alongside a series of pictures featuring the two sisters.

news_headline: I keep challenging myself because after a while the magic fades: Rahman
news_article: Stating that the only way to fight boredom is reinvention, music composer AR Rahman added, "I keep challenging myself because after a while, the magic fades and the brain becomes numb." He further said, "We have to find ways to stand out in order to break the monotony."  Rahman also noted it's natural for humans to get bored.

news_headline: 2020 has been fulfilling professionally for me: Jacqueline
news_article: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez, who'll be seen in films like 'Bachchan Pandey', 'Bhoot Police', 'Cirkus' and 'Kick 2', said, "The year (2020) has been fulfilling professionally for me with back-to-back project announcements." She further said the year 2021 will be hectic for her, adding, "I am looking forward to the year and never wish to stop working."

news_headline: That's just my face: Jennifer Lopez on accusation that she got 'tons of botox'
news_article: An Instagram user commented on a video posted by singer Jennifer Lopez and accused her of getting botox. "[Your] brows and forehead don't move at all when you talk or try to express...you definitely have [tons of] botox," the user wrote. Lopez responded, "LOL that's just my face...For the 500 millionth time…I've never done botox or any injectables or surgery!"

news_headline: People thought I was mean when I was just too nervous: Zendaya
news_article: Actress Zendaya has said she had to learn how to do small talk in the film industry because she used to "come off cold to people". "I didn't...know how to start...conversation," she added. "I remember my stylist was like, 'You come off kind of cold...People think you're mean because you don't talk,' when...I just was too nervous," Zendaya further said.

news_headline: CBI not acting responsibly: Plea in SC over Sushant's death probe
news_article: A plea regarding Sushant Singh Rajput's death moved the Supreme Court and claimed that CBI is not acting responsibly. "This court passed an order for CBI inquiry on August 19...eager family members, fans...yet to get a solace regarding the exact reason of his death," the plea stated. "Unnecessary delay...is bringing bad name to the administration of justice," it added.

news_headline: Not thinking about directing, I'm enjoying casting: Dil Bechara director
news_article: Casting director Mukesh Chhabra, who directed late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's 'Dil Bechara', has said he has no plans to direct his second film as of now. He added that he may think about it when the right script comes his way. "I am enjoying the process of casting for all my projects at hand," Mukesh further said.

news_headline: Bharti shares old pics with Haarsh Limbachiyaa on 3rd anniversary
news_article: Comedian Bharti Singh took to Instagram on Thursday to share some old pictures of herself with husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on their third wedding anniversary. She wrote, "Love is not about how many days, months, or years you have been together. Love is about how much you love each other every single day. Happy anniversary my love #lovelife #powercouple #strongertogether."

news_headline: TV actor Aamir Ali shares Remo D'souza's pictures from hospital
news_article: TV actor Aamir Ali took to Instagram to share choreographer-director Remo D'souza's pictures from hospital. Remo was hospitalised on Friday after he suffered a heart attack. "My brother is back @remodsouza #strongest," wrote Ali. Earlier, producer Ramesh Taurani had stated that a stent has been placed inside Remo's body and he is now stable.

news_headline: You are more fearless when you work on web: Ali Abbas Zafar
news_article: At the trailer launch of his upcoming web series 'Tandav', director Ali Abbas Zafar said, "You are more fearless when you work on web." Zafar also said that web as a medium is more "liberating" for a filmmaker. "When you make a film for cinema...box office decides whether you have made a good or a bad film," he added.

news_headline: Wasn't easy to break that image: Hina on 'Yeh Rishta...' role
news_article: Hina Khan, who played a character named Akshara in show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', has said it was not easy to break away from the character's image when she left the show. "It was very difficult to break that 'bahu' image and come out as...fashionista," she said, adding, "But I didn't give up, you just have to work here."

news_headline: People's love is medicine: Kamal Haasan in 1st message after leg surgery
news_article: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Tuesday shared his first message after undergoing leg surgery. He said the operation was successful and added, "I'll be at...hospital until the wound heals. I'll continue to be active on social media and will remain in your hearts. People's love is medicine." Kamal also thanked the medical team at Sri Ramachandra Hospital in Chennai.

news_headline: I used to stammer, acting was a far away thing for me: Sharad
news_article: Actor Sharad Kelkar, who recently starred in 'Laxmii', commented on facing rejections and said, "I used to stammer, so acting was a faraway thing for me... rejections were [there]." Stating that the rejection made him stronger, the actor added, "Stammering was a problem so I got rid of that. It took me two years to get rid of stammering."

news_headline: When I heard 'Golmaal 3' script, I realised it's like a paid holiday: Kunal
news_article: Talking about his film 'Golmaal 3', Kunal Kemmu said, "When Rohit (Shetty) told me about this film, I said, 'There are...so many people...I'll get lost'." He added, "When I heard the script, I realised it's one of those franchises, for us it's just like a paid holiday." Kunal further said he was nervous on the first day of the shoot.

news_headline: Felt like a child in a private magic show: Nimrat on watching Tenet in theatre
news_article: Actress Nimrat Kaur took to Instagram to share her experience of watching Christopher Nolan's 'Tenet' in a theatre amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Today, nearly after 10 months, I was in a...theatre, all by myself, like a child in a private magic show," she wrote. "But for the first time ever, a story seemed lesser impossible than our reality," Nimrat added.

news_headline: I like women's bodies but not their brains: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma
news_article: On being asked about his statement to actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi when he had said 'I like women's bodies but not their brains', filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma commented that he still maintains his stance. "Brain does not have a gender...sexual aspect is very...specific," he added. "A woman has an extra thing which is her sensuality...which I admire," Varma further said.

news_headline: McConaughey reveals where his 'Alright, Alright, Alright' dialogue came from
news_article: Matthew McConaughey has explained how he ad-libbed his famous 'Alright, alright, alright' line from 'Dazed and Confused' based on his character's motivations. "There wasn't a word written for that...scene...I said, 'I'm in my 1970 Chevelle...Wooderson's about getting high...He's about rock and roll'," McConaughey said. "I heard 'Action' and I looked up, 'Aright, alright, alright!'," he added.

news_headline: Photographer says he won't take Virat, Anushka's child's pics, Raveena praises him
news_article: Raveena Tandon praised Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani for agreeing to Team India Captain Virat Kohli and actress Anushka Sharma's request to not click pictures of their child. "Message has been passed on," he wrote. "You guys...always [kept] my request too when I didn't want you...to click my children's pics when they were younger...I...thank you for being kind enough," Raveena replied.

news_headline: Was forewarned by experts about possibility of a pandemic: Jude Law
news_article: Actor Jude Law has revealed he was forewarned by scientific experts about the possibility of a pandemic when he worked in the 2011 film 'Contagion', which focused on the spread of a contagious virus. "When...we heard about what was...happening in China, what fast became apparent around the world, it rang alarm bells. Unfortunately, I wasn't hugely surprised," he told GQ.

news_headline: Director yelled at me after my first-ever shot, I wanted to quit: Vikrant
news_article: Vikrant Massey in an interview recalled his first-ever shot and said, "I was shooting for...show, Kahaan Hoon Main. And just 20 minutes into the shoot, my director yelled at me...in front of everyone!" "I started crying and wanted to quit," he said, adding, "But the supervising producer...took me to a corner, and...spoke to me kindly...and made me go back to...set."

news_headline: She's 65 years young now: Prateik on mother Smita's death anniversary
news_article: Actor Prateik Babbar shared a post on Instagram to mark his mother Smita Patil's 34th death anniversary and called her "perfect mother, woman, role model". "Every year she grows younger...she's 65 years young now. She will continue to live with me, within me, to infinity and beyond. My beautiful mama queen," he wrote alongside the late actress' picture.

news_headline: Today would've been his 50 yrs in Bollywood: Neetu remembers Rishi
news_article: Neetu Kapoor on Friday remembered her late husband Rishi Kapoor as his film 'Mera Naam Joker' completed 50 years of release. Sharing a collage of Rishi on Instagram, she wrote, "'Mera Naam Joker' released on 18th December 1970...today would've been his 50 years in...Indian film industry." Commenting on Neetu's post, Anil Kapoor wrote, "Miss his presence on and off screen."

news_headline: First few days were really bad: Tannaz Irani on battling COVID-19
news_article: Actress Tannaz Irani, who contracted coronavirus earlier this month, has tested negative for the virus. She said that the first few days were "really bad" because she had "immense body pain and a massive headache". "I'd often lose focus on things, but I continued to have 'haldi doodh' and 'kadha' along with...Vitamin C supplements regularly...That really helped me," said Tannaz.

news_headline: Won't do bold scenes for the heck of it: Gauahar on turning down web shows
news_article: Actress Gauahar Khan recently spoke about the roles she was offered on digital platforms and why she turned them down. She said most of the offers she got required her to do bold scenes. "I'm clear...I won't do such scenes for the heck of it...I'll not be crossing the line just for...need of wanting to be...part of...show," Gauahar added.

news_headline: Nothing above court: Sonu Sood on illegal construction row with BMC
news_article: Speaking on BMC's claim about illegal construction and the impending judgement by the Bombay High Court, actor Sonu Sood said, "There is nothing above the court. I have always followed and respected the rules and will continue to do so." "I respect the BMC, who have made our Mumbai amazing," the 47-year-old actor added.

news_headline: Best part of my life will always be you: Genelia on Riteish's b'day
news_article: Marking Riteish Deshmukh's 42nd birthday, actress Genelia Deshmukh posted a montage of their pictures on Instagram and shared a note for her husband. "We've gone through all our phases in life together. From being clueless teenagers to husband and wife to parents and it's all been beautiful but the best part of my life will always be YOU," she wrote.

news_headline: What you did takes more than grit: Hina after Swapnil comes out as transwoman
news_article: Taking to Instagram, actress Hina Khan penned a note for designer Swapnil Shinde who recently came out as a transwoman. "What you did takes more than grit, it takes more than courage and it takes more than self-awareness...it's the byproduct of the power of your soul," Hina wrote while sharing a picture of the designer, who changed name to 'Saisha'.

news_headline: Vijay Sethupathi apologises for cutting birthday cake with sword
news_article: Actor Vijay Sethupathi has apologised for a viral picture that showed him cutting his birthday cake with a sword. He released a statement, saying that he was celebrating his birthday with the team of his upcoming film in which the sword "plays an important role". "Everyone...pointed out...this could set a bad example...and I promise to be careful henceforth," he added.

news_headline: Would've loved my Bob Biswas look to come out as planned: Abhishek on leak
news_article: After the pictures of his look from his upcoming film 'Bob Biswas' surfaced online, Abhishek Bachchan said, "I would've loved for...look to come out the way Diya (Annapurna Ghosh, director) intended, during our marketing campaign." However, he added that he's humbled by the praise coming his way. "The reaction was an endorsement that we're doing something right," Abhishek said.

news_headline: Kabir Singh music composers Sachet & Parampara get married, share 1st pics
news_article: Music composers and singers Sachet Tandon and Parampara Thakur, known for composing 'Bekhayali' and 'Mere Sohneya' in 'Kabir Singh', got married in a traditional Hindu wedding ceremony in Noida. Sharing the first pictures from their wedding, Sachet wrote, "Thank you for staying by my side in the last 5 years." The couple first met while auditioning for 'The Voice India'.

news_headline: Not Anupamaa, I am more like Monisha Sarabhai: Rupali Ganguly
news_article: Actress Rupali Ganguly, who is currently playing the lead in the show 'Anupamaa', said that she is like Monisha Sarabhai, from the show 'Sarabhai VS Sarabhai', in real life. In an interview with Bombay Times, the actress added, "I like watching lots of television when I have time on my hands. Family...is my priority and nothing replaces them for me."

news_headline: 'Motichoor Chaknachoor' has scarred my daughter Athiya: Suniel
news_article: Suniel Shetty recently opened up about his daughter Athiya's 2019 film 'Motichoor Chaknachoor', which was caught up in controversies. He said, "Motichoor Chaknachoor has scarred her so much. She's so scared now that anything which comes from me she wants to think about it 25 times." Last year, the producers sent a notice to Suniel for interfering with the film.

news_headline: Never felt Saif was such a profound actor: Tandav co-star Sunil Grover
news_article: Comedian-actor Sunil Grover has said working with Saif Ali Khan in Ali Abbas Zafar's web show 'Tandav' was amazing. Calling him a "dedicated" and "passionate" actor, Sunil said, "I remember, even when others would shoot for their close-ups, he'd stay around to give cues." "I never felt he was such a profound actor, who has seen the world," he added.

news_headline: Manoj Bajpayee warns against fake Twitter account in his name
news_article: Manoj Bajpayee on Thursday warned his fans about an imposter operating a fake Twitter account in his name. The actor shared a screenshot of the fake account using his name and picture and wrote, "This [is] a fake account!!! Be aware!!!! @Twitter." Earlier, actors including Sonu Sood and Raveena Tandon have also called out fake Twitter accounts in their name.

news_headline: Big B, Rhea among Google's most searched personalities of 2020 in India
news_article: Actors Amitabh Bachchan, Rhea Chakraborty, Ankita Lokhande, Kangana Ranaut and singer Kanika Kapoor are among the most searched personalities in India on Google this year. While Kanika took the third spot, Amitabh, Rhea, Ankita and Kangana grabbed the fifth, seventh, ninth and tenth positions respectively. The most searched personality in India in 2020 was US President-elect Joe Biden.

news_headline: It is hard: Liam Payne on co-parenting his child amid COVID-19
news_article: During a recent Instagram Live, singer Liam Payne revealed that it has been complicated to co-parent his son Bear Grey, with his ex-partner Cheryl Cole, amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. "It's hard...I have to make sure I'm negative before I go over and see him. So, it's having to wait that couple of days before you can test," Liam explained.

news_headline: 'Scam 1992' changed my life completely: Pratik Gandhi
news_article: During a recent interview, actor Pratik Gandhi stated that the crime-drama web series 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story' has changed his life. Speaking about choosing his upcoming projects, Pratik said, "There are interesting projects coming my way...The biggest challenge, however, is that earlier I had to select from one or two projects, now it is between 8-10 projects."

news_headline: Some reporting by Republic TV on Sushant case is prima facie contemptuous: HC
news_article: While pronouncing its order on pleas against media trial in Sushant Singh Rajput's death case, Bombay High Court ruled that media trial during an ongoing investigation does impact the investigation. "Some reporting by Republic TV and Times Now against Mumbai police in the matter are prima facie contemptuous," it observed. However, the bench refrained from taking action against the channels.

news_headline: Bigg Boss 14's talent manager Pista Dhakad dies in road accident aged 24
news_article: Pista Dhakad, who worked as a talent manager in Bigg Boss 14, has died in a road accident. A vanity van ran over Dhakad after the 24-year-old's bike slipped and she fell on the road, according to SpotboyE. Actress Yuvika Chaudhary took to Instagram and wrote, "Why u left us so early...still in a shock. Can't believe I'm writing this."

news_headline: British supermodel Stella Tennant's sudden death was suicide, confirms family
news_article: The family of British supermodel Stella Tennant, who died suddenly aged 50 on December 22, has issued a statement confirming she died by suicide. "Stella had been unwell for some time...She felt unable to go on, despite the love of those closest to her," her family stated. "Her family renews...request that respect for their privacy should continue," the statement read.

news_headline: How many throats will you choke: Kangana to Maha govt on Arnab's arrest
news_article: Following Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami's arrest, Kangana Ranaut tweeted a "message for the Maharashtra government". "How many houses will you break? How many throats will you choke, how many people's hair will your pull and how many voices will you silence?" Kangana said. "Why are Pappuro, Penguins and Sonia Sena so angry?" Kangana wrote in another tweet.

news_headline: OTT platforms allow actresses to shine at any age: Shilpa Shukla
news_article: Actress Shilpa Shukla said that the OTT platforms have allowed actresses to "shine at any age".  "When you have a limited shelf life you tend to compromise. But OTT has changed the perspective," the 38-year-old actress added. Shilpa also talked about the many "layers" and "shades" female characters have started to get because of the web.

news_headline: Singer Jazzy B arrives at Singhu border, extends support to farmers
news_article: Indian-Canadian singer Jazzy B on Tuesday reached Singhu border to extend his support to farmers who are protesting against the farm laws. "These farmers' dharnas are having an impact abroad as well," Jazzy B said. He added that the protesting farmers, especially the youth, should not do anything wrong that "would bring disrepute to the peasant movement".

news_headline: Charge of drug trafficking not applicable against Rhea's brother: Court
news_article: The special NDPS court that granted bail to actress Rhea Chakraborty's brother Showik stated that the charge of financing illicit drug trafficking does not apply to him. Section 27A of NDPS Act was invoked on Showik and a person can get a maximum punishment of 20 years if found guilty. "No drugs were obtained from him," the court stated.

news_headline: Being back on set felt tiring: Kirti on shooting after lockdown
news_article: Talking about resuming work after the coronavirus-induced lockdown, actress Kirti Kulhari said, "Everyone had gotten used to not working for months so being back on the set, it felt longer and tiring." "What happened on the first day of shoot...was that after five-six hours of shooting, I felt so tired as if I had shot for 24 hours," she added.

news_headline: Veteran Kannada actor Shani Mahadevappa dies of COVID-19 at 88
news_article: Veteran Kannada actor Shani Mahadevappa, known for films like 'Kavirathna Kaalidaasa', 'Guru Brahma', 'Shankar Guru' and others, died of COVID-19 aged 88 on Sunday in Chennai. Mahadevappa had developed breathing complications, his son said. Actor Puneeth Rajkumar condoled Mahadevappa's death and tweeted, "Shani Mahadevappa, a veteran actor who has acted in many films...passed away. RIP."

news_headline: Peter Dinklage to star in 'The Toxic Avenger' reboot
news_article: Hollywood actor Peter Dinklage, who played Tyrion Lannister in 'Game of Thrones', will star in the reboot of the 1984 film 'The Toxic Avenger', Variety reported. The original film follows the lead character Melvin, who becomes disfigured when he is pushed into toxic waste, as he assumes the name Toxie and becomes an underdog hero.

news_headline: I have posed as Zooey Deschanel to get into LA clubs: Katy Perry
news_article: During an Instagram Live session, singer Katy Perry said that she has posed as actress Zooey Deschanel to get into Los Angeles clubs. "When I first got to LA, I had no money...sometimes I would pose as you (Zooey) to get into [clubs]," Katy added. "I'm sorry if I misrepresented you, I wanted to say that now," she further said.

news_headline: Never bothered about outcome: Kartik on Love Aaj Kal's performance
news_article: Kartik Aaryan, on being asked how he handled the "dismal performance" of 'Love Aaj Kal', said, "I don't think I had to 'handle' anything." He added, "It has given me so much as an actor that I genuinely never bothered about the outcome." "A great box office performance would've been nice, but...below-average one doesn't bother me at all," Kartik said.

news_headline: Rampal arranged backdated prescription for banned tablets through relative: Report
news_article: During investigations, NCB reportedly found that Arjun Rampal had arranged for a backdated prescription for tablets banned under NDPS Act, that were seized from his residence during raid. He had arranged it illegally through a relative, the Mid-Day report added. "As far as the prescription is concerned, it's established he has committed an offence," Mid-Day quoted a senior NCB officer.

news_headline: Cheating case against Telugu actor Viswant Duddumpudi
news_article: A man filed a case against Telugu actor Viswant Duddumpudi, his father and others for cheating him in connection with the sale of a car worth ₹25 lakh for ₹17 lakh in September 2017. Police said that the victim has alleged he paid ₹12.5 lakh to the accused and took the car but was not given the vehicle ownership documents.

news_headline: Varun Dhawan confirms he has COVID-19, says 'I could've been more careful'
news_article: Actor Varun Dhawan on Monday confirmed he has tested positive for coronavirus. Sharing a screenshot of his video call with friends, Varun wrote, "VITAMIN FRIENDS...As I returned to work in the pandemic era I've contracted COVID-19." "All precautions were taken...but still nothing is certain in life...So please be extra careful I believe I could've been more careful," he added.

news_headline: Amitabh shares pic of rehearsing his first song for a film, Hrithik also seen in it
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan on Tuesday shared an old picture where the actor was seen rehearsing the first song he sang for a film. Bachchan's first-ever song that he sang for a film was 'Mere Paas Aao Mere Dosto' for the 1979 film 'Mr. Natwarlal'. "All this being overseen by...little one sitting on the bench...a certain Hrithik Roshan," the picture's caption read.

news_headline: I try to be a hands-on father, but it's complicated: Aamir Ali
news_article: Actor Aamir Ali, who was blessed with a daughter in 2019, said he tries to be a hands-on father, however, it gets complicated sometimes. "Looking at her, carrying her gives me immense pleasure. Life has changed, life has become more peaceful...because of her," he said about his daughter Ayra, who he shares with his wife Sanjeeda Shaikh.

news_headline: He took his penis out and asked me to feel it: Sherlyn Chopra on Sajid Khan
news_article: Actress Sherlyn Chopra on Monday tweeted, "When I had met him (Sajid Khan) in April 2005, a few days after my father's demise, he had taken his penis out...and had asked me to feel it." "I remember having told him...that the purpose of my meeting with him was not to feel or rate his penis," she wrote.

news_headline: Naseeruddin didn't charge any money for 'Ramprasad Ki Tehrvi': Director
news_article: Director Seema Pahwa, while talking about her upcoming film 'Ramprasad Ki Tehrvi', said the cast instantly agreed to do the film. "I was sure...no one would say no...There might be budget issues as this is...small-budget film...I told them if they don't want to work, it's ok. But they...supported me," she added. "Naseer sahab (Naseeruddin Shah) didn't...charge any money," said Seema.

news_headline: Will get it after everybody who needs it: Tom Hanks on COVID-19 vaccine
news_article: Hollywood actor Tom Hanks, who had tested positive for coronavirus back in March along with his wife Rita Wilson, commented on his plans of taking the COVID-19 vaccine. "We'll be getting it long after everybody who truly needs to get it gets it," he told Today and added that he would do it publicly to show it was safe.

news_headline: John Abraham shares pic showing veins on his muscular arm, fan calls it 'Google Maps'
news_article: Actor John Abraham reposted a picture on Instagram of his muscular arm shared by 'Satyameva Jayate 2' director Milap Zaveri. "Yeh haath nahi, John Abraham ka hathoda hai!" Zaveri captioned the picture. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "Google Maps", while another commented, "You have really good veins to do a blood test from." Meanwhile, Tiger Shroff wrote, "Insaneee."

news_headline: Can prioritise my health if COVID-19 protocols are not followed: Shruti
news_article: Actress Shruti Haasan, who is reportedly shooting for her upcoming film 'Laabam', stated that as an actor, she can prioritise her health if COVID-19 protocols are not followed. "COVID is a serious health risk everyone...I as a person and an actor have the right to prioritise my safety and health if protocols are not followed! Just saying," she wrote.

news_headline: David was angry at Varun but vented on me, that was bit of an issue: Sara
news_article: Sara Ali Khan during virtual trailer launch event of 'Coolie No. 1' said that while shooting a song, director David Dhawan got angry at Varun but vented on her. "That was bit of an issue, but it is all good," she added. "He (Varun) was doing some costume business in the van...and it was delaying the shoot," she further said.

news_headline: Sunny Leone begins shooting for Vikram Bhatt's 'Anamika'
news_article: Sunny Leone on Monday announced that she has started working on her upcoming web series 'Anamika', which is being directed by Vikram Bhatt. "The start of something new...and the end of my lockdown," she tweeted along with a picture of herself and Vikram holding a clapboard on the sets. Vikram mentioned that the series will feature Sunny doing action scenes.

news_headline: Talent is a vague word, every actor says 'I'm talented': Nawazuddin
news_article: During a recent interview, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said 'talent' has become a vague word and noted that these days every actor claims to be talented. "If you keep working hard on your craft, you can polish your skills and talent. There's no such theory that an actor is talented for life, it's an ongoing process," he told Times Of India.

news_headline: Rules are different for Big B, he has directors calling him sir: Sharmila
news_article: Sharmila Tagore recently spoke about her absence from the films and said that it happens to all the actresses beyond a certain age in Bollywood. "Even Madhuri Dixit who's...younger hasn't done anything much," the 76-year-old actress added. "Whereas...rules are different for Mr (Amitabh) Bachchan. He has directors like Shoojit Sircar calling him 'Sir' and writing roles for him," she said.

news_headline: Why am I being tortured? I need answers from this nation: Kangana
news_article: Kangana Ranaut on Friday shared a video with the caption, "Why am I being...tortured? I need answers from...nation." In the video, she said that several cases have been filed against her, adding, "I've...been told...I cannot speak about these harassments to anyone. I want to ask...SC, 'Is this...medieval age where women are burnt alive and they can't even talk to anyone?'."

news_headline: TV actors Mohit Malik, Aditi Malik to welcome their first child
news_article: TV actors Mohit Malik and Aditi Shirwaikar Malik revealed that they're expecting their first child and told Times Of India that the baby is due in May next year. Sharing the news on Instagram, Mohit shared a picture with his pregnant wife and wrote, "As we grow from 2 to 3. It makes my belief...stronger that we are 1."

news_headline: 'Brahmastra' team reunite in Mumbai for 10-day shoot
news_article: Ayan Mukerji, director of 'Brahmastra', has kicked off a 10-day schedule in a Mumbai studio with actors Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Mouni Roy and Nagarjuna. Reportedly, two songs with Ranbir and Alia will be shot in January. "It's a conscious decision to reserve the songs for next year...The team is optimistic that on-ground scenario will improve by then," reports stated.

news_headline: We shot for 'Durgamati' at real haunted places: Jisshu
news_article: Actor Jisshu Sengupta, while talking about his upcoming horror film 'Durgamati: The Myth', said, "The places where we were shooting, most of it were real locations which were haunted." He added, "Most of the sequences were at night and I used to tell my team to always be around. You know after hearing those stories, you feel spooky."

news_headline: Bombay HC rejects Sonu Sood's bail plea against BMC notice
news_article: The Bombay High Court has dismissed actor Sonu Sood's appeal and interim application against Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) notice on alleged illegal construction at his Mumbai residence. Sood's lawyer had sought 10 weeks to comply with the BMC's notice. The court, however, dismissed the appeal and said Sood had ample opportunity in the past.

news_headline: Had forgotten how to face camera: Ananya on resuming work after 6 months
news_article: Talking about resuming work after six months, actress Ananya Panday, who's shooting for her upcoming film with Deepika Padukone and Siddhant Chaturvedi in Goa, said that she was a little nervous and afraid on the first day. She added that she had forgotten how to face the camera. "But it was smooth sailing from day one," Ananya further said.

news_headline: 12 Indian celebrities feature in Forbes Asia's 100 digital stars list
news_article: Twelve Indian celebrities have made it to Forbes' list of 'Asia-Pacific's Most Influential Celebrities on Social Media'. It includes Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar, Shah Rukh Khan, Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Katrina Kaif, Hrithik Roshan, Shahid Kapoor, Anushka Sharma, Madhuri Dixit, Shreya Ghoshal and Neha Kakkar. Pakistan's Mahira Khan and Australia's Margot Robbie also featured in the list.

news_headline: Affleck to star in Clooney's 'Tender Bar' adaptation: Reports
news_article: Hollywood actor Ben Affleck will star in the film adaptation of J R Moehringer's 'The Tender Bar: A Memoir', which will be directed by George Clooney, Deadline reported. Moehringer's memoir is about growing up in Long Island, seeking out father figures among the patrons at his uncle's bar. Ben and George previously collaborated for the 2012 movie 'Argo'.

news_headline: No hang-ups in doing intimate scenes on OTT if story demands: Shivin Narang
news_article: Talking about working on OTT platforms, actor Shivin Narang said that he is open to challenges and not apprehensive about doing intimate scenes on the medium. "I've no such hang-ups that I won't do them," he said. However, the actor added that such scenes need to be shot aesthetically and shouldn't be forced into a story to garner views.

news_headline: I'll have as many kids as Hailey is wishing to push out: Justin
news_article: During his latest appearance on The Ellen DeGeneres Show, Justin Bieber said, "I'm going to have as many [children] as Hailey [Bieber] is wishing to push out." The singer added that his wife is not ready for children yet and has other plans, Just Jared reported. "Hailey...has some things she wants to accomplish...and...I think that's okay," he further said.

news_headline: So many women are playing strong characters: Gauahar on 'Tandav'
news_article: Speaking about her web-series 'Tandav', Gauahar Khan said, "There are so many women who play really strong characters. It's interesting to watch even women in power." The actress, who plays the role of Maithili Sharan in the series, added, "When I got to know that Saif [Ali Khan] is on board...and finally Dimple [Kapadia] ma'am came...I was very excited."

news_headline: Going to therapy should be like going to gym: Mallika on mental health
news_article: Speaking about focusing on mental health, actress-comedian Mallika Dua said, "More than big bad incidents, it is the everyday incidents that have a huge effect on one's mind. Going to therapy should be like going to the gym." She further added, "I had never known as much anxiety before I joined the entertainment world."

news_headline: Make-up artist denies reports he slept with Kanye West; posts video
news_article: Amid reports that he slept with rapper Kanye West, American make-up artist Jeffree Star said, "I'm single. I'm not sleeping with anyone." "I guess some girl made up a whole lie on TikTok and it went viral, where she insinuates Kanye and Kim Kardashian are getting a divorce because a big male beauty influencer is sleeping with Kanye," Star added.

news_headline: Actor Ravi Bhatia splits from Indonesian wife, says they married as she was pregnant
news_article: TV actor Ravi Bhatia, who starred in the show 'Jodha Akbar', confirmed that he has separated from his wife, Indonesian air hostess Yulida Handayani after three years of marriage. "When we got married, she was three months pregnant. Marriage is a big decision," he stated. "Cultural differences were some of the reasons for the break-up," Ravi added.

news_headline: I was really, really suicidal; the pain was so consistent: Justin Bieber
news_article: Singer Justin Bieber has revealed that he had suicidal thoughts in the past in the new documentary 'Justin Bieber: Next Chapter'. "[I was] like...is this pain ever going to go away? It was so consistent, the pain was so consistent," he stated. Bieber further said his faith in God gave him the "overwhelming confidence" to recover from the situation.

news_headline: Unique experience: Rana on filming Mission Frontline with BSF soldiers
news_article: Actor Rana Daggubati has said he realised how tough and hard the lives of Border Security Force (BSF) personnel are when he shot for the documentary 'Mission Frontline'. Rana, who features alongside BSF soldiers in the documentary, added, "Taking a leaf out of their [lives] and bringing it to the people was for me the most unique experience of all."

news_headline: Author sends notice to Kangana for copyright violation, says 'suffered mental anguish'
news_article: Author Ashish Kaul, who accused Kangana Ranaut of violating copyrights and alleged her film 'Manikarnika Returns: The Legend of Didda' is based on his book, sent her a legal notice, said Times of India. He complained that following his claims, Kangana's fans abused him on social media, causing him "extreme mental anguish". Kaul has given Kangana 72 hours to reply.

news_headline: Kamal Haasan recovering well from leg surgery: Daughters
news_article: Actresses Shruti Haasan and Akshara Haasan on Tuesday issued a statement announcing that their father Kamal Haasan's leg surgery was a success and also mentioned that the actor-politician is doing well. "He's in good spirits and working towards [a] speedy recovery...After a few days of rest...he shall be ready to interact with people as always," the statement on Twitter read.

news_headline: Haven't watched many web shows, I prefer to watch news: Sidharth
news_article: Actor Sidharth Shukla, who will make his digital platform debut with the upcoming third season of 'Broken But Beautiful' web series, revealed that he prefers watching the news over web-shows. Speaking about the first two seasons of the series, which starred Vikrant Massey, he told Mid-Day, "I haven't had the time to watch the show...I know that it was...successful."

news_headline: Farmer groups disrupt Janhvi's shoot, demand to know her opinion on farm laws
news_article: Farmer groups gathered outside a venue in Bassi Pathana city of Fatehgarh Sahib, where shooting for Janhvi Kapoor's film was taking place on January 11. They disrupted the shoot and demanded to know her opinion on farm laws. They later went back upon being reassured by the film crew, said ANI.

news_headline: Javed Akhtar records statement in defamation case against Kangana
news_article: The Metropolitan Magistrate court, Andheri, on Thursday recorded Javed Akhtar's statement in connection with defamation complaint he has filed against Kangana Ranaut. He recorded his statement through his lawyer before the magistrate for verification of the complaint. He filed the complaint over allegations that he threatened her for speaking out about her alleged relationship with Hrithik Roshan.

news_headline: YouTuber CarryMinati to make B'wood debut with Big B, Ajay's MayDay
news_article: YouTuber CarryMinati, whose real name is Ajey Nagar, is set to make his Bollywood debut with Ajay Devgn and Amitabh Bachchan starrer 'MayDay'. "I agreed to be...part of this film because I'd to essay my own character (CarryMinati)," he said. "I'm hoping I get to learn a thing or two about acting from Amitabh Bachchan and Ajay Devgn," he added.

news_headline: If I compete with Varun, I'll lose: Sara on screen time in 'Coolie No 1'
news_article: When asked how secure she is about getting enough screen time in 'Coolie No 1', actress Sara Ali Khan said, "If I'm going to compete with Varun...I will lose and I don't really like to lose, so I wouldn't do that." She further added, "The idea is not about stealing the screen, the idea is about stealing the scene...together."

news_headline: 'Fan' actress Shikha Malhotra suffers paralysis after stroke; pic surfaces
news_article: 'Fan' actress Shikha Malhotra has suffered a stroke, leaving her paralysed on one side. Her publicist Ashwani Shukla shared a picture on Instagram and said she is currently admitted in Mumbai's Cooper Hospital, and is doing better. Ashwani told The Indian Express that after Malhotra recovered from coronavirus in October, her low sugar level had been causing her health issues.

news_headline: Tiger's rumoured girlfriend Disha to play Jackie's sister in Radhe: Reports
news_article: Disha Patani, who's rumoured to be dating Tiger Shroff, will reportedly play Jackie Shroff's younger sister in the upcoming film 'Radhe: Your Most Wanted Bhai'. "They will be seen in multiple scenes," Hindustan Times said quoting a source. The actors previously featured in 'Bharat', but didn't share screen space. Directed by Prabhudheva, 'Radhe' also stars Salman Khan and Randeep Hooda.

news_headline: Alia Bhatt hospitalised for a day, resumes shoot soon after: Reports
news_article: According to a report, actress Alia Bhatt was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai on Sunday but resumed the shoot of Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' a day later. Bollywood Hungama said quoting a source, "Due to exertion and exhaustion...she [Alia] was admitted to a hospital. After...regaining strength, she was discharged on the very same day."

news_headline: I've said no to a lot of money and directors, was not easy: Divyenndu
news_article: Actor Divyenndu, known for playing Munna Bhaiya in 'Mirzapur', revealed in an interview that he has said no to a lot of money and directors and added that it wasn't easy for him. "I need to have something different where I can show...complete side of me as an artiste," he added. Divyenndu will next be seen in 'The Last Rave'.

news_headline: My father was against me getting married at 24: Kajol
news_article: Actress Kajol has revealed that her father, filmmaker Shomu Mukherjee, was against her decision to get married at the age of 24. "He said...I should work more before I tie the knot," she added. "My mom was my biggest supporter and told me to go with my gut...So, I did exactly what I wanted to do," Kajol further said.

news_headline: Hrithik is the same boy who wraps his omelette in newspaper & goes for shoot: Rakesh
news_article: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan, while speaking about his actor-son Hrithik Roshan on the occasion of the latter's 47th birthday, said, "He's still the same hard-working boy who wraps his omelette in a newspaper and rushes to his shoot in the morning." "That kind of dedication is very rare. Any director including me is lucky to have him on board," Rakesh added.

news_headline: Not upset with the delay in the release of '83': Director Kabir
news_article: '83' director Kabir Khan, on being asked if he's upset with the delay in the release of the film due to the coronavirus pandemic, said, "No." Adding that it's a "rare" and "once in a lifetime" story, Kabir said, "We were sure that for '83', every cinema hall will become...stadium...So, I don't want to rob myself and...audience of that experience."

news_headline: Not looking for praises like 'devoted wife': Dilip Kumar's wife Saira Banu
news_article: Ahead of Dilip Kumar's 98th birthday on Friday, his wife Saira Banu said that she is not looking for praises to be called a "devoted wife". "Just to...cuddle him is the world's best thing that's happening to me. I adore him...he is my breath itself," she added. Saira added that she takes Dilip's care "out of love and not duress".

news_headline: Being Sushmita Sen's daughter has been the biggest privilege: Renee
news_article: During a recent interview, Renee Sen, who made her acting debut with the short film 'Suttabaazi', acknowledged that being Sushmita Sen's daughter has been the biggest privilege in her life. She added, "I know there are lakhs of people coming to Mumbai to become actors...My mother always says...if you don't earn it then don't be in it."

news_headline: Hope OTT platforms don’t think only stars bring in audiences: Rasika
news_article: Actress Rasika Dugal, who has starred in web-series like 'Delhi Crime', 'Out of Love' and 'Mirzapur', said, "I hope OTT platforms...don't start thinking that only stars bring in audiences." She stated that the digital platforms are prioritising good content over chasing numbers. "The competition is to generate more interesting content versus who can hit a certain number," she added.

news_headline: Mithun was instrumental in my 'jinxed' tag getting wiped out: Shirodkar
news_article: Actress Shilpa Shirodkar spoke about facing struggles during the initial phase of her acting career and revealed that she was titled 'jinxed' after several of her projects did not get released. "Mithun [Chakraborty]...was instrumental in my jinxed tag getting wiped out," she said. Following the initial struggle, Shilpa did several films with Mithun, including 'Rangbaaz' and 'Apne Dam Par'.

news_headline: Ariana Grande gets engaged to real estate agent Dalton Gomez, shares pics
news_article: Singer Ariana Grande took to Instagram to reveal that she got engaged to real estate agent Dalton Gomez. Sharing pictures with him and a picture of the ring, Ariana wrote, "Forever and then some." Several celebrities, including Kim Kardashian and Hailey Bieber commented on Ariana's post and congratulated the couple.

news_headline: It'll be more realistic: John Mathew Matthan on 'Sarfarosh' sequel
news_article: Speaking about the upcoming sequel to his Aamir Khan-starrer film 'Sarfarosh', director John Mathew Matthan said, "The sequel is about [the] internal security of the country." He added, "The film is more realistic because I don't have the compulsion to put songs in it. I had to do it then because that's how the business was."

news_headline: 2020 taught us value of work, freedom which we were denied: Aftab
news_article: Calling the year 2020 a learning experience, actor Aftab Shivdasani noted that it taught him to value his health, life, work and freedom. "I had COVID-19, but 2020 taught me to value health and life...A lot of things are going to get better in 2021. This year taught us to value...work and freedom which we were denied," he said.

news_headline: I cry alone as I remember my mother on my birthday: Dharmendra
news_article: Veteran actor Dharmendra, who turned 85 on Tuesday, said he does not celebrate his birthday because his mother is no longer with him. "When the one who gave me happiness is no longer with me, how do I celebrate? I just perform the rituals and cry alone while remembering my mother," he told The Times of India.

news_headline: I don't think anyone did 'Zubeidaa' for money: Director on film's 20 yrs
news_article: On the 20th anniversary of 'Zubeidaa', director Shyam Benegal spoke about the film, which starred Karisma Kapoor, Manoj Bajpayee and Rekha. "None of them really earned money. I don't think anyone did 'Zubeidaa' for money. But [it] did win...National award," he said. "I don't think [it] did well financially. We were happy with the way it all happened," Shyam added.

news_headline: Gal reveals her husband, children have cameos in 'Wonder Woman 1984'
news_article: Actress Gal Gadot revealed that her husband, Jaron Varsano, and their children Alma (9), and Maya (3), have cameos in her upcoming film 'Wonder Woman 1984', along with director Patty Jenkins' husband and son. "This movie is more than just a movie for...me, for Patty. It completely changed my life," she said in an interview with Kevin McCarthy.

news_headline: Sona replies after Twitter user writes 'hope he's not a rapist' on father's pic
news_article: Singer Sona Mohapatra replied to a Twitter user who commented, "I hope he is not a rapist, because u find all men rapists," on her father's picture. Sona had shared the picture of her father, Navy veteran Dilip Mohapatra, wearing his medals. Sona said, "This...jingoistic is happy to put...words in my mouth that I have never uttered, believed."

news_headline: Can put Dhruv Rathee in jail for lying in video for which he got ₹60L: Kangana
news_article: After YouTuber Dhruv Rathee responded to a Twitter user's claim that a "major YouTuber" was paid money to make a video on Kangana Ranaut, the actress tweeted, "Of course this dimwit gets money...[for]...fake videos." "I can get him behind bars for lying about BMC notice for my house in his video for which he got paid ₹60 lakh," she added.

news_headline: I was Mr India in Bigg Boss 14 house: Shardul Pandit on eviction
news_article: Actor Shardul Pandit commented on getting evicted from 'Bigg Boss 14' and said, "I was Mr India in the house. I may not have been visible, but I did manage to win hearts." Speaking about the other contestants, he said, "I am thankful that even after I was gone, a few of the housemates spoke about me and missed me."

news_headline: I love laughing at myself: Renuka on 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun' memes
news_article: Reacting to the memes featuring her character's death scene from the 1994 film 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun', actress Renuka Shahane said she loves laughing at herself. "I don't take the characters too seriously or feel offended if people use it in quirky ways," she added. She said the memes are keeping the scene alive in people's minds.

news_headline: Had no plans of becoming an actress when I moved to Mumbai: Divya
news_article: Divya Khosla Kumar has said when she moved to Mumbai, she had no intention of joining the film industry. "I had not planned on becoming an actress, a director or...producer. I think it all happened spontaneously," she added. "I'm extremely hard working so my only intention was to...grow in my career...I'm...happy and proud of my journey so far," said Divya.

news_headline: OTT projects came into my life at the correct time: Jaideep Ahlawat
news_article: Jaideep Ahlawat, when asked if OTT projects came into his life at the right time, said, "It happened at...correct time." "If it was sooner or later, maybe it might not have had such...impact," added Jaideep, who was recently seen in show 'Paatal Lok'. "Films, web have their own world...I hope they continue to run parallel for me," he further said.

news_headline: I'm surprised: Varun Dhawan's uncle on reports of his wedding this month
news_article: Varun Dhawan's uncle, actor Anil Dhawan, has refuted reports of Varun and Natasha Dalal getting married this month. He said, "I'm surprised. They're marrying this month, and we didn't know? Are they going to invite us last moment?" He added, "These stories have been floating around since a long time...Last year, there was buzz...they would be getting married in May."

news_headline: BJP's Kapil Mishra sends notice to Amazon Prime; seeks removal of 'Tandav'
news_article: BJP leader Kapil Mishra on Monday said he has issued a legal notice to Amazon Prime Video asking it to "immediately remove" the show 'Tandav' from the platform. If the show is not removed, criminal proceedings will be initiated against the platform, Mishra said. An FIR was also filed in Lucknow against the show's makers for allegedly hurting religious sentiments.

news_headline: 'Tenet' has infused life back into me, can't wait to work more: Dimple
news_article: In a recent interview, actress Dimple Kapadia said that starring in Christopher Nolan's 'Tenet' acted as an "adrenaline shot" for her and added, "This film has really infused life back into me." She mentioned that after working in 'Tenet', she is looking forward to what she can explore in the future. Nolan's film also stars Robert Pattinson and Elizabeth Debicki.

news_headline: Was replaced by Kangana in 'Tanu...' on Madhavan's recommendation: Actress
news_article: Actress Neetu Chandra said that she was replaced by Kangana Ranaut in 'Tanu Weds Manu' on R Madhavan's recommendation. "For any reason, if the director thinks that hero is recommending somebody else...I don't come from the sort of background...I'm helpless," she added. "These kinds of things kept happening. I was removed from six movies in the past," Neetu further said.

news_headline: Ishaan, Tripti to star in Dharma's psychological thriller: Reports
news_article: Ishaan Khatter and Tripti Dimri will reportedly star in Dharma Productions' next psychological thriller film. Reportedly, Tripti will be playing a complex character in the film, which will be directed by Anubhuti Kashyap. The film is reportedly written by Sumit Saxena, who also worked on 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' and 'Lust Stories'. It'll go on floors mid-next year, as per reports.

news_headline: I'm okay with it: Bhumi on comparisons with Anushka Shetty in Durgamati
news_article: Actress Bhumi Pednekar, when asked if she's ready for the comparisons with Anushka Shetty in her upcoming film 'Durgamati The Myth', said, "Of course. 100%." She added that it is natural for comparisons to happen and she's "absolutely okay and comfortable with it". Directed by G Ashok, 'Durgamati The Myth' is the Hindi remake of Anushka's Telugu film 'Bhaagamathie'.

news_headline: Happy to welcome another tiny tot: Saif on 2nd child with Kareena
news_article: Speaking to GQ India about expecting a second child with wife Kareena Kapoor Khan, actor Saif Ali Khan said, "I am very happy to welcome another tiny tot home before we get old." He added, "I’m excited about being a father again. I love children, I love the idea of having their warmth and happiness at home."

news_headline: Idea is to discuss terrorism with a human angle: Director on Torbaaz
news_article: Talking about his upcoming action-drama film 'Torbaaz', director Girish Malik said, "I really like bringing forth stories and characters that people have never imagined." "The idea is to show a story of hope and also to discuss terrorism with a human angle," he added. "'Torbaaz' will surely leave an impact on the viewers," Girish further said.

news_headline: Vicky, Ranveer appreciated my work in 'Paatal Lok': Abhishek Banerjee
news_article: Actor Abhishek Banerjee has said Vicky Kaushal, Rajkummar Rao, Ranveer Singh and Arjun Kapoor appreciated his work in web show 'Paatal Lok'. "It felt great," he said, adding, "I've got more than I could have asked for with 'Paatal Lok'." Abhishek will be next seen in films like 'Dostana 2', 'Helmet', 'Aankh Micholi' and 'Rashmi Rocket'.

news_headline: Kept myself busy to stay sane: Shireen on battling COVID-19
news_article: TV actress Shireen Mirza, while talking about dealing with coronavirus, said, "It was absolute learning for me, from how to enjoy my own company to taking online make-up courses." She added that she kept herself busy and occupied to stay sane. "It was tiring being quarantined alone for so many days but I read a lot which helped," Shireen said.

news_headline: After pandemic I have lost a bit of my swag: Sudhir Mishra
news_article: Commenting on the coronavirus lockdown, filmmaker Sudhir Mishra said, "I see myself as much more frail after the pandemic...I've lost a bit of my swag." Speaking about his father, who passed away in April, Sudhir said, "When I saw myself terrified, holding my father in my arms... running towards an ICU, and...watching him die, that has done something."

news_headline: Gill and Sundar's fathers disappointed with sons not scoring tons, Sehwag reacts
news_article: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag took to Instagram to share news clips showing Team India cricketers Shubman Gill and Washington Sundar's parents' 'disappointed' reaction on their sons not scoring hundreds in the Gabba Test. "Parents are parents after all. #parents #india #100sebadhkethacontribution (the contribution was even more than a hundred)," he wrote. "Typical Indian parents," a fan wrote.

news_headline: Recovery going well: Jadeja in his training video ahead of Test series
news_article: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who was ruled out of the T20I series after being hit on the helmet during the 1st T20I, said he is recovering well ahead of the first Test against Australia. Jadeja shared his training video on Twitter with the message- "Recovery going well #trainingmode". Jadeja didn't come out to field during the first T20I.

news_headline: I should've studied Shubman in KKR nets, might be too late now: Pat Cummins
news_article: Talking about his KKR teammate Shubman Gill, who might feature for India in the first Test against Australia, fast bowler Pat Cummins said, "I should have studied him in the KKR nets. It might be too late now." Cummins added, "He is obviously a class player, and it will be interesting to see if he gets picked."

news_headline: India trail Australia by 242 runs after Day 2, Gill scores his maiden Test fifty
news_article: India ended the second day of the Sydney Test at 96/2, trailing Australia by 242 runs. India opener Shubman Gill slammed his maiden Test fifty, while Rohit Sharma, opening for the first time overseas in Test cricket, scored 26 runs off 77 deliveries. Earlier in the day, Australia were dismissed for 338 in the first innings.

news_headline: Record for 2nd and 3rd highest T20 score by an Indian broken on same day
news_article: The record for the second-highest and the third-highest T20 score by an Indian was broken during Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy matches today. Meghalaya wicketkeeper-captain Punit Bisht scored an unbeaten 146 off 51 deliveries against Mizoram to record the second-highest T20 score by an Indian, while Kerala's Mohammed Azharuddeen slammed 137*(54) against Mumbai to score the third highest.

news_headline: Natarajan did better than what was expected from him: Zaheer Khan
news_article: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan said debutant pacer T Natarajan did better than what was expected from him with his two-wicket haul on the first day of the Brisbane Test against Australia. "He didn't try to do too much extra. He just kept on bowling according to his strengths, in the areas we have generally seen him bowl," Zaheer added.

news_headline: Kallis appointed as England’s batting consultant for Sri Lanka Test tour
news_article: On Monday, former South Africa all-rounder Jacques Kallis was named as England batting consultant for their two-test tour of Sri Lanka next month. It is yet to be confirmed whether Kallis would continue as batting consultant for subsequent tour of India in February. In last 12 months, former England batsmen Jonathan Trott and Marcus Trescothick have also filled the post.

news_headline: SA-SL series broadcaster compares Rassie to Sachin with 6-match data, trolled
news_article: SuperSport, the official broadcaster of the South Africa-Sri Lanka Test series, compared Rassie van der Dussen to Sachin Tendulkar by highlighting their record after their first six Tests. Trolling the broadcaster, a fan tweeted, "Somebody tell them Rassie is already 31." Another wrote, "According to new Babar Azam law of cricket, Rassie is already as good as Sachin is!"

news_headline: Ramiz Raja tells youth to 'not mistake wealth for respect' as Amir retires at 28
news_article: Former Pakistan batsman Ramiz Raja, while reacting to Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir's retirement aged 28, tweeted, "Sad untimely exit of a potential superstar!" He added, "And a lesson for aspiring youth: Respect your talent and understand your responsibilities. Don’t mistake wealth for respect. Respect is earned by having a strong character and not by worldly glitzy shit!"

news_headline: Cricket Australia to pay tribute to Dean Jones on Day 1 of Boxing Day Test
news_article: Cricket Australia will pay tribute to former Australia batsman Dean Jones during the tea break on Day 1 of the Boxing Day Test. Jones had died in September in Mumbai while on commentary duty for IPL 2020. Cricket Australia has also decided to give a video tribute to Jones at 3:24 pm, in reference to his Test number, 324.

news_headline: Practice for an hour, no access to physios: Saina criticises BWF over restrictions
news_article: Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal criticised the Badminton World Federation (BWF) for restricting training time and denying access to physios despite testing negative for coronavirus in Thailand. "No Time for warm-ups/taping/cool downs/stretches...we are talking about the best players in the world competing isn't it?" she said. "We want to play...in good condition. Please sort this," she added.

news_headline: Mysterious 4th stump making an appearance on replays: Aakash on Hawk-Eye
news_article: After a fan spotted an apparent error in Hawk-Eye projection used in an LBW DRS review by India against Australia's Steve Smith, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra tweeted, "Have we heard any clarification from the authorities responsible for this?" He added, "The mysterious fourth stump making an appearance on replays." In the replays, stumps were seen shifted slightly.

news_headline: Time for Smith to return as captain: Waugh ahead of 1st Test vs India
news_article: Ahead of the four-match Test series against India, ex-Australia opener Mark Waugh feels it is time to reinstate Steve Smith as captain. "He's paid his penance there, so he gets back to captain. I think he is a pretty good captain," said Mark Waugh. Smith was removed from captaincy after the 2018 ball-tampering scandal and was banned for a year.

news_headline: The OTP to forget this is 49204084041: Sehwag on India's lowest-ever Test total
news_article: After India scored 36/9 against Australia, their lowest total in Test cricket history, former India opener Virender Sehwag tweeted, "The OTP to forget this is 49204084041." Sehwag was referring to the scores made by the Indian batsmen, which were all in single-digits. Mayank Agarwal top-scored for India in the innings with 9(40).

news_headline: Shubman Gill ticking all technical boxes in style, says Wasim Jaffer
news_article: Kings XI Punjab batting coach Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to praise Shubman Gill for his performance in India's ongoing second practice match against Australia A. Sharing a picture of Shubman from the match, Jaffer wrote, "Straight bat, high elbow, head still, getting on top of the bounce...Shubman ticking the technical boxes and in some style too."

news_headline: Maha govt gives nod to conduct 64th edition of Maharashtra Kesari
news_article: Maharashtra State Wrestling Association has got the permission to conduct the 64th edition of Maharashtra Kesari, the association's Secretary General Balasaheb Landge said. "The COVID-19 safety norms will be strictly followed while conducting the event," Landge said. The event, that generally takes place during November-December, was postponed because of restrictions imposed due to COVID-19.

news_headline: Samson named Rajasthan Royals captain after Smith released from team
news_article: Wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson has been named the captain of Rajasthan Royals ahead of IPL 2021. The 26-year-old replaces Australian Steve Smith as the captain of the franchise. Smith has been released from the team ahead of the auction. Rajasthan Royals had finished last in IPL 2020, which was held in UAE.

news_headline: Footballer Marcus Thuram handed five-match ban for spitting in opponent's face
news_article: Borussia Monchengladbach's French striker Marcus Thuram was banned for five games by German football federation for spitting in Hoffenheim defender Stefan Posch's face on Saturday. The ban applies to the German Cup and Bundesliga and that a further one-game ban is suspended on condition of good behaviour until December 21, 2021. Thuram has to also pay a fine of $50,000.

news_headline: Kane Williamson embraces Kemar Roach who lost his father before Test, pic goes viral
news_article: A picture of New Zealand captain Kane Williamson embracing West Indies fast bowler Kemar Roach, who lost his father ahead of the Hamilton Test, has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "I have never seen such a civilised and sympathetic and loveable cricketer in the history of cricket."

news_headline: This is new India, ghar mein ghuskar maarta hai: Sehwag on India's win vs Australia
news_article: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to praise Team India after they won the Brisbane Test to clinch the four-match series against Australia 2-1. "Khushi ke maare pagal. This is the new India. Ghar mein ghuskar maarta hai," he wrote. "There have been World Cup wins but this is special," he further wrote.

news_headline: Warner's wife jokingly suggests sex reason behind his injury, says 'Sorry Australia'
news_article: During a radio show, Australia batsman David Warner's wife Candice jokingly suggested that sex was the reason behind David Warner's groin injury which he sustained in the second ODI against India. "We only sort of reunited after four months apart...and everyone's like, 'What have you done to him?''' she said. She further said, "Sorry, Australia!"

news_headline: Pant, Jadeja suffer injuries on Day 3, both taken for scans
news_article: India wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant and all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja were taken to the hospital for scans after they suffered blows on their left elbow and left thumb, respectively, while batting on the third day of the Sydney Test. Pant was replaced by Wriddhiman Saha behind the stumps during Australia's second innings. Jadeja didn't take the field as well.

news_headline: Concussion substitute Chahal takes 3 wickets as India defeat Australia in first T20I
news_article: India defeated Australia by 11 runs in the first T20I in Canberra on Friday to take their unbeaten run in T20I cricket to 10 matches. Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who was not named in India's playing XI, replaced Ravindra Jadeja as concussion substitute and registered bowling figures of 4-0-25-3, while debutant T Natarajan also took 3 wickets.

news_headline: Medical team working, final call on Bumrah on match day: Batting coach
news_article: India's batting coach Vikram Rathour said that a final call on pacer Jasprit Bumrah's participation in the fourth Test against Australia in Brisbane will be taken before the match on Friday. "Medical team is working with Bumrah. We'll have to wait till tomorrow morning...If he can play great and if he can't we'll deal with it," Rathour added.

news_headline: Suresh Raina to play for UP in Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 tournament
news_article: Former India cricketer, Suresh Raina, who retired from international cricket earlier this year, is set to feature for Uttar Pradesh in the upcoming Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. Raina on Sunday had also shared images of his training in the nets, stating, "All set for the camp, warming up for the upcoming season."

news_headline: I am absolutely alive and fine: Pak superfan Chacha Cricket on rumours of his death
news_article: Pakistan cricket team superfan Chacha Cricket aka Sufi Abdul Jalil shared a video on Twitter to rubbish rumours of his death on social media. "Whoever posted my picture on Facebook and spread this fake news [of my death], may Allah give him Hidayat (guidance) as well," he said in the video.

news_headline: India's young players groomed into finished products unlike in Pak: Hafeez
news_article: Lauding India on their Test series win in Australia, Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez credited India for grooming young cricketers into finished products. "India's products play international cricket...in Pakistan's case only the talent does," Hafeez said. "We don't have a system which can make finished products...That's why so many of our young players fail to succeed at international level," he added.

news_headline: India's injury concerns give Aus edge going into Brisbane Test: Ponting
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said Australia will have the edge going into the Brisbane Test as India need to find "a couple of guys to bring in" due to the injury concerns. While Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the fourth Test owing to thumb fracture, Vihari went for scans after picking up a hamstring injury at SCG.

news_headline: Punit Bisht smashes 17 sixes, breaks record for most sixes by an Indian in a T20
news_article: Meghalaya wicketkeeper-captain Punit Bisht on Wednesday broke the record for most sixes by an Indian in a T20. The 34-year-old smashed 17 sixes during his unbeaten knock of 146 runs off 51 deliveries against Mizoram in a Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. The previous record was held by Mumbai's Shreyas Iyer, who slammed 15 sixes in a T20 against Sikkim.

news_headline: Watching Kane Williamson bat is therapeutic: Wasim Jaffer
news_article: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer said watching New Zealand captain Kane Williamson bat is "therapeutic". Jaffer took to Twitter to praise Williamson for his unbeaten 97-run knock on Day 1 of the first Test against West Indies. Williamson put on a 154-run stand with Tom Latham for the second wicket after New Zealand lost debutant Will Young early.

news_headline: World has officially gone nuts: Vaughan on analyst sending signals to Morgan
news_article: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan took to Twitter to react to England analyst Nathan Leamon sending coded information to England captain Eoin Morgan from the team balcony during the third South Africa-England T20I. "Signals sent from an analyst on a balcony to the captain on the pitch !!!! The world has officially gone nuts !!! #SAvENG #OnOn," Vaughan tweeted.

news_headline: Gabbard introduces bill to ban trans athletes from women's sports
news_article: US lawmaker Tulsi Gabbard introduced a bill into the House of Representatives that would stop the federal funding of schools if they permit transgender girls and women and non-binary people to compete in women's sports. Gabbard said the bill ensures "equality & a level playing field for girls & women competing in sports". Transgender activists termed the bill as "transphobic".

news_headline: Who will face who in the Champions League Round of 16?
news_article: Defending champions Bayern Munich will face Italian club Lazio in the Champions League Round of 16, while the last year's runner-up PSG will be up against Barcelona. Premier League champions Liverpool will play RB Leipzig while La Liga champions Real Madrid will face Atalanta. Manchester City will take on Borussia Monchengladbach and Serie A champions Juventus will face Porto.

news_headline: Shane Warne picks his Australia XI for the pink ball Test vs India
news_article: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne has picked his country's playing XI for the first Test match against India. Warne picked Matthew Wade and Marcus Harris as openers with Marnus Labuschagne, Steve Smith and Travis Head at number three, four and five respectively. Warne included Cameron Green and picked Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood, and Nathan Lyon as the bowling unit.

news_headline: Rahane blessed with smart brain, should lead India well in Aus: Sachin
news_article: Sachin Tendulkar believes India Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane is equipped with a "smart brain" to be able to lead India well against Australia in the absence of Virat Kohli. "He is balanced. He is aggressive but it's controlled aggression. Whatever time I have spent with him, I know he is a hard-working player," Tendulkar said.

news_headline: It portrays us in poor light: BCCI official on Aus politician's 'Don't come' remark
news_article: Reacting to Queensland's Shadow Health Minister Ros Bates' statement that Team India shouldn't come to Brisbane if they don't want to play by rules, a BCCI official said, "The statement portrays Indians in poor light." He added, "To try and propagate a view that we don't wish to follow...rules is unacceptable and...tone...in which it was said seemed rife with hostility."

news_headline: When Washington was 9, he played a match with 5 stitches on his temple: Father
news_article: India off-spinner Washington Sundar's father M Sundar has revealed that when his son was around nine years old, he played an Under-14 inter-school match with five stitches on his temple. His father said that Washington was hit on the head during practice, but still played the match the next day and scored an unbeaten 39 to help his team win.

news_headline: Sreesanth plays a professional match after 2,804 days, thanks the pitch after spell
news_article: Fast bowler Sreesanth on Monday played his first professional match after 2,804 days, representing Kerala against Puducherry in a Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. The 37-year-old registered bowling figures of 4-0-29-1 and was seen thanking the pitch after his spell. Sreesanth was banned over the IPL 2013 spot-fixing scandal and his seven-year ban ended in September last year.

news_headline: How has Rohit Sharma performed as opener in Test cricket?
news_article: India vice-captain Rohit Sharma will be opening for the first time overseas in Test cricket during the third Test against Australia, which starts in Sydney tomorrow. Rohit has opened in six Test innings, which all came in 2019. He has scored 556 runs at an average of 92.66 as an opener in Test cricket. His highest score is 212.

news_headline: India record their lowest total in Test cricket history, post 36/9
news_article: India's second innings against Australia in the first Test in Adelaide ended at 36/9. This is India's lowest-ever total in Test cricket history. Team India pacer Mohammad Shami retired hurt after being hit on the right arm. All 11 Indian players scored in single-digits in a Test innings for the first time in history.

news_headline: Starc seen grabbing hamstring after Day 4, Smith says he'll be good to go
news_article: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc was seen grabbing his hamstring after delivering the first over during India's second innings on the fourth day of the Brisbane Test. Steve Smith said he saw the same thing but stated that Mitchell is "tough" and "he's played through some injuries before and got the job done". "He'll be good to go," Smith added.

news_headline: Drunk supporters racially abuse Bumrah, Siraj, call them 'monkey'; complaint lodged
news_article: Team India management has lodged a complaint with the match officials after pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj were racially abused by "drunk supporters" at Sydney Cricket Ground. As per journalist Boria Majumdar, the two cricketers were called 'monkey' by the supporters. ICC officials and stadium security officers had long discussions with Team India management after stumps on day three.

news_headline: I believe staying in the moment, Virat is our captain now: Rahane on captaining
news_article: On being asked about captaining India in the final three Tests against Australia, Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane said he'll think about it after the first Test. "I believe staying in the moment...Right now, Virat is our captain. We think about this Test match and then after that when he leaves, we will think [about final three]," he stated.

news_headline: Should be banned for life: Hussey on racial abuse row at SCG
news_article: Ex-Australia cricketer Michael Hussey feels the spectators guilty of racially abusing Indian cricketers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj at the SCG "should be banned for life" from stadiums. "It's terrible behaviour, I can't believe it's still happening in this day and age...The Indians have come here to our shores to entertain us...To treat players like that is unacceptable," said Hussey.

news_headline: 34-yr-old ex-Brazilian boxer arrested for allegedly killing her 61-yr-old husband
news_article: Former Brazilian professional boxer Viviane Obenauf has been arrested for allegedly killing her 61-year-old Swiss husband with a "blunt object" in their apartment in Switzerland.
