The unnamed businessman died of "massive injuries" from a "sustained violent assault” in an attack that led to a drone reportedly being flown over the flat. The police also raided 34-year-old Obenauf's gym.

news_headline: Russell's pic wearing KKR gloves in Lankan Premier League surfaces, league trolled
news_article: A picture of West Indian all-rounder Andre Russell wearing KKR gloves while batting for Colombo Kings against Galle Gladiators in Lankan Premier League has surfaced online. Several fans trolled the league, with one of them writing, "It seems gloves quality in IPL is very high." Meanwhile, another fan wrote, "LPL budget must be low; can’t provide gloves I guess."

news_headline: Pak channel shows Imran Khan's win over Kohli in a poll as 'Breaking News', trolled
news_article: A Pakistani news channel has been trolled for showing Pakistan PM Imran Khan's win over Virat Kohli in a Twitter poll as 'Breaking News'. The poll was conducted by the ICC to determine the best 'pacesetter'. "Sometimes I do feel sad for...common people of Pakistan," a fan wrote. "Now, inflation will end...and the nation will prosper...Congratulations!" a Pakistani user tweeted.

news_headline: Top 5 batsmen score 50+ runs for a team in an ODI for 2nd time in history
news_article: Australia's top five batsmen (David Warner, Aaron Finch, Steve Smith, Marnus Labuschagne and Glenn Maxwell) scored fifty-plus runs against India in the second ODI on Sunday. This is the second instance of each of the top five batsmen scoring fifty-plus runs in an ODI innings. Australia's top five batsmen had scored 50+ runs against India in Jaipur ODI in 2013.

news_headline: Hardik Pandya better finisher than Andre Russell: Harbhajan Singh
news_article: Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh believes Hardik Pandya has become a better finisher than West Indian Andre Russell. This comes after he hit two sixes in the last over of the match to beat Australia in the 2nd T20I. "He [Pandya] is hitting sixes at will...It's good to see him taking up responsibility and finishing off the game," said Harbhajan.

news_headline: He's having trouble running at full speed: Langer on Warner's injury
news_article: Giving an update on David Warner's injury, Australia head coach Justin Langer said Warner is "moving well" but he's having "trouble running at full speed". Warner had sustained a groin injury while fielding in the second ODI against India and was ruled out of the ODI and T20I series. In the two ODIs, Warner scored 69 and 83* respectively.

news_headline: Australian Open 2021 delayed, will now begin from Feb 8 in Melbourne: ATP
news_article: The 2021 edition of Australian Open, which was scheduled from January 18, will now start on February 8 in Melbourne, ATP confirmed in its updated calendar. Meanwhile, the men's qualification will take place in Doha from January 10-13. The three-week delay will allow players to arrive in Melbourne and undergo quarantine before two ATP 250 events and the ATP Cup.

news_headline: NBA teams react to pro-Trump mob storming the US Capitol
news_article: NBA teams Miami Heat and Boston Celtics on Wednesday knelt for the national anthem in protest after a mob of Donald Trump supporters stormed the US Capitol. In a joint statement both teams said they were playing "with a heavy heart". Meanwhile, Toronto Raptors and Phoenix Suns decided to join arms in circle for the American and Canadian anthems.

news_headline: Deferring angioplasty safer option, Ganguly is stable: Hospital
news_article: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly is likely to be released from the Woodlands hospital in Kolkata on Wednesday with the medical board stating that angioplasty for Ganguly's two blocked arteries can be performed on a later date. Ganguly was hospitalised on Saturday following a mild cardiac arrest and was diagnosed with blockages in three coronary arteries.

news_headline: Team India's playing XI for 3rd Test against Australia announced
news_article: The BCCI on Wednesday announced Team India's playing XI for the third Test against Australia which will take place in Sydney from tomorrow. Rohit Sharma has replaced Mayank Agarwal in the side and will open alongside Shubman Gill. Further, Navdeep Saini has been included in the side as the third fast bowler.

news_headline: India vs Australia women's ODI series postponed due to COVID-19
news_article: A three-match ODI series between Australia and India women's teams has been postponed till "next season" due to the "impact of global pandemic", Cricket Australia (CA) said on Thursday.  New COVID-19 outbreaks have been reported in Sydney which has led to travel restrictions in Australia. The matches were due to take place in Canberra, Melbourne and Hobart in January 2021.

news_headline: If Hardik is unfit, where is 6th bowling option: Gambhir
news_article: After India suffered defeat to Australia in the first ODI, former India opener Gautam Gambhir asked, "If Hardik Pandya is not fit [to bowl], where is the sixth bowling option." "It's only Vijay Shankar that I can think of but does he have the same impact batting at number five or six...I have my doubts," he added.

news_headline: Rohit finishes 2020 with highest ODI score for India, streak continues for 8th year
news_article: Rohit Sharma has hit highest yearly individual ODI score for India each time for eight years. His 119(128) against Australia in January is highest ODI score by an Indian this year, while his 159(138) was India's best in 2019. Rohit's 209(158), 264(173), 150(133), 171*(163), 208*(153) and 162(137) were India's highest scores in 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018 respectively.

news_headline: Maxwell is mini in IPL but becomes max when he plays for Aus: Aakash
news_article: Talking about Glenn Maxwell's performance in the two ODIs against India, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said the Australia batsman is "mini" in IPL but becomes "max" when he plays international cricket. "Indian [bowlers] need...to play with his ego because he is an egoistic player...India should try to get him out right from the outset," he added.

news_headline: Archer's old tweets go viral after he dismisses Gayle for 99 runs
news_article: RR fast bowler Jofra Archer's old tweets have gone viral after he dismissed KXIP's Chris Gayle for 99 runs on Friday. "I know if I was bowling I know he wasn't getting da 100," Archer's seven-year-old tweet read. Another viral tweet read, "Cg don't hurt yourself boy." The second tweet referred to Gayle throwing away his bat in frustration.

news_headline: F1 2021 calendar revised, Australian and Chinese GPs postponed
news_article: Formula One organisers on Tuesday revealed revised calendar for upcoming 2021 season, which will now start in Bahrain on March 28. The Australian GP, which was the season-opener, has been postponed to November due to COVID-19. The Chinese GP also won't take place as scheduled on April 11 due to current travel restrictions. Organisers are planning to reschedule it later.

news_headline: Williamson slams his 3rd ton in 3 Tests as NZ end Day 2 at 286/3 vs Pak
news_article: Kane Williamson on Monday slammed his third century in as many Tests to help New Zealand end the second day of the second Test at 286/3 in reply to Pakistan's 297. Williamson had slammed 251 in the first Test against the West Indies and 129 in the first Test against Pakistan. This is Williamson's 24th Test career hundred.

news_headline: Williamson shares 2nd spot with Virat in Test rankings after double ton
news_article: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson climbed two places in the ICC Test batting rankings to join his Indian counterpart Virat Kohli at the number two spot. Williamson gained 74 points in the rankings after scoring career-best 251 against West Indies in the first Test in Hamilton. Australia's Steve Smith continues to lead the rankings with 911 points.

news_headline: Saina Nehwal tests positive for COVID-19 in Thailand
news_article: Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal tested positive in her third COVID-19 test in Bangkok ahead of the Thailand Open. Meanwhile, HS Prannoy, who also tested positive in the third round, returned negative on getting further tests done on Tuesday. Saina's husband Parupalli Kashyap has also been taken to hospital for tests since he was in close proximity with Saina.

news_headline: Best player in 2nd Australia-India Test to get a special medal, pics released
news_article: Cricket Australia has announced that the best player in the Australia-India Boxing Day Test will be awarded the Mullagh Medal, named after Johnny Mullagh, who was the captain of the 1868 cricket team. The team was the first Australian sporting team to tour internationally. The medal is a recreation of the original belt buckle worn by the 1868 team.

news_headline: 2 Pak batsmen run towards same end & 1 dives to reach first; video goes viral
news_article: During the 26th over of their innings in the first ODI against Zimbabwe, Pakistan batsmen Imam ul Haq and Haris Sohail ran towards the same end with Imam diving to reach first to avoid getting run-out. However, the wicketkeeper missed the throw. The square-leg fielder gathered the ball and threw it towards the bowler, who dislodged stumps at non-striker's end.

news_headline: Langer seemingly objects to Jadeja's concussion substitution, Jaffer trolls him
news_article: Australia head coach Justin Langer seemingly objected to Team India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal replacing Ravindra Jadeja as a concussion substitute in the first T20I. Langer was seen having an animated conversation with match referee David Boon. After Chahal took two wickets in his first two overs, Wasim Jaffer trolled Langer by sharing a meme from 'Munna Bhai MBBS'.

news_headline: Very surprised Kuldeep not playing Brisbane Test: Ajit Agarkar
news_article: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar said he was "very surprised" by Kuldeep Yadav's omission from Team India's playing XI for the fourth Test against Australia in Brisbane. "Going with five bowlers, Washington Sundar playing as an all-rounder...Why not have another spinner? Gives you better balance in the attack...If the pitch flattens out and there isn't much for the quicks," he stated.

news_headline: KKR spinner Varun Chakaravarthy gets married, pictures surface
news_article: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) spinner Varun Chakaravarthy tied the knot with his long-time girlfriend Neha Khedekar in Chennai on Friday. KKR shared a video from the ceremony congratulating the couple, who had to postpone their wedding earlier this year due to the pandemic. Earlier, Chakaravarthy missed the T20I series against Australia after his maiden India call-up due to an injury.

news_headline: Made Australia scratch their head a little bit: Ponting on Ashwin-Vihari partnership
news_article: Talking about Hanuma Vihari and Ravichandran Ashwin's partnership which helped India draw the Sydney Test, ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said, "Australia will be most concerned that they didn't create many chances." "[The stand] made Australian players scratch their head a little bit. That says a bit about the pitch but also about the character...those two guys showed," Ponting added.

news_headline: IPL shares pic of Rohit and Pant, Yuvraj trolls them over their fitness
news_article: The IPL tweeted a picture of MI captain Rohit Sharma and DC wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant with the caption, "Still waiting for that six-hitting competition between Pant and Ro!" Trolling the duo over fitness, Yuvraj commented, "Or competition of fat percentage on their cheeks." Yuvraj further wrote, "It's like Ro is saying to Pant tere gaal jyada motey hain ya mere?"

news_headline: Nurse approaches player for inside info for IPL betting, said she'll delete texts
news_article: A Delhi-based nurse has been accused of asking an India cricketer confidential team information on social media during IPL 2020 as she wanted to bet on matches. The cricketer reported the matter to BCCI's Anti-Corruption Unit. As per an official, the nurse told the cricketer she would delete all the messages after he responded to her with an angry emoji.

news_headline: Ashwin breaks world record for dismissing left-handers most no. of times in Tests
news_article: Team India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has broken the world record for dismissing left-handed batsmen most number of times in Test cricket history. Ashwin has now dismissed left-handers 192 times, which is 51.2% of all wickets he has taken in Test cricket. He overtook former Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, who had dismissed left-handers 191 times in Test cricket history.

news_headline: Fan points out 'mistake' in Hawk-Eye during review by India, pic goes viral
news_article: A fan spotted an apparent error in Hawk-Eye projection used in an LBW DRS review by India against Australia's Steve Smith in the third Test in Sydney. As per projection, the ball was seen clipping the stumps and the umpire's call stayed with India retaining the review. The fan shared a picture which showed that the stumps were shifted slightly.

news_headline: Told Shaw during IPL to pay attention to fitness to train mind: Kaif
news_article: Talking about Prithvi Shaw's performance in Adelaide Test, former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said that difficulty was bound to come as the 21-year-old was playing his first pink ball Test and that too on Australian soil. "Coming to fitness...I told Shaw [during IPL] that when you pay attention to your fitness...you also train your mind," he added.

news_headline: Wriddhiman Saha back at the nets, BCCI shares batting video
news_article: Team India wicket-keeper batsman Wriddhiman Saha, who is recovering from a hamstring injury, was seen batting in the nets in a video uploaded on Twitter by BCCI. In the video, Saha was seen hitting the ball right out of the middle of the bat while taking throwdowns. Playing for SRH, Saha had injured himself in the recently-concluded IPL 2020.

news_headline: It would be nicer if Warner gets injured for a long time, jokes KL Rahul
news_article: Reacting to Australia opener David Warner sustaining a groin injury in the second ODI, Team India wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul joked, "It would be nicer if he gets injured for a long time. He's one of their main batsmen." He added, "If his injury takes a long time, it would be good for our team."

news_headline: Chennai stadium to have no crowd for Eng Tests: TN Cricket Association
news_article: The Tamil Nadu Cricket Association (TNCA) has confirmed that no spectators will be allowed for the first two Tests against England at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. "We won't have any fans coming in. What happens later in the series is a call for BCCI to take along with the English cricket board," the TNCA official said.

news_headline: How does the WTC points table read after NZ's 2-0 win over West Indies?
news_article: New Zealand defeated West Indies by an innings and 12 runs in second Test to register a 2-0 whitewash in the two-match Test series. With this, they jumped to the third spot on the World Test Championship points table, with 62.5% points earned. West Indies are seventh on the table (11.1% points earned), while India are second (75% points earned).

news_headline: Horrible to play without fans, it's a very ugly sensation: Messi
news_article: Lionel Messi has said that it's "horrible" and "ugly" to play without fans amid the coronavirus pandemic. On Barcelona being fifth in La Liga standings, Messi explained, "Seeing no one in the stadium is like a training session and it's very tough to get going at the start of a game...that's why we are seeing such evenly matched games."

news_headline: Rohit Sharma joins Team India after 2-week quarantine, BCCI shares video
news_article: Team India batsman Rohit Sharma joined the Test squad in Australia after undergoing a two-week quarantine. The BCCI took to social media to share a video of Rohit meeting the team for the first time in Australia. "Good to have you, Rohit...The Hitman has joined #TeamIndia and gets a warm welcome...Who else is excited," the BCCI captioned the video.

news_headline: Pak's Raza Hasan expelled from domestic cricket season for COVID-19 breach
news_article: Pakistan spinner Raza Hasan was sent home from the Quaid-e-Azam Trophy after he left the bio-bubble at a hotel without clearance. "It is sad and unfortunate that despite several reminders...Raza Hasan decided to take matters in his hand and overstepped the line," said PCB. "He has been expelled from the tournament and won't be allowed for remaining season," PCB added.

news_headline: Pant has dropped more catches than any other keeper since his Test debut: Ponting
news_article: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant has dropped more catches than any other wicketkeeper in the world since his Test debut. "The knock on Rishabh is always going to be on his keeping," he added. Pant dropped Australia opener Will Pucovski twice today.

news_headline: Captaining Australia was fun until Hardik came out: Matthew Wade
news_article: Speaking at the post-match conference after India chased down the 195-run target, Australia stand-in captain Matthew Wade said that captaining was fun until Hardik Pandya came out to bat. "When you have a player like Hardik who comes out and finishes, he can take anything off the last 5-6 overs," Wade added. India needed 37 runs off last three overs.

news_headline: Nation standing with protesting farmers: Wrestlers Sushil Kumar, Vinesh Phogat
news_article: Wrestlers Sushil Kumar and Vinesh Phogat have expressed solidarity with the farmers protesting against the farm laws. While Vinesh said that farmers want respect for their hard work, Sushil stated that the entire nation is standing with the farmers and their demands need to be heard by the government. Farmers have called for Bharat Bandh on December 8.

news_headline: Manchester City owner secretly buys oldest existing FA Cup trophy for ₹7.5 crore
news_article: Manchester City owner Sheikh Mansour secretly bought the oldest surviving FA Cup trophy for £760,000 (₹7.5 crore). The Football Association Challenge Cup trophy, a forerunner of the FA Cup in use today, was presented to winning teams from 1896 to 1910, when the original was stolen from a shop in Birmingham after Aston Villa won the title.

news_headline: India batted well, we couldn't have changed much: Labuschagne
news_article: Australia batsman Marnus Labuschagne, while talking about the Sydney Test, said that India "batted well" on the fifth day of the match and they couldn't have changed much in the innings. "When a team blocks out 131 overs, that's fair play to them...You have respect for the opposition and you respect the way they play," he added.

news_headline: Pujara becomes 11th Indian batsman to make 6,000 runs in Test cricket
news_article: Cheteshwar Pujara on Monday became 11th Indian cricketer to reach 6,000 runs in Test cricket. Pujara reached the landmark on final day of the third Test at the SCG. Pujara took a single off Mitchell Starc in the 73rd over of the fourth innings to achieve the feat. He went on to score 77 off 205 balls before getting dismissed.

news_headline: He won't get away with that language: Broad on Paine calling Ashwin 'd**khead'
news_article: England fast bowler Stuart Broad took to Twitter to react to Australia captain Tim Paine being caught on stump mic calling India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin 'd**khead'. "This is all a part of the game. The Test match battle but Painey won’t get away with that language with the laws above," he wrote.

news_headline: Pakistani players just think about themselves: Kaneria on Pandya-Natarajan pic
news_article: Former Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria took to Twitter to share a picture of Team India cricketers Hardik Pandya and T Natarajan, wherein Pandya can be seen giving away his Man of the Series trophy to Natarajan. "Great pic...can't be better...Natarajan must be delighted and motivated," he wrote. "Have Pakistani players ever done it? They only think about themselves," he added.

news_headline: Australia haven't lost a single Test at the Gabba in over 32 years
news_article: The fourth Australia-India Test will take place at the Gabba from tomorrow. Australia haven't lost a single Test at the stadium since November 1988. Their last defeat at the Gabba had come against West Indies, who won the match by 9 wickets. Australia have since played 31 matches at the stadium, winning 24 and drawing seven.

news_headline: Whole world would be looking at Rohit as captain and batsman in Australia: Akhtar
news_article: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said whole world would be looking at Rohit Sharma as captain and batsman in Test series against Australia. "Australia will be his best chance to prove himself as captain. He should grab it with both hands," Akhtar added. He further said, "If he does well...then there should be a debate about split captaincy."

news_headline: Harris, Pucovski break Waugh brothers' Sheffield Shield record with 486-run stand
news_article: Victoria batsmen Marcus Harris and Will Pucovski have broken Mark Waugh and Steve Waugh's 30-year-old record for the highest partnership in Sheffield Shield history with their 486-run stand against South Australia. The Waugh brothers had stitched a 464-run partnership for New South Wales against Western Australia in 1990. Pucovski finished the innings with his career-best 255*(386).

news_headline: Mushfiqur Rahim shares pic with teammate he almost hit in anger, apologises
news_article: Bangladeshi wicketkeeper Mushfiqur Rahim, who almost hit his teammate Nasum Ahmed in anger during a domestic T20 match, took to Instagram to share a picture with Nasum and issued an apology. Saying that he "already apologised" to Nasum after the match, Rahim wrote, "I would like to apologise to all my fans and spectators regarding the incident."

news_headline: Top 4 runners break half marathon's world record, Kenyan runner sets new record
news_article: Kenyan runner Kibiwott Kandie on Sunday smashed the half marathon's world record, clocking 57:32 at the Valencia Half Marathon. Notably, all top four men ran under the previous world best, with Jacob Kiplimo of Uganda finishing second in 57:37, Kenyan Rhonex Kipruto third in 57:49 and Kenyan Alexander Mutiso taking fourth place in 57:59. The previous world record was 58:01.

news_headline: Rohit needs to captain India if Virat is not there: Michael Clarke
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke said Rohit Sharma needs to lead the side in the Test series after Virat Kohli flies back. "If I was picking the Indian team before they came to Australia and knew that Virat was going to go home after the first Test, I would have picked Rohit Sharma...his [Rohit's] captaincy and leadership is outstanding," Clarke said.

news_headline: Hats off to him: Gambhir on Kohli becoming fastest to hit 12,000 ODI runs
news_article: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has praised Virat Kohli for becoming the fastest player to cross the 12,000 ODI-run mark, breaking Sachin Tendulkar's record by 58 innings. "Hats off to Kohli," he stated. Kohli, who is also the fastest batsman to reach 8,000, 9,000, 10,000 and 11,000 ODI runs, took 242 innings to reach the milestone.

news_headline: Shaw may be better suited to bat in the middle-order: Hogg
news_article: Former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has suggested that 21-year-old Prithvi Shaw, who scored zero and four in Adelaide Test as an opener, might be better suited to bat in the middle-order. "Shaw has made a lot of runs in domestic cricket, so he has talent...his technique will be better suited [in the middle-order]," Hogg stated.

news_headline: Cycle mechanic thought I was my sister's servant due to my looks at 14: Kapil Dev
news_article: Kapil Dev, in an episode of #NoFilterNeha, revealed that once a cycle mechanic mistook him as his sister's servant due to his looks when he was 14. Kapil said he had gone to the mechanic with his sister after her cycle got punctured. "The mechanic said to my sister, 'You can go. Leave your servant here'," Kapil added.

news_headline: Gayle throws his bat in frustration after getting out on 99, video surfaces
news_article: KXIP batsman Chris Gayle threw away his bat in frustration after getting out on 99 against RR on Friday. This is the first time in his T20 career that he got out on 99. "To the guys who I promised a century today, I missed out but in my mind it's a century. I scored a hundred," he later said.

news_headline: South Africa cricketer tests COVID-19 positive ahead of Eng series
news_article: One South Africa cricketer tested positive for coronavirus ahead of the limited-overs series against England, confirmed Cricket South Africa (CSA). Two players who were in close contact are under self-isolation as precautionary measure. "All three players have been placed in immediate isolation in Cape Town," CSA said. Meanwhile, CSA won't replace the two players under isolation for the series.

news_headline: I don't think it was the right approach: Ponting on Pujara's 50 off 176 balls
news_article: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara's 50-run knock off 176 balls put "too much" pressure on his batting partners. "I don't think it was the right approach, I think he needed to be a bit more proactive with his scoring rate," Ponting added. Pujara had scored 16 runs from the first 100 balls.

news_headline: Shastri told me over drinks Yadav might be India's 3rd pacer in Tests: Chappell
news_article: Talking about the upcoming Australia-India Test series, ex-Australia captain Ian Chappell said that India will miss Ishant Sharma's height and the steep bounce he is able to generate on Australian tracks. Chappell further said, "I was having a drink with Ravi Shastri the other day and he told me probably Umesh Yadav will get the nod as the third pacer."

news_headline: Just can't believe the day has come: Parthiv's wife shares note on his retirement
news_article: After wicketkeeper-batsman Parthiv Patel announced his retirement from all forms of cricket, his wife Avni took to Twitter to share a note. "Dear husband...I just can't believe the day has come," she wrote. She added, "I know how hard it's to say goodbye to cricket. Even for us...Looking forward to spend more weekends and holidays we both have dreamed of."

news_headline: I'm proud we won T20I series without established players like Rohit, Bumrah: Kohli
news_article: After taking an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match T20I series against Australia, India captain Virat Kohli said, "I am very proud of this team." He added, "The fact that we didn't have Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah, our established white-ball players and we still did well makes me happy." Bumrah was rested, while Rohit wasn't included in T20I squad.

news_headline: What is the breakdown of Chris Gayle's 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket?
news_article: KXIP's Chris Gayle on Friday became the first-ever cricketer to smash 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket history. The 41-year-old has represented 26 teams in T20 cricket, playing a total of 410 matches. He has hit more than 100 sixes for three teams, RCB (263), Jamaica Tallawahs (124) and West Indies (105). Further, he has hit 84 sixes for KXIP.

news_headline: Can use Rishabh Pant just as a batsman: Murali Kartik ahead of 2nd Test
news_article: Ex-India cricketer Murali Kartik said wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant can be included "just as a batsman with the X-factor" for the second Test. "Pant hasn't done anything wrong as a batsman so you can play him as a batsman and don't take the gloves from Saha," said Kartik. Australia dismissed India for 36 in the second innings of the first Test.

news_headline: Rishabh Pant should play as a pure batsman in Brisbane Test: Parthiv Patel
news_article: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel has suggested that Rishabh Pant should play as a pure batsman in the Brisbane Test, while Wriddhiman Saha should play as a keeper. "The way in which Pant has batted, the way he has carried himself and showed his character, I feel there is a strong case [he can play as a pure batsman]," Parthiv said.

news_headline: Australia have identified where to bowl to Pujara: Glenn McGrath
news_article: Ex-Australia pacer Glenn McGrath has said Australia pacers have identified where to bowl to Cheteshwar Pujara to keep him away from scoring runs. "Pujara is getting out in similar ways...[Australia] have been able to execute [their plans]...and they've got the result they wanted," he added. Pujara has scored 215 runs in his seven innings so far in the four Tests.

news_headline: How can a Test match end as drawn, not tied when scores are level?
news_article: A Test is considered drawn, and not tied if the batting team has wickets remaining when the time expires, even if the scores are level. A Test can be termed tied only if the chasing side gets all-out with the scores level. The Bulawayo Test between England and Zimbabwe was declared drawn with the scores level, on December 22, 1996.

news_headline: SA-England ODI postponed an hour before start as SA player tests COVID-19 positive
news_article: England Cricket Board and Cricket South Africa have announced the postponement of the first ODI of the three-match series to Sunday. The ODI has been postponed just one hour before scheduled start today in Cape Town. This comes after a player from South Africa tested positive for COVID-19 after the teams' last round of scheduled testing performed on Thursday.

news_headline: Sharapova announces engagement to millionaire UK art dealer Gilkes, shares pics
news_article: Ex-world number one women's tennis player Maria Sharapova has announced her engagement to millionaire UK art dealer Alexander Gilkes. The duo took to their respective social media accounts to share pictures and videos. "I said yes from the first day we met...This was our little secret, wasn't it," Sharapova wrote. The duo have been dating for almost three years.

news_headline: Ponting rightly predicts Shaw's dismissal as he talks about his flaw, video viral
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting, while commentating in the Australia-India Test, rightly predicted Prithvi Shaw's dismissal. "If he does have a chink in his armour it's the ball which does come back into him...Quite often he leaves a big gap between bat and pad and that's where the Aussies will target," said Ponting. Shaw was bowled by Mitchell Starc for 0(2).

news_headline: ICC alters WTC points system due to pandemic, India dethroned from top spot
news_article: The ICC today announced that the ICC World Test Championship points system has been amended due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The teams will now be ranked in order of percentage of points earned. With the update, Australia went past India to claim the first position on the points table. Australia has earned 82.2% points, while India has earned 75%.

news_headline: I am being mentally tortured: Pakistan's Mohammad Amir quits international cricket
news_article: Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir has announced that he is retiring from international cricket. "I cannot play cricket under this management. I am being mentally tortured," he said. He added, "I cannot tolerate this. I have already tolerated a lot of mental torture from 2010 to 2015 when I was banned."

news_headline: Bumrah has awkward action but he's the real deal: Allan Border
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Allan Border has said that the rise of India pacer Jasprit Bumrah "through the ranks" out of IPL has been "incredible". "Bumrah has just taken the world of cricket by storm...He's the real deal...He has the awkward action but he bowls at good pace, so not the classical way of doing things," Border stated.

news_headline: Unfair to ask Pujara to not play his natural game: Tom Moody
news_article: Former Australia all-rounder Tom Moody said Cheteshwar Pujara can't be pulled up for his slow batting approach on Day 3 of the SCG Test. "I don't think Pujara at all is the culprit in this case...It would be unfair for the team to be asking him to be playing something which is totally out of his natural style," Moody said.

news_headline: Shocked that Aus weren't good enough to win Test series vs India: Ponting
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said he was "quite shocked" that hosts Australia didn't manage to win the Test series against an inexperienced Indian side that was plagued with injuries. "The cold hard facts of it are pretty much that was the India A team that played this Test match and still won...It's probably not even (India's) second-picked team," Ponting added.

news_headline: Hotel room where Maradona stayed during Kerala visit turned into museum, pics surface
news_article: The hotel suite where late Diego Maradona stayed during his visit to Kerala in 2012 has been converted into a museum in his memory. Maradona stayed in room number 309 at Kannur's Blue Nile Hotel during his visit eight years ago. "All objects used by the football legend back then are kept here in his memory," an official said.

news_headline: Aus all out on Day 1 of an MCG Boxing Day Test after 10 years, India 36/1 at stumps
news_article: After winning the toss and deciding to bat first in the Boxing Day Test against India, Australia were bowled out for 195 runs in 72.3 overs in their first innings. It is the first time since 2010 that Australia were bowled out on opening day of a Boxing Day Test at Melbourne Cricket Ground. India ended the day at 36/1.

news_headline: Cricketers might skip overseas tours due to quarantine: Hazlewood
news_article: Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said amid the pandemic cricketers might end up pulling out of overseas tours to avoid the quarantine period. "These two weeks are the hardest coming back from an overseas tour," said Hazlewood. "I think bubble life is a lot easier than quarantine. There is a few things you can get out to do," the pacer added.

news_headline: 3 defeats don't make us a bad team: DC's Ajinkya Rahane
news_article: Talking about their three consecutive defeats, DC opener Ajinkya Rahane said that results were not as per what they wanted but "this...happens in a tournament like IPL". "Losses don't make us a bad team. It's all about playing to our strength and backing each and every individual...We're really looking forward to playing against MI now and then RCB," he added.

news_headline: Had a poor game as leader, ended up looking like fool: Tim Paine
news_article: Australia Test captain Tim Paine admitted that he 'ended up looking like a fool' after he had a poor game both as a captain and a wicket-keeper against India at the SCG. "You behave as I did in this Test match and then perform like that, you open yourself up to criticism...I want to apologise for the mistakes," Paine said.

news_headline: NZ defeat Pak in 1st T20I as Jacob Duffy registers best figures on debut by NZ player
news_article: New Zealand on Friday chased down Pakistan's 153-run total and won the first T20I by five wickets, taking 1-0 lead in the three-match series. Jacob Duffy, 26-year-old, registered the best bowling figures of 33/4 on T20I debut by a New Zealand player. Pakistan had won the toss and elected bat first but were reduced to 20/4.

news_headline: Mesut Ozil leaves Arsenal to join Turkish club Fenerbahce
news_article: German footballer Mesut Ozil confirmed on Sunday that he was leaving English club Arsenal to join Turkish side Fenerbahce. Ozil, who was at Arsenal for seven-and-a-half years, hasn't played for them since March 2020. "I'm very happy...God has given me the chance to wear the Fenerbahce shirt. I'll wear it with pride and give everything for the team," Ozil said.

news_headline: Not a good tradition: Shahid Afridi on 28-yr-old Amir's retirement
news_article: Talking about 28-year-old pacer Mohammad Amir's retirement after he was excluded from the T20I squad for New Zealand series, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said it's not a good tradition. "PCB should communicate its plans with them so that they mentally prepare themselves if they are dropped due to any issues," he added. Amir had alleged "shabby" treatment from PCB.

news_headline: What he was thinking there we'll never know: Ponting on Rohit's dismissal
news_article: After Rohit Sharma got out playing a rash shot on Day 2 of the fourth Test, ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting criticised him for the way he got dismissed. "The trap was set for him...so what Rohit was thinking there we'll never know...You can't just be going and throwing what could have been such a promising innings away," Ponting said.

news_headline: Team India's playing XI announced a day before first Test against Australia
news_article: The BCCI on Wednesday announced Team India's playing XI for the first Test against Australia which will take place in Adelaide from Thursday. Prithvi Shaw has been chosen as Mayank Agarwal's opening partner over Shubman Gill, while Wriddhiman Saha has been picked as wicketkeeper ahead of Rishabh Pant. Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Umesh Yadav are the three pacers selected.

news_headline: 'Wine & dine with Team India' scam busted in Australia, fans cheated of over ₹60 lakh
news_article: A fraudster cheated fans of over ₹60 lakh after promising them a fake 'wine and dine with Team India' at a Sydney restaurant. The fraudster had left flyers on cars parked at Sydney Cricket Ground during the last ODI and promoted the event, saying it's scheduled for January 5. The restaurant said that the fraudster conned them by missing meetings.

news_headline: MI win an IPL match in Dubai for the first time, hand DC their 4th straight loss
news_article: Mumbai Indians defeated Delhi Capitals by nine wickets on Saturday to register their first win in IPL in Dubai in six matches. The defeat is Delhi Capitals' fourth straight loss in IPL 2020. With the victory, Mumbai Indians are also assured of a top-two finish on the IPL 2020 points table. Ishan Kishan top-scored for Mumbai Indians with 72*(47).

news_headline: Kevin Pietersen tweets in Hindi, asks Team India to be careful about England series
news_article: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to congratulate Team India on their Test series win against Australia. The 40-year-old tweeted in Hindi, saying India deserve to celebrate the historic victory as it came after several obstacles. He further said that the "real team" England are coming to tour India in two weeks and asked India to be careful.

news_headline: Let it go and move on, keep a positive mindset: Smith advises Team India
news_article: Australia's Steve Smith has asked Team India to forget and move on after the visitors got dismissed for 36 in the second innings of the first Test. "You got to let it go...try and keep yourself in a positive mindset," Smith said. "It's important to keep moving forward, look at yourself individually, what you could have done better," Smith added.

news_headline: Kohli himself might have to bowl: Tom Moody on India's 6th bowling option
news_article: Talking about the India-Australia series, former Australia cricketer Tom Moody said that India captain Virat Kohli might himself have to bowl "a few of his little mediums" as the sixth bowler. "Australia have got all their bowling options sorted. They've got experience in those bowling options at [Aaron] Finch's disposal," he added. Currently, all-rounder Hardik Pandya isn't fit to bowl.

news_headline: Australia weren't aggressive enough: Ponting on Day 3 of 4th Test
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said he's "disappointed" with the way Australia went about the third day of the Brisbane Test. "I don't think they were aggressive enough, didn't bowl enough short balls. They let the Indian batsmen be way too comfortable at the crease. They almost bowled the way those batsmen would have wanted them to bowl," he stated.

news_headline: SA-Eng 1st ODI called off again after hotel staff tests COVID-19 positive
news_article: The first ODI between South Africa and England in Paarl on Sunday was cancelled after two hotel staff, where the visitors were staying, tested COVID-19 positive. The start of the match was initially delayed after the tests returned positive, but the match was eventually suspended. The match was rescheduled to Sunday after a South Africa cricketer tested positive for coronavirus.

news_headline: The boy has become a man on this tour: Sehwag on Siraj's performance in Australia
news_article: Virender Sehwag praised pacer Mohammed Siraj, who took his first Test five-wicket haul today. Sehwag tweeted, "The boy has become a man on this tour...Leader of the attack in his first Test series...He has led from the front." He added, "The way newcomers have performed for India on this tour will be etched in memories for a long time."

news_headline: I'm in good zone, not worried about IPL auction: Azharuddeen whose bucket list went viral
news_article: Kerala opener Mohammed Azharuddeen, whose bucket list at his house went viral after he smashed a 37-ball hundred in a T20 match against Mumbai, has said that he's in a good zone and is not worried about the IPL auction. "IPL, four hundreds in a Ranji season, own house, Benz, 2023 World Cup," his bucket list read.

news_headline: Mohammed Siraj ducks even before Pat Cummins releases ball, pic goes viral
news_article: India pacer Mohammed Siraj ducked even before Australia pacer Pat Cummins bowled a delivery to him during the first innings of the Sydney Test. Reacting to a picture that went viral, a fan tweeted, "Don't blame him. Too many short balls." Another fan wrote, "I guess his survival instinct kicked in. Better to duck than to lose your arm bone."

news_headline: Please let Shubman enjoy his cricket, don't compare him to anyone: Wasim Jaffer
news_article: Talking about 21-year-old Shubman Gill, who aggregated 80 runs in his first-ever Test, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Shubman is special but please let him enjoy his cricket." He added, "Don't compare him to anyone and put undue pressure on him. He's not next somebody he's first Shubman Gill. We've lost many great talents due to undue pressure and unreal expectations."

news_headline: Indian bowlers can't get carried away with bouncy wickets in Aus: Kapil
news_article: Former India all-rounder Kapil Dev said Indian bowlers shouldn't get excited with Australia's pace-friendly wickets and "start bowling short" during the four-match Test series. "Our fast bowlers are not that used to bowling on Australian pitches...It's very important to understand their pace and back their strengths," Kapil said. He added that Australia have the edge going into the Test series.

news_headline: My little boy has asked me to wake him up whenever Kohli comes to bat: Vaughan
news_article: Talking about Team India captain Virat Kohli's impact on children, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said, "My little boy...always asks me to wake him up when Kohli comes out to bat. As soon as Kohli gets out, he goes back inside to do something else." He further said, "Kohli is that powerful with the kids."

news_headline: I saw death coming, told myself I had to get out for my children: F1 driver on crash
news_article: F1 driver Romain Grosjean, whose car burst into flames and split into two after a 225-kmph crash at the Bahrain Grand Prix, has said that he really saw death coming. "I told myself that I had to get out for my children. I put my hands in the fire, so I clearly felt it burning on the chassis," he added.

news_headline: Troll calls Shikhar Dhawan 'ugly' and 'sh*t player' on Instagram, cricketer responds
news_article: Team India batsman Shikhar Dhawan took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with Yuzvendra Chahal and Deepak Chahar from a flight. Commenting on the picture, a user wrote, "Tatti shakal...Tatti game play (You are ugly and a sh*t player)." Dhawan responded, "Yes...Your family members were also saying this about you."

news_headline: Video of a child crying in stands during Australia-India T20I goes viral
news_article: A video of a child crying in the stands during Australia-India T20I in Sydney has gone viral on social media. In the video, a Team India fan can be seen holding the boy as the camera panned over the spectators, who can be seen cheering. "Cricket's not everyone's cup of tea," Cricket Australia wrote sharing the video.

news_headline: Indian arm-wrestling champion beats US bodybuilder in a Super Match
news_article: India's 70-kg arm wrestling champion Rahul Panicker defeated American bodybuilder Larry Wheels in an arm-wrestling match in Dubai. Despite losing the first two rounds in the encounter, Panicker made a comeback to win the next three rounds to take the match. A software engineer by profession, Kochi-based Panicker has won six national medals in the last decade.

news_headline: F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has tested positive for coronavirus. His team said that he reported "mild symptoms" on Monday morning less than 24 hours after he claimed his 11th win of the season at the Bahrain Grand Prix. He will miss this weekend's Sakhir Grand Prix as he will be in quarantine.

news_headline: Jadeja slams 2 sixes off last 2 balls to help CSK beat KKR, MI qualify for playoffs
news_article: CSK all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed two sixes off the last two balls to help CSK chase down the target of 173 against KKR. The defeat is KKR's second in a row, while CSK, who are out of the playoffs race, registered their fifth victory. With KKR's defeat, MI became the first team to qualify for IPL 2020 playoffs.

news_headline: I have a problem with Jadeja kind of players in white-ball cricket: Manjrekar
news_article: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said that he doesn't have a problem with Ravindra Jadeja but he has a problem with his kind of cricketers in white-ball cricket. "Even Hardik Pandya will not be in my team. They add illusionary value to the team," he added. He further said, "I have always rated Jadeja highly in the Test format."

news_headline: Wasim Jaffer shares 'hidden message' for keeper Pant ahead of 3rd Test, post viral
news_article: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a 'hidden message' for Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant ahead of the third Test against Australia. Sharing a collage of four pictures, Jaffer wrote, "Easy one for you...Pant #decode...Cc: @ashwinravi99 @imjadeja." Decoding the message, a fan tweeted, "Pant should sing Butta Bomma when Ashwin and Jadeja are bowling and stump Warner."

news_headline: Was just sticking to basics: Bumrah on 4-wicket haul on Day 1
news_article: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah picked four wickets for 56 runs on the first day of the Boxing Day Test against Australia. Talking about his performance, Bumrah said, "Sometimes when you try too hard you don't get that success, so was just sticking to the basics." Bumrah has now picked more than three wickets in a Test innings six times.

news_headline: Ex-Russia captain, who hospitalised referee during match, sentenced to community service
news_article: Former Russia captain Roman Shirokov has been sentenced to 100 hours of community service over an assault on a referee whilst playing in an amateur competition in August. Shirokov had punched and kicked the referee after being denied a penalty during the match. Later, the 39-year-old posted an apology on social media and expressed his regret over the incident.

news_headline: Which players have been released by CSK ahead of IPL 2021 auction?
news_article: Chennai Super Kings, who finished seventh in IPL 2020, have released six players from their squad and retained 18 players. Kedar Jadhav, Piyush Chawla, Murali Vijay, Harbhajan Singh and Monu Singh are the Indian players released by CSK. Meanwhile, Shane Watson, who retired from all forms of cricket, is the only foreigner released by CSK.

news_headline: Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar named Delhi head coach for 2020-21
news_article: India captain Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has been appointed as the head coach of the Delhi Ranji team for the upcoming 2020-21 domestic season. Sharma was the bowling coach of the team last season when KP Bhaskar was the head coach. Sharma is a Dronacharya awardee and he has also coached ICC Associate team Malta.

news_headline: Cricketer Mandeep Singh, wife Jagdeep blessed with a baby boy
news_article: Punjab captain Mandeep Singh and his wife Jagdeep Jaswal Singh have been blessed with a baby boy. The cricketer took to social media to announce the news. He wrote, "How wonderful life is now that he’s here...Me and Jagdeep are extremely happy to announce the arrival of our little prince, Rajveer Singh...Born January 16, 2021."

news_headline: India take over 4 hours to bowl 50 overs vs Australia, fined 20% of match fee
news_article: Team India players have been fined 20% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against Australia in the first ODI in Sydney on Friday. India took more than four hours to complete their quota of 50 overs. Virat Kohli's side was ruled to be one over short of the target after time allowances were taken into consideration.

news_headline: Alyssa Healy takes a dig at Team India's alleged 'jail hotel' complaints in Brisbane
news_article: Australia Women wicketkeeper Alyssa Healy took a dig at Team India's alleged complaints about their hotel in Brisbane. Reacting to a report that stated Indian players have complained about being "locked up" in rooms and having to "clean toilets", Healy wrote, "Australia and NZ women's teams did their quarantine in the same hotel last year. Here's a shock...We survived."

news_headline: Claire Polosak becomes first-ever female match official in a men's Test match
news_article: Australia's 32-year-old umpire Claire Polosak has become the first-ever female match official in a men's Test match. Polosak is the fourth umpire in the third Test match between India and Australia which is taking place in Sydney. Polosak had become the first-ever woman to officiate in a men's ODI on April 27, 2019.

news_headline: India lose a T20I for the 1st time in a year as Aus end their 11-match unbeaten run
news_article: Australia defeated India by 12 runs in the third T20I in Sydney on Tuesday as India clinched the three-match series 2-1. This is India's first defeat in a T20I match since December 8, 2019. India were on an 11-match unbeaten streak in T20I cricket. Team India captain Virat Kohli top-scored in the match with 85 runs off 61 balls.

news_headline: Fourth Test will be played in Brisbane, as planned: Cricket Australia
news_article: Cricket Australia (CA) on Monday confirmed that the fourth Test between India and Australia will go ahead as planned in Brisbane. "I had a call last night from the BCCI secretary...he confirmed we are good to travel to Brisbane," CA chief said. Both boards got signed assurances from Queensland Health that players will be allowed to mingle within the hotel.

news_headline: Rohit ignores Labuschagne's 'What did you do in quarantine?' sledge, video viral
news_article: Australia batsman Marnus Labuschagne teased India opener Rohit Sharma during the third Test in Sydney. While fielding at short leg, Labuschagne asked Rohit, "What did you do in quarantine?" In the video shared by Cricket Australia, Rohit can be seen ignoring the Australian. "This is a catch. Catch here!" Labuschagne was later heard saying to disturb Rohit.

news_headline: Lara named daughter after Sydney where he hit 277 as 1st hundred
news_article: Ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara named his first daughter Sydney, after the city where he went on to convert his maiden Test ton into a double hundred on January 5, 1993. Lara, who began the day four of the Test against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground at 121*, scored 277 in the innings, helping Windies draw the Test.

news_headline: Dhoni used to play that kind of role: Manjrekar on Pandya's 90 off 76
news_article: Talking about Hardik Pandya's knock of 90 runs off 76 balls against Australia while batting at number six, cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said that the ex-captain MS Dhoni used to play that kind of role. "There was clarity and there was sense in the way he batted...He is actually an impressive product to look at," he added.

news_headline: Sanjay Manjrekar gets trolled after Pandya, Jadeja share 150-run partnership
news_article: Sanjay Manjrekar, who said Hardik Pandya and Ravindra Jadeja wouldn't be in his ODI team, was trolled after the duo shared an unbeaten 150-run partnership against Australia. "If Manjrekar comments on whole squad...every batsman will play well," a fan tweeted. Another wrote, "Today Manjrekar got a befitting reply. Irony was he was the commentator when the two got going."

news_headline: Dates for England's India tour announced, world's largest stadium to host all 5 T20Is
news_article: The BCCI and ECB on Thursday announced the fixtures for Team India's home series against England. Motera, the largest cricket stadium in the world, will host all the five T20I matches from March 12 to March 20 next year. It will also host two Tests, including a Day-Night match in February. The ODI series will be held in Pune.

news_headline: Rabada ruled out of ODI series against England due to injury
news_article: South Africa pacer Kagiso Rabada will be missing the ODI series against England after sustaining a groin injury. He has been released from the squad and also the bio-bubble since he is likely to take three weeks to recover. Cricket South Africa will be expecting to get Rabada fit before the Test series against Sri Lanka, starting later this month.

news_headline: Dwayne Smith smashes six sixes in an over against his brother in T10 match
news_article: Ex-West Indies batsman Dwayne Smith smashed six sixes in an over for Errol Holder Stars against his brother Kemar Smith in the final of the A&A Auto Parts Errol Holder Ten10 Classic tournament. CRB's Kemar was hit for six maximums in the first over of the match as their mother looked on. Later, Dwayne dismissed Kemar for a golden duck.

news_headline: Out ho ja bhootni ke: Pak spinner heard saying on stump mic as batsman misses ball
news_article: Pakistan leg-spinner Yasir Shah was heard saying 'Out ho ja bhootni ke' on stump mic in frustration after New Zealand batsman Henry Nicholls missed a cut shot on his bowling in first Test today. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "Hahaha top stuff with tongue but bowling [thumbs down]." Nicholls is unbeaten on 42 off 100 deliveries after day one.

news_headline: Ravichandran Ashwin dismisses David Warner for 10th time in Tests
news_article: Spinner Ravichandran Ashwin on Saturday dismissed Australia batsman David Warner for the 10th time in Test cricket. It is the most Ashwin has dismissed any batsman in the longest format of the game. As for Warner, England's Stuart Broad is now the only bowler who has dismissed him on more occasions than Ashwin. Broad has dismissed Warner 12 times.

news_headline: Good people finish first too: Ganguly lauds Rahane and team after MCG win
news_article: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly took to Twitter to praise Ajinkya Rahane and his side for their eight-wicket win against Australia in the second Test. "A special win at MCG...Well done Ajinkya Rahane ..good people finish first too.. congratulations to all," Ganguly tweeted on Tuesday night. Ganguly also wished the team "best of luck" for the remaining two Test matches.

news_headline: Virat Kohli clarifies why he wasn't allowed to take DRS against Wade in 3rd T20I
news_article: While talking about umpires not allowing him to take DRS against an LBW appeal against Matthew Wade, Team India captain clarified that it was a mistake from the production side. "We were still discussing...and within 15 seconds the replay was on big screen," Kohli said. "We decided to take DRS but the umpire said nothing can be done," he added.

news_headline: Daughter asked Ashwin to take leave, said 'Why go to office in pain': Wife Prithi
news_article: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin's wife Prithi has revealed ahead of the last day of the Sydney Test, their four-year-old daughter Aadhya asked Ashwin to take leave after seeing him "writhing in pain". Prithi said Aadhya told Ashwin, "Why go to the office in pain...when you can chill at home?" "I couldn't imagine how he was going to play," Prithi added.

news_headline: I never thought I would break any records: Messi on breaking Pele's record
news_article: Barcelona forward Lionel Messi, who broke Brazilian legend Pele's record for scoring most number of goals for a single club, said, "When I started playing football...I never thought I'd break any records, especially Pele's." He added, "I can only thank everyone who's helped me all these years, my teammates, my family, my friends, and everyone who supports me every day."

news_headline: Hazlewood will be the biggest threat for Indian batsmen: Sanjay Manjrekar
news_article: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood is likely to pose the biggest challenge for India on the final day of the Brisbane Test. "Pat Cummins has been spoken about more. But...it seems, among the three, Josh Hazlewood is applying his brain the most," he added. Hazlewood is the second-highest wicket-taker in the series so far.

news_headline: Parthiv Patel retires from all forms of cricket at 35 after 18-yr career, shares note
news_article: Wicketkeeper-batsman Parthiv Patel has announced his retirement from all forms of cricket aged 35, ending his 18-year-long playing career. Sharing a farewell note on social media, Parthiv wrote, "I feel at peace having played the game in its truest tenets." Parthiv had made his international debut aged 17 and went on to represent India in 65 international matches.

news_headline: India need 309 runs on last day to win Sydney Test and take 2-1 series lead
news_article: India ended the fourth day of the Sydney Test against Australia at 98/2 on Sunday, needing another 309 runs to win. Earlier in the day, Marnus Labuschagne's 73, Steve Smith's 81 and Cameron Green's 84 helped Australia declare their second innings at 312/6. India openers Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill shared a 71-run opening stand in the second innings.

news_headline: KXIP retain 16 players from IPL 2020 squad, release list
news_article: KXIP, who had finished sixth on the points table in IPL 2020, have retained 16 players from their squad ahead of IPL 2021 auction. The players are: KL Rahul, Chris Gayle, Nicholas Pooran, Mohammad Shami, Chris Jordan, Mandeep Singh, Mayank Agarwal, Ravi Bishnoi, Prabhsimran Singh, Deepak Hooda, Sarfaraz Khan, Arshdeep Singh, M Ashwin, Ishan Porel, Harpreet Brar and Darshan Nalkande.

news_headline: Maxwell was more serious about his golf during IPL, was there for enjoyment: Sehwag
news_article: Talking about Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell, who hit 16 sixes against India in the limited-over series and had failed to hit even one six in IPL 2020, Virender Sehwag said, "He was more serious about his golf than cricket during IPL." He added, "He was there only for enjoyment. He did everything except score runs in IPL."

news_headline: India's 100-yr-old Chandorkar now oldest living 1st class cricketer as Burgess dies
news_article: Former wicketkeeper Raghunath Chandorkar, who turned 100 years old last November, has become the oldest living first-class cricketer. This comes after New Zealand's Alan Burgess, who held the title, passed away at the age of 100 years and 250 days on Wednesday. Chandorkar, who was born in Maharashtra's Karjat, played seven first-class matches and scored 155 runs.

news_headline: SCG pitch has much less pace, bounce: Ashwin on Smith, Labuschagne innings
news_article: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said Australia batsmen Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne played him better in the third Test as the SCG pitch has lesser pace and bounce compared to the first two Test venues. "A combination of the pitch and their strategy to push at balls that they haven't really covered have also really worked for them," Ashwin added.

news_headline: I posted video on his Instagram: Model-friend defends F1 driver who groped her in car
news_article: Model Andrea D’lVal has defended her Formula One driver-friend Nikita Mazepin after a video shared on latter's Instagram account showed him groping Andrea in a car. She wrote, "I posted this video on his story as an internal joke...I'm truly sorry. I can give you my word he's really a good person and he'd never do anything to hurt me."

news_headline: After Dhoni, Kohli, Pandya can be the next global superstar in cricket: Vaughan
news_article: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said that India all-rounder Hardik Pandya can be the next global superstar in cricket after MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli. "Pandya has to look at the next three years...the next T20 WC being in India...the IPL being in India, the  50-over World Cup is in India in 2023...He's got a great opportunity," Vaughan added.

news_headline: Have a heart: Kaif to people criticising Pujara for slow batting
news_article: Ex-India batsman Mohammad Kaif has defended Cheteshwar Pujara for slow batting in the ongoing Sydney Test. "Will this Test go the distance? Did India need to score quickly and declare? Pujara came to Australia after nine months of no cricket. Have a heart, please don't talk about slow rate...remember this is Test cricket not slog overs of...white-ball contest," Kaif tweeted.

news_headline: Tim Paine issues clarification over Steve Smith scuffing batting mark controversy
news_article: Referring to Steve Smith scuffing Rishabh Pant's batting mark, Australia captain Tim Paine issued a clarification, saying that he does that every single match, five or six times a day. "He's always standing in the batting crease, shadow batting," Paine added. "He wasn't by any stretch of the imagination trying to change guard or do anything like that," Paine stated.

news_headline: Kohli scores most runs against Australia as India captain, breaks 51-year-old record
news_article: During the first day of the first Australia-India Test, Virat Kohli set the record for scoring the most runs against Australia as India captain. Kohli overtook Mansur Ali Khan Pataudi, who had registered 829 runs against Australia as India captain from 1964 to 1969. Kohli took 17 innings to overtake Pataudi, who had scored 829 runs in 20 innings.

news_headline: Brad Hogg takes a dig at India's top-order batting, gets trolled by Wasim Jaffer
news_article: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg took to Twitter to take a dig at India's top-order batting during the two practice matches against Australia A. Hogg said Indian players need to know where their off-stump is and added they should learn to leave ball off good length. Responding to Hogg, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Australia need to know who their top order is."

news_headline: Hanuma Vihari slams 21st 1st-class ton as India lead by 472 runs on Day 2
news_article: Batsman Hanuma Vihari slammed his 21st first-class century off 188 balls on Day 2 of the second practice game between India and Australia A. Batting first, India posted 194 runs in their first innings and then restricted Australia to 108 runs. Currently, India lead by 472 runs with 386/4 after 90 overs on Day 2 at stumps.

news_headline: Wasn't expecting it: Rahul on being named India vice-captain for Aus tour
news_article: On being named India limited-overs vice-captain against Australia, KL Rahul said that though he wasn't "expecting it", it's a "happy and proud moment". "I am ready for responsibility and challenge and I'll try to do my best for my team," he added. Rohit Sharma has not been included in any of Team India's squads for Australia tour over injury concerns.

news_headline: Pakistan's Fawad Alam scores his second Test hundred 11 years after his first
news_article: Pakistan batsman Fawad Alam on Wednesday scored 102 runs off 269 deliveries against New Zealand in the first Test. It is the 35-year-old's second hundred in Test cricket. His first hundred had come more than 11 years ago in July 2009, when he hit 168(259) against Sri Lanka on debut. The first Test against New Zealand is Alam's sixth Test.

news_headline: Gunaah Hai Yeh: Australian journalist on Rohit, Kohli fans disliking each other
news_article: Australian journalist Chloe-Amanda Bailey took to Twitter to question why Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma fans dislike each other despite both playing for the same team. In her tweet, she used a meme from the film 'Sarfarosh' which read "Gunaah Hai Yeh! (It's a crime)". Reacting to Bailey's post, Wasim Jaffer shared a meme reading "Noticed you copied my style".

news_headline: Shane Warne trolls Rishabh Pant over sunglasses, gets trolled by fans
news_article: Ex-Australia spinner Shane Warne trolled Rishabh Pant over his sunglasses while commentating in Brisbane Test. "Straight out of the service station?" Warne commented on Pant's shades. A journalist tweeted images of Warne wearing different sunglasses, writing, "Warne having the gall to call out anyone's taste in sunglasses." Another wrote, "Some late entries into Warne sunglasses hall of shame."

news_headline: Faulkner jokingly dares Siddle to mankad as bowler warns him for leaving crease early
news_article: During the 20th over of Hobart Hurricanes' innings, Adelaide Strikers captain Peter Siddle stopped in his run-up and warned non-striker batsman James Faulkner for leaving the crease early. Faulkner had almost started running to the striker's end. Reacting to the warning, Faulkner jokingly dared Siddle to mankad him after which the duo shared a laugh together.

news_headline: Whatever you say about Pujara, it will be very less: Sunil Gavaskar
news_article: Ex-India skipper Sunil Gavaskar has said Cheteshwar Pujara's 56-run innings off 211 balls on the final day of the Brisbane Test was extremely important as it gave confidence to his batting partners. "He held the fort together till the second new ball...[it] gave confidence to Rishabh Pant and then you see what happened," Gavaskar added.

news_headline: I don't have an answer: Manjrekar as fan asks why Kohli is unable to score hundreds
news_article: A Team India fan took to Twitter to ask cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar why Virat Kohli is unable to convert his starts into hundreds since 2019. The fan added, "We cannot say that he is not timing the ball well.. so what is actually going wrong?" Responding to him, Manjrekar said, "Good question. So good that I don't have an answer."

news_headline: It's been unfair on Pant, Saha both: Gambhir on Team India playing XI
news_article: After Rishabh Pant was included in the playing XI instead of Wriddhiman Saha for the Melbourne Test, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir asked what will happen if Pant doesn't score in the upcoming Tests. "Would you go back to Saha?" Gambhir asked. "It's been unfair on Pant and Saha both...[management has] picked...players on conditions...you don't do that with wicketkeepers," he stated.

news_headline: KKR & NZ pacer Lockie Ferguson develops fast bowling analytics app with brother
news_article: New Zealand and KKR pacer Lockie Ferguson and his brother Mitch, a software developer, have developed an application called 'Machineroad' with which bowlers can measure their speeds on their smartphones. The app allows bowlers to record their training sessions while providing real-time feedback on lengths and bounce points. "We’re trying to put [the analytics] in someone’s pocket," Lockie said.

news_headline: Ruturaj reveals when he met Dhoni for 1st time, shares 'How it started' meme
news_article: CSK's Ruturaj Gaikwad shared 'How it started, How it's going' meme with photos with MS Dhoni. He revealed he met Dhoni in 2016 during his Ranji debut wherein he had fractured his finger. "He himself came and asked me about how I am," he wrote. Ruturaj added Dhoni talked to him about life after his low scores in IPL 2020.

news_headline: Messi ignored Ronaldo in his votes for Best Men's Player Award, reveals FIFA
news_article: Barcelona forward Lionel Messi didn't vote for Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo for any preference for the Best FIFA Men's Player award, FIFA revealed. Messi chose Neymar, Kylian Mbappé and Robert Lewandowski as his first, second and third choice, respectively. Meanwhile, Ronaldo voted for Messi as his second choice. Lewandowski, whom Ronaldo chose as first preference, eventually won the award.

news_headline: Rajasthan Royals release captain Steve Smith ahead of IPL 2021 auction
news_article: Rajasthan Royals have released their captain Steve Smith ahead of  the IPL 2021 auction. Rajasthan Royals had finished last on the points table in IPL 2020, which had taken place in the UAE. Smith had played all the 14 league matches for the franchise last year, scoring 311 runs at a strike rate of 131.22.

news_headline: Wrestler Narsingh Yadav tests COVID-19 +ve at national camp after Diwali break
news_article: Wrestler Narsingh Yadav along with wrestler Gurpreet Singh and physiotherapist Vishal Rai has tested positive for coronavirus after rejoining the national camp at Sonepat after the Diwali break. All three are reported to be asymptomatic and have been moved to a hospital as a precautionary measure. Meanwhile, a month-long training camp has been sanctioned for Bajrang Punia in the US.

news_headline: There's a process we need to go through: Langer on Smith becoming Aus captain again
news_article: On Matthew Wade being appointed Australia's stand-in captain in Aaron Finch's absence, coach Justin Langer said that the team would go through a "process" before Steve Smith is named captain. Smith's 24-month captaincy ban over the sandpaper scandal ended in March this year. "Smith doing all the right things to show leadership without a title at the moment," Langer added.

news_headline: Warne alleges 'something suspicious' in Natarajan's no-balls, fans criticise him
news_article: Reacting to India pacer T Natarajan bowling eight no-balls in Brisbane Test, ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne said he found it "very odd" that "five of them were off the first ball of an over". Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "This is just lame." "Pretty poor of Warne to indicate Natarajan was...spot-fixing...I hope BCCI takes this up seriously," another wrote.

news_headline: Ashwin trolls former England, Australia cricketers with Team India's 'Champions' photo
news_article: Following India's 2-1 series victory over Australia, Team India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took to Twitter to troll former England and Australian cricketers who had said India won't be able to win the Test series. Ashwin shared a picture which had quotes from the former cricketers. To troll them, he shared the group picture of Team India following their win.

news_headline: Marnus Labuschagne's picture blowing air into bat's grip goes viral
news_article: Australia batsman Marnus Labuschagne's picture blowing air into his bat's grip while batting during the Sydney Test has gone viral. "My grip was wearing out. It was getting too thin. If you blow air into the top of the grip, it actually expands and pushes the grip down," he explained. "It probably didn't look that good on camera," he added.

news_headline: Pujara's innings wore Australia pace attack down: Hogg on Sydney Test
news_article: Talking about the Sydney Test, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said that Cheteshwar Pujara wore Australia's pace attack down by "chewing up balls" in both of his innings. "You could see their pace on the radar dropping off...So well done to Pujara," he added. Pujara scored 50 off 176 balls in his first innings and 77 off 205 balls in second.

news_headline: This will embolden India's resolve: Dasgupta on claims of COVID-19 protocol breach
news_article: Ex-India wicketkeeper Deep Dasgupta has said that the claims of Team India players breaching the COVID-19 bio-security protocols will "further galvanise" the team and "embolden their resolve". "[This is] to distract the attention from the fragile batting of the Australian side. Now, suddenly the focus after the Melbourne Test is not on the Australian side," he added.

news_headline: Which players have been retained by RCB for IPL 2021?
news_article: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) have retained 12 players for IPL 2021 from their 2020 squad. They are Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers, Yuzvendra Chahal, Devdutt Padikkal, Washington Sundar, Mohammed Siraj, Navdeep Saini, Adam Zampa, Shahbaz Ahmed, Josh Philippe, Kane Richardson and Pawan Deshpande. Some prominent players released by RCB include Umesh Yadav, Aaron Finch, Chris Morris and Shivam Dube.

news_headline: Australia end Day 1 of Brisbane Test at 274/5 as Labuschagne slams hundred
news_article: Australia ended the first day of the Brisbane Test against India at 274/5. Marnus Labuschagne smashed 108 runs off 204 balls, which is his fifth Test hundred. Team India debutants T Natarajan and Washington Sundar picked up three wickets between themselves. Meanwhile, fast bowler Navdeep Saini complained of pain in his groin and is currently being monitored.

news_headline: Ball hit my stomach, it made me angry: Pant on scoring 22 in 5 balls to hit ton
news_article: India wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant revealed the reason why he went for his century in the last over of day's play against Australia A. "The first ball...hit...my stomach, it made me angry," he said. "That's when I said to myself, 'Now, I've to try going for...shots'," added Pant, who scored 22 runs off last five deliveries to get to his century.

news_headline: Fans troll pitch being used in NZ-WI Test match after pics go viral
news_article: Several pictures of the green-top pitch being used for the first New Zealand-West Indies Test in Hamilton have gone viral on social media. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "Looks like the groundsmen forgot to make the pitch." Meanwhile, other tweets read, "I wish my lawn looked like that pitch" and "That might be the greenest pitch I've ever seen."

news_headline: How does the WTC points table read after India's 2-1 win over Australia?
news_article: Following their 2-1 Test series victory against Australia, India jumped to the top of the World Test Championship (WTC) points table. India have accumulated 430 points and earned 71.7% points. With the defeat, Australia slipped to the number three position, with 69.2% points earned. Meanwhile, New Zealand are second with 70.0% points earned.

news_headline: Aus should produce pace-friendly wickets for India: Shoaib Akhtar
news_article: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said Australia should prepare fast and bouncy wickets to assist their pace attack against India during the upcoming tour. "It takes two-three innings to control that forward trigger movement in foreign conditions...It will be interesting to see how the pitches will be. The Aussies will come hard at India that is for sure," Akhtar said.

news_headline: Expecting India to come out firing, not have any scars from Adelaide: Lyon
news_article: Ahead of the Boxing Day Test, Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon feels India will "come out firing and not have any scars" from the first Test, when they were dismissed for 36. "I don't think it will be that difficult. You look at the quality of players in the Indian side...Cricket's a new day, new game every time," Lyon said.

news_headline: Latest ICC Test rankings for bowlers out; Ashwin jumps 1 spot, Hazlewood 4
news_article: The ICC on Sunday released the latest rankings for Test bowlers. Australia fast bowler Josh Hazlewood, who recorded the most economical five-wicket haul by an Australian in 73 years after registering figures of 5-3-8-5 against India in the second innings of Adelaide Test, jumped four spots to be ranked fifth. Meanwhile, Ravichandran Ashwin jumped one spot to be ranked ninth.

news_headline: Saliva ban not a major issue in white-ball cricket: Bumrah
news_article: MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah said the ban on saliva for shining the ball isn't a major cause of worry for him while bowling with the white ball. "The ball doesn't swing anyway a lot and the seam movement is also not much in the shortest format... It is a much bigger factor in the red ball format," Bumrah said.

news_headline: Will definitely miss Ishant, yet to decide team combination: Rahane
news_article: India Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane on Tuesday said that pacer Ishant Sharma 'will definitely be missed in Australia' but didn't divulge any information about the playing XI combination ahead of the first Test. "There is another day to go, one more practice session to go, we will sit tomorrow (Wednesday) and discuss what's our combination," Rahane said.

news_headline: I'm in shock: Shane Warne criticises Lyon for his tactics against Pujara
news_article: Ex-Australia spinner Shane Warne has criticised Nathan Lyon for not using an off-side bat-pad fielder for Cheteshwar Pujara on the final day of the Brisbane Test, which India won to clinch the series 2-1. "I just cannot believe it. I'm in shock...Lyon knows how [off-side bat-pad fielder] changes Pujara's game...so why on earth would you not have one?" Warne stated.

news_headline: Car wash worker crashes Italian footballer's ₹3-crore Ferrari, pics surface
news_article: A car wash worker crashed Italy and Genoa goalkeeper Federico Marchetti's £300,000 (₹3-crore) Ferrari after losing control of the car. The worker was supposed to deliver the car to Genoa's training base. He hit five parked cars and crumpled the front of the vehicle into a barrier. "Thank god, no one was hurt," Marchetti wrote on Instagram.

news_headline: All Blacks pay tribute to Maradona ahead of haka war dance, video viral
news_article: Ahead of their ritual pre-match haka war dance against Argentina, All Blacks (New Zealand rugby team) laid down a black jersey adorned with 'Maradona 10' in a tribute to the late football legend. "I never ever get tired of watching the All Blacks’ haka. The tribute to Maradona is icing," a fan tweeted. "Really emotional seeing that," wrote another.

news_headline: India's highest ODI and T20I totals came at the same stadium
news_article: India achieved their highest-ever T20I total by scoring 260/5 against Sri Lanka at the Holkar Stadium in Indore on December 22, 2017. On December 8, 2011, India had achieved their highest-ever ODI total by putting up 418/5 against Windies at the same stadium. India's highest-ever Test total of 759/7d came in December 2016 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.

news_headline: Nehra names his IPL Team of 2020, chooses Suryakumar over Kohli for no. 3
news_article: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra has named his IPL Team of 2020, with KL Rahul and David Warner as openers. Nehra mentioned he is choosing Suryakumar Yadav over Virat Kohli at number three as he scored "impact runs". Other players include AB de Villiers, Ishan Kishan, Hardik Pandya, Jofra Archer, Rashid Khan, Yuzvendra Chahal, Jasprit Bumrah and Ravichandran Ashwin/Mohammad Shami.

news_headline: Paine joins India huddle during racial abuse incident, Langer calls him 'class act'
news_article: Australia captain Tim Paine joined Team India's huddle while the play was briefly stopped over the racial abuse incident during the fourth day of the third Test at Sydney Cricket Ground. Reacting to it, Australia head coach Justin Langer said, "It was nice to have Tim out there when that incident happened today. He's a class act as we know."
