news_headline: Take hands out of pockets, you're playing for India not a club: Yuvraj on Gill's pic
news_article: After Australia-India ODI series concluded, Shubman Gill took to Instagram to share pictures from the third ODI. "Great feeling representing my country," he wrote. Reacting to a picture wherein Gill can be seen standing on the field with his hands in pockets, Yuvraj jokingly wrote, "Take your hands out of pockets, you're playing for India not a club."

news_headline: Cummins, Lyon will cause problems for India on Day 3: Ponting
news_article: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that Australia pacer Pat Cummins and spinner Nathan Lyon will cause "a few" problems for India on the third day of the Sydney Test. "Cummins' spell [on the second day] was as good a fast bowling (spell) as you'll see. He was challenging every ball with just enough sideways movement," he added.

news_headline: Fielder 'flies like Superman' to save 6 in BBL match, video goes viral
news_article: Sydney Sixers' Jordan Silk saved a shot by Hobart Hurricanes' Colin Ingram from going for a six at deep midwicket boundary in a BBL match. Silk dived full length to collect the ball. He caught the ball with his right hand and flicked it back into play a millisecond before falling. Commentator Adam Gilchrist reacted saying, "He flew like Superman."

news_headline: Number 1 or 3, it doesn't matter, I'm ready to face ball: Labuschagne on India Tests
news_article: Amid talks that he might open for Australia in the first Test against India, Marnus Labuschagne said it doesn't matter where he'll bat, he's "ready to face the ball". "If the team needs me to open, that's what I will do...it's about winning games," he added. Both David Warner and Will Pucovski have been ruled out of the first Test.

news_headline: Really happy that Aus are coming up with a plan against me: Iyer
news_article: India batsman Shreyas Iyer, who was dismissed for 2 runs in the first ODI and 38 runs in the second, has said that he's really happy that Australia are coming up with a plan against him. "I feel overwhelmed and take it as a challenge. But I thrive under pressure and it motivates me to go against them," he added.

news_headline: Cristiano Ronaldo scores twice on return from coronavirus in Juventus win
news_article: Cristiano Ronaldo scored three minutes after coming on as a substitute before converting a penalty to lead Juventus to a 4-1 Serie A victory against Spezia. The match was Ronaldo's first since recovering from coronavirus. Ronaldo shared pictures from the match on Instagram, writing, "Happy to be back and help the team with two goals! Well done team."

news_headline: India are playing timidly, lacking aggressive approach: Vaughan
news_article: Talking about Team India's performance in the ongoing Australia tour, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said that the Virat Kohli-led side is playing "timidly". "It's a little bit back the innings when [India] play consistently. They've got enough talent to go out for it a little bit early and a bit harder," he added. India lost the three-match ODI series 1-2.

news_headline: 'At least you’ll play one game': Lyon recalls father's reaction to Test debut
news_article: Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon, who is currently playing his 100th Test, recalled the reaction his father had to the news that his son would play a Test for Australia back in 2011. "I called mum and dad...I said, 'Dad you won’t believe this...I'm making my debut.' He goes, 'That’s all right, at least you’ll play one game'," Lyon said.

news_headline: We can win three matches in a row to lift maiden IPL title: De Villiers
news_article: After RCB qualified for the playoffs despite four back-to-back defeats, AB de Villiers is confident that his team can win three consecutive matches for their first IPL triumph. "Now, after four consecutive defeats, can we regain our winning momentum. Can we win the three matches that stand between us and a first IPL title? Yes, we can," De Villiers said.

news_headline: It has been a tough year, I haven't seen home in 6 months now: WI captain Holder
news_article: Following their 0-2 Test series defeat against New Zealand, West Indies captain Jason Holder said, "It has been a tough year...I haven’t seen home in six months now." He added, "I've been going non-stop. We've had pay cuts." Talking about "going from bubble to bubble" amid coronavirus pandemic, Holder said, "The room just gets smaller and smaller by the second."

news_headline: Harbhajan Singh and CSK part ways ahead of IPL 2021
news_article: Veteran off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to reveal that his contract with CSK has come to an end. "Playing for this team was a great experience...beautiful memories made and some great friends which I will remember fondly for years to come," he wrote. He added, "Thank you CSK management, staff and fans for a wonderful two years...All the best."

news_headline: Kohli is the most Australian non-Australian cricketer of all time: Greg Chappell
news_article: Former Team India head coach Greg Chappell has said that Virat Kohli is the most Australian non-Australian cricketer of all time. He added, "Kohli embodies the new India. As the premier player and captain of the world’s pre-eminent cricket power, he feels an abiding responsibility to the wider game." Chappell stated, "Kohli does not believe in passive resistance."

news_headline: WI's Gabriel caught saying 'F**k you' to teammate for dropping catch, video viral
news_article: West Indies fast bowler Shannon Gabriel was caught saying "F**k you" to Darren Bravo for dropping a catch on the first day of the second Test against New Zealand on Friday. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "He sneezed...I heard, 'ha chew'." Meanwhile, another fan wrote, "There goes the match fee...brutal."

news_headline: This half Indian team is better than fully-fit Australia: Akhtar
news_article: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar feels the Indian team playing the fourth Test, which is missing many of its senior players due to injuries, 'is better than the fully-fit Australian side'. "Inexperienced Indian players are up against a ball of fire but they are making sure that Australia is being tested...They're fighting. This is the character I'm talking about," said Akhtar.

news_headline: Inzamam criticises Waqar Younis for calling Babar Azam's injury 'major setback'
news_article: Former Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has criticised Pakistan bowling coach Waqar Younis for saying that Babar Azam's injury came "at the wrong time" and that it is a "major setback" for them. "I don’t think the management should say that we are concerned, as it sends out a message to the opposition that our morale is down," Inzamam said.

news_headline: You are welcome to have your child in Australia: Brett Lee to Virat Kohli
news_article: Former Australia fast bowler Brett Lee, in a message to Team India captain Virat Kohli, said, "If you would like to Mr Kohli, you are welcome to have your child in Australia." He added, "If you have a little girl, fantastic. If you have a little boy, fantastic. They might become a Baggy Green."

news_headline: Washington was disciplined, filled Ashwin's role quite well: Aus assistant coach
news_article: After Australia were bundled out for 369 runs in their first innings at The Gabba, their assistant coach Andrew McDonald said that Indian bowlers applied pressure throughout the innings made scoring difficult for the hosts. "I thought Washington Sundar, in particular, was disciplined and [he filled] that role of Ravichandran Ashwin quite well and kept it tight," he added.

news_headline: All rules are applicable to everyone else other than Kohli: Sehwag on team changes
news_article: Criticising "frequent" changes made in Team India by captain Virat Kohli, former India opener Virender Sehwag said, "All the rules are applicable to everyone else other than Kohli, no rule is applicable to him." He added, "Neither his batting order is changed nor is he left out or given break when he is out of form. So, that is wrong.”

news_headline: Pollard will always be my inspiration: Hardik after last-over win vs Aus
news_article: After guiding India to a last-over win against Australia in the 2nd T20I, all-rounder Hardik Pandya said he always draws his inspiration from his Mumbai Indians teammate Kieron Pollard. Hardik said, "Pollard has done it many times for his country and franchise." Hardik scored an unbeaten 22-ball 42, including two last-over sixes to help India take an unassailable 2-0 lead.

news_headline: Cavani incident shows players need more education: Man Utd manager Solskjaer
news_article: Talking about striker Edinson Cavani's social media post in which he used the term 'negrito', Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said that the term is used in a "different affection" in Uruguay than in England. "All players coming from different cultures should be educated and Edinson has learnt the hard way," he stated.

news_headline: Completely opposed to racism: Cavani apologises for racist post
news_article: Manchester United footballer Edinson Cavani apologised and deleted a racist social media post, saying he is "completely opposed to racism". Cavani added, " The last thing I wanted to do was cause offence to anyone...[I] deleted the message as soon as it was explained that it can be interpreted differently." Cavani had used the term 'negrito' in his Instagram post.

news_headline: No confinement to hotel rooms: Cricket Australia on Sydney, Brisbane bubble rules
news_article: Amid the controversy over alleged breach of bio-bubble rules by some Indian cricketers in Melbourne, Cricket Australia has issued a clarification on the bio-bubble protocols in Sydney and Brisbane. It said that the players would not be bound to their respective hotel rooms. The players would be allowed to use the entire hotel's facility and the training grounds.

news_headline: India ruled 1 over short of target in 3rd T20I, players fined 20% of match fee
news_article: Team India players have been fined 20% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against Australia in the third T20I on Tuesday. The sanctions were imposed by the match referee David Boon who ruled Virat Kohli-led side to be one over short of the target. India players were also fined 20% of match fee in the first ODI.

news_headline: Ajay Jadeja says 'I am worried about the baby' after Kohli drops catch, criticised
news_article: While talking about Virat Kohli dropping a catch in the second T20I against Australia, Ajay Jadeja told the Sony Ten Network, "I am not worried about the Indian team but the baby arriving."  Criticising Jadeja, a fan tagged BCCI President Sourav Ganguly and tweeted, "Don't you think it is wrong to constantly drag players and their personal lives?"

news_headline: Rahul deserves a chance, should bat at No. 6 in Tests : Brad Hogg
news_article: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg feels KL Rahul should be given another chance in the longer format after a disappointing Australia tour in 2018-19. "He is confident, he is raring to go, and I think he will be the perfect number 6 for India," Hogg said. He believes after Virat's departure Shubman Gill should bat at number 4 in Tests.

news_headline: Starc to rejoin Aus Test Squad, will be available for 1st Test vs India
news_article: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc will be rejoining the team on Monday and will be available for selection for the first Test against India, starting December 17. Cricket Australia confirmed that Starc will travel to Adelaide with other teammates and Team India in a charter flight on Monday. Starc had opted out of the T20 series due to a family illness.

news_headline: Vaughan calls India's fielding 'atrocious' in 3rd T20I vs Australia
news_article: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan called India's fielding in the third T20I against Australia "atrocious". Earlier, former India captain Mohammed Azharuddin had said that there's a "drop in the concentration levels" of Team India players. In the third T20I, India failed to chase down Australia's 186-run total and lost the match by 12 runs. India won the series 2-1.

news_headline: Ravi Shastri delivers dressing room speech after historic win, BCCI shares video
news_article: The BCCI has shared a video of Team India head coach Ravi Shastri delivering a speech to the team in the dressing room after their historic win at the Gabba. "Today, forget India, the whole world will stand up and salute you," Shastri said. "You will be known as the ultimate warrior," he said addressing Cheteshwar Pujara.

news_headline: Akhtar names his pick between Dravid and Sachin for Test batsman
news_article: During a question-answer session on Twitter, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar was asked to pick Test batsman between former India cricketers Rahul Dravid and Sachin Tendulkar. Replying to the user, Akhtar named Rahul Dravid. On being asked to name the best all-format batsman, Akhtar took the name of India captain Virat Kohli and Pakistan skipper Babar Azam.

news_headline: Two players test COVID-19 positive at Australian Open qualifying event
news_article: Two players withdrew from Australian Open qualifying tournament in Doha in Qatar and are into hotel quarantine after testing positive for COVID-19, Tennis Australia confirmed. America's Denis Kudla and Francisco Cerundolo of Argentina won their respective first-round matches before they were withdrawn. The withdrawals mean both their opponents got walkovers into the third round of the event.

news_headline: We do not want to raise a child in the public eye: Anushka Sharma
news_article: Actress Anushka Sharma, who is due to deliver her first child in January, has said she and her husband, Team India captain Virat Kohli, do not want to raise a child in the public eye. She added, "We don’t plan on engaging our child in social media. I think it’s a decision your child should be able to take."

news_headline: Started missing my father: Siraj reveals reason behind crying during National Anthem
news_article: Team India fast bowler Mohammed Siraj, who broke down in tears during the National Anthem ahead of the third Test against Australia, said that he cried because he started missing his father. "I got very emotional. My father wanted to see his son play Test cricket. If he had been alive, he would have seen me play," Siraj added.

news_headline: Got to know 10-15 mins before our bowling that I'll play: Chahal
news_article: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who replaced Ravindra Jadeja as concussion substitute in the first T20I against Australia, was named Man of the Match for registering bowling figures of 4-0-25-3. Talking in the post-match conference, Chahal revealed that he got to know 10-15 minutes before Australia's innings that he'll play. "I've played so many games and was mentally fit," he added.

news_headline: Kuldeep can be India's game-changer with pink ball: Pragyan Ojha
news_article: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has backed Kuldeep Yadav to be India's game-changer with the pink ball ahead of the Day-Night Test in Australia. "In domestic pink-ball tournaments, he was successful. Batsmen were finding it difficult to pick him. Especially during the twilight period, batsmen were struggling to read him," Ojha said. "That's when he picked up maximum wickets," he added.

news_headline: Jadeja ruled out of remaining T20Is against Australia due to concussion
news_article: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the remaining T20Is against Australia after sustaining a concussion while batting in the first T20I in Canberra. "Jadeja remains under observation and will be taken for further scans if required based on the assessment on Saturday morning," the BCCI said. Fast bowler Shardul Thakur has been named as his replacement.

news_headline: Michael Schumacher's son Mick to race for Haas in 2021 F1 season
news_article: Mick Schumacher, son of seven-time world champion Michael Schumacher, will be racing for Haas in the next Formula One season. The 21-year-old German signed a multi-year agreement and will partner Russian Nikita Mazepin. "The prospect of being on the Formula One grid next year makes me incredibly happy...I'm simply speechless," said Mick. He is currently leading the Formula Two championship.

news_headline: 1st tied Test match was caused by direct hit off penultimate ball
news_article: Australia needed one run off two balls with one wicket remaining when Windies' Joe Solomon's direct hit resulted in the first-ever tied Test. The match's last over, consisting of eight balls, involved a leg-bye, bye, caught behind, dropped catch and two run-outs. The first-ever tied Test ended on December 14, 1960, almost 84 years since the first Test in 1877.

news_headline: How many Day-Night Tests have been played so far and which team has won the most?
news_article: A total of 14 Day-Night Test matches have been played so far, with each of the match producing a result. Australia have played the most number of Day-Night Tests (seven) and have won each of the seven matches. India have played one Day-Night Test so far, which they won against Bangladesh at Kolkata's Eden Gardens in November 2019.

news_headline: Women boxers Simranjeet, Manisha bag gold for India at World Cup in Germany
news_article: India's Simranjeet Kaur and Manisha Moun won gold in the women's 60kg and 57kg category respectively at the Boxing World Cup in Cologne in Germany. While Manisha beat India's Sakshi 3-2, Simranjeet got the better of Germany's Maya Klienhans 4-1. India finished second in the medal tally after claiming three gold, two silver and four bronze medals in the competition.

news_headline: Natarajan was picked as net bowler, he turned opportunity into golden one: Shastri
news_article: Team India head coach Ravi Shastri said that pacer T Natarajan was picked as a net bowler for the Australia tour and the 29-year-old got an opportunity which he turned into a golden one. "He's got a long journey ahead of him," he added. Natarajan debuted in the third ODI and then featured in the T20I series, picking 6 wickets.

news_headline: I think India have been the best team in this series: Shane Warne
news_article: Former Australia spinner Shane Warne feels India have been the "best team" in the ongoing four-match Test series against Australia. "I think Australia have had so many opportunities to win this series, they just haven't taken them...At times their tactics haven't been good enough," Warne said. Team India lost many players due to injuries during the series.

news_headline: Juhi Chawla prays for KKR during CSK's run chase, picture goes viral
news_article: Bollywood actress and Kolkata Knight Riders' (KKR) co-owner Juhi Chawla was spotted praying at the Dubai stadium on Thursday night during the final over of Chennai Super Kings' run chase. Pictures of her praying have gone viral on social media. However, CSK beat KKR by six wickets after successfully chasing down the target of 173 runs.

news_headline: ICC issues clarification over New Zealand's Test ranking after win vs Pakistan
news_article: The ICC has issued a clarification after several reports, including that of the official broadcaster of New Zealand-Pakistan Test series, stated New Zealand have become the number one side after winning the first Test. "New Zealand move closer to the number one spot in...ICC Test team rankings...They'll confirm their place at the top if they win the series," ICC stated.

news_headline: Perfect role model but Virat's captaincy still work-in-progress: Laxman
news_article: Ex-India cricketer VVS Laxman said captain Virat Kohli leads by example but there is scope for improvement as far as his captaincy is concerned. "He's a perfect role model of how a captain should be. There's still work-in-progress as far as captaincy is concerned," Laxman said. He added that he feels Virat does become little defensive, especially with field changes.

news_headline: Umpires should call dead ball if a batsman tries to play a switch hit: Ian Chappell
news_article: Former Australia captain Ian Chappell has said that the umpires should call the ball dead if a batsman tries to play a switch hit. He added, "The square-leg umpire is already paying close attention to the batsman's feet...If a batsman changes the order of his feet, then the square-leg umpire ought to simply declare the ball dead."

news_headline: Rahane held the team together during the Test series in 2018-19: Paine
news_article: Australia Test captain Tim Paine credited Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane for keeping Virat Kohli-led Team India together during their previous Test series in Australia in 2018-19. "He (Rahane) was the glue last time around so he is a huge focus for us," said Paine. This time around Rahane would captain the side once Virat flies back after the first Test.

news_headline: Cristiano Ronaldo recovers from coronavirus after 19 days
news_article: Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo has tested negative for coronavirus after nearly three weeks, the club has announced. Ronaldo first tested positive on October 13 and had since been in quarantine at his home in Turin. He missed Juventus' draws with Crotone and Hellas Verona in Serie A and a loss to Barcelona in the Champions League group stage.

news_headline: Manchester United exit Champions League after loss against RB Leipzig
news_article: A 3-2 loss to RB Leipzig in the Group H encounter on Tuesday knocked Manchester United out of the Champions League. Due to the loss, United finished third in Group H with nine points from six matches while Leipzig and PSG progressed to Round of 16. United needed at least a draw against Leipzig to progress to the knockout stages.

news_headline: Green ruled out of practice match after being hit on head while bowling
news_article: Australia all-rounder Cameron Green has been substituted out of the second practice match between India A and Australia A with a concussion after being hit on the head while bowling. The 21-year-old was likely to debut against India in the first Test, starting December 17. Australia's Will Pucovski had suffered a concussion in the first practice match.

news_headline: Egg on my face over here: Vaughan after his India series prediction goes wrong
news_article: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan, who had predicted that Australia will beat India 4-0 in the Test series, took to Twitter to react after India won the series 2-1. "Wow...That has to go down as one of the greatest if not the greatest Test victory of all time," he wrote. "Egg on my face over here in the UK," he added.

news_headline: Paine teases Labuschagne over remarks by Warne, Symonds; caught on stump mic
news_article: Australia captain Tim Paine was caught on stump mic teasing Marnus Labuschagne over remarks by ex-cricketers Shane Warne and Andrew Symonds. "When you're hundred Tests in and I am commentating, it'll be exactly the same. I'm going to be sitting with Symonds and Warne saying the same thing...'hog pile him'," Paine said. Warne and Symonds had mocked Labuschagne's batting style.

news_headline: You don't need housekeeping or room service to motivate yourself: India batting coach
news_article: Team India batting coach Vikram Rathour has suggested that the problems in the Brisbane hotel didn't for once affect their focus on the Test match ahead. "We are playing Australia in Australia against one of the better attacks in the world. So I think motivation is there. You don't need housekeeping or room service to motivate yourself," he said.

news_headline: Shardul, Sundar's fifties help India score 336; Australia lead by 54 runs after Day 3
news_article: Australia ended the third day of Brisbane Test at 21/0 in the second innings, leading India by 54 runs. Earlier, Washington Sundar and Shardul Thakur put on a partnership of 123 runs off 217 balls, India's highest partnership for the seventh wicket at the Gabba. The duo also scored their maiden fifties in Test cricket, helping India score 336.

news_headline: Virat Kohli has never lost a Test match after winning toss
news_article: Team India captain Virat Kohli has never lost a Test match after winning a toss. Kohli has won 25 tosses in Test cricket so far and has led India to 21 victories and four draws in those matches. India won the toss and elected to bat first against Australia in the Day-Night Test in Adelaide today.

news_headline: Will forever be grateful, will never forget the sacrifices: Cricket Aus to BCCI
news_article: In an open letter, Cricket Australia (CA) thanked BCCI on Wednesday for their cooperation amid the global pandemic to 'help deliver a series that brought joy to millions'. "Australian cricket will forever be grateful to BCCI for their friendship, trust and commitment...We will never forget the sacrifices made by our friends at BCCI that made all this possible," CA wrote.

news_headline: If we can travel and stay in quarantine, why can't umpires: Holder
news_article: West Indies Test captain Jason Holder feels that just like cricketers, overseas umpires should also travel and do the quarantine. "I still don't understand a situation where we're just having home umpires. If players are making the sacrifice and going on the road and continuing cricket then I feel as though the umpires should do the same," said Holder.

news_headline: Yuvraj named in Punjab's 30-man probable squad for Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy
news_article: Yuvraj Singh has been named in Punjab's 30-man probable squad for the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 tournament. Yuvraj who turned 39 recently, has reportedly been training regularly in Mohali. However, the former India all-rounder, who had announced his retirement from all forms of cricket last year, is yet to receive approval from BCCI President Sourav Ganguly.

news_headline: Babar Azam's ex-classmate, who accused him of rape, alleges murder attempt
news_article: Pakistan captain Babar Azam's ex-classmate, who had accused the cricketer of sexually and financially abusing her for 10 years, has filed a police complaint alleging a murder attempt. She claimed armed men opened fire at her vehicle. "My life is in danger. I've been receiving death threats for days," she said and asked Pakistan PM Imran Khan to provide protection.

news_headline: You don’t want to be in both dressing rooms when Rishabh Pant bats: Ashwin
news_article: Talking about wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant's batting, India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said, "He's quite electrical. His knock set us up [in Sydney Test]." "You don’t want to be in both dressing rooms when he bats," he added. Ashwin further said, "Opposition dressing room would be hoping for a wicket, and we'd be sitting and thinking he shouldn’t play a rash shot."

news_headline: How does the WTC points table read after NZ's 2-0 win over Pakistan?
news_article: New Zealand defeated Pakistan by an innings and 176 runs in the second Test to register a 2-0 whitewash in the two-match Test series. New Zealand have now accumulated 420 points from 11 matches and are third on the World Test Championship points table, with 70.0% points earned. Pakistan are sixth on the points table, with 30.7% points earned.

news_headline: Kohli's post announcing Anushka's pregnancy most liked tweet in India in 2020
news_article: Team India captain Virat Kohli's post from August announcing his wife, actress Anushka Sharma's pregnancy is the most liked tweet in India in 2020, with over 6.4 lakh likes. Actor Amitabh Bachchan's tweet from July confirming he was COVID-19 positive is the most quoted tweet of 2020. The most retweeted tweet is actor Vijay's selfie with fans from February.

news_headline: I’m getting out as soon as my blood is getting hot: Andre Russell
news_article: KKR all-rounder Andre Russell, who returned from an injury against RR on Sunday, attributed his poor run with the bat this season to his inability to convert starts. "As soon as I start to sweat and my blood's getting hot, I'm ready to go, you know, I get out," Russell said. Against RR, Russell smashed three sixes for 11-ball 25.

news_headline: Ruturaj Gaikwad is a young superstar in the making: Watson
news_article: Praising teammate Ruturaj Gaikwad, CSK's Shane Watson said that the 23-year-old is a "young superstar in the making". "He's so calm and composed at the crease. And the shots that he plays, not premeditating anything, wherever the ball is bowled, he takes the game on. It has been an absolute pleasure to be able to bat [with him]," Watson stated.

news_headline: Pak denied training rights in NZ after 8 squad members test COVID-19 +ve
news_article: New Zealand's Ministry of Health on Friday withdrew Pakistan cricket team's exemption to train during managed isolation in Christchurch. This comes after eight members of the 53-strong Pakistan squad tested positive for coronavirus since arriving in New Zealand. The Pakistan squad was also warned for breaching bio-security regulations last week.

news_headline: Pujara victim of racism at Yorkshire, was called 'Steve' by players: Ex-staff member
news_article: Ex-employee of county side Yorkshire Taj Butt has suggested that India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara was a victim of racism at the club. "They called every person of colour 'Steve'. Even Pujara...was called Steve because they couldn't pronounce his name," he said. This comes amid ongoing investigations into ex-England U-19 captain Azeem Rafiq's allegations of "institutional racism" at Yorkshire.

news_headline: Aus must be frustrated but fair on India to use concussion sub: Gambhir
news_article: On Yuzvendra Chahal replacing Ravindra Jadeja in Canberra T20I as concussion substitute, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said that it was fair on India to use the concussion rule. "I understand that Australia must be frustrated...[but] If there's a concussion, and there is a concussion rule, why not use it...India used it to the best of their advantage," he added.

news_headline: Hopefully you don't have to bat and show your talent again: Karthik to Shardul
news_article: With Team India needing 324 runs on the final day to win the Brisbane and clinch series 2-1, Dinesh Karthik tweeted that "hopefully" Team India will not need pacer Shardul Thakur to bat and save the match. Karthik also praised the 29-year-old for picking seven wickets in the match, three in Australia's first innings and four in second.

news_headline: Our batsmen weren't brave enough: Virat Kohli after losing to SRH
news_article: After the five-wicket loss against SRH, captain Virat Kohli said RCB weren't brave with the bat to put up enough runs to defend. "It (a target of 121) was never enough... I thought we weren't brave enough with the bat throughout the innings," Kohli said. "The situation is straightforward: win the last game and finish in top two," Kohli added.

news_headline: Rohit, Pant need to play the game that got them to Test level: Gavaskar on Day 5
news_article: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that Rohit Sharma and Rishabh Pant need to play the game that got them to the Test level on the final day of the Brisbane Test. "They just need to be a little careful about their shot selection," he added. India need 324 runs to win the match and clinch the 4-Test series 2-1.

news_headline: How has India's head-to-head record been against Australia in Tests at SCG?
news_article: India and Australia have played a total of 12 Test matches between them at Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG). Australia have beaten India five times in Tests at SCG, while six Australia-India Test matches have ended in a draw at the stadium. India's only Test victory against Australia at SCG had come in January 1978.

news_headline: Get a life: Dodda Ganesh to trolls for linking Ganguly's heart attack with oil ad
news_article: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh has criticised trolls for linking Sourav Ganguly's heart attack with a refined oil advertisement the BCCI President had done. "No cooking oil can guarantee you...good healthy heart. People who're using Ganguly's present medical condition to take the mickey out of him and drawing pleasure...need to get a life...Heart attack can happen to anyone. Period," he tweeted.

news_headline: Supriyo tweets 'Hanuma Bihari has murdered cricket', Vihari corrects spelling
news_article: Singer-politician Babul Supriyo took to Twitter to criticise Team India batsman Hanuma Vihari's batting in the fourth innings of the Sydney Test. "Playing 109 balls to score 7! That is atrocious....Hanuma Bihari has not only killed any Chance for India to achieve a historic win but has also murdered Cricket," he wrote. Vihari responded to his tweet by writing, "Vihari*."

news_headline: Rahane's calmness really provided us stability: Ashwin
news_article: Talking about the MCG Test win, Ravichandran Ashwin said that Ajinkya Rahane's calmness provided the team with the stability to "express themselves" in the game. "Getting bowled out for 36 was never going to be easy. We're quite a proud cricketing country and losing Virat Kohli was a bit of a setback...but we stuck on really well," he added.

news_headline: Afghanistan spinner Mujeeb tests COVID-19 +ve in Australia hotel, hospitalised
news_article: Afghanistan's 19-year-old spinner Mujeeb Ur Rahman has been hospitalised after testing COVID-19 positive at Voco Hotel in Surfers Paradise in Australia's Queensland. Mujeeb had travelled to Australia from Kabul last week to be a part of Brisbane Heat for this year's BBL. He reported symptoms during his mandatory quarantine period this week.

news_headline: Former wicket-keeper Luke Ronchi appointed New Zealand batting coach
news_article: New Zealand Cricket appointed former wicket-keeper Luke Ronchi as their full-time batting coach. He played four tests, 81 ODIs and 30 T20Is for New Zealand between 2013 and 2017 but he started his international career with Australia, playing 4 ODIs and 3 T20Is in 2008. Ronchi was part of the New Zealand coaching staff at the 2019 ICC World Cup.

news_headline: Umpire's Call not ideal but it doesn't bother me: Tim Paine
news_article: Australia Test captain Tim Paine said the provision of Umpire's Call in the Decision Review System (DRS) isn't ideal but his team is okay with it. "It doesn't bother me to be honest, there is so much talk about it whether we like it or we don't. It's irrelevant...while it's there, teams are going to use it," said Paine.

news_headline: Neesham trolls Williamson over celebration after scoring double century, shares pic
news_article: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham took to Twitter to troll Kane Williamson over his celebration after scoring double century against West Indies in first Test. Posting a picture wherein Williamson can be seen raising both his hands with a "serious" face, Neesham wrote, "'Sorry guys...I didn’t really want to do that but it’s my job so I kinda had to'."

news_headline: Latest ICC rankings for Test batsmen out; Kohli and Smith swap spots
news_article: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batsmen following the India-Australia Sydney Test. Australia batsman Steve Smith jumped one spot to be ranked second, while Team India captain Virat Kohli dropped a spot to be ranked third. Meanwhile, India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara jumped two places and is now ranked eighth, while stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane is seventh.

news_headline: PSG manager Mauricio Pochettino tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Mauricio Pochettino, the newly-appointed manager of Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) has tested positive for COVID-19, the club announced on Friday. "He will therefore enter isolation and is subject to the appropriate health protocols," PSG said. His assistants Jesus Perez and Miguel D'Agostino managed the side on Saturday against Angers. PSG currently top the French League 1 table after 20 matches.

news_headline: India will have to score a lot of runs to win Tests in Australia: Gavaskar
news_article: Former India opener Sunil Gavaskar has said that India will have to score a lot of runs in Australia if they want to repeat their series win from 2018-19. "We all talk about the fact that you need to take 20 wickets to win matches. But, unless you also score runs along with it, you don't win matches," he stated.

news_headline: Not at all surprised: Laxman on Williamson's 3rd ton in 3 Tests
news_article: Reacting to New Zealand captain Kane Williamson's third ton in as many Tests, former India batsman VVS Laxman said that he's "not at all surprised" by Williamson's consistency. "Unbelievable work ethics and attention to detail while preparing for any match are the reasons behind his success," Laxman tweeted. Williamson scored 251 against West Indies, 129 in first Test against Pakistan.

news_headline: KXIP look different since Chris Gayle's inclusion: Graeme Swann
news_article: Former England cricketer Graeme Swann has said that since the inclusion of Chris Gayle in the playing XI of the KXIP, the franchise has looked like a "completely different" team. KXIP have won five matches in a row after Gayle's inclusion after having lost six of their seven matches. Currently, KXIP are fourth in IPL points table with 12 points.

news_headline: Mercedes bag record 7th F1 constructors’ title as Hamilton wins at Imola
news_article: Mercedes secured their record-breaking seventh consecutive constructors' title on Sunday as Lewis Hamilton won the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix at Imola in Italy. Hamilton beat his Mercedes teammate Valtteri Bottas by 5.7 seconds. "What an incredible achievement for all of you. I am so proud of everybody and I am so grateful to be a part of it," Hamilton said.

news_headline: Finch names 3 players who can replace David Warner in 3rd ODI
news_article: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has named Alex Carey, Marnus Labuschagne and Matthew Wade as the possible players who can replace injured David Warner as opener in the third ODI against India. "Any team Warner is not a part of is going to be slightly weaker but we have got guys that can...really contribute heavily in that role," Finch added.

news_headline: Aus have Warner, Smith, Labuschagne this time: Tendulkar on Test series
news_article: Talking about the upcoming India-Australia Test series, Sachin Tendulkar said that the hosts have got three "important players" this time from the last time they played India. "They have got David Warner who is back in the team, Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne," he stated. "This is a far better squad compared to the earlier one," he added.

news_headline: Hardik needs to keep getting better: Virat Kohli
news_article: Captain Virat Kohli said Hardik Pandya is now playing the finisher's role for Team India and thus he needs to keep getting better. "He [Pandya] realises that this is his time, the next four-five years, to become that bankable middle-order player that can win you games from anywhere," Virat said. Hardik scored 22-ball 42 in the 2nd T20I against Australia.

news_headline: Which sportspersons earned the most in 2020 as per Forbes?
news_article: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer is the highest-paid sportsperson of 2020 with $106.3-million earnings, as per Forbes' highest-paid celebrities list. He is followed by Cristiano Ronaldo ($105 million) and Lionel Messi ($104 million). PSG forward Neymar is next with $95.5-million earnings. LA Lakers' LeBron James is fifth-highest paid athlete with $88.2-million earnings.

news_headline: Bit of a relief for us to get rid of Rohit: Aus coach Langer on Day 4
news_article: Australia coach Justin Langer said Pat Cummins dismissing Rohit Sharma on the fourth day of the Sydney Test is a "bit of a relief for them". "If [he's] out there, [he's] going to keep scoring runs quickly," Langer added. Rohit got out after scoring 52 off 98 balls with India ending the day at 98/2, needing 309 runs to win.

news_headline: Party nahi chalegi till 6 in the morning: Police on catching celebs at pub at 3 am
news_article: After celebrities like Suresh Raina and Guru Randhawa were caught at a nightclub in Mumbai's Andheri at 3 am following a raid, the Mumbai Police tweeted, "Party (Nahin) Chalegi Till Six In The Morning!" It added, "Action has been initiated against 34 people, out of which 19 were from Delhi and Punjab, including some celebrities #NewNormal."

news_headline: Lyon builds pressure, he'll be a massive threat for India: Ponting
news_article: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that spinner Nathan Lyon, who gave 68 runs in his 21 overs during India's first innings at Adelaide, will be a "massive threat" for the visitors. "Lyon looked like he troubled Pujara...He builds pressure, he bowls very few bad balls," Ponting added. Lyon has picked 390 wickets in 96 Tests.

news_headline: Rahane took blows on his body while preparing for Aus tour: Pravin Amre
news_article: Ex-India cricketer Pravin Amre said India's stand-in-captain Ajinkya Rahane took blows on his body during practice sessions before the Australia tour. "He was aware that there will be sessions in Australia where he has to take blows on his body to survive that session," Amre said. He added that Rahane also worked on reducing his reaction time before reaching Australia.

news_headline: Which Team India players got injured during the Test series against Australia?
news_article: Mohammad Shami, Umesh Yadav, KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja were ruled out during the course of the Test series against Australia after suffering injuries. Cheteshwar Pujara, Hanuma Vihari, Ravichandran Ashwin and Rishabh Pant batted in Sydney Test's fourth innings despite being injured. Mayank Agarwal was taken for scans after injuring his finger, while Jasprit Bumrah suffered abdominal strain.

news_headline: Hardik Pandya pens note for his late father, shares pics
news_article: Cricketer Hardik Pandya took to Instagram to pen a note for his father Himanshu Pandya, who passed away due to a heart attack on Saturday. "Your sons are standing where they are right now only because of you, your hard work, your self-belief and [that] you were always happy," he wrote. "Rest in peace my king," he added.

news_headline: The short run has come back to bite us very hard: Rahul on KXIP's elimination
news_article: After KXIP failed to make it to IPL 2020 playoffs, captain KL Rahul said, "A lot could've been different." He added, "The short run [decision in the first match], looking back at it, it has come back to bite us very hard." During KXIP's match against DC, the umpire declared short run despite the batsman making it to the crease.

news_headline: India end Australia's 32-year unbeaten streak at the Gabba, win Test series 2-1
news_article: India today ended Australia's 32-year unbeaten streak at the Gabba in Brisbane to win the four-match series 2-1. India chased down the target of 328, which is the highest successful run chase in Test cricket at the Gabba. The previous highest successful run chase at the Gabba had come in November 1951, when Australia chased down 236 against West Indies.

news_headline: Latest Test rankings out, NZ become number one team for the first time in history
news_article: The ICC released the latest Test rankings after New Zealand defeated Pakistan by an innings and 176 runs in the second Test to register a 2-0 series whitewash. New Zealand have displaced Australia from the top of the rankings to become the top-ranked team for the first time in history. New Zealand have now won six consecutive Test matches.

news_headline: Rahane becomes inaugural winner of Mullagh Medal, BCCI shares pic
news_article: India stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane became the inaugural winner of the Mullagh Medal as he won Man of the Match award in the Boxing Day Test. The BCCI shared the picture of Rahane wearing the medal. The award is named after Johnny Mullagh, who was the captain of the 1868 cricket team, the first Australian sporting team to tour internationally.

news_headline: India end their 7-match losing streak as Australia lose ODI in Canberra for 1st time
news_article: India defeated Australia by 13 runs in the third ODI in Canberra on Wednesday to end their seven-match losing streak in international cricket across all formats. This is the first time that Australia have lost an ODI in Canberra. Hardik Pandya top-scored for India in the match with 92*(76). The three-match Australia-India T20I series will begin on Friday.

news_headline: Ganguly will continue to be our brand ambassador: Adani Wilmar Dy CEO on Fortune oil ads
news_article: After Adani Wilmar removed all ads of its Fortune Rice Bran cooking oil featuring Sourav Ganguly across platforms, its Deputy CEO Angshu Mallick said that a "temporary break" has been taken and Ganguly will continue to be their brand ambassador. Social media users had trolled the ad campaign for promoting heart health after Ganguly suffered a mild cardiac arrest.

news_headline: India end Day 1 of their first-ever Day-Night Test on Australian soil at 233/6
news_article: After winning the toss and deciding to bat first, India ended the first day of their first-ever Day-Night Test on Australia soil at 233/6. Team India captain Virat Kohli top-scored on the day with 74 runs. He was run-out in the 77th over after a mix-up with Ajinkya Rahane. Mitchell Starc picked up two wickets for Australia.

news_headline: Ben Stokes shares pics of 'Teams of the Decade' caps he received, trolls ICC
news_article: England all-rounder Ben Stokes took to Instagram to share pictures of caps he received for being named in the ICC ODI Team of the Decade and the ICC Test Team of the Decade. Trolling ICC, he captioned his post, "Very proud of both these caps, one of them just doesn't seem right, it's a bit BAGGY and GREEN...thanks ICC."

news_headline: Crowd abuses Mohammed Siraj, police kick out spectators as play briefly stopped
news_article: The fourth day's play in the Sydney Test between Australia and India was briefly halted after a section of the crowd abused Team India fast bowler Mohammed Siraj. Team India stand-in captain Rahane and Siraj had a word with the umpires after which the police intervened. The play resumed after some spectators were kicked out by the police.

news_headline: I'll remember forever what you did for me in last 5 days: Ganguly on pic with friend
news_article: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly shared his first post after getting discharged from hospital, where he was admitted following a heart attack. Ganguly shared a picture with his friend Joydeep and wrote, "What you have done for me in the last 5 days is something I will remember for life...have known you for 40 years now...and it's gone beyond just family."

news_headline: Time for Rahane to step up and relish the opportunity to lead: Virat
news_article: India captain Virat Kohli, who would be flying back after the first Test against Australia for the birth of his first child, said Rahane should really step up and enjoy the opportunity to lead Team India. "I'm quite excited about how Ajinks (Rahane) goes. I think he is someone who'll enjoy the responsibility of captaining while I'm away," said Kohli.

news_headline: Cracks on pitch will play in minds but we're prepared: Mohammed Siraj
news_article: India's Mohammed Siraj has said the cracks on the pitch at The Gabba will play in the minds of the Indian batsmen on the final day of the Brisbane Test. He, however, also added that batsmen are prepared for it. On the fourth day, one of Siraj's deliveries hit Australia's Pat Cummins after landing on a crack and being deviated.

news_headline: Team India returns home after series win in Australia, pics surface
news_article: Following their 2-1 Test series victory against Australia, several members of Team India returned home on Thursday. Stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane, along with few other team members, were welcomed at the Mumbai airport. The contingent was felicitated by Mumbai Cricket Association at the airport. Rahane also cut a cake to celebrate the team's win.

news_headline: Melbourne Renegades get all out for 60, suffer biggest defeat in history of BBL
news_article: Aaron Finch-led Melbourne Renegades got all out for just 60 runs in 10.4 overs while chasing down the target of 206 against Sydney Sixers in a Big Bash League match on Sunday. Melbourne Renegades' 145-run loss is the biggest defeat for a team in the entire history of Big Bash League. Further, their 60-run total is the second-lowest BBL total.

news_headline: Play Natarajan in place of Saini, Kuldeep instead of Chahal in 3rd ODI: Aakash
news_article: Talking about the third India-Australia ODI, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has suggested India to play T Natarajan in place of Navdeep Saini and Kuldeep Yadav instead of Yuzvendra Chahal. Saini conceded 83 and 70 runs in the first two ODIs while Chahal went for 89 and 71. "If Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami are both fit, please play them," he added.

news_headline: Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal marries YouTuber Dhanashree Verma, shares pics
news_article: Team India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal got married to YouTuber and choreographer Dhanashree Verma on Tuesday. The 30-year-old took to Instagram to share pictures from the wedding and wrote, "We started at 'Once upon a time' and found 'Our happily ever after', coz finally, #DhanaSaidYuz for infinity and beyond!" The duo had got engaged in August this year.

news_headline: His patience, perseverance was praiseworthy: Ajay Jadeja on Rohit's 52(98)
news_article: Former India player Ajay Jadeja has said that Rohit Sharma took his game one level higher in India's second innings of the Sydney Test. Jadeja added that Rohit, who scored 52 runs off 98 balls, showed patience and perseverance which was praiseworthy. "You don't see that from Rohit Sharma because he generally destroys the opposition," he further said.

news_headline: I am not Dhoni: Wade heard saying on stump mic after missed stumping
news_article: Australia stand-in captain and wicketkeeper Matthew Wade was heard saying 'I am not Dhoni, not quick enough like Dhoni' on stump mic after a narrow stumping miss in the second T20I. Team India batsman Shikhar Dhawan, who was on the striker's end, was seen acknowledging Wade's statement with a nod. This happened in the ninth over of India's innings.

news_headline: Vihari should bat at number four or five in Virat's absence: MSK Prasad
news_article: Former chief selector MSK Prasad feels Hanuma Vihari should bat up the order in Virat Kohli's absence in the Melbourne Test, starting December 26. "I would prefer Vihari batting at No. 4 or 5 in the next few Tests...He is a gutsy boy and I have confidence that he will do well if given the challenge," said MSK Prasad.

news_headline: RR chase down 186-run target in 17.3 overs, end KXIP's 5-match winning streak
news_article: Rajasthan Royals chased down the 186-run target against Kings XI Punjab to register their second consecutive win. With the victory, RR ended KXIP's five-match winning streak and jumped to the fifth position on the IPL 2020 points table. The match witnessed KXIP's Chris Gayle become the first batsman in T20 cricket to reach 1,000 sixes.

news_headline: Who is Pankaj Advani's wife Saniya Shadadpuri?
news_article: Indian cueist Pankaj Advani married Saniya Shadadpuri on Wednesday. Saniya is a hair and makeup artist based out of Mumbai. She did her graduation in makeup from Los Angeles-based Make-up Designory (MUD) and did an advanced course at London's Delamar Academy. She has worked on hair and makeup for films like Shuddh Desi Romance, Daawat-e-Ishq and Rustom, among others.

news_headline: Rohit's dismissal takes out that little hope of winning the game: Manjrekar
news_article: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said that the dismissal of India opener Rohit Sharma on the fourth day of the Sydney Test "takes out the little hope of winning the game". "With Rohit Sharma around, there was the slightest possibility of India getting to the target...his dismissal takes out that glimmer of hope," he added. India ended the day at 98/2.

news_headline: Which teams have qualified for most consecutive playoffs/knockouts in IPL?
news_article: SRH have become the third team to qualify for at least five consecutive playoffs/knockouts in IPL. CSK hold the record for qualifying for most consecutive playoffs/knockouts in IPL (eight, 2008 to 2015). CSK, who were banned in 2016 and 2017, also qualified for playoffs in 2018 and 2019. MI went past the league stage in six consecutive seasons (2010-2015).

news_headline: Ball gets hidden inside batsman's sweater as he tries to steal single, video viral
news_article: During the 20th over of Melbourne Stars innings against Sydney Thunder, the ball got stuck inside batsman Nick Larkin's sweater. Sydney Thunder fast bowler Daniel Sams bowled a length ball on stumps and Larkin got an inside edge and started running. The ball popped out of his sweater while he was running and the umpire called it a dead ball.

news_headline: Series has been contest between India batsmen and Cummins only: Kaif
news_article: Talking about the India-Australia four-Test series, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said, "This is the third Test match. It's clear the contest is between the Indian batsmen and Pat Cummins only." "He has caused trouble for a batsman like Pujara...he's the only bowler who can cause trouble for the Indian batsmen [on the 5th day]," Kaif added.

news_headline: People dressed up as Star Wars characters seen during Aus-India Test
news_article: During the second day of the fourth and final Test between Australia and India at the Gabba, spectators dressed up as Star Wars characters were seen at the stadium. Photos and videos of the spectators went viral on social media. ICC shared an image of the spectators and wrote, "The best dress up award on day two goes to."

news_headline: Will be interesting to see how Siraj, Saini handle pressure against Aus: McGrath
news_article: Ex-Australia pacer Glenn McGrath said it will be interesting to watch how young Indian pacers Mohammed Siraj and Navdeep Saini "stand up if Australian batsmen can apply pressure". "When things are going well, everything is fine. It's when the pressure comes that you miss that experience," said McGrath. Saini made his debut in the third Test at the SCG.

news_headline: Karachi Kings players to get an apartment each for winning PSL 2020
news_article: Karachi Kings owner Salman Iqbal has announced that each player of the team will get an apartment for winning the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2020. The players will get apartments in Salman's real estate development project called ARY Laguna. Karachi Kings defeated Lahore Qalandars to win PSL for the first time.

news_headline: Stop spreading fake news: Amir on reports of him coming out of retirement
news_article: Fast bowler Mohammad Amir took to Twitter to react to reports of him coming out of retirement from international cricket. "I would like to clarify that yes I will be available for Pakistan only once this management leaves. So please stop spreading fake news just to sell your story," he wrote. Amir had quit international cricket in December last year.

news_headline: We had nothing to lose with our backs against the wall: David Warner
news_article: SRH captain David Warner said they had nothing to lose in the do-or-die match against MI. "There is great resilience in the side...We looked back to 2016 when we had to win every game to win the title," Warner said. SRH will now play RCB in the Eliminator. "Another do-or-die game. Hopefully, we can carry the momentum," Warner added.

news_headline: Being faster on feet, putting pressure on Ashwin worked: Smith on 27th ton
news_article: Talking about his 27th Test hundred, Australia batsman Steve Smith said being faster on his feet against spinners and putting pressure on Ravichandran Ashwin worked for him in the innings. "Plenty of people said I was out of form, so it was nice to come back...in the form," he added. Smith had scored 10 runs in the first two Tests.

news_headline: Rohit Sharma leaves for Australia ahead of Test series: Report
news_article: India opener Rohit Sharma has reportedly left for Australia and will be available for the final two Tests of the four-match series. According to ANI, Rohit left for Australia via Dubai in the early hours of Tuesday. Rohit was dropped from the tour after he suffered a hamstring injury during the IPL but was later added to the Test squad.

news_headline: Pucovski won't play Gabba Test due to injury, Harris named replacement
news_article: Australia opener Will Pucovski has been ruled out of the fourth and final Test against India at the Gabba with a shoulder injury. Marcus Harris will be replacing Pucovski in the playing XI. "He tried to train this morning, did not quite come up. He will have a bit of work to do," captain Tim Paine said on Thursday.

news_headline: Kohli, De Villiers not delivering to standards they've set for themselves: Aakash
news_article: Talking about RCB's five-wicket defeat against SRH on Saturday, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said that the "game was all about Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers". "Kohli and AB are going to pay a huge price for their own success because they have set the yardstick very high and the two of them are not delivering to the standards," he stated.

news_headline: Absolute peak of rowdy behaviour, sad to see: Kohli on 'racial abuse' against Siraj
news_article: Reacting to Team India fast bowler Mohammed Siraj allegedly getting racially abused by a section of Sydney Test crowd, Team India captain Virat Kohli tweeted, "It's sad to see this happen on the field." "Having gone through many incidents of really pathetic things said on the boundary Iines, this is the absolute peak of rowdy behaviour," he wrote.

news_headline: Teenager claiming to be Maradona's lovechild demands his body be dug up for DNA test
news_article: Santiago Lara, a 19-year-old boy who claims to be late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona's love child, has demanded Maradona's body be dug up for DNA test to prove his case. Santiago instructed his lawyer to make the appeal less than 24 hours after Maradona was buried. A written request with a family court in La Plata has been lodged.

news_headline: Tharoor trolls Team Aus with word of the day 'epicaricacy' after Gabba loss
news_article: MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday trolled Team Australia with 'word of the day' tweet after India ended their 32-year unbeaten streak at Brisbane's Gabba to win the series 2-1. Tharoor shared the word 'epicaricacy', which means deriving pleasure from the misfortune of another. He also shared comments of former Australian cricketers who predicted trouble for India in the test series.

news_headline: Impressed with Pucovski, to look the part on Test debut promising sign: Ponting
news_article: After Australia batsman Will Pucovski scored 62 off 110 balls on his Test debut against India, ex-Australia skipper Ricky Ponting said that he's impressed with the 22-year-old's innings at Sydney. "To look the part at Test level on debut is a promising sign and rapt for him to break through after the setbacks he's had along the way," he added.

news_headline: Pakistan defeat NZ by 4 wickets in 3rd T20I, lose series 1-2
news_article: Pakistan on Tuesday defeated New Zealand by four wickets after Mohammad Rizwan scored his career-best 89 off 59 balls to help the visitors chase down the 173-run total. New Zealand had already secured the series, winning the first two games by five wickets and nine wickets respectively. Both sides will now play the two-Test series, commencing on December 26.

news_headline: Australia question if Chahal was 'like-for-like' concussion substitute for Jadeja
news_article: Australia have questioned whether Yuzvendra Chahal was a 'like-for-like' concussion substitute for Ravindra Jadeja in Canberra T20I. "Jadeja was more of an all-rounder and he'd done his batting. Chahal is (pure) bowler," Moises Henriques said. He added, "We aren't talking about decision to make replacement. Only thing we're saying is there should be a like-for-like replacement."

news_headline: I couldn't spot the ball: NZ batsman as Sun stopped play during T20I
news_article: New Zealand batsman Glenn Phillips said he wasn't able to spot the ball due to sun-glare during his team's innings against Pakistan in third T20I in Napier. The match was stopped due to sunlight during New Zealand's 12th over and was resumed after sunset. "You have to love cricket, it will stop for any reason, no problem," a fan tweeted.

news_headline: Ganguly announces ₹5-crore bonus for Team India after 2-1 series win vs Australia
news_article: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has announced a ₹5-crore bonus for Team India after they clinched the four-match Test series against Australia 2-1. "Just a remarkable win...To go to Australia and win a test series in this way...will be remembered in the history of Indian cricket forever," Ganguly tweeted. He added, "The value of this win is beyond any number."

news_headline: Bollywood lacks spine, should stand with their community: Vijender on farmers' protest
news_article: Amid the ongoing farmers' protests against the recently passed agricultural bills by the government, boxer Vijender Singh has criticised Bollywood for not supporting the farmers. "When the oil prices were hitting the roof back in 2014, celebrities like Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar, were extremely critical of the then government...and now...they are nowhere to be found," he said.

news_headline: Smith's wife shares video of him shadow batting in kit in hotel room, calls him a kid
news_article: Australia batsman Steve Smith's wife Dani Willis took to Instagram Stories to share a video of her husband batting in full kit in their hotel room. "Like a kid on Christmas Eve," she wrote. Smith shared Dani's post and wrote, "Sometimes you've just got to shadow bat in full kit to get the feel."

news_headline: Moises Henriques added to Australia's squad for first Test vs India
news_article: All-rounder Moises Henriques has been added to Australia's squad for the first Test against India as injury woes continue in Australian camp. Henriques comes in for Will Pucovski, who was ruled out of the first Test after he was hit on the helmet by a bouncer during the first tour match last week. Henriques last played a Test in 2016.

news_headline: 'My hair has turned grey waiting for it': Sachin told Raina on reaching 100th hundred
news_article: Former India batsman Suresh Raina, who was at the non-striker's end when Sachin Tendulkar scored his 100th international hundred, has revealed what the latter told him on reaching the milestone. Raina said, "I congratulated him saying, 'Well done, paaji, it was due for so many months.' Sachin said, 'My hair has turned grey waiting for this moment'."

news_headline: People would name Rahul, but my pick is Shubman for no. 6 spot: Agarkar
news_article: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar has said that Shubman Gill should bat at number six position after the Adelaide Test. "I don't see any better options at this point [for number six spot]. People could point to KL Rahul and his white-ball form but if I had to pick, I'll go with Shubman Gill [for it]," he stated.

news_headline: Saddened by my father's statements: Yuvraj on Yograj's 'Hindus are traitors' remark
news_article: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to respond to his father Yograj's statement wherein he said, "Hindus are traitors". Yuvraj wrote, "As a proud Indian...I'm indeed saddened and upset by statements made by Mr Yograj Singh." He added, "I wish to clarify...his remarks have been made in an individual capacity and my ideologies aren't the same in any manner."

news_headline: Rohit, Rahane laugh at Rishabh Pant after loud and failed appeal, video goes viral
news_article: During the 84th over of Australia's first innings in Brisbane Test, India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant started appealing for caught behind despite the batsman not having edged the ball. However, Pant did not receive any support from the slip cordon. Ajinkya Rahane and Rohit Sharma were seen laughing at Pant as he tried to convince the captain to take DRS.

news_headline: Why was Super Over used in Pakistan-Zimbabwe ODI despite it being a dead rubber?
news_article: The tied Pakistan-Zimbabwe ODI was decided by Super Over despite the match being a dead rubber in the three-match series. Super Over was used as the series was a part of World Cup Super League through which teams will qualify for 2023 World Cup. The league's rules state that Super Overs will decide the tied matches since "each point matters".

news_headline: If Ishant is fit, send him to Australia now: Gavaskar on Shami's injury
news_article: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that if Mohammad Shami is not playing then it's going to be "trouble" for India in the upcoming Tests. "If Ishant Sharma is fit, I am suggesting to send him to Australia now...so that he can be ready for the Sydney Test," he added. Shami reportedly suffered a fractured arm in Adelaide.

news_headline: We still need to do a bit: Smith as RR move to 5th in points table
news_article: RR on Friday chased down KXIP's 186-run target and moved to the fifth spot in the IPL 2020 points table. "Would have been nice to have a couple of wins in the middle. We still need to do a bit to make the playoffs...we need things to go our way," said RR skipper Steve Smith at the post-match conference.

news_headline: Never trusted DRS: Ian Chappell after 'umpire's call' saves Pujara
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ian Chappell said he "never trusted Decision Review System (DRS)" after Australia were denied Cheteshwar Pujara's wicket on final day of the fourth Test due to the 'umpire's call' provision. "The bulk of the ball is hitting the stumps, how can that be umpire's call?" Chappell said after Tim Paine reviewed an LBW call off Nathan Lyon's bowling.

news_headline: Jaffer uses 'Bajirao Mastani' dialogue to praise Jadeja for running Smith out
news_article: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to praise all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for running Australia batsman Steve Smith out in the Sydney Test. He used a dialogue from 'Bajirao Mastani'. "Cheete ki chaal, baaz ki nazar aur Jadeja ke throw par sandeh nahi karte," he wrote. Jadeja ran to his right from square leg and executed a direct hit.

news_headline: I thought Natarajan should be Man of the Match, he had a good game: Pandya
news_article: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, who was named Man of the Match for his unbeaten 42-run knock off 22 balls in the second T20I, has said that pacer T Natarajan had a "really good" game and he should've been Man of the Match. Natarajan gave 20 runs in his four overs and dismissed D'Arcy Short and Moises Henriques in the match.

news_headline: Everyone questioned when I picked T Natarajan for KXIP for ₹3 crore: Sehwag
news_article: Virender Sehwag has revealed that everyone questioned his decision after he bought T Natarajan for ₹3 crore in 2017 IPL auctions. He added that the move had been questioned because Natarajan had not even played domestic cricket then. He further said he had seen Natarajan's videos after which he decided to buy him as KXIP needed a death bowler.

news_headline: Aussies just don’t seem to learn, what on earth is wrong with them: Lloyd on Paine
news_article: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd has criticised Australia captain Tim Paine for his on-field banter with India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin during Sydney Test. "If someone had talked to me like he did to Ashwin...I’d have lost all respect for them," he said. "They just don’t seem to learn [even after sandpaper gate]. What on earth is wrong with them?” he added.

news_headline: I can't understand why India didn't attempt short balls against Smith: Hogg
news_article: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg has criticised Team India's bowlers for not trying to get Steve Smith out by short-pitched bowling in the first two ODIs. "India didn't attempt to bounce him out at any stage. They bowled on a good length or a little fuller. I can't understand that, because Smith's weakness is with the short ball," he stated.

news_headline: Azharuddin's car meets with an accident in Rajasthan, ex-cricketer escapes unhurt
news_article: Former Team India captain and Congress leader Mohammed Azharuddin’s car met with an accident on Wednesday morning in Rajasthan's Soorwal. Azharuddin escaped unhurt according to his personal assistant, news agency ANI reported. Azharuddin was returning to Ranthambore along with his family when the accident happened. He was taken to his hotel in another car.

news_headline: Virat-Anushka seen for 1st time post child's birth, thank media for respecting privacy
news_article: Team India Captain Virat Kohli and his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, were seen in public for first time after their daughter's birth on January 11. "Thank you for respecting," said Anushka while referring to the couple's request to media photographers to "not take or carry any content" that has their child. "We'll...ensure...you get all the content...featuring us," they had said.

news_headline: Cricket Australia criticises Channel 7 over statement on India series, thanks BCCI
news_article: After Channel 7 said Cricket Australia is terrified of BCCI amid a contract battle, the Australian board criticised the broadcaster. "It's disappointing...Seven West Media has again chosen to use...media to talk our wonderful game down," CA interim CEO Nick Hockley said. He thanked "friends at BCCI" for going ahead with the tour "in the most challenging environment sport has faced".

news_headline: Captain once dropped himself, replacement broke his ribs
news_article: England captain Mike Denness left himself out of the team for an Ashes Test that started on January 4, 1975, after scoring 65 runs in previous six innings. John Edrich replaced Denness as captain and broke his ribs after getting hit by the first ball he faced in the second innings. Australia went on to win by 171 runs.

news_headline: Ashwin can take 800 Test wickets but Lyon not good enough: Muralitharan
news_article: Ex-Sri Lanka spinner Muttiah Muralitharan feels India's Ravichandran Ashwin might end up taking 800 Test wickets but Australian Nathan Lyon "isn't good enough" to reach there. "Ashwin has a chance because he is a great bowler...Don't think any younger bowler coming in will go to 800," Muralitharan said. He added Lyon took many matches to near 400 wickets.

news_headline: Prithvi Shaw hits Rohit Sharma with a stray throw, gets trolled after video goes viral
news_article: Team India vice-captain Rohit Sharma was hit on his fingers with a stray throw by substitute fielder Prithvi Shaw during the first day of the Brisbane Test. Reacting to a video shared by Cricket Australia, a fan tweeted, "Shaw trying to find a place in playing XI." "Shaw to Rohit: Na khelunga, na khelne dunga," wrote another.

news_headline: Cricket 19 video game censors Niroshan Dickwella's name, pic surfaces
news_article: Cricket 19 video game has censored Sri Lankan cricketer Niroshan Dickwella's name from the platform. His name appears as 'N D-Censored' in the game. Renowned cricket writer Jarrod Kimber took to Twitter to share a picture from the game. Reacting to it, a user wrote, "What nonsense." Another user jokingly wrote, "Lol...if parents didn't censor, who are they to?"

news_headline: Australia will win the T20I series as well, predicts Aakash
news_article: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has predicted that Australia will win the three-match T20I series against India. "If Australia win the first match, they will win the series 100%. If India wins the first match, then 60% I still feel that Australia will win the series," he added. Australia elected to field in the first T20I. India lost the ODI series 1-2.

news_headline: Rishabh Pant wasn't even aware Smith scuffed his batting mark: India batting coach
news_article: Team India batting coach Vikram Rathour has revealed that India wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant wasn't even aware that Australia's Steve Smith scuffed his batting mark. "Only after the game and after the media picked it up, we noticed," Rathour added. Smith had later said that he was shocked at the reaction as he does it almost every match.

news_headline: US Olympic medallist Klete Keller, arrested over Capitol riot, released from custody
news_article: US Olympic swimming gold medallist Klete Keller, who was arrested after being charged for participating in the attack on US Capitol by President Donald Trump supporters, has been released from federal custody. Keller was caught on camera among the rioters wearing his Olympics jacket. Keller participated in the Olympics in 2000, 2004 and 2008 and won five medals.

news_headline: In Tests, always keeping skills first: Manjrekar backs Saha over Pant
news_article: Ex-India batsman Sanjay Manjrekar believes Wriddhiman Saha should be in the playing XI for the Australia Test series instead of Rishabh Pant since he is a "better keeper". "In Tests always keeping skills first...So Saha. Also need better keeper against pace in Australia. Again Saha," tweeted Manjrekar. On Saturday, Pant went on to score a century in the warm-up match.

news_headline: Still want to lead Australia, making WTC final still achievable: Paine
news_article: Amid criticism following their defeat to India in the four-Test series at home, Australia Test captain Tim Paine has said that he still wants to lead the side. "We've had a goal to make this World Test Championship final [and] I think that's still achievable," he added. Australia have slipped to the number three position in the WTC points table.

news_headline: Not being able to train in NZ has affected our players: Misbah
news_article: Pakistan head coach and ex-captain Misbah-ul-Haq has said that not being able to train in New Zealand has affected their players. "Top professional athletes require a certain environment to prepare so that they can perform," he added. The Pakistan cricket team has been denied the right to train while in managed isolation after their eight members tested positive for COVID-19.

news_headline: Ishant bowls full tilt at NCA, aims for full fitness ahead of Aus Test
news_article: Eyeing to regain full fitness ahead of the Australia Test series, Ishant Sharma bowled full tilt at the NCA on Wednesday. In a video uploaded on Twitter, Ishant can be seen bowling from his full run-up in the presence of NCA director Rahul Dravid and chief selector Sunil Joshi. Ishant was ruled out of IPL 2020 due to muscle tear.

news_headline: Kohli invested in gaming platform which became Team India's kit sponsor
news_article: Captain Virat Kohli invested in online gaming platform Mobile Premier League (MPL) in February 2019 which became the Indian cricket team's official kit sponsor and merchandise partner in November last year. Kohli was allotted Compulsory Convertible Debentures (CCDs) for ₹33.32 lakh in Galactus Funware Technology, which owns MPL, according to records accessed by The Indian Express.

news_headline: KL Rahul jokes around with Finch after he gets hit on stomach, video viral
news_article: Team India wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul joked around with Australia captain Aaron Finch after the latter was hit on the stomach by a full-toss delivery by fast bowler Navdeep Saini. In a video that has gone viral, Rahul can be seen checking on Finch by touching his stomach. "This series is too friendly," a commentator was heard saying.

news_headline: F***ing consistency: Tim Paine heard saying on stump mic over umpire's decision
news_article: Australia captain Tim Paine was heard saying 'F***ing consistency, Blocker' to on-field umpire Paul Wilson after a failed review against India's Cheteshwar Pujara. Third-umpire Bruce Oxenford asked Wilson to stay with his decision after evidence from replays couldn't conclude whether Pujara's bat had touched the ball. "I'm not the third umpire," Wilson was heard telling Paine.

news_headline: Stellar intent, remarkable grit: PM Modi congratulates India on beating Australia
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate Team India on winning the Test series against Australia. He wrote, "We are all overjoyed at the success of the Indian Cricket Team in Australia." He added, "Their remarkable energy and passion was visible throughout. So was their stellar intent, remarkable grit and determination. Congratulations! Best wishes for your future endeavours."

news_headline: Gambhir criticises Karthik for leaving KKR captaincy mid-IPL 2020, gives his example
news_article: Ex-KKR captain Gautam Gambhir has criticised Dinesh Karthik for leaving KKR captaincy mid-IPL 2020. "It just shows the mindset. You left captaincy because you wanted to concentrate on batting...but then it hasn’t worked," he said. He added, "When I was through a [bad] phase in 2014...I got three straight ducks...It was captaincy that helped me...get back into form."

news_headline: Smith isn't that far away from Kohli: Gambhir on best ODI batsman ever
news_article: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said that Australia batsman Steve Smith is not far behind Virat Kohli in the "best ODI batsman in the world ever" discussion. "Getting...two back to back hundreds in 60 balls is no joke. Yes, Kohli will always have better numbers but look at the impact Smith has had in the last two games," he added.

news_headline: Coded messages sent to England captain from balcony by analyst, pics surface
news_article: During the third South Africa-England T20I, England analyst Nathan Leamon sent coded information to England captain Eoin Morgan from the team balcony. Leamon placed a series of numbers and letters like '4E' and '2C' on clipboards to suggest Morgan on how to impact the game. England and Wales Cricket Board said the signals were "intended as a live informational resource".

news_headline: Pakistan suffer 2nd straight defeat vs NZ, lose T20I series 0-2
news_article: Pakistan on Sunday suffered their second straight defeat against New Zealand as Kane Williamson-led side chased down their 163-run total in the second T20I. NZ pacer Tim Southee was named Player of the Match for picking four wickets in his four overs, giving 21 runs. NZ had chased down Pakistan's 153-run total in the first T20I.

news_headline: Sledging is overrated and irrelevant: Cheteshwar Pujara
news_article: Ahead of the four-match Test series against Australia, India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara described sledging to be 'overrated' and 'irrelevant'. "I don't think you can win too many battles with sledging. I don't even know what they are saying when I am in my zone," Pujara said. In 2018-19, Pujara played over 1000 deliveries during the four-match Test series against Australia.

news_headline: No fitness issue, Hardik will be back for playoffs: Rohit Sharma
news_article: MI captain Rohit Sharma clarified that Hardik Pandya has no fitness problem and was only rested for their last league match against SRH. "We just wanted to give him (Hardik) a break and give other guys some opportunities...I am sure he will be ready for the playoffs," Rohit said. MI will face DC in Qualifier 1 on November 5.

news_headline: We're going to make it as hard as possible for Pujara to score: Cummins
news_article: Talking about India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara's 50-run knock off 176 balls during India's first innings at Sydney, Australia pacer Pat Cummins said they're going to make it as hard as possible for Pujara to score.
