"It's one of those things. You know (Pujara) is going to hang around. As long as you're controlling the scoreboard...you're not overly bothered," he added.

news_headline: Aus should make Smith vice-captain immediately: Gilchrist
news_article: Ex-Australia wicketkeeper-batsman Adam Gilchrist has said that he sees no reason why Steve Smith shouldn't be given second chance regarding captaincy. "If the selectors feel [Smith is the right guy] and he's [also] keen to do it, I think they should make him vice-captain immediately," he stated. Smith was banned from captaincy for 24 months over the sandpaper scandal.

news_headline: Pakistan playing school-level cricket due to PCB's policies: Shoaib Akhtar
news_article: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar criticised Pakistan team for playing "school-level cricket" in the Test series against New Zealand. He blamed Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) policies for the situation. "They (PCB) keep bringing in average players...they keep making average teams...leading to average results," he said in a video. "Whenever Pakistan will play Tests, they will be exposed," he added.

news_headline: Maradona had almost nothing left in his bank account, he died poor: Friend
news_article: Argentine football legend Diego Maradona had almost nothing left in his bank account and he died poor, friend Luis Ventura said. "Maradona's wealth was squandered because of his pierced hands and largely stolen in order to trick him...All they had to do was ask and he gave," he added. "He never had over €100 in his pocket," Maradona's lawyer said.

news_headline: He was a full of life person: Kohli condoles demise of Pandya brothers' father
news_article: India captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter to condole the demise of Himanshu Pandya, the father of Hardik Pandya and Krunal Pandya. "Heartbroken to hear about the demise of Hardik and Krunal's dad. Spoke to him a couple of times, looked a joyful and full of life person. May his soul rest in peace. Stay strong you two," Kohli wrote.

news_headline: Kohli is more in your face while Rahane is calm and composed: Shastri
news_article: After India's win at MCG under Ajinkya Rahane's leadership, India head coach Ravi Shastri said that both Virat Kohli and Rahane are good readers of the game. He added that while Virat is very passionate, Ajinkya is very calm and composed. "It's their characters...Virat is more in your face while Ajinkya is quite prepared to sit back," he added.

news_headline: Sydney Thunder win Women's Big Bash League for the second time
news_article: Sydney Thunder beat Melbourne Stars by seven wickets on Saturday to lift the Women's Big Bash League (WBBL) title for the second time. Opting to bat, Melbourne Stars could only manage 86/9 in their 20 overs as Sydney Thunder reached their target with 38 balls to spare. Pacer Shabnim Ismail was named the Player of the Match in the final.

news_headline: Australia's XI in Brisbane Test have taken 1,033 wickets, India's XI just 13 wickets
news_article: The ongoing Brisbane match is the first instance of a Test wherein a playing XI with a tally of fewer than 100 wickets is playing against an opposition with 1,000-plus wickets. India XI had taken just 13 wickets between them before Brisbane Test, while Australia XI had taken 1,033. India XI's tally is the lowest since Lord's Test in 1946.

news_headline: With Kohli gone, want to see where India get their energy from: Brad Haddin
news_article: Former Australia wicketkeeper-batsman Brad Haddin has said that he wants to see where India will get their energy in the absence of Virat Kohli in the upcoming Tests against Australia. "A lot of energy comes off the back of what Kohli does [during the match]...now I think they need a senior player like [Rohit Sharma]," he added.

news_headline: Afridi gets angry at 21-yr-old Afghan pacer over fight with Amir, video goes viral
news_article: Galle Gladiators captain Shahid Afridi got angry at Kandy Tuskers' 21-year-old Afghan pacer Naveen-ul-Haq after the latter had a verbal spat with Mohammad Amir. While greeting the Afghan's team after their LPL match, Afridi was seen staring at Naveen-ul-Haq and angrily asking, "Kya hua?" Afridi later tweeted, "My advice to...[him]...was simple, play the game and don't indulge in abusive talk."

news_headline: Can't have review after replays are on big screen: Aakash on denied DRS
news_article: Cricketer turned commentator Aakash Chopra has said that the decision to deny DRS to India for the LBW appeal against Matthew Wade during the third T20I was "right". "Can't have the review after the replays are on the big screen," he stated. However, Aakash also raised the question of whether the replay was played earlier than it should have been.

news_headline: Pant will play as wicketkeeper, if India go with 5 bowlers: Ian Chappell
news_article: Talking about Team India's combination in the upcoming Tests, former Australia captain Ian Chappell said that if India play five bowlers then Rishabh Pant might play as wicketkeeper-batsman. "Pant is better as a batsman [than Wriddhiman Saha]," he added. He, however, also added that if India play batting-heavy line-up then the visitors will go for the "better wicketkeeper [Saha]".

news_headline: He certainly has skills, swings away from lefties: Labuschagne on Siraj
news_article: Talking about India's bowling on the first day of the Melbourne Test, Marnus Labuschagne, who top scored for Australia, praised debutant India pacer Mohammed Siraj. "He is more of a swing bowler...swings away from lefties. He certainly has skills," he stated. He further said that the MCG pitch is helping the bowlers a little bit more than usual.

news_headline: Controversy erupts over Paine's run-out decision, Cricket Australia shares video
news_article: During the 55th over of Australia's first innings in the Boxing Day Test against India, Tim Paine was declared not-out by the third umpire after a close run-out call. Several former cricketers and fans contended that Paine should've been given out as "no part of his bat was behind the line". The third umpire claimed there was "no conclusive evidence".

news_headline: We discuss how to get Virat out not how to taunt him: Aus coach Langer
news_article: Australia coach Justin Langer said his team prefers planning on how to dismiss Virat Kohli rather than focusing on how to taunt the Indian captain. "We play on the skill, not on emotions...We have to control our emotions," Langer said. "I have got so much respect for Kohli...we are going to be really well planned for him," Langer added.

news_headline: Ravindra Jadeja ruled out of Brisbane Test due to thumb dislocation
news_article: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the fourth and final Test against Australia to be held in Brisbane from January 15 at the Gabba. Jadeja had suffered a blow to his left thumb while batting on Day 3 of Sydney Test. He later went for scans and the results have shown that he has dislocated his thumb.

news_headline: Warner-Finch equals Sachin-Sehwag's ODI record of 12 first-wicket century stands
news_article: Australia's Aaron Finch and David Warner equalled Virender Sehwag and Sachin Tendulkar's record of 12 first-wicket century stands in ODIs. The duo reached the milestone against India in the 2nd ODI on Sunday and went on to put on an opening stand of 142 runs. Sourav Ganguly and Sachin Tendulkar lead the list with 21 first-wicket century stands in ODIs.

news_headline: Ex-cricketer BS Chandrasekhar admitted to Bengaluru hospital
news_article: Former India spinner BS Chandrasekhar had to be hospitalised in Bengaluru on Friday after he complained of tiredness, according to his wife. "He was fine and was watching match when he suddenly complained of fatigue and slurring in speech. So we took him to the hospital. He is fine and will be back home in two days," his wife said.

news_headline: Hanuma Vihari, who was ruled out of 4th Test due to injury, leaves for India
news_article: India batsman Hanuma Vihari, who was ruled out of the ongoing Brisbane Test due to a Grade 2 tear on his hamstring, left Australia on Friday. Vihari had picked the injury soon after he walked to bat during India's second innings at Sydney. He remained unbeaten at 23 after facing 161 balls to help India draw the match.

news_headline: Gayle fined 10% of his match fee for throwing away his bat after getting out on 99
news_article: KXIP batsman Chris Gayle has been fined 10% of his match fee for breaching IPL's Code of Conduct during his team's match against RR in Abu Dhabi. Gayle breached the code by throwing away his bat in frustration after getting out on 99. Gayle has admitted to the offence and has accepted the sanction, the IPL said in a statement.

news_headline: KXIP on rise but it's not easy to win 6 matches in a row: Aakash
news_article: Ahead of KXIP's match against RR on Friday, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said that the KL Rahul-led side, who have won five matches in a row, are on "the rise" and another win will bring them close to qualification. "[It's] a fairytale story that we are seeing...[however] it's not easy to win six...consecutive matches as this is the IPL," he added.

news_headline: SRH beat MI by 10 wickets, qualify for IPL playoffs for 5th consecutive season
news_article: SRH chased down the target of 150 against MI in 17.1 overs without losing any wicket to qualify for the IPL 2020 playoffs. This is the fifth consecutive season that SRH have made it to the playoffs. SRH finished third on the points table. With SRH's win, KKR failed to make it to the playoffs.

news_headline: Just zip it: Warne, Waugh to Pant for chattering when bowler is about to bowl
news_article: Ex-Australian cricketers Mark Waugh and Shane Warne have criticised India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant for his "constant chatter" behind the stumps. "You’ve got to zip it [when a bowler is about to bowl]. I think...umpires have got to take some control in these situations," Waugh said. Warne said Pant should let batsmen concentrate when the bowler is starting to come in.

news_headline: Natarajan would add variety as a left-arm pacer: Gilchrist
news_article: Ex-Australia wicket-keeper Adam Gilchrist feels Natarajan should get the nod over Navdeep Saini for the Sydney Test since "he would add variety as a left-arm pacer" to the bowling line-up."[Natarajan] would also leave some handy footmarks for Ravichandran Ashwin to exploit," Gilchrist added. Natarajan was added to the Test squad after pacer Umesh Yadav injured himself during the second Test.

news_headline: Gill should play in middle order as Kohli's replacement in last 3 Tests: Aakash
news_article: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Shubman Gill should be picked over KL Rahul to bat at number four in place of Virat Kohli in the last three Australia Tests. "If you're looking to bat someone in the middle order...Shubman should get the nod ahead of Rahul...if there's a spot as an opener...then [it should be] Rahul," he stated.

news_headline: Virat Kohli becomes 9th out of 231 Indian cricketers to play 250 ODIs
news_article: Team India captain Virat Kohli has become the ninth Indian cricketer to play 250 ODIs, achieving the feat in the second ODI against Australia in Sydney on Sunday. A total of 231 Indian cricketers have played ODI cricket. Sachin Tendulkar holds the record for playing most ODIs among Indians (463). Kohli had made his ODI debut in 2008.

news_headline: Australian baby store issues clarification over Kohli, Pandya's 'bio-bubble breach'
news_article: After Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya were accused of breaching bio-bubble after being spotted without masks at a baby store in Sydney, the store's owner Nathan Pongrass has issued a clarification. "At that stage, there were no restrictions in New South Wales...[Despite that] our staff was not allowed to touch them and shake hands with them," he said.

news_headline: He got me pregnant, beat me up: Ex-classmate accuses Babar of sexually abusing her
news_article: Pakistan captain Babar Azam's former classmate has accused him of sexually and financially abusing her for 10 years. "He promised to marry me, he got me pregnant. He beat me up and threatened me and used me," the woman said. The woman threatened to set herself on fire in front of Pakistan Cricket Board if she failed to get justice.

news_headline: Jadeja shares pic after undergoing surgery, says 'Will soon return with a bang'
news_article: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who dislocated his thumb while batting on Day 3 of the Sydney Test, has undergone surgery. The 32-year-old took to Twitter to share a picture of himself after the surgery and wrote, "Out of action for a while. Surgery completed. But will soon return with a bang!" Jadeja took seven wickets in the Test series.

news_headline: Gill, Rahane played more pull shots than Australia played in two Tests: Ponting
news_article: Former captain Ricky Ponting criticised Australian batsmen for not playing enough pull shots against India in the first two Tests. "Shubman Gill & Ajinkya Rahane played more good pull shots than I think Australia have played in the two Tests," Ponting said. "I can count on one hand in two Tests how many pull shots have been played," he added.

news_headline: Don’t think India will recover from the loss at Adelaide: Brad Haddin
news_article: Former Australia wicket-keeper Brad Haddin feels it won't be possible for Team India to recover from the eight-wicket loss in the first Test at Adelaide. "I thought their only opportunity to win a Test match was the first Test at Adelaide," Haddin said. "I don't think they will be able to turn it around," Haddin added.

news_headline: Umpire doesn't declare head-high delivery as no-ball in RCB-SRH match, criticised
news_article: RCB fast bowler Isuru Udana bowled a head-high delivery against SRH's Kane Williamson, which umpire failed to declare as no-ball. Several cricketers criticised the decision with Jimmy Neesham tweeting, "No balls are head high now???" Meanwhile, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "I honestly can’t believe that was not given a no ball ! Like seriously!!!" "Wakey wakey," wrote Mitchell McClenaghan.

news_headline: Hardik, Krunal Pandya's father dies due to heart attack, Krunal leaves SMAT bio-bubble
news_article: Cricketers Hardik Pandya and Krunal Pandya's father Himanshu Pandya passed away due to a heart attack this morning. Baroda captain Krunal has left the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) bio-bubble in order to be with his family. Krunal wouldn't be taking part in the remaining matches of the tournament, Baroda Cricket Association (BCA) CEO Shishir Hattangadi told ANI.

news_headline: Umpire gets hit on head by spider cam during 3rd Australia-India T20I, video viral
news_article: A video of umpire Gerard Abood getting hit on his head by spider cam during the third Australia-India T20I has gone viral on social media. Cricket Australia took to Twitter to share the video, writing, "So that's why Gerard Abood wears the helmet!" Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Yellow card for spider cam."

news_headline: Australian Open player shares video of mouse in her hotel room amid quarantine
news_article: Women's world number 28 tennis player Yulia Putintseva of Kazakhstan took to Twitter to share a video of a mouse in her Melbourne hotel room, where she is quarantining ahead of the Australian Open. "Been trying to change the room for two hours already! And no one came to help due to quarantine situation," she wrote.

news_headline: Suryakumar will never leave India to play for another country: Kaneria criticises PCB
news_article: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has criticised PCB after 24-year-old batsman Sami Aslam moved to USA after being ignored for national selection by the board. "Injustice has been done," Kaneria said. He added, "India’s Suryakumar Yadav got an offer from Scott Styris to play for New Zealand, but his franchise stood by him...BCCI stood by him, so he'll never leave India."

news_headline: Kashyap retires mid-game to make first-round exit from Thailand Open
news_article: Indian shuttler Parupalli Kashyap on Wednesday exited from the Thailand Open 2020 after he retired during the third game of his first-round match against Canada's Jason Anthony Ho-Shue. Kashyap was trailing in the third game 8-14 when he decided to retire as he pulled a calf muscle. After losing the first game 9-21, he had won the second game 21-13.

news_headline: Smith gets out for a duck in a Test after 4 years, 1st time ever against India
news_article: Australia batsman Steve Smith, who is the top-ranked Test batsman, got out for a duck on the bowling of Ravichandran Ashwin in the first innings of Boxing Day Test. It is Smith's first duck in Test cricket since November 3, 2016. It is also the first time that he got out for a duck in a Test against India.

news_headline: Ashwin mocks Paine over 'Gabba' sledge, tweets 'Good evening from Gabba' after win
news_article: Following Team India's victory at the Gabba, off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin mocked Australia captain Tim Paine over the 'Can't wait to get you to Gabba' sledge. Tagging Paine in a tweet, Ashwin wrote, "Good evening from Gabba!" He added, "I am sorry I couldn’t play here but thanks for hosting us and playing some hard cricket during these tough times."

news_headline: Rohit fit to join Team India, call on playing Tests vs Aus after quarantine: BCCI
news_article: The BCCI on Saturday said that Rohit Sharma has completed his rehabilitation process at the NCA and is now "clinically fit". "He will be reassessed by the Team India medical team post his quarantine [in Australia] to establish his fitness status and a call on his participation in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy will be taken accordingly," the BCCI added.

news_headline: SRH chase down 121-run target in 14.1 overs vs RCB, stay alive in IPL 2020
news_article: SRH chased down the target of 121 in 14.1 overs against RCB to stay in contention for a playoff spot in IPL 2020. The victory was SRH's second in a row, while RCB lost their third straight match. Only MI have booked a playoff spot so far, while CSK are the only team who are out of the playoff race.

news_headline: PV Sindhu knocked out of Thailand Open after first round loss
news_article: India's PV Sindhu on Tuesday lost 21-16, 24-26, 13-21 to Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt in the first round of the Thailand Open 2021 to make an early exit. In the men's singles, Sai Praneeth lost his first-round match to Thai opponent 16-21, 10-21. Meanwhile, the Indian mixed doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Ashwini Ponnappa were off to a winning start.

news_headline: Physio not coming out when Jadeja was hit breach of protocol: Manjrekar
news_article: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said that Team India physio's absence on the ground to check on Ravindra Jadeja after the all-rounder was hit on the head during India's innings was a breach of protocol. "[Team] India support staff should have come out. And then it [substitution] would have looked a little more credible," he added.

news_headline: All Fortune oil ads featuring Ganguly pulled down by Adani Wilmar: Reports
news_article: Adani Wilmar has reportedly removed all ads of its Fortune Rice Bran cooking oil featuring Sourav Ganguly across platforms after the BCCI President suffered a mild heart attack. Social media users had trolled the ad campaign featuring Ganguly for promoting heart health. The creative agency for the brand is working on a "fresh redressal campaign", reports said.

news_headline: World War II bombs found at training ground of football team in Italy, pic surfaces
news_article: Serie A side AS Roma has revealed that the Italian army's bomb squad was called to their training ground after World War II explosive devices were discovered at their facility. Around 20 bombs were found by a technician who was beginning the groundwork for a new pitch. The devices were safely and successfully removed by the Army, Roma said.

news_headline: Will send him a text tonight: Kohli as video of his 6 with ABD-like shot goes viral
news_article: A video of India captain Virat Kohli hitting a six off Australia pacer Andrew Tye with an AB de Villiers-like scoop shot in the second T20I went viral. In the post-match presentation, Kohli said, "It was a bit of funny moment, I surprised myself there." He added, "I'll send ABD a text tonight and see what he thinks of it."

news_headline: India need to remember they were ahead for 2 days in 1st Test: Gambhir
news_article: Ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia, former India opener Gautam Gambhir has said that Team India need to forget the Adelaide defeat and remember that they were ahead for two days in the match. "[For the Melbourne Test, India's batsmen need to] think about scoring 200-250 runs and give...bowlers runs on the board," he added.

news_headline: Shah, Ganguly working on plans to improve India's performance in Australia: Shukla
news_article: Ex-IPL chairman Rajeev Shukla has said that BCCI Secretary Jay Shah and BCCI President Sourav Ganguly are working on some plans to improve Team India's performance in Australia. "We are not happy, it was not a good score and we are really concerned," he added talking about India recording their lowest Test total in the first Test.

news_headline: David Warner ruled out of first Test against India
news_article: Australia opener David Warner won't be playing the first Test against India, starting December 17, due to groin injury. "Right now I feel I am short of being able to play at peak fitness and another 10 days will make a difference," Warner said. Other opener Will Pucovski is also doubtful for the first Test due to a concussion scare.

news_headline: Continue with Burns as Test opener, don't disturb winning combo: Ponting
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said he would request coach Justin Langer to continue with Joe Burns as one of the Test openers against India instead of Will Pucovski and not disturb the winning combination. "Burns hasn't done much wrong...I always say you don't want to be making too many changes if you don't need to," Ponting said.

news_headline: Don't regret playing that short off Lyon: Rohit on being dismissed on 44(74)
news_article: India opener Rohit Sharma said he doesn't regret playing the aerial shot off Nathan Lyon on the second day of the ongoing fourth Test. "I reached where I wanted to reach just that I did not connect with where I wanted to hit the ball...I actually liked what I did today," he stated. Rohit got out after scoring 44 runs.

news_headline: If Kohli has his baby here, we can claim his offspring as Australian, jokes Border
news_article: Talking about Virat Kohli taking paternity leave for the birth of their first child, ex-Australia captain Allan Border joked, "We were thinking he might think about having his newborn...here because we can claim his offspring as Australian." Border added, "The one thing that is in Australia’s favour is Virat Kohli playing only the first Test."

news_headline: Hanuma Vihari ruled out of 4th Test with hamstring injury: Report
news_article: India batsman Hanuma Vihari has reportedly been ruled out of the Brisbane Test with a hamstring injury he picked while batting on the final day of the Sydney Test. "Even if it's a grade 1 tear, he's out for at least four weeks...So it's not only Brisbane Test but also...England Tests at home," a BCCI source was quoted as saying.

news_headline: Tum karo toh sarcasm, aur koi kare toh racism: Sehwag condemns racial abuse at SCG
news_article: Former Team India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to condemn Australian fans racially abusing Team India cricketers at the Sydney Cricket Ground. "Tum karo toh sarcasm, aur koi kare toh racism. Very unfortunate with what some of the Australian crowd has been doing at the SCG and spoiling the vibes of a good Test series," he wrote.

news_headline: Anushka does shirshasana during pregnancy with Kohli's support, shares throwback pic
news_article: Anushka Sharma took to social media to share a throwback picture of herself doing shirshasana during her pregnancy with the support of her husband Virat Kohli. "[I] used the wall for support and also my very able husband supporting my balance, to be extra safe," she wrote. She added, "I'm so glad I could continue my practice through my pregnancy."

news_headline: Indians are in Christmas mood, giving gifts a week early: Gavaskar on fielding
news_article: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar trolled India's fielding in the ongoing Test against Australia in Adelaide. After Prithvi Shaw dropped Marnus Labuschagne on the bowling of Jasprit Bumrah, Gavaskar said, "All I can think of is the Indians are in a Christmas mood. Giving their Christmas gifts a week early."  Labuschagne, who was dropped multiple times, scored 47(119).

news_headline: Haven't seen my child for 4 months, would like to spend time with family now: Hardik
news_article: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has ruled out chances of him having an extended stay in Australia for the Test series, stating that he hasn't seen his child for over four months and would like to spend time with his family now. Hardik was named Man of the Series for his performance throughout the T20I series.

news_headline: Will Pucovski suffered shoulder subluxation injury at SCG: Cricket Australia
news_article: Providing an update on Australia batsman Will Pucovski's injury, Cricket Australia (CA) said that the 22-year-old suffered a shoulder subluxation injury while diving in the field on the final day of the Sydney Test. "He will continue rest and rehabilitation over the next two days before a decision is made on his fitness for the fourth Test match," CA stated.

news_headline: World no. 2 Simona Halep tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: World number two women's singles player Simona Halep on Saturday announced that she has tested positive for coronavirus. "I wanted to let you know that I tested positive for COVID-19. I am self-isolating at home and am recovering well from mild symptoms," she tweeted. The 29-year-old won the Wimbledon in 2019 and the French Open in 2018.

news_headline: Team has blossomed under Rahane's leadership: Dilip Vengsarkar
news_article: Former India cricketer Dilip Vengsarkar has said that Team India has blossomed under the leadership of Ajinkya Rahane. "India were bundled out for 36 and lost the match (Adelaide Test) but the way Rahane led the team after the defeat is amazing. Ajinkya showed tremendous character. Players are more at ease under Rahane," he stated.

news_headline: Lewis Hamilton wins BBC’s Sports Personality of the Year
news_article: Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton was named as BBC's Sports Personality of the Year on Sunday. Hamilton beat Liverpool midfielder Jordan Henderson and British jockey Hollie Doyle to win the prize in a public vote. The other three members of the six-person shortlist were boxer Tyson Fury, snooker player Ronnie O'Sullivan and cricketer Stuart Broad.

news_headline: Gill hai ki manta nahin: Sehwag after Gill scores 91 on Day 5 of Brisbane Test
news_article: Ex-Indian opener Virender Sehwag tweaked the title of a popular Bollywood movie to come up with a wordplay to hail Shubman Gill's 91-run knock on Day 5 of the Brisbane Test. "Australia gave it everything in the session, but they must be saying 'Gill hai ki Maanta Nahi'. Great start to the day for India," Sehwag tweeted on Tuesday morning.

news_headline: The game has evolved, can't ban the switch-hit: Ganguly
news_article: Former India captain and BCCI President Sourav Ganguly contradicted former Australia captain Ian Chappell and said there is no reason for the switch-hit to be banned. "The game has moved on, so I don't see we can take away this popular stroke from the modern-day batsmen," Ganguly said. Earlier, Chappell had said the switch-hit is unfair to the bowlers.

news_headline: We had India 200/6, then Shardul, Sundar batted beautifully: Hazlewood
news_article: Talking about the third of the Brisbane Test, Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said they thought they were on top when India lost six wickets before reaching the 200-run mark. "Washington Sundar and Shardul Thakur batted beautifully," he added. Sundar and Thakur stitched a partnership of 123 runs off 217 balls, India's highest partnership for the seventh wicket at the Gabba.

news_headline: Pujara is almost scared to play a shot: Border on batsman's slowest-ever Test fifty
news_article: Reacting to India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara scoring his slowest-ever Test fifty off 174 balls against Australia, ex-Australia captain Allan Border said, "He is almost scared to play a shot...He's playing to survive rather than looking to score." Border added, "It's like he's stagnated at the crease and it has had a bit of a ripple effect through the Indian batting."

news_headline: Jadeja, Hardik can be huge assets for Team India in Aus: Sourav Ganguly
news_article: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly praised Hardik Pandya and Ravindra Jadeja after their match-winning partnership against Australia in the third ODI. "Jadeja and Pandya can be huge assets to this team in the long run...plays at difficult positions," Ganguly tweeted. He also mentioned  that despite the ODI series loss, Wednesday's win might "turn things around as it's a long tour".

news_headline: Every session we discovered new hero: Sachin after India's series win vs Aus
news_article: Describing India's 2-1 series win against Australia as "one of the greatest", Sachin Tendulkar highlighted how India discovered a new hero in every session of the four-match Test series. "Every time we got hit, we stayed put & stood taller. We pushed boundaries...to play fearless but not careless cricket. Injuries & uncertainties were countered with poise & confidence," Tendulkar tweeted.

news_headline: Shimla-born Robin Jackman, former England cricketer and commentator, dies aged 75
news_article: Former England fast bowler and commentator Robin Jackman has passed away at the age of 75. He was diagnosed with throat cancer in 2012. Jackman, who made his Test debut in 1981 aged 35, took 14 wickets in his four England appearances, and also featured in 15 ODIs between 1974 and 1983. He was born in Shimla in 1945.

news_headline: F1 driver apologises for groping model-friend in car and sharing video online
news_article: Russia's 21-year-old driver Nikita Mazepin, who'll race for Haas in Formula One next year, has apologised after sharing a video on Instagram of himself groping his model-friend in a car. "I'm sorry for the offence I've rightly caused and the embarrassment I've brought to Haas F1 Team," he wrote. Mazepin's model-friend defended him, saying, "Nothing in...video was serious at all."

news_headline: Sexist clown: Serena Williams' husband after billionaire comments on her weight
news_article: American tennis player Serena Williams' husband Alexis Ohanian labelled Romanian billionaire Ion Tiriac a "sexist clown" after he commented on her weight. Tiriac stated Serena should retire, adding, "At this age and the weight she is now, she does not move as easily as she did 15 years ago." "No one gives a damn what Ion Țiriac thinks," Alexis tweeted.

news_headline: My name has been turned into a Hindi word: Ben Stokes to Jofra Archer
news_article: During an interaction with his Rajasthan Royals teammate Jofra Archer, all-rounder Ben Stokes asked the fast bowler, "What is your favourite Hindi word? Not sure you can say that." In response, Archer said, "No. I can't. I can't...Jaldi. You can say Ben Stokes as well." Stokes replied, "My name has been turned into a Hindi word as well."

news_headline: 52-year-old rider dies while being airlifted to France after Dakar Rally crash
news_article: French motorcycle rider Pierre Cherpin has died five days after crashing during the seventh stage of Dakar Rally, organisers said on Friday. The 52-year-old, who was taking part in his fourth Dakar Rally, had undergone neurosurgery and was placed in a medically-induced coma after the crash in Saudi Arabia. He was being airlifted to France when he breathed his last.

news_headline: Lala you're 100% right: Amir on Afridi's tweet after fight with 21-yr-old Afghan pacer
news_article: After a video of him getting angry at Kandy Tuskers' 21-year-old Afghan pacer Naveen-ul-Haq following his fight with Mohammad Amir went viral, Galle Gladiators captain Shahid Afridi posted a tweet with an advice to the youngster. Afridi said that his advice to Naveen-ul-Haq is to not indulge in abusive talk. Amir reacting to the tweet, saying, "Lala you're 100% right."

news_headline: We considered pulling out of New Zealand tour while in quarantine: Misbah-ul-Haq
news_article: Pakistan head coach Misbah-ul-Haq has said that Pakistan considered pulling out of the New Zealand tour while in quarantine after several Pakistan squad members tested positive for coronavirus. He added, "We finally decided to say no to this option because when you invest this much time on this, then you have got to give it a shot."

news_headline: Ex-Pak women's captain Sana Mir tests +ve for COVID-19
news_article: Ex-Pakistan women's captain Sana Mir tested positive for coronavirus while being part of the PCB commentary box for the Quaid-e-Azam trophy final in Karachi, which ended in a tie on Tuesday. Mir had shown symptoms of fever on Day 3 of the match and was then isolated in a hotel. PCB clarified there was no contact between broadcasters and players.

news_headline: It does feel nice: Babar Azam on comparison with Virat Kohli
news_article: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said it feels nice to be compared to a very good player like Virat Kohli. "Comparisons with big players also help you to set goals that match those of the big players," said Babar. Both Virat and Babar are the only two batsmen right now, who are in the ICC's top 10 rankings in all formats.

news_headline: Cricket South Africa's bio-bubble didn't appear to be bio-secure: Ashley Giles
news_article: England's director of cricket Ashley Giles questioned Cricket South Africa's bio-secure bubble that wasn't effective enough to keep infections away. "We were coming into a bio-secure environment and from very early on it appeared it wasn't bio-secure," Giles said. On Monday, England tour of South Africa became the first bilateral series to be suspended since resumption of cricket in July.

news_headline: 14 out of 15 cricketers part of India's 2003 World Cup squad have retired
news_article: Wicketkeeper-batsman Parthiv Patel on Wednesday announced his retirement from all forms of cricket, becoming the 14th cricketer part of Team India's 2003 World Cup squad to hang up his boots. Off-spinner Harbhajan Singh is the only member of the 2003 World Cup squad who is still an active cricketer. Harbhajan had pulled out of IPL 2020 due to personal reasons.

news_headline: 29-yr-old Spanish tennis player banned for 8 years, fined ₹18 lakh for fixing matches
news_article: Spanish tennis player Enrique Lopez Perez has been banned for eight years for fixing matches at tournaments in 2017. The Tennis Integrity Unit said Lopez cannot play in or attend any officially recognised tournament while banned. He has also been handed a fine of $25,000 (around ₹18 lakh). The 29-year-old had reached a career-high singles ranking of 154 in 2018.

news_headline: Australia end Day 3 of Sydney Test at 103/2, lead India by 197 runs
news_article: Australia ended the third day of the Sydney Test at 103/2, leading India by 197 runs in the second innings. India were dismissed for 244 runs in their first innings earlier in the day, with Australia's Pat Cummins picking up four wickets. India's Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja were taken for scans after suffering blows while batting.

news_headline: Only 2 Indian players have played all the 4 Tests in series against Australia
news_article: Team India stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara are the only two players who have featured in each of the four Tests in the ongoing series against Australia. India made four changes to their side for the fourth Test, fielding two debutants (Washington Sundar and T Natarajan). India had made two changes in the third Test from second Test.

news_headline: Almost as if Kohli, Tendulkar were batting: Manjrekar lauds Sundar, Shardul
news_article: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has compared Washington Sundar and Shardul Thakur to Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli during their 123-run seventh wicket stand against Australia in the fourth Test. "Some of the shots they played, it was almost as if Kohli and Tendulkar were batting together...these are No. 7 and No. 8 batsman. It was that good," Manjrekar said.

news_headline: We were trying: Carey on Allan Border's 'disgraceful performance' remark
news_article: Former Australia captain Allan Border had criticised Australia A's performance against India in the second practice game, calling it an "absolute disgrace". Responding to the remark, Alex Carey, who captained Australia A, said that their attitude in the match "wasn't bad". "We were trying. It was difficult out there with two set batters," he added.

news_headline: AB de Villiers releases his latest music video; features Kohli, Chahal
news_article: South African cricketer AB de Villiers has released his new song 'The Flame'. He came up with the music video in collaboration with singer-songwriter Karen Zoid and Ndlovu Youth Choir. The video features cricketers including De Villiers' RCB teammates Virat Kohli, Yuzvendra Chahal and Dale Steyn. De Villiers thanked cricketers who feature in the video for "leaving their comfort zones".

news_headline: Ben Stokes' father Ged passes away aged 65 after year-long battle with brain cancer
news_article: Ged Stokes, former New Zealand rugby league international and father of England all-rounder Ben Stokes, has passed away aged 65 after a year-long battle with brain cancer. Ged's former rugby league club Workington Town announced the news. "Ged is written into the rich fabric of Town history and will be greatly missed," they wrote.

news_headline: Which bowler has dismissed Kohli the most number of times in IPL?
news_article: SRH pacer Sandeep Sharma dismissed RCB captain Virat Kohli for 7(7) today. This was the seventh time Sandeep dismissed Kohli in IPL, the most number of times a bowler has dismissed Kohli in the tournament. Sandeep overtook Ashish Nehra, who had dismissed Kohli six times. Dhawal Kulkarni, Mitchell McClenaghan and Mohammad Shami have dismissed Kohli four times each.

news_headline: If Rohit doesn't play in Tests, I'd go for Shaw as 2nd opener: Manjrekar
news_article: Talking about the upcoming India-Australia Test series, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said that if Rohit Sharma doesn't play then Prithvi Shaw should play as the second opener with Mayank Agarwal. "If Shaw shows the poor form as he did in the IPL, then Shubman Gill can be looked at," he added. The four-Test series will begin on December 17.

news_headline: Steve Smith reacts to Ian Chappell's remark on bouncers, calls it 'bizarre'
news_article: Reacting to ex-Australia captain Ian Chappell calling on umpires to protect tailenders from facing bouncers, Steve Smith said, "It seems like Chappell has a bizarre statement after every match." He added, "Short balls are part of the game...We've seen over the years there've been some really good battles and I don’t think they should be outlawed at all,” he added.

news_headline: Ready to go to Australia if India can't find 11 fit players, jokes Sehwag
news_article: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to share a picture showing names of several India players currently injured ahead of the Brisbane Test against Australia. "There are so many players injured...I am ready to go to Australia if the numbers are falling short of 11...will see about quarantine," he jokingly wrote. Sehwag also tagged BCCI in his post.

news_headline: PCB showed no vision at all: Inzamam-ul-Haq on Pak squad for SA Tests
news_article: Ex-Pakistan skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that the PCB selection committee headed by Mohammad​ Wasim showed "no vision at all" in picking the squad for South Africa Tests. "Tabish Khan is a pacer [who] is over 36...Abdullah Shafique has played one first-class match...On the basis of just one match, we're making efforts to give Test cap to a player," Inzamam added.

news_headline: Aus much better Test team than it was 2 yrs ago: Vaughan on India Tests
news_article: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said Australia are a much better Test team than it was two years ago when India won the series Down Under 2-1. "India will have to see off trio of Mitchell Starc, Josh Hazlewood and Pat Cummins...If Australia win [first] Test...and India lose Virat Kohli for the next three, this could be 4-0," he stated.

news_headline: Shane Warne calls Cheteshwar Pujara 'Steve', criticised for 'casual racism'
news_article: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne has been criticised for calling India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara as 'Steve' during the first day of the first Australia-India Test in Adelaide. "Referring to Pujara as ‘Steve’ is: a) unprofessional, b) disrespectful, c) racist...Learn to say his name," a fan wrote. "Sick, Casual racism," tweeted Jamie Alter.

news_headline: Timing for IPL 2020 wasn't ideal: Justin Langer
news_article: Australia coach Justin Langer feels that the scheduling of IPL 2020, which got delayed due to the pandemic, might be a cause for the growing list of injured Indian and Australian cricketers. "The timing of it (IPL), probably wasn't ideal and I wonder if that is having an impact on the injuries we are seeing for both teams," said Langer.

news_headline: Teenage wrestler Anshu Malik wins silver at Individual World Cup
news_article: Wrestler Anshu Malik finished second in the women's 57kg category to win India's first medal at the Individual World Cup in Belgrade, Serbia. The 19-year-old lost in the final 5-1 against Moldova's Anastasia Nichita. "It was a tough match, but she didn't give up. Her overall performance in the competition was good," said Anshu's father Dharamvir, a former international wrestler.

news_headline: MCG in Australia becomes India’s most successful ground outside India
news_article: With the eight-wicket win over Australia in the Boxing Day Test, India registered their fourth win at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), making it India's most successful hunting ground overseas. Prior to the second Test, India also had three wins each at the SSC in Sri Lanka, the Sabina Park in Jamaica, the Queen's Park Oval in Trinidad and Tobago.

news_headline: Dhoni should play some super-competitive cricket before IPL 2021: Sangakkara
news_article: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Kumar Sangakkara said that CSK captain MS Dhoni, who has scored 200 runs in 13 matches, would be "disappointed with his personal form" this IPL season and should play "some super-competitive cricket" before IPL 2021. "You can't have long gaps between your IPL seasons, not playing international cricket or not playing regional or first-class cricket," Sangakkara stated.

news_headline: Mohamed Salah again tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Egypt and Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah again tested positive for coronavirus, the Egyptian Football Association announced. He had previously tested positive last Friday. With this development, Salah could be missing Liverpool's next two matches. "I'd like to thank everyone for the supportive messages and well wishes. I'm confident I'll be back on the field soon," Salah wrote on Twitter.

news_headline: Saini's extra pace makes him a better choice at Sydney: Nehra
news_article: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said that Navdeep Saini should be Team India's first choice for the third pacer's slot in Sydney. "Saini was first choice and Shardul Thakur and T Natarajan both came in as replacements," Nehra stated, adding that Saini's extra pace and "mean bouncer" also makes him more suited to play Sydney Test.

news_headline: Maradona's daughter breaks down as football team gives her ovation, video surfaces
news_article: Dalma Maradona, daughter of late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona, broke down as Boca Juniors players gave her an ovation while paying tribute to her father during their game against Newell’s Old Boys. Dalma was sitting in her father's box at Bombonera Stadium, when Boca players went to the touchline and laid down a Maradona shirt after scoring a goal.

news_headline: Rohit bowls a medium-pace ball to complete injured Saini's over, Karthik trolls him
news_article: Team India vice-captain Rohit Sharma bowled one medium-pace delivery to complete fast bowler Navdeep Saini's over after the latter got injured. Dinesh Karthik took to Twitter to troll him by using 'The Flash' GIF and wrote, "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami...better watch out, new fast bowler in the wings (Rohit Sharma) #absolutelyrapid."

news_headline: Cricket Aus terrified of BCCI, breached contract for them: Channel 7
news_article: Amidst a contract battle, broadcaster Channel 7 has claimed that Cricket Australia (CA) is "terrified" of the BCCI. The channel has already taken the battle to court and has accused CA of not honouring their contract. The channel has problem with regards to change in the itinerary for the India tour, with the limited-overs matches being held before the Tests.

news_headline: Raina wasn't aware of local protocols: Cricketer's manager on Mumbai pub incident
news_article: After Mumbai Police booked 34 people including Suresh Raina after a raid at a Mumbai pub over COVID-19 norms at 3 am, the cricketer's manager issued a statement. He said, "Raina was not aware of the local timings and protocols. Once pointed out, he immediately complied with the procedures laid out by the authorities and regrets the incident."

news_headline: Doesn't matter who's bowling, Indian bowling attacks are disciplined: Labuschagne
news_article: Australia batsman Marnus Labuschagne, who scored 108 runs on the first day of the fourth Test, praised Team India's bowling attack for not giving away too many loose balls. "Doesn't matter who is bowling...They're very planned and strategic...They were pretty disciplined early and didn't give us many scoring opportunities in that first session," he added.

news_headline: Cricket is a gentleman's game, no place of racial abuse: BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla
news_article: After Team India management lodged a complaint with match officials over Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj being racially abused by "drunk supporters" at Sydney Cricket Ground, BCCI Vice President Rajeev Shukla said that these kinds of things are "not accepted". "I think the Australian court should take cognisance of it and these kinds of incidents must be prevented," he added.

news_headline: Starc's return will be huge for India pink ball Test: Josh Hazlewood
news_article: On Australia pacer Mitchell Starc rejoining the team ahead of the first Test against India, teammate Josh Hazlewood said he's "huge part of Australia's team and attack". "Everyone knows his numbers with the pink ball. We welcome him with open arms," he added. Starc had opted out of the T20I series due to a family illness.

news_headline: Won't use our people to test a vaccine from any country: Cambodia
news_article: Cambodian PM Hun Sen has said the country will not use its own people to test a vaccine from any company or any country. He added that his government has already ordered 1 million doses of potential vaccines from the World Health Organization-led COVAX initiative. Cambodia wouldn't accept vaccines uncertified by the World Health Organisation, he further said.

news_headline: North Korea's economic plan failed to meet its objectives: Kim
news_article: Addressing the ruling party's first congress since 2016, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has admitted the five-year economic plan failed to meet its objectives. "Almost all sectors fell a long way short of the set objectives," he said. Kim described the difficulties faced by his government as "the worst-ever" and "unprecedented", the state media reported.

news_headline: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya calls Twitter ban on Trump "threat to democracy"
news_article: Reacting to Twitter's ban on US President Donald Trump following the US Capitol riots, Bengaluru South MP, Tejasvi Surya said that ban on Trump was a wake-up call for those who don't understand the "threat to our democracy by the unregulated big tech companies". Twitter on Saturday permanently suspended Trump's account citing the "risk of further incitement of violence".

news_headline: Biden picks Kurt Campbell to be his Indo-Pacific coordinator
news_article: US President-elect Joe Biden has appointed Kurt Campbell as his coordinator for the Indo-Pacific region at the White House National Security Council (NSC), a spokeswoman said on Wednesday. Campbell had served as a diplomat in the US administration led by Barack Obama. He is considered one of the architects of the Obama administration's "pivot to Asia" strategy, Reuters reported.

news_headline: Pope Francis, ex-Pope Benedict XVI receive 1st dose of COVID-19 vaccine
news_article: Pope Francis and former Pope Benedict XVI have received the first dose of a vaccine against coronavirus, an official said on Thursday. Pope Francis said everyone should get vaccinated and referred to it as "an ethical choice". Vatican City began a vaccination programme on Wednesday, with vulnerable groups and frontline workers being the first to receive the dose.

news_headline: Trump helped Mexico get COVID-19 vaccine: President Obrador
news_article: Mexico's President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has said that US President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence helped the country get COVID-19 vaccine. Mexico, on Wednesday, signed a deal with American drugmaker Pfizer to acquire 34.4 million doses of its COVID-19 vaccine. Obrador said that Mexico will distribute the vaccine only after US regulators approve it.

news_headline: Brazil's Amazonas state running out of oxygen amid rise in COVID-19 deaths
news_article: Hospitals in Brazilian state of Amazonas are running out of oxygen amid rise in COVID-19 deaths, its government said on Thursday. Amazonas Congressman Marcelo Ramos said the state has appealed to US to send a military transport plane to the capital city Manaus with oxygen cylinders. According to media reports, people on respirators were dying due to suffocation in hospitals.

news_headline: Satellite-controlled machine gun used to kill scientist: Iran
news_article: A satellite-controlled machine gun with "artificial intelligence" was used in last month's assassination of Iran's most senior nuclear scientist Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, the deputy commander of Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) said. The gun fired 13 shots at Fakhrizadeh and managed to target him with such accuracy that his wife, sitting just inches away from him, escaped injury, he added.

news_headline: Gulf states to restore trade link with Qatar within a week: UAE
news_article: Gulf states could resume travel and trade links with Qatar within a week of signing an agreement on January 5 to end their dispute, UAE Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Anwar Gargash said. However, restoring diplomatic ties will take time, he added. "Some issues are easier to fix and some others will take a longer time," Gargash further said.

news_headline: Italy imposes night-time curfew amid rising COVID-19 cases
news_article: Italy's Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte has signed new COVID-19 rules including a nationwide night-time curfew amid the rising number of coronavirus cases in the country. The measure includes restricting people from entering or leaving the region's territory and closure of all non-essential business for at least two weeks. Italy has reported over 7.59 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

news_headline: 5 on flight from UK, where new COVID-19 strain has been found, test +ve in Delhi
news_article: Authorities have said that five out of 266 passengers and crew members on a flight, which arrived at Delhi airport from UK's London last night, have tested COVID-19 positive. Their samples have been sent to NCDC for research and they've been sent to a care centre, authorities added. The UK has reported a new coronavirus strain, calling it highly infectious.

news_headline: Canadian leaders making ill-informed comments about farmers' protests: India
news_article: After Canadian PM Justin Trudeau called the farmers' protests "concerning", MEA spokesperson Anurag Srivastava said some Canadian leaders have made "ill-informed comments relating to farmers in India". These are "unwarranted especially when pertaining to internal affairs of a democratic country. It's also best that diplomatic conversations aren't misrepresented for political purposes", he added.

news_headline: TN CM condemns removal of war victims' memorial from Lankan university
news_article: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami has condemned the demolition of a monument inside the Jaffna University campus dedicated to civilians killed during the final months of Sri Lanka's civil war. This has caused great pain to "Tamils of the world", he added. Over 40,000 Tamilians lost their lives in the final months of the war, according to the UN.

news_headline: Trump's personal lawyer Rudy W Giuliani tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: US President Donald Trump has said that his personal lawyer Rudy W Giuliani tested COVID-19 positive. Referring to coronavirus as "China Virus", he added, "[Giuliani] by far the greatest mayor in the history of NYC...has been working tirelessly exposing the most corrupt election (by far!) in the history of USA." Meanwhile, Giuliani said, "I'm getting great care and feeling good."

news_headline: Indonesia earthquake kills at least 35, injures hundreds
news_article: At least 35 people died and hundreds were injured in a powerful earthquake on Indonesia's Sulawesi island on Friday. Thousands fled their homes for higher ground when the magnitude 6.2-quake struck 6 km northeast of the town of Majene. The aftershocks damaged more than 300 homes and two hotels, as well as flattening a hospital and a government building.

news_headline: PM Modi speaks to UK PM, discusses COVID-19 vaccine development
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that he had an "excellent discussion" with UK PM Boris Johnson on the ties between both the nations for the next decade. The leaders discussed COVID-19 challenges and reviewed "promising cooperation" between the countries in COVID-19 vaccine development, a press release said. Johnson reiterated that the year 2021 is important for UK-India ties.

news_headline: Storming of US Capitol condemnable, will try to speak to Trump: Athawale
news_article: Following the storming of the US Capitol by supporters of US President Donald Trump, Union Minister Ramdas Athawale said, "The incident that took place is condemnable...I will try to speak to Trump over the phone." Athawale added, "It's not only an insult to the Republican Party but also to America and democracy. That is why we are expressing our displeasure."

news_headline: US Vice President Mike Pence receives COVID-19 vaccine live on TV
news_article: US Vice President Mike Pence received the coronavirus vaccine live on television on Friday. The White House said the aim of the move was to "promote the safety and efficacy of the vaccine and build confidence among the American people". Along with Pence, his wife Karen Pence and Surgeon General Jerome Adams were also administered the vaccine.

news_headline: Violence level in Afghanistan unacceptably high: Mike Pompeo
news_article: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Friday said that violence level in Afghanistan is "unacceptably high" and could threaten ongoing peace talks between the Afghan government and the Taliban. He added that the US has asked both the rival parties to "stand back". The Afghan government and Taliban negotiators, on Wednesday, agreed on the rules for the peace talks.

news_headline: Madame Tussauds in Berlin puts Trump's wax statue in dustbin
news_article: Berlin's Madame Tussauds put its wax statue of US President Donald Trump into a dustbin, with the words "Dump Trump Make America Great Again" written on the front of it. It was surrounded by garbage bags and images of Trump's tweets, including "I love Berlin". The move is rather of a symbolic character ahead of US elections, the museum said.

news_headline: China to begin work of Sichuan-Tibet Railway close to Arunachal
news_article: China is set to start construction of the Sichuan-Tibet Railway between Ya'an in Sichuan province and Linzhi in Tibet, close to the Indian border in Arunachal Pradesh, the state-run China News reported. This comes after China Railway announced on Saturday the bidding results for the power supply project, and construction of two tunnels and a bridge of the Ya'an-Linzhi section.

news_headline: American singer arrives in Pakistan to relocate world's loneliest elephant
news_article: American singer Cher arrived in Pakistan to send off Kaavan, dubbed the world's loneliest elephant, before he is moved to a sanctuary in Cambodia on Sunday from Islamabad Zoo. The singer, who for years lobbied for his relocation and is helping pay for his move, met PM Imran Khan on Friday. Kaavan has been at the zoo for 35 years.

news_headline: There are frictions and frustrations on Indo-US trade front: Envoy
news_article: In his farewell speech, outgoing US Ambassador to India Kenneth Juster said that there are "frictions and frustrations" on the trade and investment front between the two countries. "Despite persistent efforts, we were unable to conclude even a small trade package," he added. "Moreover, there are growing restrictions in India on...access for certain US goods and services," he further said.

news_headline: Trump can't live at his Florida golf club after presidency, say neighbours
news_article: Neighbours of Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago golf club in Florida warned the US President that he cannot live at the club after he leaves the White House. They said a 1993 agreement Trump made with the town prohibits anyone from living there, including him. This comes as Trump plans to move with his wife and son to the private club.

news_headline: Over ₹101 cr lottery prize goes unclaimed in Germany
news_article: A lottery winner has failed to collect €11.3 million (over ₹101 crore) in prize money by its deadline on December 31, 2020. The winning ticket was announced on April 1, 2017. "Even after a long search, we still sincerely wish we could have been able to pay out the lucky fellow," Georg Wacker, managing director of state-owned Lotto Baden-Württemberg, said.

news_headline: Armenia, Azerbaijan swap prisoners captured during conflict
news_article: Armenia and Azerbaijan have begun exchanging prisoners as part of a Russia-brokered peace deal to end conflict over disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh, Russian Defence  Ministry said on Tuesday. The exchange was facilitated by Russian peacekeepers that have been deployed in Nagorno-Karabakh under the deal. According to the ministry, 44 captives were handed over to Armenia and 12 to Azerbaijan.

news_headline: China announces sanctions on US officials over Hong Kong
news_article: China has announced sanctions on US officials and lawmakers who were "primarily responsible for the vile actions on Hong Kong". This comes after US sanctioned six Chinese and Hong Kong officials over mass arrests of pro-democracy activists in Hong Kong. US must "immediately stop using various pretences to interfere in China's internal affairs, endangering China's national security", China said.

news_headline: Alex Padilla to replace VP-elect Kamala Harris in US Senate
news_article: California State Secretary Alex Padilla has been named as US Vice President-elect Kamala Harris' replacement in the US Senate, becoming the first Latino to represent California in the nation's upper house. Padilla will hold the Senate seat until 2022, when Harris' term ends. Padilla pledged to "work each and every day to honour that trust and deliver for all Californians".

news_headline: Indo-Canadian MP steps down as parliamentary secy over trip to US
news_article: Indo-Canadian MP Kamal Khera said she'll step down from her role as the parliamentary secretary to the minister of international development over a trip to the US last month amid the pandemic. Khera travelled abroad despite government guidelines urging people to avoid non-essential travel. Last week, Ontario's Finance Minister Rod Phillips resigned over a Caribbean vacation he took last month.

news_headline: Instagram star 'Zombie Angelina Jolie' freed days after being jailed in Iran
news_article: Iranian Instagram star Sahar Tabar has been freed days after being jailed for 10 years, according to campaigners and activists in Iran. Masih Alinejad, a journalist, said that Tabar, who shot to prominence after posting photos in which she resembled what has been described as a zombie version of Angelina Jolie, was freed after "massive media pressure".

news_headline: Africa secures 270 million COVID-19 vaccine doses
news_article: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Wednesday said that the African Union has secured a provisional 270 million COVID-19 vaccine doses for African countries. The vaccines will be supplied by Pfizer, AstraZeneca (through Serum Institute of India) and Johnson & Johnson, Ramaphosa added. At least 50 million of the doses will be available between April and June, he further said.

news_headline: US accuses China of genocide against Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang
news_article: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has accused China of committing "genocide and crimes against humanity" against Uighur Muslims and other minority groups in Xinjiang province. "We are witnessing the systematic attempt to destroy Uighurs by the Chinese party-state," he added. The US has determined that this has been going on since at least March 2017, he further said.

news_headline: Putin critic Navalny detained on return to Russia 5 months after being poisoned
news_article: Russian opposition leader and critic of President Vladimir Putin, Alexey Navalny, was detained by police on Sunday, moments after his return to the country and five months after he was poisoned with the nerve agent Novichok. The 44-year-old was placed on the country's federal wanted list last month for violating terms of probation related to a years-old fraud case.

news_headline: Palestine approves Sputnik V vaccine for use in self-rule areas
news_article: Palestinian Authority has approved the emergency use of Russia's Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine in Palestinian self-ruled territory, Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) said. The first shipment of the vaccine is expected to arrive within a month, it added. Earlier, the Palestinian Authority had accused Israel of ignoring its responsibilities to ensure vaccines are available in occupied territory.

news_headline: Influencer tricks elderly men into eating soap covered in chocolate; apologises
news_article: A Colombian social media influencer has apologised after he tricked elderly and homeless men into eating soap bars covered in chocolate. "In reference to the joke we recently made that caused a negative reaction from the public, I sincerely apologise to the people involved and to the community," Milton Domínguez wrote on Instagram.

news_headline: China cancels plan to jointly launch commemorative stamps with India
news_article: China's State Post Bureau has cancelled its plan to jointly launch commemorative stamps with India. The two countries were to launch a stamp commemorating 2020 as the 70th year of bilateral relations and a special stamp showing the Mogao Caves from China's Gansu province. This comes amid a LAC standoff between India and China in eastern Ladakh.

news_headline: Airline flies 69 passengers to wrong destination in Nepal: Report
news_article: Nepal's Buddha Air on Friday flew 69 passengers to Pokhara instead of Janakpur, The Kathmandu Post reported. Birendra Bahadur Basnet, Buddha Air's managing director, told the Kathmandu Post that they have formed a committee to investigate the incident. The ground staff and the flight attendant reportedly failed to brief the captain and co-pilot that the flight's number had been changed.

news_headline: 101-yr-old woman who lived through Spanish flu & WWII, survives COVID-19 thrice
news_article: A 101-year-old Italian woman who lived through the Spanish Flu and World War II, has survived coronavirus three times. Maria Orsingher had first tested positive in February and for the second time in September, during which she underwent treatment for 18 days at a hospital. She was asymptomatic when she tested positive for the third time.

news_headline: Trump claims he has won the election despite counting still on
news_article: Claiming that he has won the presidential election, US President Donald Trump said, "I want to thank American people for their tremendous support." "The results have been phenomenal...Such a success. The citizens of this country have come out in record numbers to support us," he added. Counting of votes is underway in several states including Pennsylvania, Georgia and North Carolina.

news_headline: UN, Ethiopia sign deal for humanitarian access to Tigray amid conflict
news_article: United Nations on Wednesday said that it has signed a deal with the Ethiopian government to provide humanitarian aid in the northern Tigray region amid the ongoing conflict with rebel forces. The aid will be provided to every single person who needs it without any distinction, the UN added. According to reports, the conflict has displaced over 10 lakh people.

news_headline: 'Good riddance', says China as Germany leaves UNSC this month
news_article: China's Deputy UN Ambassador Geng Shuang has said it's "good riddance" that Germany's UN  Ambassador Christoph Heusgen is planning to retire and the country is finishing a two-year term on UNSC this month. Shuang's comments came after Heusgen, during his last scheduled Security Council meeting, appealed to China to free two Canadians, who were detained in 2018, for Christmas.

news_headline: Israel and Bhutan establish formal diplomatic relations
news_article: Israel and Bhutan on Saturday established formal diplomatic relations to "build upon the existing close ties" and "open the path to greater cooperation". The agreement follows several years of secret contacts between the two countries with the aim of establishing relations, Israeli Foreign Minister Gabi Ashkenazi said. "This is a milestone in Israel's deepening ties with Asia," he added.

news_headline: Avoid publishing unnecessary details of nuke program: Iran to UN watchdog
news_article: Iran has asked United Nations' nuclear watchdog to not publish any "unnecessary details" of its nuclear program. Iran's nuclear department issued a statement asking the International Atomic Energy Agency to avoid publishing anything that may create confusion in the international community. This comes after Germany, France and UK said that Iran's uranium development was a violation of 2015 deal.

news_headline: Drunk man refuses to wear mask, taxi driver takes him directly to police station
news_article: A taxi driver in Canada took a drunk passenger directly to the police station after he refused to wear a face mask or follow COVID-19 safety measures. The drunk passenger repeatedly tried to touch the taxi driver's face. The man, who at first refused to leave the cab, was taken into custody and fined nearly C$700 (over ₹40,000).

news_headline: We're in war against Islamist ideology, more attacks likely: France
news_article: More attacks on the French soil are likely as France is engaged in a "war against Islamist ideology", the country's Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said. "We are in a war against an enemy that is both inside and outside," he added. His comments came a day after a woman was beheaded in a knife attack at a church in Nice.

news_headline: UK in race against time to roll out COVID-19 vaccines: PM Johnson
news_article: UK PM Boris Johnson has said Britain is in a race against time to roll out vaccines as coronavirus-related deaths continue to rise and hospitals run out of oxygen. "Next few weeks are going to be the worst weeks of this pandemic in terms of numbers into the National Health Service," Johnson added. UK has reported over 81,000 coronavirus-related deaths.

news_headline: Armenia, Azerbaijan reach agreement to exchange all war prisoners
news_article: Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan has said that Armenia and Azerbaijan have agreed to exchange all war prisoners captured during Nagorno-Karabakh conflict. The agreement would not only apply to those who were detained during the recent fighting, but also to those who were detained earlier, he added. Azerbaijan had detained around 60 Karabakh servicemen and 40 civilians, as per an official.

news_headline: Withdraw govt troops from Tigray: Rebel leader to Ethiopian PM
news_article: The leader of the rebel forces in Ethiopia's Tigray region, Debretsion Gebremichael, on Monday called on Ethiopian PM Abiy Ahmed to "stop the madness" and withdraw troops from the region. Gebremichael claimed that fighting continues on "every front" despite Abiy declaring victory last week. "We are sure we'll win," Gebremichael, who leads the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), said.

news_headline: WHO, EU chiefs urge G20 leaders to provide funds to fight COVID-19
news_article: G20 leaders must help close a funding gap of $4.5 billion to fight COVID-19, a letter from the World Health Organization and European Commission heads said. The letter was sent ahead of the virtual G20 summit in Riyadh. G20 leaders must commit "a proportion of future stimulus" spending on the tools, aimed at securing supplies for lower-income countries, it added.

news_headline: Israel PM Netanyahu receives 2nd dose of COVID-19 vaccine
news_article: Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu received the second dose of the Pfizer/BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine after becoming the first Israeli to be inoculated last month. He was administered the second dose along with Health Minister Yuli Edelstein. Israel has reported 4,85,434 COVID-19 cases, while the death toll stands at 3,645, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

news_headline: Over 50 HK activists arrested under national security law: Reports
news_article: Over 50 Hong Kong pro-democracy activists were arrested on Wednesday on suspicion of breaching city's new national security law, media reported. The Democratic Party said the arrests were related to an independently organised vote to elect democratic candidates for a legislative election last year. Hong Kong government, China had warned at the time that it would violate the new law.

news_headline: Man found living at US airport for 3 months, says didn't fly due to COVID-19
news_article: A 36-year-old California man named Aditya Singh lived at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport for three months before being discovered, the Chicago Tribune reported. Prosecutors said the man told police he was too scared to fly because of COVID-19. Singh was charged with felony criminal trespass to a restricted area of an airport and misdemeanour theft.

news_headline: India donates ₹22 cr to complete Palestine-India Techno Park
news_article: India on Tuesday donated the fourth and final tranche of over ₹22 crore to complete the construction of Palestine-India Techno Park. India has in total donated over ₹88 crore towards building the project in the Palestinian city of Ramallah. The project is almost in its final stage and likely to be inaugurated in February or March of 2021, officials said.

news_headline: Argentine Senate approves bill legalising abortion
news_article: Argentina's Senate on Wednesday voted 38-29 in favour of a bill to legalise abortion up to the 14th week of pregnancy. Until now, abortions in the country were only permitted in cases of rape or when the mother's health was at risk. The bill, proposed by President Alberto Fernández, had been approved by the Chamber of Deputies earlier this month.

news_headline: What happens next as Donald Trump is impeached again?
news_article: Impeachment refers only to the House of Representatives, the lower chamber of US Congress, bringing charges against President Donald Trump, and the next step is for the Senate to determine his guilt. The Senate trial is expected to occur after Trump leaves office. However, if convicted, Senators can vote to bar him from running for President again in 2024.

news_headline: Trump grants pardon to two convicted in Russia meddling probe
news_article: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday pardoned two people convicted in the 2016 Russia poll meddling case. Trump granted full pardons to George Papadopoulos, a foreign policy adviser to his 2016 campaign, and Alex van der Zwaan, a Dutch attorney. Both men had pleaded guilty to making false statements to federal officials during investigation and had served brief jail sentences.

news_headline: China builds 1,500-room hospital in 5 days after surge in COVID-19 cases
news_article: China on Saturday finished building a 1,500-room hospital for COVID-19 patients in five days to fight a surge in infections in Nangong city, state media reported. The hospital is one of the six hospitals being built in Nangong in Hebei province. A similar programme of rapid hospital construction was launched at the start of the outbreak last year in Wuhan.

news_headline: Ready to play constructive role in UNSC to end Syrian conflict: India
news_article: India on Wednesday said it's ready to play a "constructive and meaningful role" in United Nations Security Council (UNSC) to end the Syrian conflict. It's "disheartening" to see the ongoing crisis in Syria having no end in sight, TS Tirumurti, Indian Permanent Representative to UN, said. Tirumurti called on international community to give assistance to Syria for rebuilding its infrastructure.

news_headline: German Parliament boosts security after US Capitol violence: Report
news_article: The security at Germany's Bundestag (lower house of parliament) has been increased after the violence at US Capitol by President Donald Trump supporters, a report said. Bundestag President Wolfgang Schäuble has asked the Foreign Ministry for a report on the violence to "clarify" to government "what conclusions should be drawn for Bundestag security", it added.

news_headline: Navalny to return to Russia on January 17 despite prison threats
news_article: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny said that he'll return to the country on January 17 despite the threat of imprisonment. "[Russian President Vladimir] Putin, who gave the order for my murder, is...telling his servants to do everything so that I do not return," Navalny added. Navalny is currently recovering in Germany after he was poisoned with Novichok nerve agent.

news_headline: Indians account for one-fourth of total PR granted by Canada in 2019, set record
news_article: Indian immigrants accounted for one-fourth of the total permanent residencies (PR) granted by Canada in 2019, setting a new record, according to Canada's annual report submitted in their parliament. Of the 3,41,180 permanent residents admitted last year, 85,593 were Indians. India was followed by China at 30,246, the Philippines at 27,818, Nigeria at 12,602 and Pakistan at 10,793.

news_headline: Aus marks 1st day of no domestic COVID-19 transmission since June 9
news_article: Australia on Sunday marked the first day without a domestic transmission of coronavirus since June 9, Health Minister Greg Hunt said. "Thank you to all of our amazing health and public health workers and above all else the Australian people," he tweeted. Victoria state, Australia's coronavirus hotspot, saw zero new daily infections and no deaths for the second straight day.

news_headline: Farmers' voices must be heard: Indian-American lawmaker on protests
news_article: Speaking on the farmers' protest in India, Indian-American Congressman Ro Khanna has said that farmers are the backbone of India and must have their voices heard. "I hope there's a...fair solution so they can provide for their families. I'm encouraged by the ongoing dialogue," he added. "India and the US share a rich tradition of...peaceful protests," he further said.

news_headline: Yellow mealworms become first insect approved in EU as human food
news_article: Yellow mealworms have become the first insect approved by the European Food Safety Agency (EFSA) as a human food. "Rich in protein, fat and fibre, they are likely to be the first of many insects to feature on European's plates in the coming years," an EFSA food scientist said. Mealworms are already used in Europe as a pet food ingredient.

news_headline: Biden projected to win Arizona, only the 2nd Democrat since 1948 to win the state
news_article: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden is projected to win Arizona, a state which US President Donald Trump won in 2016, according to The Associated Press. If Biden wins, he will be only the second Democrat since 1948 to win Arizona, a Republican stronghold. Joe Biden is also projected to win in Hawaii, according to Edison Research exit polls.

news_headline: Men remove metal monolith from US mountain and replace it with cross
news_article: A metal monolith that appeared atop a mountain in the US state of California has been removed by a group of men. A video of the men surfaced online, in which they can be heard chanting "America First" and "Christ is King". The group replaced the metal monolith with a wooden cross.

news_headline: Two metal monoliths appear in Poland; pics surface
news_article: Two metal monoliths, similar to those that have appeared in the US, Romania and the UK, have now appeared in Poland. The first, standing at around 9-feet tall, was spotted in the city of Kielce at the site of a former quarry turned into a nature reserve. The second was found on the banks of the Vistula river in Warsaw.

news_headline: Hong Kong internet provider admits blocking pro-democracy website
news_article: Hong Kong Broadband Network (HKBN) has become the first internet service provider to admit blocking pro-democracy website HKChronicles under Beijing's National Security Law. South China Morning Post reported that HKBN had "complied with an official request" to disable customers' access to HKChronicles, which contained information related to the 2019 unrest in protest of the National Security Law.

news_headline: Woman drives car into BLM protesters in Manhattan, several injured
news_article: Several people were injured after a woman drove her car into protesters participating in the Black Lives Matter demonstration in Manhattan, New York City, on Friday. A video showed the stopped BMW sedan suddenly accelerating and knocking aside the protesters who were blocking it. The woman driving the car has been taken into custody, the New York City Police said.

news_headline: COVID-19 vaccine delivery to poor nations to start in early 2021: WHO
news_article: World Health Organisation on Friday said that the coronavirus vaccine delivery to poorer countries, through its COVAX vaccine-sharing scheme, will begin in the first half of 2021. However, WHO added that the deliveries remained "contingent upon regulatory approvals and countries' readiness for delivery". The agency has secured almost two billion doses of candidate vaccines.
